pDvgTOduRjfxjtnJstUlRg.text: I've been a regular for more than a year and the past few times, I've been extremely disappointed in the food.  Poached eggs were closer to hard-boiled, and today's short rib hash was barely warm, the potatoes were under-cooked, and while the menu describes the dish as having onions and peppers, there was literally one piece of a roasted red pepper and one piece of onion.  That's a lot of disappointment for $15.95.  Has there been a change of kitchen staff?  The service, on the other hand, did not disappoint.

59o4amV_U7HJZ8bfG3cfag.text: Cozy atmosphere, grass-fed food, and bottomless mimosas.  Our server Elle was outstanding, and catered to all of our needs.  She explained multiple items in great detail and made sure we were taken care of.  All of us preferred different items, the butternut squash hash, protein breakfast, and chorizo omelet.  All three of us were truly satisfied with our orders  First the butternut squash hash was outstanding topped with shredded turkey.  For the table we ordered some sweet potato fries that were amazing as well.  My friend ordered the chorizo omelet with bacon and literally could not stop talking about it.  The melding of cheese egg and bacon truly made the meal for him.  As far as atmosphere, the tables are close together, but far enough to have individual conversations.  Realistically this place always has a wait, and tries their best to accommodate as many patrons as possible.  My best advice is to order the bottomless mimosas.  At $8 a glass and $16 bottomless, it makes absolute sense to go all the way.  Be sure to try all the options, blood orange, regular, and pomegranate.  Last but not least, be sure to try the banana nut bread.  My friend ordered it as a starter and we had to order another!  Between the food, the ambiance, service, and overall presentation, this place is definitely a 5/5.

k7gBpDL5e7MyHcJYVkxdvg.text: Went here for the first time. Cute ambiance. Good food. A little pricey for the shrimp po boy when you only get 3 shrimp. It's flavorful but not really price worthy. Service was friendly enough.

olc7pwoGkpSuC2RnsLLLPA.text: Delicious! The food was excellent and the service was great. I even bought a few pastries to take home. Soo good

3MM1jR7Kiil7cjvVfKtAOQ.text: Craft Kitchen is pretty consistent with quality.  Food is very good, service is attentive and the cleanliness of the Craft Kitchen is excellent. I have been a few times for special occasions but it's not something I would frequent. Needless to say we always enjoy our experience.  I would recommend to give it a try.

FhhrmT3Wzz6vDXbZKNMkZQ.text: The food and service is top notch. Me and my old lady go or get take out almost every Sunday. The vegan menu is awesome and the all the pastry's are fantastic! I've never had a bad experience here and plan on going back often. My only regret would be not singing their praises earlier.

G_rWIYgxJlnemaa24bDnJA.text: Best breakfast!!!! New and innovative. Friendly atmosphere with excellent service. Try any of the Benedicts...amazing. Don't forget the take home some of their pastries

6T2gCAey1NnRhDRvQuoRlg.text: We finally got up early enough to try this place and wanted to see what all the hype was... but sadly I didn't see it.  Maybe breakfast eateries are scarce in this area making this place popular.   We came in early, a little after they opened, since we read and heard that all their popular pastries are gone within the first few hours they open, like the monkey bread.  Speaking of which they did not have any ready at the time we arrived, we asked about their other specials and they were also not ready. I truly don't get this. The host told us 9 am or later...umm you open at 7 am right?   She said it takes a while to make, okay fair enough, but then why wouldn't the baker come in prior to opening to be ready when the establishment opens or why not open at 9am. If it were a brunch Item I would understand, but that is not the case at all.     Okay we decided to run some errands and then come back at 9 am.  Unfortunately the items we wanted to try were still not ready at 9am.  We decided to place our order anyway and we would order breakfast and hopefully the other items would be ready by the time we finished eating breakfast.     We ordered their breakfast burrito to share, which consisted of a chile relleno, cheese, chorizo, and scrambled eggs.  Sadly I did not care for the taste and honestly I was starting to second guess this place and the great reviews.  We then got our Monkey Bread and Kouign Aman.  I didn't find anything special about the Monkey Bread except for the presentation.  I thought it was overly sweet and just good on the first bite. The Kouign Aman on the other hand was delicious.   The place is cute, the service was friendly, but nothing over the top food wise and I can't see a reason to return.

30VsV5gn_tHpAKVF57OtYA.text: Love this Place!!! Amazing food!! I bring my family every Sunday for lunch and we always have a blast. Best Brunch restaurant in Vegas so far! Our Waitress Ilse is always amzing too!

-mDeKK_xKoTXRAuxI_RMow.text: Friendly service and delicious food makes a difference at Craft. My husband ate the chorizo scramble which was flavorful, hearty and prepared with care. I ordered the smoked salmon on pretzel roll, a delectable alternative on a hot day.  Other benefits at this restaurant; pleasing acoustical environment, outdoor patio which won't turn away your dog, and a bakery selection that will make your mouth water like Pavlov's dog. We will eat here again because I've got to try everything on display in the bakery!

yLBmb0pbQ0CcvNUSuTyzug.text: This is one of our very favorite places to go especially for a late breakfast... the staff is wonderful! They keep us coming back.. the staff and the coffee. Oh the coffee! My hubby loves the avocado toast and I usually order the burrito. When I'm not in the mood for meat I love their fruit plate and smashed potatoes, it's tiny potatoes smashed into yummy fat French fries (sorta). We have been going there since they opened and they weren't that busy, NOW they are super packed sometimes that we make sure we go super early or during the last hour... I would do super early. Enjoy!

5ClaZZs1m4iOauSWQ7ZyQQ.text: First, let me say all the food is 5 stars. Been in more than a handful of times and they food is always the best quality. Service though lacks quality and it's more like 2 stars. I'm not sure if there's a lack of management in the customer service ends of things, but drinks not being refilled and not asking if you'd like anything else before bringing the bill are basic things that are missed. Several times I've encountered the same issues while having lunch with friends. Service is the only thing that keeps be from visiting more frequently.

zfXmh_p1m4CQyUH2sdXUQg.text: Consistency is key. I have been going there since the second day they opened their door just to see what kind of coffee they were serving. Its been about two years since. The food is still of the same great quality and attention to details. Their bennie is amazing especially when joined with added berry house jam. I haven't had anything I didn't like yet from their menu. No joke.   Waitlist? Yup! Good problem but also no problem. Their staff are very friendly and they care to get you seated as soon as ppossible  Social media presence should also be acknowledged. Many owners cut corners and hire an agency to bulk their page and promote their business. These guys run their own page and actively respond to their customers. I applaud that.  Overall: go try if you haven't. Worth the drive if you live far from Anthem area.

7jsqwi6bPYKDNYRJSn_tRQ.text: So first off, I really like that this place exists. The atmosphere is very clean and open. The servers were friendly and professional. I LOVE that they have a vegan menu-- this restaurant is clearly cognizant of the dietary needs of its customers! It's so refreshing that so many non-vegan restaurants are offering options! I had the veggie toast, and it was delicious! I finished all of it, and it didn't leave me feeling disgusting or over-stuffed. My only complaint is the clientele, but I'm not sure that's the restaurant's fault! ':-) I came in around noon, and I was surrounded by chatty women b****ing about their husbands and every other woman they know who wasn't present for their brunch. I mean, what did I expect from a brunch spot, but holy cow! The food is delicious, but I felt like I was stuck watching an episode of The Real Housewives. It might help if the hostess could spread customers out a little more. It wasn't too busy, so I can't imagine it would have been much trouble to spread people out a little.  \_()_/

UN55aYSUjHQV4wYGTMtdgQ.text: I am a Sunday CRAFTKitchen regular. So much so that when we come in, they know what we start off with. Servers are super friendly. Ambience is casual yet chic. Have yet to try the infamous monkey bread but I have been working my way down the menu and so far everything is great!  Food can sometimes take a bit to come out but go with great company and you won't even notice.

Xcl6SunK_jVgek6vm-2IYQ.text: This is my third time here. I got the smoked salmon and the quiche of the day.   The quiche of the day was wonderful with the asparagus and bacon that they today. The quiche itself was light and fluffy that bounces off the tongue and the roof of the mouth. The asparagus went pleasantly well with the bacon for an addition of a slightly salty taste with the small crunch of the asparagus. All in all a wonderful and light quiche with a flavorful combination of texture and flavors.  The salad sauce was on the sour side as a vinegrette that may have been good with something else but did not go with the quiche. Otherwise the small potato crisps are always a welcome addition to the salad. Perhaps a less flavorful salad dressing would have been a better pairing.  Other than that the smoked salmon was on a wonderfully browned and soft bread with a very large helping of smoked salmon. While I do enjoy getting my bang for buck the large amount of smoked salmon made it hard to eat as the height of the food exceeds that of the mouth, and even if you press down on the meal your hands would be oily. Beyond that the copious amounts of salmon mask all the other flavors sans the white sauce they decided to use which was also a large amount. Otherwise it was quite succulent. Between the choice of bang for buck and a few overpowering aspects of the meal, this place is a solid choice to go.

Fpe2HaGEDuLMWFyrRa_-SQ.text: I LOVE this place. The restaurant is so cute and the service is awesome. The coffee is made FRESH to order, the food is great, everything about this place just makes my day better lol.

Xla_f094WBLTCgJ11q4bRg.text: this is an amazing place with wonderful healthy and gluten free options.  we will definitely be returning.  their acai bowl was the best I've ever had.  customer service was exceptional! A must try!

ks7-dnXg85rWk3QsjhJEuA.text: I stumbled onto Craft purely by accident. It was lunch time and my little kiddos were begging for McDonalds, I couldn't stomach the thought so I asked it we could try something totally new. We walked into Craft and we all loved it! My son ordered pancakes and fruit, my daughter got the butternut squash soup, and I ordered quinoa cakes. Don't let my boring name turn you off to the idea, the quinoa cake order (I can't remember its official menu name) was SO GOOD! I loved the dish. The flavors blended so well and I haven't been able to stop thinking about it for the last two weeks.  The staff was all incredibly kind and considerate. They were kind to my kiddos and made sure we each loved our meals. It was a great experience and I will definitely return again!

kMGCKwtjLpjNI8TEhjBY2g.text: A scrumptious glass case filled with delectable sweets beckons you in to this modern gathering place. Any menu choice will make you smile. Great coffee too

m--BZ69d3xmKF0-A7zmlzA.text: Living in Sunridge at MacDonald Ranch is pretty sweet, but with the addition of the Craft Kitchen at Eastern and Sunrdige Heights, the experience just got even better.  What an amazing little slice of culinary heaven tucked away in the best kept secret in Henderson.  We just finished our second visit after a nice mid-morning walk...gotta justify the bottomless mimosas (traditional, pomegranate and blood orange) somehow!  The menu is truly amazing, with flavorful customization to traditional dishes, like the pulled turkey benny or completely unique dishes like their short rib hash, which left me licking the plate, the cutlery and anything the plate and cutlery touched...almost got me tossed, but I think they had seen the reaction before! The restaurant its self is very charming, you will immediately forget that this funky-fresh, country-cool eatery is situated in a strip mall...they created this fun little outdoor eating area where seating is at a premium, that is separated from the rest of the world by a sort of make shift herb garden created from customizing old pallets... The food is great and well it should be as the owners are very accomplished chefs on the Strip and this little venture, from what I understand is where they get free reign to express all their creativity, and wow does it show!   The staff for the most part is wonderful, especially a young go-getter named Caleb, who is definitely destined for great things!  Jeffrey, who has helped us twice is also extremely helpful and accommodating, we sat inside today after our walk and my wife was a bit chilled, so asked to be moved outside.  Jeffrey and Caleb made sure we were moved to warmer climes and well situated outside, but unfortunately, this seemed to rub the person in charge of the great outdoors the wrong way.  I believe her name was Katy, hard to know, as she was determined to either ignore us completely or to get us to leave as quickly as possible...which is the only reason I am unable to give the Craft Kitchen a 5 star review at this time.  I wasn't sure if she was upset because she had interlopers in her area whose tip would be going to another server, or if she was angry because one of her tables would be taken up by us for a few minutes...we were nearly done with our meal, Caleb moved our dishes to the outside when we reseated and reminded Katy that we needed a couple more mimosas.  Maybe she didn't like being reminded of this from a younger member of the staff, but for whatever reason, she conveniently forgot and we were left waiting for about 10 minutes before I went back inside to see if I could just bring the drink order out myself and was told that it would be brought to me.  Katy (again, I hope I'm getting her name correct) finally delivered our drinks and asked, "who was your server"?  I mentioned that Jeffrey was helping us and she left. Half way through the second glass of our "bottomless mimosas" Jeffrey showed up and gave us our bill.  Apparently Katy told him we were ready to leave...again, she couldn't wait to get us out of her station.  Normally I get a bit prickly about something like that, but we still had to walk home and while one more mimosa would have made the mile home a bit more enjoyable, I might have wandered into traffic or stumbled into a random wall, so I guess I should thank her for making sure we go out of there before we could do too much damage to ourselves or the oncoming traffic!   Still it would have been a much nicer experience for us if she had recognized the fact that had she gotten us the drinks quickly, we would have finished more quickly instead of waiting for our drinks.  Also, had she just "taken one for the team" and provided the exemplary service we received from the other members of the staff there might have been an effort put forth on our part to ensure she received a separate tip for herself.  Instead, she made it quite clear that she really didn't have the comfort level of the guests at Craft Kitchen as her top priority; just those that she was sure would enrich her tip jar at the end of the day. At any rate, the Craft Kitchen is easily one of the best places for breakfast/brunch/lunch in 89052, and is well worth the drive from any other zip code for that matter!

yfPvqsbgE173l5Wg34AzVQ.text: Service has really gone down hill. Arrived for breakfast with my family, total of 6 people. When being seated, the hostess asked if we wanted a vegan menu which we said yes. Unfortunately she never came back with the menu so a member of our party had to go to the podium and acquire one. Ordered the monkey bread for an appetizer, after taking forever to come out, it was cold. Had to chase down the waitress to tell her. The monkey bread was removed and we were told they would make us a new one. Instead they simply threw the one we had eaten from into the microwave and brought it back.  Never had that happen before, normally a restaurant makes a fresh item if it's complained about. Food also took a long time to come out, noticed other tables seated after us received their food before us. After food was delivered, never saw the waitress again. No refills on coffee or water. Sad because this used to be a great place. Won't be going back.

PdT7XZSk9Xui_I18x5kliQ.text: This place has great food but the service is just terrible.  The hostess is quoting people a 30 min wait with 9 empty tables inside and at least 3 outside!!  What???!!!!

xRGKgCVhi3ya2FYOyagqOQ.text: Disappointed with the food today. My husband had the hamburger sliders and the meat was not cook.:(  I did enjoy my oatmeal. Was a very expensive lunch for something that was not cooked properly.

As a result Craft has quickly grown to becoming busy most every day since they opened a couple years ago. My favorite is the burrata salad. Best burrata I've had. Go check them out.

tQ2nLJEv5q__DcQcAN3hbQ.text: Overall: no cronuts on weekdays, very cold inside, flakey pastries  We were initially drawn to this place because we saw the cronuts on instagram! So we headed over just for a few pastries for a light breakfast.   To our disappointment, they only sell cronuts sometimes, and mostly on weekends- so they didn't have them! We ended up ordering a cinnamon roll, homemade poptart, and cronut holes.  These were all delicious. The waitress heated them up for us too. The poptart was not too sweet and had an apricot filling, and the pastry dough was very flakey. The cinnamon roll had a little too much icing but was very soft inside, and the cronut holes were so flakey and soft, which made us think of how good the cronut would have been!  One thing to note was that it was COLD inside! I know vegas often over air conditions, but I had goosebumps and plenty of people were getting asked to move outside to get out of the cold.

USU_D3k1xcfiasIeEUH5MA.text: From my first visit to this one, it was a definite turn around.  I met a friend here for Friday Happy Hour.  Unfortunately we found out it was their last Friday night with HH but it was certainly memorable.    We decided to start off with their Cheese Plate.  This cheese board was one of the best assortments.  Creamy blue cheese, brie, truffled parmesan, aged parmesan, homemade jam, fruit and toast.  Each cheese sang a different melody.  It was simply amazing!  My Yelp friend and I also opted to share some of their dishes: Caesar Salad, Lump Crab Cakes and Cavatelli & Short Ribs.  The caesar was very large and fresh.  The large salad was plenty to share with leftovers as well.  The fresh parmesan crisp in the center gave it a great flavor.  The 2 crab cakes were a delight with the lemon aioli.  The lemon kicked it up a notch with the real crab.  The cavatelli & short rib had a unique flavor that was my winner of the evening.  It was a wonderful pasta and meat dish that is delicately sprinkled with fresh parmesan.  Everything sitting on our table would be highly recommended for another order.    Service here does not go unnoticed.  Our waitress, Jenna, provided such attentiveness and gratitude.  Her friendly professional attitude completed the wonderful evening.  I hope they bring back the happy hour again soon as I would love to enjoy their delectable dishes!

_wxbG-0os8mFwLJWk1dXbw.text: Having heard and seen many of my friends going here, I wanted to try it too. I went in the early morning probably 30 mins after they opened. The place was nice, cute and spacious inside. Got the salmon benny and bread pudding as breakfast.  The salmon was seasoned well. Really enjoyed the fried capers, very interesting cause I've never seen that done before. I didnt particularly enjoy the hollandaise sauce, it was a bit sour for my taste so I only drizzled a bit over the top. The poached egg was cooked just right. Once you cut into that egg, you could see the bright yellow yolk running down and spreading all over the salmon, tomatoes and the English muffin...mmmmm But, again it was just an Eggs Benedict with Salmon substituting the bacon or ham.  The bread pudding was moist and soft inside. Not too sweet. It had chocolate swirled and hidden into every bite. Came in a cute small cast iron pot dusted lightly with powdered sugar. I really enjoyed it.  Overall, I would come again to try their bakery goodies and lunch menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon benny
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Mini bread pudding

Eoitq64PDIemy80FKu14Cw.text: I think this place has the potential for a higher rating, but I just wasn't that impressed based on my personal experience.   Maybe I just didn't order the right item, or it was the ridiculously long wait to get our food, but I don't quite understand the hype over this place.  It's great that it has a separate vegan menu, and tries to use locally sourced organic ingredients whenever possible, but that shouldn't cause such a long time to prepare the food.  Our wait time actually wasn't as bad as some other reviewers but it was still uncomfortably long.  20 to 30 minutes is way too long in my book, especially considering we came when this place wasn't even busy.  My wife and I came here around 9:40 a.m. on a Tuesday and there were only four other parties besides us so I can't understand why it took so long for us to get our food.  We had similar dishes at Kitchen Table the day before during a very busy brunch time, and we still got our food within 10 minutes.  As far as the food, it was mixed.  I liked the Short Rib Hash but was disappointed by Turkey Benny.  All other ingredients in the dish were fine but the turkey was extremely dry.  It was so dry, it felt like it was going to get stuck in my throat.  I initially wanted to send it back but didn't want to wait another 30 minutes for another dish.  I managed to finish half by using lots of citrus hollandaise sauce that came with this dish.  The hollandaise sauce tasted like a lemon bar, and was good by itself.  However, it didn't quite go well with rest of the items.  I thought it was too acidic for a dish that doesn't have much fat.  I don't know how some people are managing to wait 30-45 minutes just to get a table here.  I wouldn't wait that long even if the food was excellent. For people that are new to the area I would still recommend trying this place, but should only come during non-peak times.

EFm74AfLxb6G9sDsQE7Bcg.text: Vegan soyrizo chilaquiles are out of this world.  Also got the crispy avocado tacos and those were also a hit. I wish I knew where they bought their plates from. The warped, frosted glass ones. It's like a plate for a mermaid. I need those.  I WILL RETURN FOR MORE FOOD!

_xpOjdBNSFPXMjg6KL-wwQ.text: Great food, great service. Love the Yelp waitlist and that you get a text when your table is ready. Great selection of gluten free options and they understand food handling for food allergies. We will definitely be coming back.

jELDHhYhVFAx5d0jXi6iDw.text: Love this place! I take everyone here for breakfast/brunch. Some of my favorites are the chorizo skillet, creme brulee French toast, and the latest rice krispy crusted French toast with vanilla cream in the middle. Always great service and you can get in line from home to reduce the wait time.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

JhWaOkInBHWOtYBecWMECw.text: I am sitting in craft kitchen now.  Reeling over the deliciousness of the most amazing blueberry cheesecake Kouign Amann In the world!  I just devoured it with my awesome cappuccino!  You may think I am exaggerating. But I am not.  The only other place they serve this is in heaven! Just saying.  Ok now our food came I went healthy with the protein fix. It's great healthy and perfect for my needs.  But my daughter got the short rib grilled cheese sandwich. Ok. Talk about plate envy!  Yes I am very envious. But she loves me and reluctantly gives me a bite.  I can't stop eating it.  I'm discussing coming back later to fit more of this incredible food in my mouth.    Did I mention I highly recommend this place??

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. protein fix

YcNLze0TtgfF2XyckiOGNg.text: I had the Chilaquiles with soy chorizo on the Vegan menu and a cup of coffee. Meal was delicious and I enjoyed it. Coffee was really good. 22 bucks for breakfast is kinda steep but the service was great and food was better. If you're in the area and want more than just a salad I recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chilaquiles with Soy Chorizo.

CuQn-A0iTCVScNyjKQYqbw.text: Today my lover and decided to eat at kraft kitchen. I place ourselves on their waitlist and it indicated to be there by 1132am which was perfect. We arrived and checked in and within 10 minutes got a text message at 1135am that our table was ready. The sweet hostest sat us down and gave us menus to look over. We began talking and noticed after awhile that no one came to ask us what we wanted to drink or  acknowledge that we were there. So we waited a little longer and after about 15 minutes we left. We were disappointed at the lack of service that was not provided to us as we sat down. This is not a review of the food but of their service. I also have to mention that this would have been my second time eating here and the first time the good was great but I did notice a few people got our food before we did. I wish i could remember extactly what happened it has been at least 2 months since.

1m3-0jM5qH63PPIDsE93Sw.text: Wonderful experience.. short wait to be seated... Louis was an awesome server... bottomless mimosas... the food was AWESOME... 3 of us ordered and shared all of these delicious dishes

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Crab Benedict
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib hash

1xnMkpbavj1Z63ncvcykpA.text: Absolute favorite local restaurant in Vegas right now. The staff here is always friendly and the food is pretty amazing.  We love coming here because we have a two year old and this place is SUPER family friendly. Some of the must tries are  monkey bread, breakfast burrito,  crab cakes and sammy sandwich!

hE0_fBcILWHicq59tcF_Jg.text: The food is always great and the service is always nice...there is usually a wait but well worth it...today we ordered the weekly specials...the banana pudding pancakes...and the biscuits and gravy...the pancakes were the best I've ever had here...we enjoy this place 1-2 times a week and never disappoints....

yQp1CTpI97ZdwUO0_-2s7A.text: Not certain what has changed over the years that we've been dining here for breakfast, brunch, lunch and celebratory occasions- but there's been a steep decline in food quality, new staff service and overall experience. Today we arrived for breakfast with the in-laws and were served cold / luke warm monkey bread, and dirty side plates! When we were seated at the table there was a pesky fly hovering over us the entire meal. And lastly, the bathrooms were subpar.  Hopefully Jared and his wife read this review and realize today's experience among the past few visits as well need attention. It breaks my heart when a thriving, successful business starts to have more issues consistently. Everyone has a few flaws or mistakes that can be overlooked, but as a Duchess of "CK regular" there's a sincere concern. Please train new staff so they're as spectacular as your veterans, please wash your plates and check the temperatures of your dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. CK burger
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Café Mocha

IARoYMhLelnobXjVoULIJw.text: Pricier than the rest, but worth it. We just went for breakfast pastries and coffee, but boy, were they good. They reminded us of Dominique Ansel (in New York) but without the line around the block. My husband was very happy with their Kouign Amann with ham and cheese, while I (who'd originally come in for their salmon plate) went for their strawberry cheesecake Kouign Amann. We wanted to order everything on the menu. They even serve one of our favorite wines. We plan to go back to try other dishes like the aforementioned salmon, plus churro waffles, pork carnitas benedict and passion fruit mimosas (!).

b5YsxzeoySUbWMsiaxYCbA.text: Super cute spot in a shopping center.  Very nice coffee, croissants, fresh fruit and green juice.  They also have hot food, eggs pancakes waffles.  Cute decor and friendly staff.  I had cheese grits yummy but could not finish as they were super rich.  Minus 1 star as they don't have Apple Pay.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

8F41ivnpdRmwAJB0-ZJxYw.text: I had a very reasonable visit to CRAFTkitchen for the first time. For my group of four, it took roughly thirty minutes to get seated for Sunday Brunch. I ordered the Chicken and What? which was chicken and waffles with a jalapeno maple syrup. Personally, I was expecting a bit more in relation to the serving size to price ratio but I was still very excited to eat. In the end, while none of the food particular jumped off the page for me, it was still very satisfying for the mid-price point that we paid.   I will say however that I did appreciate that they had very considerate menu options for GF, Vegetarian, Vegan, etc. I also really like the idea that they update their seasonal menu items frequently, so I hope to be back soon to try another food adventure.

HF11iKQknnrenP2O4iztQg.text: I absolutely love it when food tastes as good as it looks and Craftkitchen nailed it! I'm still dreaming about that short rib hash but the other dishes were really great too. The staff that I met there were all really wonderful and seemed like really great people that have such a love and passion for food.   Beautiful delicious food and amazing people behind the food are just the perfect combination for me and really speak to my heart.   Kudos, Craftkitchen! I really can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib hash - amazing!

h420iOy9J2rv9jnGXwZ4Kw.text: The food is really good but the wait time was horrible. It was not busy and there were many empty tables but it still took over an hour and a half to get seated. Everytime we asked for a update on wait time they continue to say we are still waiting for a table to open up. Looking inside the restaurant and seeing many empty tables inside and outside we were a bit confused. I would come back for the food but not to wait over a hour to hear we cannot seat you because we are waiting for a table to open up. Really bad service.

DAT91HT1rZ-eHwUK1BXAeA.text: I used to come to this restaurant every single Saturday with my husband and son. The food is good but definitely overpriced. The last few times we have gone the service is abysmal. After avoiding the place for a while we thought we'd give it another chance. After waiting for 30 minutes for a table (being told it would only be 10 minutes) people that arrived at the restaurant a good 10 minutes after us were sat before us. I will not be returning to this place and I will be sure to spread the word to others to avoid it as well.

sSADyxGCDkPf3G1HAn3hIQ.text: I got the short rib hash and was disappointed. It was basically a bland beef stew flavor with mostly plain potatoes. Didn't even get full for $17.

QgoT799IaDAhoW8VY-ZzlQ.text: Couldn't wait to try our Craft Kitchen!! Arrived at 930 am and there were copious amounts of people waiting for 7 tables to 8 empty tables. They didn't want to sit anyone because they didn't want to seat anyone with a backed up kitchen. How about seat everyone and offer coffee water and juice??? I've never seen so many servers and the manager/owner standing around doing nothing. Disappointed. Trendy looking restaurant. Missed the mark. :(

Q-Rfd-rjS8EZfr4gvOABxg.text: Amazing food! This place was recommended by a vegan friend as they have a regular menu and a full vegan menu. My omni friends enjoyed french toast, bacon and eggs, and avocado toast with poached eggs. I had the farmers market stack which was awesome. This will definitely become a regular spot.

XrFb8DPgEYvh8XIfInQhfA.text: After wanting to try a different place for brunch, I came across Craft Kitchen. They had great reviews and the red velvet pancakes looked to die for!   The atmosphere was amazing as it had an old farmhouse rustic yet fresh and modern feel. I ordered the red velvet pancakes of course and my partner ordered the salmon Benedict. While waiting I also ordered coffee and the bottomless mimosas ($16, not a bad deal).   When the food arrived it was presented so lovely. I really enjoyed the pancakes, however I feel like they could have had more of the cream cheese sauce on top. Or a side of syrup. I really enjoyed the salmon Benedict, the salmon was very fresh!   The server was sweet and checked in on us periodically throughout our meal! I definitely recommend this place and will be trying new dishes the next time we go!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict and red velvet pancakes

yysA9XGDuH0mW73hu0GAVw.text: Ordered the: -immune boost juice ( they took it to the wrong table and arrived at the end of the meal, but they were nice enough to take it off) juice was poppin -chicken and waffles: they do a jalapeno twist on it and while it was good the waffles were just adequate. -chorizo skillet: this was the star very good portion. Super tasty, loved all the potatoes in it. Really good. -seasonal pop tart: not too sweet which i approve of and really liked it.  Price wise was as expected we spent about $35 for the above. Not including the juice that was about $9.  Love the decor and ambiance the place has. Staff was really friendly and helpful.

JpPkemR2c9_ykvL0XOsh7Q.text: Great spot! Further more proves that Henderson has wonderful hidden gems throughout city! Definitely will return.

wszKwt3M68TwSwkYZVWj_Q.text: CraftKitchen is my favorite breakfast spot in Henderson. The coffee is very good (black with a little heavy pouring cream = divine).  Every meal I've had here has been delicious, the salmon eggs benedict is my favorite so far. Geoffrey seems to be my server every time I go in!  He's wonderful; so friendly, and so attentive!  This is the restaurant I go to every time I'm up in the area, which is by the hospital and my surgeon, so they've seen me at worst, and the service has always been incredible. LOVE this place.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict

SzLtz3E7z3igDzS4QvlDsg.text: I've been here a few times. Ordered crab eggs Benedict and it was fine. Their tart but delicious Hollaindaise came on the side.   Coffee was out of a machine.   The pastries are pretty amazing though! Tons of options from cinnamon rolls to apple tarts and small individual sized pies.   Service was friendly and prompt.

ULRY0jazEjwfY_UEn5K83A.text: Love everything about it! Great food, great service!  Bottomless mimosas are awesome! Passion fruit is my favorite!

AVn6PbAryOcDyu7zxTOIoA.text: Recently found I was intolerant to dairy and gluten so I have been searching around town for restaurants that accommodate special dietary needs, and CRAFTkitchen just became my favorite one.  There's quite a selection of vegetarian and gluten free options which made it easy to decide. I ordered the protein fix and it was so delicious!  Teresa was our waitress, she was very nice and we can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Waited quite a while..... but for the BEST omelet ever!!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. I love the industrial look of the restaurant
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Wall decor is so adorable

TkVY70avCQFYSHWIZ-4tEw.text: Came here on a whim when I visited Vegas to clean out my old place.  When I arrived, I had realized it was the old 'Bread and Butter' cafe that I use to come often with some friends!  I am super glad I went on Yelp to look for a place to eat lunch.  While I was perusing through the pictures and reviews, I decided I wanted the Smashed Avocado Toast!    As soon as we entered, we were greeted promptly with a big smile from the hostess which I thought was very welcoming and really sets a friendly mood!  Good job on that part!  We were seated promptly and given menus to decide what to order.  I learned I could order both breakfast and lunch items!  Yay!    Food:  - Smashed Avocado Toast - Very tasty and avocado was creamy on a toasted ciabatta which paired well.  Favorite dish of brunch.  - CK House Burger - Very tasty  Meat cooked to your liking, I usually go with well-done.  The tomato jam used is pretty good too.   - Truffle Fries - I really liked these fries because it was thin and crispy.  And truffle oil?  Nothing can go wrong with that!   Baked Goods: - Granola Bars - Super delicious granola bars!  I have no idea what they use but the sweetness of it is so addicting!    - Nutella Cronut - Their cronut was very delicious.  Slight crunch but still soft and flakey!  It was perfect with the spread of nutella on the top!  Definitely gonna get this again.    - Chocolate and Banana Loaf - I didn't really care for it, was a bit too dry.    - Cronut Holes - I'm guessing it's just the left over dough and deep-fried.  My brother didn't really like it, I think he got a dry one, but the one I ate was pretty good!  Coated in sugar and a bit soft on the inside.    Parking - easy to find.  Large parking lot in front.   Service - Great!  No complaints!  Hostess was friendly, warm and welcoming.  Our server was quick, checked up on us periodically and friendly.

ZODuc_0OgF25UsfdEE1-fg.text: We LOVE CraftKitchen! The Avocado Toast is a necessary part of life.  The staff and service is fantastic and the coffee is !

gxrjS-k_1zoE1TCsqrSSoA.text: Cute breakfast pastry spot at the edge of Henderson.  A group of us girls decided to host a holiday brunch here with the theme being "an ugly sweater and white elephant party exchange". Craft Kitchen has a private room for a large group that is enclosed in glass which also has a closing glass door. You are seated away from the other guests; however  you can look through the glass room  and they too can look back into the Glass Room . Which makes the rooms semi-private.  A number of my friends ordered their bottomless mimosas which they really enjoyed during our visit. I ordered the chicken and waffles which was really good and spicy. The waffle was very flaky and the chicken was fried nicely.  The chicken and waffles came with a pickled jalapeno and pickled jalapeno maple syrup. The syrup had a hint of spice and heat with a taste of sweet as well. While there we didn't have the opportunity to try their pastry from their pastry bar, however another one of the guests did order a tray of pastries that she would take to a party later that night. Overall Craft Kitchen is a place that I would tell people to try especially for breakfast and I would like to go back and try it one more time without a group of people.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and What?

_hORjVOPZ3vZrFT3E_gGMw.text: Craft kitchen is AMAZING!!  By far the best coffee in town. It's a guaranteed perfect start to any day!

BqCSn7k2yETWR3HVFr23EQ.text: Best things about Craft Kitchen  *kids menu (they give you two sides-fruit, French fries, or chips with all their kids entrees) *breakfast all day!! *patio seating  The food and coffee is delicious (they do offer soy and almond milk substitutes).  I wish they had a location on my side of town.

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Kids portion grilled cheese with fruit and French fries! Great size!!

sHYtcwimOTJkDaSgNTRmVw.text: My favorite brunch place!!! I live in Summerlin and I dont mind the drive. Great atmosphere and customer service!   I've tried their shrimp and grits and the short rib beef hash and they are both amazing!   Dont miss out on dessert! They have THE best BREAD PUDDING in my life! Their espresso drinks are also great to pair with the pudding.   I had a sticky bun to go and it is a MUST try!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

0IoZSw15yCZirWucSdRfHw.text: This place is great!! The quality of food and presentation offers a fantastic addition to the city's already crowded breakfast scene. They were very busy, I mean packed with a long line. They were still able to deliver a fantastic product with timely service. To complement the quality of food, their decor is great, along to the vessels used for service. The best part? The value! Yes, more expensive than some of the other breakfast joints, but their quality is far superior.  Items ordered:   Chicken and What? - Fantastic Smoked salmon - Better than fantastic Turkey Benny - Good, just a tad dry...its turkey though! RV pancakes - Very good  The coffee was very good. They have been open for less than two months, and already killing it.  One small "opportunity for improvement" would be to work a little with the staff, so they would smile a little more often. By no means the service was not excellent, just that you can read a little stress on their faces, due to business pressure. They still were polite and efficient, though.   Can't wait to go back, even if this means another 40 minute drive!!

fcealZQc8ault33_Fl_tBQ.text: I would give it a 3.5.   Pros: - Good food - Decent menu selection  Cons: - Had to wait a while to even be greeted by someone at the door - Prices were slightly high for the portion sizes  Neutral: - Although they forgot to bring out something I ordered, they apologized & comped that part of my meal. Good job on the save there. - The atmosphere was loud, but only due to other customers (several groups of loudly cackling house wives). - I didn't try the coffee products, but they seem like they're trying to serve gourmet coffee / espresso at those prices, but nobody knew anything about their beans & they have automated machines that make the coffee - not really hitting it home in that area.  I'll try it again. I'm neutral at this point. Maybe next time they'll deliver better on the service side and it'll get a bump up to 4 stars!

NuVIjORQaoCzGna8eELsiw.text: I love this place!! That atmosphere is casual and laid back, and comfortable. We have gone here many times and have always had a good experience. Some of my favorite things are the short rib hash which is to die for!!! The flavor is amazing and the portion is a good size. The chicken and waffles dish is also one of our go to options which doesn't disappoint, again the combinations of flavor on this dish are awesome from the pickled jalapenos to the fried chicken to fluffy waffle. If you're in the mood for a lunch option the burger is also a great option and both the truffle fries and the sweet potato fries with the maple bacon aioli are great too! After you finish your meal you must save room for dessert they are all homemade and are all delicious. The cronuts are by far my favorite option with Nutella on top!! Next time you're in the mood for some brunch check this place out you will not be disappointed!

TteP_Gfc9DERsxFlXAsQWg.text: Great breakfast places are very hard to find. Breakfast items are often hard to make stand out from one another. Unless it's clearly poorly made, a pancake is a pancake, and an omelette is an omelette. However, this place has some great creativity with fresh ingredients while keeping the dishes True to breakfast and hearty enough to be satisfying without going overboard.  I had the chicken and waffles dish. My wife had the short rib dish. Both were amazing. The coffee was very rich and definitely not your diner style weak brew.   I'm a fan. We'll be back for sure.

As6_mHHG0ihXyKWYcw8HRQ.text: Great food and service! Loved the short rib hash with smashed potatoes. Nice selection of vegan/vegetarian/gluten-free items. Pastries were fantastic too. Will definitely be back!

VLSftnQ6fy5uhstPCHFzvw.text: Ugh. My boyfriend and I went for Brunch last Sunday. The service was not rude in any way but extremely disorganized (example: 3 different servers came by to get our drink order, but it took probably 20 minutes to finally get drinks).  I ordered chicken and waffles and my bf ordered a burger and garlic fries. The garlic fries were good and my boyfriend enjoyed his burger. The chicken and waffles, however, were *terrible*. No flavor, no texture and a serious lack of seasoning. With so many delicious brunch options nearby, we will not be back. The kicker? $78 for the bill. Nope.

UDOlY4RZYp-Ag3zIRn-azQ.text: Really great brunch place, less exciting lunch.  Haven't enjoyed the desserts yet, but salmon eggs benny is on point.  My husband always orders the chorizo skillet, it's insanely good and high quality. The smashed potatoes, oh my god...  Highly recommend for breakfast/brunch. Service is always an A!

CyOW7bCGxBYBtsR_jshrMQ.text: Popped my cherry today.. Everybody's friendly, the food's awesome, decent serving.. the ambiance is refreshing.. Def one of my fave breakfast n brunch spot

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Pulled turkey Benny
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked salmon on a pretzel bun

TwFluajMxyzvAxMYLOnW2Q.text: I was really excited about this place because of the good reviews. We waited for a seat inside for about 27 minutes! Wow! I asked the hostess if you needed reservations she said no, unless it's for a large party of 10 or more. Funny, because the couple that came 5 minutes after us was seated prior to us. We were a party of 2 as well. :(  We ordered coffee, strawberry lemonade, beef hash, and breakfast croissant sandwich = $32 plus tax & tip not included. $40 for our meal. We tip good because our waitress was really nice and polite. My husband said the food was okay, nothing special. The beef hash had great flavor. It would have tasted even better if it was served HOT not room temperature.  The decor is really cute, retro outdoor feel and clean. But as busy as it was, I wondered why they had all that room in the front left area upon walk in? Why not put 3 more tables there so there's more seating = more money = less waiting = better customer service?

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. All the room, why not add 2 or 3 more tables? Less waiting time for customers = more revenue...just a thought.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Breakfast croissant
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Beef hash, great flavor but served at room temperature. :(

rLb8iZowfji8GQG-Sggwwg.text: Great food and cool vibe. Love this spot and the bottomless mimosas with all the flavors are all delicious. Been here a few times and it's always solid.

S9ptwcuhAYIWp_sl5LyxgQ.text: So good. Great service. Short rib was superb. Such a cute environment. Will be back forsure.

AW6RBrBbvZTJqG420Z7UYA.text: Love this place! Excellent food, several choices for Gluten-free/Dairy-free. Service was terrific, love the coffee, decor and location. Definitely recommend for breakfast, brunch, lunch or dinner!

fb4cIk-hBvI_G1TXguCp4Q.text: 4 visits. Excellent food presented beautifully. Caprese sandwich on fresh baked Ciabatta roll can't be beat and I have ordered it at every visit; creamy mozzarella with sliced heirloom tomatoes and basil, drizzled with an incredible balsamic reduction. My wife is more creative and has ordered something different each time. This last visit she had a Croissant Egg and Bacon sandwich. Bacon was thick-sliced. Killer!   Baked goods to eat there or carry out. Nice friendly service. These people have worked in big name kitchens, and it shows in their work. Also the best damn coffee on this side of town.

FcRRWipUFT-iDWm3BTTFuQ.text: Amazing food! Me and my little man enjoyed a lunch date of GF kids cheeseburger sliders and short rib hash. So good!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy GF options.

lKgXF0eZAYgNX5U5nrbVjg.text: Hands down top spot. Top 3 spots to enjoy dining with a great atmosphere. I had the Italian melt. First the bread is amazing. Flavored properly and with a nicely added crunch. The pesto aioli is complimentary on the sandwich. But with the added Italian meats it give the sandwich a slight sweet, salty flavor. The salad that Comes with the melt has a phenomenal vinaigrette flavor. Light but packed with tons of flavor.

1fRq1YCqYkoz3r5rh27j0g.text: This is the best breakfast/brunch restaurant in Henderson. The Cronuts are perfect treat for my coworkers and me!! French dip was very good, slightly salty but the food was excellent.

mo-5A9ln5ALEBw8YvxZy8g.text: Ok the chorizo shepherds pie was fantastic! I actually had them add some cheese, because I'm a cheese whore! My friend had the Sammy and said it was also fantastic! I plan on coming back, because there's so much more on the menu that I want to try.

WteRiIDCKH0-litvXO3Iiw.text: Love all their meals!  I feel heathy when I leave!  Perfect place for lunch or breakfast!  Friendly staff too!

mxoBTeXLTFgeZ6I8E0yr6Q.text: Great service from everyone especially Elle!!  Made sure our mimosas were never empty.  Food was amazing.  Loved the short rib hash and monkey bread.  Cute place with good atmosphere and we were able to sit outside on a beautiful day...

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Monkey bread so delicious!!

xqbMHigTseBqPKhJKOSStw.text: I've been wanting to come here for about two years now and never made it out here. It's on the other side of the planet from my house, where the old Bread & Butter location used to be. I came around 10:30 on a Monday and it wasn't terribly busy. The hostess was easily the nicest person I've ever met, and let me know their pastries are running low, but to make sure to check them out. The weather outside was perfect, so I snagged a table for me, myself, & I and started off with a cup of coffee and a homemade pop tart. The coffee was fantastic, but I wasn't too impressed with the pop tart, I'd skip it. Wish I would have gotten there earlier to have a better selection.   I ordered the salmon Benedict and I was soooooo glad I did. They have a lengthy vegan menu and I was really tempted to keep it light & healthy but decided that would be for another time.  The server was quick & efficient and I only wish that this location were closer to my house!!

1ETOW_I3mFT0FZ2uzcv-pg.text: Love, Love this place! The atmosphere, the crew and specially the Food is outstanding. Been here 3 times in one week. Tried different stuff every time and was never disappointed.  Only complain was we wish we didn't find this place. Lol!

_FJ0_lVKn6e6N_GMaI_lQQ.text: We love craft kitchen and dine there fairly regularly. The latte is my favorite In town and the creme brulee French toast is to die for!!! Also love the short rib hash!

Z1O38RIVLFcIPHN6zkSsOw.text: Great food. Check in online to avoid the wait for a table!  We had lunch there and the food was amazing!  Good restaurant in Henderson, NV.

s8lEgWoAYgHR4G9fQu209A.text: Food was good. Atmosphere super cute. However, there is no hurry with hosts or servers. So, if u r super hungry, be prepared to wait even with reserved waitlist.

_9o1aZOpv2panpKzvENS9Q.text: Always a delight to dine at CRAFT Kitchen. There's definitely something in the water or something to the way this spot is managed because the staff always seems so excited to engage their guests. The food selection is great, the ambience/deco is minimal and so tasteful.  Today I dined by myself with Emily as my server, and she was quick attentive and polite. Gave me an honest recommendation that I followed -- the protein fix -- and I wasn't disappointed. Paired it with a matcha latte with almond milk. Great meal, filling but not bloating. But beware! Their house made salsa definitely has a kick to it, which is great if you can handle the heat!  All in all, this is one posh and pleasant neighborhood brunch spot that I'll come back to over and over again!

NQ1n9fE390bEa6XvB9jOSA.text: Love the food, the passion behind the food and the incredible people who are so proud of the food that is being made. We need more restaurants like Craft where you can taste the love and passion for what they do. Thank you for all that you all do everyday to bring delicious food to the Vegas community.

yJRbg3TbVEnnHbq3nbokbQ.text: This is a great brunch spot! Because it's so great, there's always a long wait, but the great thing is you can join the wait list on yelp! They have bottomless mimosas which is always a wonderful thing. I've been here multiple times and have always enjoyed my meal. The Vietnamese shrimp tacos were very flavorful and delicious. The vegetable panini was very fresh with nice foccacia bread. I've had the crustless quiche before as well which was great and came with a side salad.

SlcDp3QCk3kmEp16SQGXQA.text: This place is wonderful! Came here with my friend for Saturday brunch and truly enjoyed the taste experience! First and foremost I need to say this: bottomless mimosas!! And they are delicious! We're ordered monkey bread as a starter to our brunch and I want to order it to go the next time I go there! It was like eating a pull apart cinnamon roll! Next I ordered the crab cake benedict. It melted in my mouth and there was a lot of crab! My friend ordered the chorizo skillet breakfast and he loved it! He said it had a lot of flavor and it was savory!  The best part about my visit was the service! Everyone at CRAFTkitchen was polite and courteous and funny, very attentive and friendly!! Overall I give this place a thumbs up  and 5 stars!

jpXqfyxvfFjqOpqwvV0drQ.text: Last Sunday my friend and I went to CRAFTkitchen for brunch. It was our first time here and it did not disappoint! From the bottomless mimosas, pastry options and variety of breakfast and lunch food, we ended up trying a handful on the menu. Everything was delicious! We had cappuccino's, cronut holes, croissant sammy, a Cinnabon/muffin, omelette and an amazing concoction called a cruffin that had strawberry and a scrumptious custard filling.  The decor is clean, lots of light and an ideal setting for friends/family/dates. Our server Katie was friendly, personable and more than helpful when it came to our indecisiveness on what all to try.  If you haven't been here yet make sure you try it out!

anco2ujctE2skUTepCZ2aQ.text: Hidden breakfast/brunch gem in Henderson. I met a friend here at 9am on a Sunday for breakfast, and by 11am there was a line out the door of hungry people waiting for a table.   PROS:  + They have an entire separate vegan menu loaded with fantastic yummy options.  + Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about both the regular and vegan menus.  + Avocado toast was crunchy, creamy and flavorful and the vegan cinnamon roll was soft, sweet and warm, perfect combo.  + They have freshly squeezed juice options!  CONS:  - It seems to get very busy around 11am - 12pm, so either get their early or prepare to wait  TIP(s): They have so many options, I would recommend ordering a few and sharing. Also, as stated above it gets busy so if you can try to get there before 10:30am - 11am on the weekends.

aTwxq1SH18Izd4Y9zp9D0w.text: Just had my 2nd great breakfast at CRAFTkitchen.  So for the Carnitas Benedict and Chorizo Scramble have been great.  Service is attentive, coffee is outstanding.  Portion size is just right (not too big and not too small).  One of my top 2 breakfast spots in LV.

IKI9Snp-IqLAT7GwMdUd-A.text: This is one of the best breakfasts I've had in a long time (and we frequently go out for breakfast!) The creme brulee French toast is probably the best breakfast dish I've ever tasted. I highly recommend you visit this place! If possible, I recommend checking in ahead of time via the Yelp app because otherwise they may be on a wait. Using the check-in feature via Yelp, we ended up waiting less than 15 minutes vs 45. I think this place is really excellent-- honestly, I'm not a frequent yelper, and I had such a great experience here I wanted to be sure to let everyone know!

Tod3hblEYKbOuETzdPXbbQ.text: My wife, son, and I decided to drop by for breakfast. Plenty of parking outside since it's conveniently located in a strip mall-style area. It wasn't too busy fortunately so we were seated right away. The host thoughtfully asked if our son wanted crayons to keep him entertained which we gladly accepted. Unfortunately, those never came but no big deal. Seating inside is very spacious and the restaurant is very clean. The prices are on the higher end but the food wasn't anything to write home about. Don't get me wrong, everything tasted great but I'm not convinced the prices match the taste but keep in mind that most of the menu are organic, etc so it makes sense. The staff were very friendly and attentive. I recommend anyone stopping by for breakfast, brunch, or lunch if they are in the area.

rtiOw9Lv2sx-7KlYRHMIeA.text: My favorite brunch place! I love everything I've had here. Their pancakes are amazing.

ZddDSPCKhYNERx4-9HXDuQ.text: Stop #2 on the "OMG, WHY HAVEN'T I BEEN HERE SOONER" tour...  CRAFTkitchen is one of those places located far enough away to make it seem virtually impossible for me to make it over there without a great deal of personal hardship. In other words, it's outside of that 10-mile radius for Las Vegas residents that makes it seems as though it's located on another planet. What's up with that, anyway?   With that said, I finally made it over for brunch on a beautiful almost-spring Saturday morning with some girlfriends. The stars must have aligned for this journey because the 215, Eastern, and the CRAFTkitchen parking lot were relatively easy to maneuver. Furthermore, the wait for a table was only a few minutes. Thanks, universe!   The restaurant itself is wonderfully well-lit and open. The seating is comfortable; though in our booth, we were close enough to the surrounding tables to get a good look at their food (not a bad thing) and to eavesdrop on their conversation (if we were inclined to do so).   The menu covers all the brunch classics with unique touches that don't make you feel like a total lame for ordering yet another benedict. Looking back at the meal, I appreciate how well everything was prepared. I left my meal both satisfied and with a list of all the things I need/must/will try on my next visit.   This is one of those places where it's great to go in a small group with friends who are willing to eat family style or share plates. Thankfully, my group was completely down for this plan so we were able to order quite a few items, including:  - Smashed Avocado Toast. I tell myself over and over that I can make this myself but, damn, this one's good.   - Crustless Quiche of the Day. We had bacon and cheese. It was delicious, but perhaps a tad bit on the small side.   - Pork Carnitas Benedict. I had my doubts and they were quickly erased. This was beautifully done.   - Chilaquiles (made vegan with soyrizo). I'm really picky about the chips used in a chilaquiles. These were perfect.  - Mimosa. Having driven the 15 miles from home because I didn't have the energy to chat up a Lyft driver, I opted for one $8 blood orange mimosa. There is a bottomless option for $16 if you can muster up the chattiness to let someone else drive. Here's my thing with mimosas: I don't really do juice. I'd rather just have a glass of bubbles. THESE mimosas though... consider the juice to bubbles ratio nailed, everyone.   - Coffee. I've been drinking a lot of free office coffee. Because free. It sucks. It's almost undrinkable on most days. The coffee at CRAFT was a real treat. So smooth.    We also got a few baked goods. Frankly, CRAFTkitchen is worth a visit just for carby sweet and savory goodies.   - Ham and Cheese Kouign Amann. GET IT WARMED UP AND THANK YOURSELF FOR BEING YOUR BEST FRIEND IN THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD  - Vegan Cinnamon Roll. Also great. Warm. It. Up.   - Vegan Blueberry Lemon Scone. You know it's good when you question its lack of dairy.   - Monkey Bread. Ours was a little bit overdone, but not enough for it to be problematic. It was still gooey in the best way possible.   I'm hopeful to make a return trip for more brunch madness soon and am eager to try dinner... if and when I can get my mind wrapped around driving this "far" again.

nT4Ck3-2mWKrYnIwY17dNQ.text: Good food, good coffee, a little noisy. I'll give it  3 1/2 stars  due to the noise level, I waited 15 minutes for a table that was already open when I put my name on the list, & the service started off good. The waiter was friendly & helpful  but the waiter got too busy to even give me more water. He said he would come back but didn't.

ctBIvIrR4lrrs8pW26XTrw.text: *Food Allergies  I honestly do not know what star rating is fair here. Please read below for a full assessment (I was going to give 3 stars but decided on two in hopes of catching the restaurants attention)... their food is great but I've only tried the Pork Carnitas Benedict, have had it every time ...my daughter turned us on to this place and she also loves the Pork Carnitas Benedict...she would take everyone there...unfortunately she has MS and controls it through diet the last time we were there about three weeks ago she ordered her usual with gf bread unfortunately she was not given gf bread...she even confirmed with her favorite waitress 3 times and was told it was definitely gf the waitress even double checked with the kitchen...we should have known better her answers seemed unsure....needless to say my daughter was in pain and feeling ill for over a week after having breakfast here... so for the Pork Carnitas Benedict I give 5 stars for the carelessness of the waitress and kitchen 1 star but really should be negative stars...we have been here many times prior to this, my daughter was there at least once a week, she refuses to go back and I don't blame her our family will not be returning...I hope this place takes allergies more seriously in the future....watching my daughter in pain for over a week was overwhelming and I can't imagine what she felt...

L0eJTuzW7qkvMTMVgUg6iw.text: My favorite breakfast/ brunch place in all of vegas  Fantastic food & excellent service every time  I will be telling everyone to go there  Thanks!

They need to raise their prices on their weekend menu so the wait time gets better... this would also give them extra capital so they could one day expand which I hope they do. ACk0ci-15GZNdXkTje3J4w.text: Probably won't eat here for a while... Fined at this restaurant numerous times & it has always been spectacular.We ordered an assortment of food to brunch w/ a friend in town from LA.   FOOD: My shrimp Po'Boy was missing the shrimp when it arrived at the table. The remoulade was slathered all over the bun that my fingers were coated w/ sauce. Churro waffles & Roast Beef sandwiches are amazing though.  SERVICE: I would say our server was adequate at best. Waited awhile to get our food order in. When she checked on us at the end of the meal, She cleared my half eaten plate & we asked for a box. She came back & dropped the check WHEN we still wanted to order some delicious pastries to-go.  Being someone that has worked in the F&B industry and dined at this establishment many times, I left pretty disappointed.

hQ2zw29FTA2U1THX4KgL8A.text: Tried the Craft Benedict, Carnitas Omelet and the Apple Cobbler Pancakes. Now let me just say, I came here with some seriously high expectations and honestly this place DID NOT DISAPPOINT! I love wholesome, made from scratch comfort foods and CRAFTkitchen most certainly serves up some of the finest there is to offer. Everything was superb, very well made and perfectly plated.   My favorite things about each dish are as follows: the thick Niman Ranch ham and the zesty citrus Hollandaise sauce made the CRAFT Benedict extra delectable, the cobbler crumble, caramel sauce, and the whipped cream were perfection on the Apple Cobbler Pancakes, and lastly my favorite things about the Carnitas Omelet were the avocado salsa and the carnitas (so sooo good together).

3nN6nrhIQn7i21FWwqj2Mw.text: Went here for lunch with a friend on Wednesday around 11:45am. I didn't know this place existed before seeing them at the Lion Habitat event. Located in a strip mall behind Osaka's, on Eastern between Horizon Ridge and Sunridge.  They have some outdoor seating, and when you walk in it is very simply decorated, clean, with plenty of light from the windows. They even have a back room area for larger groups. We were quickly greeted by the host and sat.  Service was outstanding, maybe 3 minutes before drink orders taken and 8 minutes before food order. Refills of ice tea and water were prompt.  I ordered the Turkey Benny, and my friend went with the French Dip. Rave reviews on both meals. My Turkey Benny had plenty of turkey, grilled tomatoes, avocado, and perfectly poached eggs. The citrus hollandaise sauce was delicious, with a nice hint of butter taste. It's not a huge meal that will fill you up, but nicely sized and perfect for my lunch. My friend raved about the beef in his french dip.  Overall, great place to come and have breakfast or lunch, and weekend brunches. It wasn't too busy when we went, and filled up about halfway while we were there. I didn't explore the bakery or coffee selections so I can't comment on that. Fresh ingredients expertly prepared. Enjoy!!

JOoLRi548EzdgIuiIleN7Q.text: We had a wonderful brunch here today. It was my mother-in-law's birthday and we decided to branch out and trying something new. We found this place highly recommended on YELP so we put our name on the list online and headed over. We waited maybe 2 minutes for a table (highly recommend putting your name on the list to avoid the wait) and Susan, the manager seated us. She was very gracious. We were lucky enough to have JP as our server. He was so attentive and had some great recommendations. We tried the Cuban sandwich (our overall favorite and something we would come back for),a mocha latte (oh my goodness HEAVEN), a chicken pot pie (good but not our favorite), and the avocado toast (DELISH). We also had some bottomless mimosas. We asked to speak to the manager to RAVE about JP (yes the service was THAT good) and told her it was our first time and we would definitely come back. She packed up some pastries for us to take home! My goodness what amazing service. I feel like good service is hard to find in Vegas but this place takes the cake. We will definitely become regulars. Thank you JP and Susan for showing us our new favorite brunch spot.

1IxQjTlD9-FHQUZnxKsO9g.text: Excellent food!  I've been here numerous times and never leave disappointed.  The turkey benny is a nice twist that they have come up with as they use real pulled turkey with a home made hollandaise sauce that you pour on top of the benny.  I still want to try their home made chorizo and some of their other items as well.  But do yourself a favor and make sure you either leave room for their baked goods or take some home with you.  Sticky buns, scones, COOKIES, and croissant are some noteworthy baked items.  Seriously, they are all good.  Take some home to the family and you'll have a happy household.  If you're from out of the area, it's worth the drive to try this spot.  I'm gonna try their home made pop tarts next time.
