cvNd7vQydaehvfRnSXxiCw.text: This was my first time dining here and I will be back often. I ordered a pretty basic breakfast of eggs and bacon with potatoes but there was something different about it.  If you like hot sauce they have one with the right amount of heat that was perfect with the eggs and potatoes. Getting great service was an added bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

yIrvk_j7nkHdCgEsT9jpxQ.text: I have visited this new start up 6 or 7 occasions thus far. Most often for breakfast - in part because they serve great coffee. The decor is bright - fresh - clean. Service is excellent and friendly. But the real star here is the food.  Offerings are not your standard bacon and eggs fare. Short rib hash, smashed potatoes, avocado crostini, pastries, caprese sliders are brightly flavored and beautifully presented.  Future adds will be housemade breads for purchase/take home.  Stop in near their 3 pm close and they will sell you left over housemade slider buns and pretzel rolls at a discount. Check this place out!

bUBfEAcpDNXTHZ4J9Aq7eA.text: ....really nice location...I had the C.K. Special and it was good...I didnt realize till later no one asked if I wanted more coffee...perhaps they serve by the cup but if that is the case they should have a French Press as an option...surprised their baked products were so limited...and as a whole there just seemed something a tad off with how they present themselves and execution....perhaps they were training new employees....I will go back for sure...

FbE0zi6bWLdS7-QI5BzXQA.text: A gem just behind Osaka hibachi in Henderson. Decor was minimal with a touch of organic modern the support staff was on top of their game Katie did a great job, food was insanely good and better leave room for dessert the owners True magic happen after you eat an impressive meal. I had the chicken pesto salad, truffle fries. The dessert was intense Lemon meringue and a Chocolate smores treat ! Great private party room fantastic cooking looking forward to see if their breakfast holds up as well as their lunch menu!

_-jgURX3tQRJG0x7NzHkCQ.text: This place is awesome and we will definitely be going back. We first tried their food at the Yelp event Lions, Tapas, and Scares. The fresh barrata and pumpkin soup was delicious so we had to come in for brunch. My husband got the bottomless mimosas so he could try one of each. His favorite in order was raspberry, white peach, blood orange, then pomegranate. They were a little slow on the refills but they were busy. They did not skimp on the champagne. I had a mocha and it was high quality. We started with the monkey bread and it was to die for; ooey, gooey, sticky, buttery, sweet deliciousness. For our meal my husband got the croissant sandwich. He asked for the egg over easy which it came out hard but other than that it was good. He also had a side of sweet potato fries with maple bacon aioli which he liked. I got the acai bowl which was beautiful. I have definitely had better smoothie bowls but I think that had to do with the berries being out of season and tart. The coconut and granola on it were good. I got a side of turkey sausage which was extremely dry, probably because it was made with turkey breast. It was also $4 for a small patty, I wouldn't order it again. Next time we will try other things off the menu since some items weren't our favorite, but I know they have lots of great options to try and think they have 5 star potential.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. The egg came out hard when we asked for over easy but was still good.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Acai Bowl. Tart but fresh.

VzgM4Bq9RU3TIOXje0D7SQ.text: This place is pretty solid. Quality of the ingredients and presentation is off the charts. Big league attention to detail.  Don't expect anything here to be your basic b**** variety. Everything, from the silverware, plates, and the cream holder for the coffee is next level. You are not going to see pre-packaged vacuum sealed artificial- imitation plastic synth creamer containers in a little bowl in the corner like you would see in a run down diner, no, you get a stylish, contemporary ceramic container with FRESH cream. Those little things do make a difference. In addition, they have some very interesting menu items and the taste profiles harmonize pretty well together most of the time.  Something I really like is their "Sweet" stuff, like pancakes and other sweet things are pretty awesome. A lot of places just have stuff like that as an after thought, something to fill space on the menu.  It does not get a 5 though, for several reasons, mainly because it is kind of expensive. I am probably a couple of tax brackets too low to afford eating here on a regular basis. Ok... I am exaggerating a little bit, for the type of food you are getting, it is a really good value if you consider the quality of the ingredients and attention to detail put into it. But still, expect to pay about double compared to going to Denny's.    The other reason I don't give it a 5, and this is probably really petty, is the staff seems slightly too reserved. I am not saying they need to act like a bubbly teenager working at chick-fl-a, but it would be nice to see a little more bounce, a little more glow, a little more pep.   Also, this may be a plus for some people, but the clientele who frequent this establishment are a little too pretentious for my tastes. I'm talking about the kind of people who look like they think that they have an inherent superiority over the plebs because they spent $15 on a kale-infused, gluten free, acai berry , fair-trade, quinoa loaf for brunch.  Despite all that, solid 4/5. This would make a great place to take someone on a date as well.

0xtJrNVAmcFyv8DXEpPjxw.text: This place is super delicious! Great food and great service! Alexandra was very friendly which makes me definitely want to come back for more!

9QgYEfSPG4S4twXaMICfBA.text: I was invited to brunch here with a dear friend - now I did not choose breakfast this time around - I ordered the sliders and my husband ordered the street tacos. I must say they were both excellent and glad we had the opportunity to re visit Thai restaurant. The mimosas were amazing as well - perfect balance and nice and cold. We will be back for their lunch /brunch offerings

dCRPhAG_AWVL51d9m62cog.text: First time and my last time. I was Very disappointed with my breakfast experience. First of all I have never sat in more uncomfortable seating, chairs are made for children not adults, benches take riding the pine to a whole new level. My breakfast was served on a side plate sized plate, and the forks are for children's hands. There are no choices for toast, I was served two very small dried out hard tac crumbling pieces of something that even starving birds would ignore. There are no choices for jam, I was brought strawberry jam, that's it for your choices. They served my bacon and eggs with sprouts, are you kidding? Sprouts! The eggs, smashed potatoes, and bacon were cooked perfectly. I also thought the service was excellent. My breakfast was over priced by 20% by Henderson standards. This restaurant was recommended to me by a friend who said their brunch was to die for, maybe so but my experience during a weekday morning visit was simply terrible. My advice, don't screw around trying to be trendy.

28ENY7uGKhVRC6VFClmirw.text: Delicious smoked salmon tastes very light and fresh. I asked the chef Jared/Troi if it was possible to have a bread that was crispier he put it on some ciabatta for me instead of the pretzel roll. AWESOME!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon

9kPstUGelCqmHCZduw7D-g.text: This is my first time here and I cannot say enough good things about it!! My mother and I ordered the Farmer's Market Stack and the Wild Mushroom and Garlic Quiche. Umm WOW! They were both fantastic to say the least.   Not only is the food amazing, but the atmosphere and level of customer service you receive while dining provides you with that local business vibe.   Definitely a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Wild mushroom quiche... Enough said

VhA2UDWlbL_zyAmXchF5hw.text: Best pastries in Henderson!! Make sure to indicate which items you want from the case as you walk in because they might be gone when you leave! The food is fantastic and they will adjust it by request. Not eating bread or potatoes? They will saute spinach and mushrooms to put under you salmon benedict, which is so delicious! Love the cobb salad, french dip, and red velvet pancakes. They also make cakes and deserts to order for events, and they are absolutely amazing. We ordered a tirimisu cake for a birthday party and it was to die for.

2McPRBikvaIJ1FNkMEKEHg.text: Short rib hash and monkey bread. Just wow. Go here.  Service was great, with perfect recommendations.

FjNmTqPs7wBvoHasgDtp5g.text: I have been here just for coffee and most recently for breakfast.  I had the chorizo scramble and it was good but the chunks of chorizo are much too large.  The service and ambiance is nice so overall an A-OK rating until I try some other menu items...pastries look decadent.

A1FjgOdBnqcYKs93udy_cw.text: Great Food!! Short rib hash was my favorite. All the baked pastries were so good. The avocado toast is amazing.

A4lHjqvHAuG4n38i3zUlmQ.text: A pricey little place for brunch with low-key atmosphere. The food is excellent. Had the ribs meat with potato and egg. Also had the red velvet pancakes. Great presentation and friendly staff. Well worth the price for a unique experience. Portions are not huge so come for the flavor and experience rather than the high calorie content.

pmtrh19XSD8PIIphBySV2w.text: Food was good but they allowed three dogs to come inside the restaurant while we were eating.  One table had three.  All emotional support dogs?  Really? Seemed to know the manager?   Should be on patio I think.  More in line with health codes.  Other than that nice.

kLU7vgpNWZOcKOTI2mXCMQ.text: This is the very best place to eat. The food is fresh, no additives, peanut free. The bakery goods are fantastic. If I lived here, I would buy fresh bakery items from this place.  I had the veg omelette. Honestly it was the freshest most tasty breakfast I've had in a long time.  It's family owned and the owners are the chefs. Try the turkey sausage, cinnamon rolls, fresh coffee and on and on We spoke to one of the owners, Tammy and she was delightful. Give a great local business your business.  I wish they were in Prescott and Gilbert AZ where we hail from.  Thank you for a great morning meal.  Betty E LoisB

2JUwew25CxWE6_h2yrrHRQ.text: Favorite breakfast place in town! I have severe nut allergies and after alerting our waiter of this, the owner came out and explained to me that her daughter also had nut allergies so nuts do not even touch the kitchen. This was amazing to me that she took the time to come out and talk to me and put me at ease. I love the environment of this restaurant and appreciate the cleanliness and smiling faces every time I come in!

bahGhi4boGuJL8Ubo_Yf2Q.text: Came here for brunch with my family. The staff was very helpful and kind. The food was great.

h4zfmQ65FXQnTzKMoNakgw.text: I love this spot. I go weekly, sometimes twice. Even the two times things weren't perfect, I was met with amazing customer service that made the issue disappear. The staff is so kind. I dearly miss the forager sandwich, but they are constantly adding inventive tasty items to the special menu and the regular menu doesn't change too much, which I appreciate. The French Dip is lean, I haven't experience tough, fatty, or grisly in it yet and I've ordered it about 10 times. I love the smashed toast with the sunflower seeds, micro greens and avocado. If you'd like a sugar coma definitely come on a weekend when they have the churro waffles on the specialty menu, you can't put your fork down. And of course, homemade pop tarts!!! I've heard some complaints about slow service, and you just have to understand, they get SLAMMED on weekends for brunch, and everything is cooked to order and fresh, so of course there could be a chance for a wait. But it's definitely worth it. And if you ever do have an issue, management is attentive and happy to make it right given the opportunity. Love love love!

wDdkVM7MqyVpnQQG62BKcA.text: A friend had told me about this spot.  I finally had time to stop by.  I was not disappointed!  Friendly and attentive staff.  They didn't hover but they were there to answer questions. Their recommendation of the braised short rib hash was spot on.  I'm not a fan of eggs for breakfast and sometimes find the menu too limited. Not here. This hash was awesome with smashed and crispy small Yukon potatoes and flavorful short ribs.  Maybe the best part was the fresh brewed coffee. No refills but a fresh cup brought to my table.  Breakfast was so good I selected 4 pastries to bring home to my hubby.  The place was constantly busy even on a late Tuesday morning.   Not a place to miss.

rcFuijbae6p2UUslB3L4bQ.text: This review is for the catering. I was hosting  a small gathering at my home. I wanted simple yet delicious food. Eating CraftKitchen food never disappoints so I had them cater. Wow the sandwiches were sooooooo good and the salads they made were raved about for days. Everything was fresh and ready on time. I will absolutely use them again for parties big or small.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. These delicious gems completed our Home Depot party. They tasted amazing too!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Ask and you shall receive! Birthday Home Depot orange cupcakes AND unbelievably yummy as well. Totally nailed it once again CraftKitchen

VJvwwA5ZQqJ3pojG1a2PAA.text: I've lived in Las Vegas for 3 years and today, I found my favorite Brunch Spot! Locally Sourced, Non-GMO, Open, Airy & Bright.   Our server Elle was Fantastic! She was upbeat, super nice and gave great recommendations. I had the Avocado Toast with a poached egg (which was creamy, had a nice citrus flavor and on a thinly sliced crusty bread). Food was light and perfect portion size. The prices were reasonable and they had a great selection of pastries (Pop Tart was delicious) and desserts looked great- (small, cute sizes). Great Local Place- Vegas needs more restaurants like this! :)

nvFH4a259s3Qng7jTGckdw.text: Everything about this place is amazing. By far my new favorite brunch place...The service is excellent, the lattes are amazing, and the food leaves your tastebuds screaming for more! Try the monkey bread, turkey Benedict, cheesy grits, and chile verde omelet!!!

kWxFCUeLFU4bbz_WI8Ib3w.text: These people were so awesome and nice to us. Our waiter was on top of it and kept the drinks refilled. Was even nice enough to take our picture for our girls brunch! I loved the homemade pop tart! I even got two! The pork carnitas omelet with that creamy lime sauce was delicious! Oh and their pomegranate mimosas were perfectly balanced.

1_wUDeCyeSbpScx3jCmnZA.text: I highly recommend this place, the atmosphere is very hip. The food choices are interesting and different from most breakfast places. I am a pescatarian and there were a lot of cool options for me both vegetarian and with seafood.

Nb4rvWHe-boQHOLBXlWg0g.text: This place is a lot cuter in real life! As soon as you come up - you see some pallets turned into planters which gives the place a bright entrance. As soon as you walk in, you'll see the counter along with  a display of their desserts. There are a few booth seats along the window, along with a separate room that you can see into through glass. They also have these cute little square salt & pepper shakers along with a mini plant on each table.  My friend and I got the Smoked Salmon, Red Velvet Pancakes, and the Sweet Potato Fries. Everything came out pretty quickly and looked amazing! All the dishes were very colorful. The prices can be a bit high for the portions, but that's just my opinion.   Smoked salmon: comes with two little pretzel buns, some sort of sauce, a decent amount of salmon, some micro-greens and some little green things that I had no idea what they were. Something in there was really salty so it wasn't as enjoyable. I believe it was those little green things that made it pretty salty.  Red velvet cakes: comes with 4 little red velvet cakes, cream cheese icing, white chocolate (?) shavings, and some raspberries & blueberries (like 4 of each...). These tasted exactly how they should but they were a bit dry, so I wasn't able to finish all of them sadly.  Sweet potato fries: skinny sweet potato fries and a side of crack sauce (maple bacon aioli). Tasted how you would expect them to! Some of the skinnier fries were a bit burnt though.  The servers were really nice and pleasant. I can't remember their names because there were about 3 who helped us out. They always checked up on us and tried to have little conversations with you. I would consider this place a hidden gem! This place is a bit of a drive but I would consider coming back.

fxHfP6PC9Joj3euQQPReuw.text: Great food, fresh ingredients, options for both meat eaters and vegetarians, and good portion sizes.  Nice clean and modern ambiance.  We ordered:  -lemon meringue tart (must get! Nice balance of tart with sweet, and the creamy meringue was a perfect topping) -corned beef hash (my friend enjoyed it, the side of mustard sauce was really flavorful) -butternut squash hash (came with two eggs, and the potatoes were not typical hash style, but were whole roasted fingerling type potatoes with were perfectly crispy on the outside and really delicious) -vegetarian breakfast burrito (stuffed with chili relleno. I asked for their homemade hot sauce which brought the burrito to a new level. Their avocado tomatillo sauce had a nice tang but was not spicy enough for me. Hot sauce was an extra charge (0.75 I believe) -blood orange mimosas (weekends only, one for $8 or bottomless for $16) -dirty chai latte (light flavor, not the best I have had, but comes with a small biscotti which was light and flavorful)  I came two times over my stay! Really enjoyed my food and dessert, and the service was friendly and quick!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Butternut squash hash, served all day
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Super creamy meringue
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Dirty chai and lemon meringue tart

spsqcHsDAU93KBqLb8D90Q.text: I loved this place!!! It was quite a drive for me since I live in northwest Las Vegas, but oh so worth the trip. We went during prime time, brunch on a Saturday, so the wait time was around 10 minutes which wasn't bad at all. The menu had a lot to choose from and was very affordable (ranging from $10-12); all the food, and even the coffee, tasted wonderful; service was great and fast; bakery items were also cheap and delicious. Overall I highly recommend this place since there aren't too many classy yet fairly priced breakfast/brunch places out here.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Crustless quiche of the day: asparagus, bacon, and gruyere with fresh fruit

s7iywPvra40yxEqQlaBv8g.text: We decided to try this restaurant for brunch since it has been around a couple of years and we hadn't visited it yet. It's a very nice restaurant with a hip and modern vibe. It is small and fills up quickly but has some seating outside as well. The staff is very friendly and on top of everything, especially when we told them we were first timers. We partook of their Bottomless Mimosas that come in three flavors, Pomegranate, Orange, Blood Orange. For brunch my wife had the Chicken and What? (Chicken and Waffles with Jalapeno Syrup), holy smokes was it good. I had the Chorizo Scramble Skillet (Chorizo, Scrambled Eggs, Smashed Potatoes, Cheddar Cheese), again it was great. Remember, they're only open for breakfast and brunch and can run out of some popular items, so make sure you get there early. We look forward to returning.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chorizo Scramble Skillet
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and What? (Chicken and Waffles)

_Lq6UqSDWVPICuU0IWPUGw.text: Beautiful and delicious food, very pleasant staff.  Recommended by a friend.  Will definitely return here!

sYhrrhJqSP7VU_PfgaVF4A.text: First time trying this place, at the request of my husband. I like fresh, homegrown, organic ingredients, and he used that to get me to go! I also like supporting local small business.   The place was packed! We got the last empty table inside of the restaurant. That told me that this place was going to be good. The decor is super cute, and the bathroom is clean. Love all of the plants everywhere, including the herb garden outside.   Server came right over after we sat down with water. I didn't catch his name, but he had a long black point tail. He was really good! As it was our first time here, we had to read the entire menu over, and the server was kind enough to give us a couple of minutes several times to decide what we wanted.   My little one ordered hot chocolate, which she loved! She was delited that it came out so pretty. They do flat whipped cream with chocolate plaid like lines on top. Plus, it was really yummy! Big hit.   I ordered the butternut squash hash. Whatever they put on that squash was so addictive. This was one of the best things I have had in a long time. Everything in it was delicious.   My little one ordered the mini chocolate chip pancakes. She was full from the hot chocolate (ha!) so I ate half of her pancakes. They seriously need to put these on the adult menu, because they were awesome. I would come back just for these.   My husband got the CK house burger. It was gone in about 30 seconds. He said it was delicious as well. He also got a side of garlic french fries. Yum!  We also got my daughter a cake pop to go!  Its a little pricey, but that's to be expected for good quality food. Overall, 5 stars for sure!!

2YzzdUJRxwv-c0xiW8C-RQ.text: This food was so good.  It was like high-end homemade.  Came for brunch, and had the omelette, and we shared pancakes.  I think someone also ordered another savory dish.  All was excellent. Service was fine.  The indoor-outdoor vibe of the restaurant is great and on-trend.  The reason for a minus star is the fact that seating is difficult, and depending on the time, you will wait a while for a table.  We came at the end of their brunch (before they closed) to avoid this, but then we felt we were rushed to get out of there before they shut down.

pO5Va25UP7MX13ePrratGw.text: We truly enjoyed this most innovative menu which had several vegan options as well.  Service was flawless.  The noise level was a bit too loud for me since I was longing for a quiet, peaceful place after a whole week in Las Vegas at a trade show on the strip. I highly recommend this place for lunch.

74XZT3z0C-749gAqltXLxA.text: One of my favorite brunch spots in Henderson! The churro waffles are to die for. There is usually a short wait, but it is totally worth it.

qzUk5dvGBzLgeij4Ubatnw.text: This is a fun spot to go to for brunch. Service is wonderful, and the inside has a great vibe to it. My friends and I enjoyed their bottomless mimosa option very much, especially because when you got it refilled you could switch up and try their other flavors. The food was delicious as well, the only thing I'd say is that there was a large portion of my side compared to entree, and while I love potatoes I wasn't too big of a fan for how they do them. Otherwise, definitely still worth it to keep coming here and try their other options. Well priced as well.

OLlL_Li9aceSYIwcdAAIYQ.text: Came here after seeing Yelp reviews. Had such a good experience that I've been coming here regularly. Busy local spot that is popular for brunch. Bottomless mimosas on the weekends.   Favorite dishes I have had here are short rib hash and chorizo skillet. But honestly, everything here is good. I have also had the monkey bread, sweet potato fries, pork carnitas omelet, and oatmeal.   Follow them on Instagram. They post weekend specials. I most recently had the short rib mac and cheese and the crab and asparagus omelet from the weekend specials menu.   Super good restaurant. Expect to wait for 20 minutes for a table. But it's well worth the wait.

AaLIDiRciS7USeKVZXr3WQ.text: Great food! Pricey, but worth it! There pesto chicken arugula salad was on point the chicken was cook right, Not dry! If your looking for something to fill you up for breakfast their CK breakfast burrito I would recommend or if you want something light there Greek yogurt, I could eat those mini muffins all day!

eq9Til370KX3g2RqD4eaXg.text: This is one of my favorite brunch spots in the Henderson area.  Food is always amazing and service is almost perfect (lol).  Ambiance is typically chill.  If you have a big party, be prepared to wait!  The CK Breakfast Burrito with the red sauce is a must get!!  Erica R is our favorite server, she came in clutch today (6.2.2018).  Our experience was out to a very rough start but Erica swooped in and made sure we were taken care of from start to finish, thank you so much!

O6qJ340zlr2qem_4wIQIZQ.text: Warning: This review is by a casual breakfast eater. With that being said, this place has nice ambiance, a versatile menu and friendly servers. A separate coffee bar is also a nice feature. I had the avocado toast and the CK Special. The avocado toast is the clear standout here. The special was bacon and eggs with "smashed potatoes".. the potatoes were good, the bacon very good but the eggs were just okay.. over east eggs should have a good amount of runny yolk. Although, we did not have mimosas they looked great! $16 for bottomless

bPARhjjlitabKj6jWHUysA.text: Fathers Day treat for my husband -put us on the waiting list on line - got seated @ almost 1:30. Now to be fair, they were busy, well staffed but busy. Took about 10 minutes to get water - we perused the menu for another 10 minutes - placed order. The main reason that I took hubbs there was the monkey bread that was the 1st thing we ordered. We were told that all the monkey bread was gone & if we wanted it we had to get there early.  You would think that the kitchen had the skill to be able to plan for a holiday on a Sunday sales, it is not that hard, especially because it can be made & panned ahead of time.  Settled on just ordering peach Kouign-amann, a breakfast burrito sauce & jalapeno on the side & short rib grilled cheese with salad with ranch, garlic Parmesan fries, 1 ice tea with lime that turned out to be some kind of flavored tea. The server said she could slice a lime for the tea. Finally got the tea at about the time we were served that was never refilled. Had to ask for sauce & jalapeno, salad had vinegar on it. All the food was good. Not memorable, a little bland, but good. Overall with a half an hour drive from across town - not worth it.  For $38.10 should have gone to the buffet @ Green Valley Station.

BeDAkZJJLhIe-WCffZrh4Q.text: I absolutely love this place. The food is always fresh and delicious (my favorite dish is the steak sandwich with chimichurri sauce) and their pastries are so scrumptious too. It's such a wonderful place that one often has to wait, but they have a nice wait list system with not only the buzzer device to let you know when they're ready for you, but they'll text you when they're ready too, if you choose that option. The metal chairs are uncomfortable though. I guess they do that to encourage a faster turnaround time.

88u0FPbZ5Op7ArRSQiaTvA.text: Fantastic Food, wonderful simple decor. A little Gem in Henderson. Don't miss out , you have to stop in and try anything, the food is that Amazing!!

CiyUr6yfAr_BmFCxis3-dw.text: One of my favorite brunch spots in all of Las Vegas. All around they nail it here! Great food, service, interior design, and attention to detail. Once you're greeted by Devin the customer service manager and taste the "farm to table" style food, you'll as well become a loyal fan. I've eaten here not just many times, but have had them cater a few family events. Adam the manager does a great job for catering events and the service in addition to fantastic food. Keep it up my friends!!!

ei2YpM0y-SOiU52qbybV7Q.text: We arrived here just an hour and a half after opening and already there were many people seated. That already told me, they must be good!   Everything about this place seemed geared toward being eco-friendly, and while they did have tons of succulents on each table and also along the wall, I do think it'd be nicer if they were all real :)   That aside, the food was delicious. It took awhile to get to our table, but it was presented nicely and tasted so good! We will definitely come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

ik2jjklmf8F8ORT3CXUR6g.text: Nom nom nom nom nom!   OMG!  I'm in love!  I'm so sad I can't have breakfast here every single Saturday morning - because I'm telling you folks - if I lived in Vegas - I would.    Found it on Yelp (of course) while looking for a breakfast place to load up on before driving to Red Rocks.  It's located in a busy strip mall district but we easily found parking right out front and walked in and were pleasantly surprised by the lack of wait.  We were sat at a cute quiet corner two person booth.  BOOM.  Already starting off well.   I ordered a soy chai latte and it was promptly brought out with a small biscotti cookie.  Yum!  It was delish.  The carafe of orange juice was fresh and delicious as well.   There were several items I wanted to try on the menu --- but I ended up going with the avocado toast which had smashed avocado, sesame seed pesto, greens and a poached egg on ciabatta with greek yogurt topped with fresh berries and homemade granola.  I also tried the monkey bread which was DELICIOUS.  I want to try turkey sliders, cinnamon rolls, the acai bowl, veg omelete, breakfast burrito, etc. etc.  This is def. going to be a place I haunt next time I come to Vegas.   Service was great and we had great conversation with a nice lady who sat at the table beside us and was a local business owner.    Excellent experience with great food, good service, and great healthy ingredients and menu options!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. The special menu with my soy chai latte. Mmmm
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Avocado toast.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Small size yogurt parfait. The yogurt was whipped deliciousness.

W6pzWAHz7WR3NcuXOvC8Zg.text: Wow. We came in on a Sunday morning. Very busy, we waited about 25-30 minutes and we were lucky. Lots of breakfast and lunch options. Very tasty, healthy, and sweet options. Great service, seemed very friendly and relaxed place. Lots of babies with parents.  Will return next time I'm in town. Here are some pictures of the Hash with fried egg and my vegetarian omelette. Both very well presented and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Tasty vegetarian omelette. Very happy with the choice.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Wow. Squash Hash with fried egg.

9tiAsmLHjV77rQoElF8k2g.text: By far one of the best hidden gems in Henderson. I've come here a handful of times and every single time it's been hands-down one of the best experiences.  The staff is always friendly and eager to help. Very knowledgeable on the menu and always smiling. One of the most customer service friendly restaurants around.  Restaurant itself is bright and always clean. Decor is very modest. The real star of the show is the food.  My go to is always the lox platter. It's presented on a homemade pretzel bun. Cream cheese, tomato's, Red onions, lox, capers and micro greens. What more do you need! Firm 5/5. Not bad for about $12.   They always feature a different pancake plate as well. Blueberry lemon pancakes have been the favorite but the bananas foster also were amazing. Both are 4/5 and 5/5.  Another go to is the chillaquilles. Yes it's s staple around town but the salsa is what turns this one up a notch. We do the vegan way with no chorizo. Ask for extra sauce on the side.  Chef owned and run you can taste the difference here. By all means make the trek to Henderson!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas foster Pancake of the Day
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas foster pancakes
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Truffle Fries

t3f_s94t0KuP9bfm7TSTEQ.text: So today at 12:00 I finally went into CRAFTkitchen today for a sit down meal since I usually just get my food to go.  We were greeted by the hostess and was told it was about a 45 minute wait. We weren't super starving so we were okay sticking around.  Once we were finally seated, we took a look at the menu. They have everything here from birthday pancakes to avocado tacos. Everything looked and sounded so yummy we had a hard time figuring out what we were going to order!  So we started off with a Bloody Mary (for my guy) and a mimosa (for me!)  The presentation of the Bloody Mary was SUPERB!  It was stacked high with bacon, shrimp, and olives.  We finally decided on ordering the carnitas omelette and the chorizo scramble skillet.  Our food came out within 15-20 minutes which was super quick considering how slammed they were!   The Food:  This is where I had to knock off a star. In the past when I've gotten take out, the food had succeeded my expectations. Unfortunately that wasn't the case dining in. Both of our dishes had ZERO flavor. My carnitas were dry and the chorizo scramble was pretty bland.  Again I was so confused because previously I have had nothing but amazing flavor from this place.   In the end, I will be back to try some other dishes, and maybe just stick with my favorite "Avocado Toast." But in all honesty the service form our waitress today was probably one of the best I've received in all of Henderson!

qZf29B5cFbkrpxlw4FilTg.text: The restaurant is clean, beautiful, the staff is very friendly and somewhat attentive. We did have to wait a few times for our drinks but the service for our food was very quick and I was impressed because they were very busy. Our waitress was friendly but I asked for scrambled eggs instead of poached on mine and it still came to poached . My family waited for their coffee a little bit longer than I'd like but the food is delicious. I wish it wasn't as loud in there as it is but it's a small space. Definitely use the app to get on the waiting list and make sure you check in to let them know for sure you're coming or you will not be able to use the waiting list.

tRdqOsB_ID3roxljyjb0Fg.text: We ordered 3 things and all of them underwhelming and disappointing.  CK burger- was too rare and undercooked.  Pesto chicken salad- chicken was over cooked and dry.  Farmers market stack- tomatoes and tomatoes pure was tangy and felt like it had gone bad.   Quite disappointing but drinks were good.

MnS9DYO3zyOr7FVDG1qlvg.text: During my most recent trip to Vegas, a friend invited me to breakfast. She suggested that we meet at CRAFT Kitchen. Not knowing anything about the place, I did what most people would do and check yelp. Looking at the pics, I just knew I would enjoy the food here. Also, the reviews of this place were positive.  Like other breakfast places, it was packed on a Saturday. One of the most awesome features that I seen on yelp is the check in ahead feature. It tells you how long the wait is and puts your name on the wait list. Essential you are on the list while driving down. Once getting there, we waited about 5-7 more minutes for a table to open. We were seated inside although they do have patio seating but it was just too cold for me.  All of the food look so delicious. I ended up getting the short rib hash. The meat was so tender and flavorful. The potatoes not mushy. It was just a great pairing. I look forward to eating there again and trying some of the other dishes.

GsrKrUuf5yXhnkf6sNSi7Q.text: This is the second time we've been here and the short rib grilled cheese was awesome! Side comment I must make when I got the bill there was a charge for "salsa".... Really...I asked for Tabasco replied we don't have Tabasco but we have some other hot sauce. Maybe a little mentioning next time if you're going to do an upcharge without our knowledge and I' just add it to the bill and hope it slides through-- completely wrong. The food is awesome but that absolutely put a bitter taste in my mouth, not sure if we'll be back. This is Vegas in there are plenty of good restaurants inthis town.

Jcl11oEp_-oohR9dd2hOew.text: Troi is the best!!!! Ask for him. Food & mimosas are amazing! My friends & I really enjoy this place. Even the coffee is great!

u-1QAk34oHhGJrayVU7Cwg.text: We stopped in for a quick brunch around 11am and the place was packed! Thankfully my friend had a reservation so we were seated within a few moments. I had the braised short ribs with homemade red hot sauce. That has some heat to it! My meal was very good. However, I could have done with about half of the potatoes. Their potatoes are not normal square potatoes they are simi smashed fingerling potatoes. We had a very good meal. The pastries looked great!

6NhRig3IzLok4yaopXwW5g.text: This place is very close to our house and a fantastic location for breakfast or brunch. The food is creative and fun. The service is good. Sometimes a bit slow, because they are always packed. You will usually have to wait for a seat for the same reason. They have outdoor dining for those who bring their dogs or want to sit outside. Everything is really good! The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because they don't have much in the way of gluten-free offerings. I can't eat grains of any kind and it's kind of slim pickings. If you have no dietary restrictions, this place is fantastic!

zfjLjBgratlRPLQqtP_RmQ.text: Fantastic restaurant! Food and service.were exceptional. We traveled almost 40 minutes from the far northwest side of town to eat here after hearing many good things. CRAFT kitchen did not disappoint. I had the salmon eggs Benedict. It was a very well balanced delicate but decadent dish. My SO had the huevos rancheros and they were among the best we've ever had. Maybe a bit spicy for those don't like spice but the flavors were perfect otherwise. The monkey bread was awesome too! Slightly crispy on the top but our favorite part was the soft parts on the bottom. Many times with these types of restaurants you get either good for or service but with this local spot you get both. The hostesses were nice, the server was knowledgeable and kind and what stood out was the manager Susan who was really good with our toddler and went above and beyond to serve our sometimes challenging needs.

XTmRnylXN73MArrPTQ-j6A.text: I appreciate that they have a vegan menu. I ordered the Avocado Taco. The presentation was beautiful, and the flavors were great - but, as they deep fried the avocados, the texture was mushy. There was no relief from the mushy texture. They need to put some lettuce or cucumber slices on the plate to break up the monotony.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan Avocado Tacos

ItoJH_01rlQkavImlybE6w.text: My sister and I came in for brunch on Black Friday. The dining room was packed, but we only had to wait a few minutes for a table. We requested the vegan menu.   The selection was pretty impressive, considering CRAFTkitchen isn't a vegan restaurant. The dishes were largely vegetable dishes with the option of adding meat substitutes. They offered Gardein chick'n and soy chorizo, which was probably also a store bought brand, but it was nice having the option. We opted for the soy meats, but the dishes were great vegetable dishes on their own. The hash consisted of perfectly cooked butternut squash cubes, grilled onions, and kale pieces sprinkled throughout. The smashed potatoes were perfectly cooked and well seasoned, but there was a disproportionately large amount of them. I desired more of the kale and caramelized onion. The fried avocado in the tacos were generously portioned; the texture of the crispy coating along with the creamy avocado made for a luscious bite. The black bean was smooth and the crema sauce was flavor-packed. The soyrizo added that extra hit of spice.   Service was attentive and friendly. The decor was hipster-y, but not in a pretentious way. Easy parking in a shared lot.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan menu
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Crispy Avocado Tacos with soyrizo and Butternut Squash Hash with Gardein chick&#39;n

aJaGqfoIleKX_Zr31Uhj5A.text: On my visit the day I visited Craft Kitchen, all I wanted was a salad.  I checked Yelp and saw that Craft Kitchen serves healthier foods and so I made the decision to head on over.  Especially because it is super easy to get to from the back roads from where I work.  My lunch is at 11am and I got here not too soon after.  The restaurant was actually busy.  I took a seat by the window and searched and searched and searched for a plain ole salad, but none was to be found.  They only have the fancy kind.  Nothing on the menu was appealing to me either.  So I ended up with the buffalo chicken wrap. But it's vegetarian, so it really isn't chicken.  The service was slow.  So slow, that I almost didn't make back to the office on time.  While I waited a long while, I was noticing that those that had ordered before I got there, were waiting longer than I was.  The restaurant was nice looking.  They have a nice glass enclosed conference room that appeared could be reserved ahead of time for people to have luncheon meetings in. And, I thought the service is good too.  My meal finally came, but only left me 10-minutes to down my food.  The "chicken" was fine, but the buffalo seasoning was too tangy for me like it had too much vinegar.  Thank goodness for the fried potato chips it came with.  That was the only thing I really enjoyed.  Because of the delay in getting my meal and pressed for time to finish it, I couldn't wait anymore for someone to drop off the check and for me to pay it.  I ended up having to walk up to the cashier to pay.  It's kind of a bummer because I was looking forward to trying this place out for quite sometime, only to be disappointed. Maybe healthier vegetarian cuisine just isn't for me.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken wrap

zrePLSbi82HlcUByrclZ6A.text: By far my favorite out of all the brunch restaurants I've eaten in Las Vegas and Henderson. They never disappoint. Came specifically to try their Kouign Amann and boy was it worth the wait and the travel. Since we waited a while before our orders was taken, they compensated our long wait by giving us complimentary Kouign Amann and cronuts both delish. I had their chilaquiles and my son had the chicken and waffles, the chicken was moist and tender and the chilaquiles was so flavorful. Will definitely be back to try.  Special shoutout to our server as well for the exceptional service. Will definitely be back to try their K.F.C. Korean fried chicken!

BeVndJKNEUzDodeYQwHS9A.text: This is hands-down my favorite breakfast spot in town. Their creme brulee french toast is to die for and everything else I've tried is five-stars. Also their coffee is amazing! Their staff is nice and very attentive and will not make you wait for refills no matter how busy they are. *** Just do yourself a favor whenever you decide to come here and get yourself on the Yelp wait list. It's not fair when people complain about the 40min wait when this place is trying to do everything they can to accommodate people fast. ***

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;Creme Brûlée&#34; Stuffed French Toast Pancake of the Day The Veg Omelet

jNZQHJsFodYyorZmDiSRNw.text: Las Vegas feels like it's growing and this restaurant is evidence that the glory of Vegas and its surrounding cities aren't limited to the strip.  Visiting my best friend who moved there, he found this chic, adorable spot. It's got great decor, a hip vibe, and really cool staff. It's in the middle of an unassuming plaza, so don't judge the restaurant by the cover.   I had a really hard time ordering because there were so many things I wanted. And cruising on Yelp didn't help as there were many beautiful photos. Arriving at 10:45 am on a Saturday, peak brunch hours. We were sat within 30 minutes.   I ended up getting the fried avocado tacos and boy am I glad. They were delicious, a fantastic texture, and as someone who hails from Los Angeles, a really good ode to Mexican food with a hip, modern twist.   The rest of my party was also incredibly satisfied with their dishes, from the bloody Mary's to the cups of coffee, brewed one at a time.   Highly recommend, 5/5 for ambiance, service (even though a bit slow at times, just relax & enjoy!), and food.   The food actually tasted as good as the photos looked.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried avocado tacos. Do it!

eclun8O46EQX9kndr84AUw.text: Probably the best place in the area for breakfast. But bring your patience on the weekends. You should make a reservation and still expect To wait a bit. This is a very popular spot. The food is exceptional. It's very healthy, fresh and they do a nice presentation.

qTb1rTgtlPa0dgxOx4bebw.text: I was excited to eat here because I had heard awesome reviews but was let down.  We had a super long wait which was okay, I expected there to be one.  What was a bummer was how long it took for our orders to be taken and how all of our orders were wrong.  There were 4 of us and none of them were right. Instead of apologizing our waitress laughed about it.   Heard a lot of good things about this place but was let down.

3GZlxsYwOVSKM8sgHjCDrA.text: First time I was impressed...today, second time,  I'm a forever fan. Jaret truly knows the essence of who he is and the impact he wants to make with his patrons. He is a master of his craft and picks his staff as carefully as he picks the organic fare he nourishes us with. Being a designer, you are transported to a fresh look that embraces our desert with cacti on the walls and sayings that speak of family and food. Today we were lucky enough to have Katie wait on us and Devin with the good hair, entertain us...great place-great people-great food. Can't wait for next time!!

3rpaPEhyTGY5LCUmsP95Lg.text: I ordered the salmon bagel here. It was delicious but the salmon was kind of too fishy for me and they put too much on it. Their drinks were great. It's nice spot to grab brunch and you can sit outside.

dsLu_cN9Iu1_pgC8JDk6wg.text: Great place for Saturday brunch. Had bottomless mimosas, delicious food, good service.

NWOQY7iTUPbSTB5HfVJtQw.text: This was my second time eating at the Craft Kitchen.....and I still think the food is good, but way over priced! I can understand that some of their signature items may justify a higher cost....but I fail to see how this a applies to a sack of pancakes. This morning's breakfast consisted of a stack of regular (not the pancake of the day) pancakes $10.95, three pieces of bacon $5.00, and a cup of coffee $2.50. I can't speak for anyone else, but I think $18.45 for this breakfast is excessive and quite frankly indefensible! By the way the $18.45 does not include sale tax $1.48, and my 20% tip (on the entire amount) $4.00. Total bill: $23.93! I thought it was only the casinos that stole your money? Needless to say....I won't be back!! Signed, Taken

J0xiLFhfENAl7ZAgpk1atg.text: I have came to this restaurant multiple times. The review is based off the service not food. The food is delicious but the service here SUCKS. This is the reasoning behind this review.   The last time I went in, I waited over an hour for my food. My brunch date had to get out of his seat to ask about the food. When the food was brought out it was cold. Who eats cold eggs Benedict? So, I then asked for something that wouldn't take as long and new. They took another 30 mins to cook the same meal. So I explained I'm in a rush and have to leave. I didn't ask for the same meal because it took too long the first time and the messed up the order. I prefer the smoked salmon vs the fresh salmon. Anyways, I didn't end up eating until 3 1/2 hours later.   Then today...my order was messed up. I love the fried capers but I got none. I wanted avocado spread on my English bread for my salmon Benedict. They brought me a big chunk on the side, happens every time. I didn't ask for my eggs on the side but they did it anyways, weird? Much? I asked to spice up my food, nothing. Didn't offer hot sauce or bring any. The server also forgot my coffee. I had to stop someone else after my food came and it still wasn't there.  Hopefully the owners and management see this review so they don't lose business. I have brought many friends here and refuse to go now. Everyone enjoys the food but when it doesn't come out in time, orders get messed up or it's served cold. You can't convince a friend to try it again when it happens the second time. Third time isn't a charm here!

4GaLiJa_ahiWEXoX3sfhCw.text: Great vegan, vegetarian and meat lover options. Food is delicious!! Service is a tad slow. My server punched in the wrong order. Other than that, I recommend CRAFTKitchen. You will love the food and atmosphere.

XhpWT7mzm47x3D6NYZMdrg.text: Modern, clean and friendly staff breakfast place. I am a foodie, love good food and willing to pay the price and service. Craftkitchen is nothing special, food is okay and plating is clean but not enough food on the plate to fill your hungry stomach for the price.  Ordered a Red Velvet Pancake (5 little mini ones), a seasonal dish and a cup of tea for one person, cost $34. The portion is very very small. If you expect to leave this place feeling somewhat full, expect to spend more than $30 per person.    "Chicken and What" comes with 2 mini waffles and 2pcs of small chicken strip.   "Chorizo Scamble Skillet" the spices for this dish does not go well together. One bite and I will never want to eat it again.  Red Velvet Pancake comes with 5 mini size ones. It's fluffy and small, not worth the money.   Portion size is good for children.   You will notice these friendly staff keeps coming to your table asking if you would like dessert or anything else they could get you. The reason is they know you are not going to be full after these small clean looking plate of food.   If you are on a budget, this is not a place for you. If you want to try something new and different, this is new but not that different to other similar breakfast place. You could get the same kind of food elsewhere, better tasting and fills you up. If you know how to cook, you could make the same dishes for less, healthier and better tasting. You don't have to be a chef to make these dishes.   When it comes to taste and enjoying a good breakfast, this place is not for me.

Qk23pcw6v_l4jE6qQZf8eA.text: Great brunch spot! I had croissant bacon egg and my husband chicken & waffles. Our waiter was super friendly and attentive ( Jeffery)  We will be back and look for my husbands article on this place in Gaming Today from Marco D'Angelo

3U6K6nfOu26XPfHxkOkfmQ.text: 2.5  Just not impressed with this place, like at all. I'm sure this review will receive the typical owner comment explaining away the legitimate issues I will address (ps owner where are you? There was zero owner/manager interaction with guests seen) but here goes:  My significant other and I spend every November in Vegas at the M Resort and I am always looking for places off the beaten path to eat at. More so, I specifically look for small businesses to support. When I bookmarked this place I was excited, walking out I was disappointed.   Regarding decor, it's  the typical "new" craft kitchen/gastropub standard decorative scheme. Coming from LA this has become common and we all know what I'm talking about; white tile, dark salvaged wood, herb/succulents, burnished steel. Been there, done that. We all know it's beautiful.   Our server, although sweet, seemed extremely overwhelmed and unsure of herself. Having worked in the hospitality industry for almost a decade I noted to my significant other "there's too much people doing busy work and not enough servers on." Someone should talk to the staff and let them know if people's waters or coffees are empty, if there are dirty plates on the table, that rolling silverware or rearranging pastries is not the priority. Our server also forget the egg we requested on our short rib hash. It came after we were almost done (like three bites left). The egg should have  been comped, period or the whole meal offered to be remade as ordered.   Regarding the taste and quality of food. I have to agree with some other reviewers, the price point is about two to three dollars too high for each item. The short rib hash was very small and although delicious (not amazing) I know what it costs to locally source and profit margins. Our coffee WAS amazing though, so very high marks for that.  Additional notes to staff and owner: While I was sitting there and there was an obvious wait, some people came in and bypassed the line to sit down at a table and camp out while they put in a Togo order. None of the staff were brave enough to approach these people despite the over a dozen people that were already standing there waiting. Train your staff to be more proactive and  take responsibility for their environment or post a clear sign.   If I lived in the area, I wouldn't come back to eat, but I would probably grab a pastry and a Togo coffee.

nwjv2FauXn6BYfiE34e6FQ.text: After reading the reviews I was very enthusiastic about trying this place, love that it is locally owned, and near the Anthem area.   Walked in on a Sunday around noon for brunch. Not many tables, and very crowded. When you walk in it is very awkward, not clear where to ask for a table. After putting our name in we awkwardly stood next to the entrance as there wasn't a clear area to wait. Because the place is awkwardly laid out you feel like youre in the way. Servers walking through the 'waiting area' or lack there of. The wait was at least 30 minutes, which the hostess failed to mention when we put our name in, so we spent 30 minutes standing in the middle of chaos.   The food was good, but very overpriced for what it was. The portions were small, and the food although good, you can get the same quality for much less elsewhere. 2 adults and a child $75 bill.  Wouldn't mind paying the price if the service was better, and the waiting area/seating were not so awkward.  The service was very very slow. Especially waiting for the bill. Nearly 20min wait for the check, had to find someone to request it, and still took 10min to get it after that. You can't demand the high price and offer low quality service, it doesn't make sense.  For the price I would expect a stress free, well serviced dining experience, and Craft unfortunately did not deliver.  The decor was done very well, hope Craft Kitchen can work through some of the deficiencies, and continue to be successful. As for me I probably won't be going back.

sIHTRy65OMXHggG5iuxGrA.text: The ambiance is clean, modern, and friendly. The food is unique and delicious. We are paleo and was able to find our diet preference in their menu. The prices match what they serve, not cheap but not expensive. We can't wait to return.

9G7ORXgijFVplmwD6wMYXA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Everything about it, the atmosphere, decor, the passion that the chefs put into the restaurant, the quality, the staff is incredibly friendly, offers great recommendations, and the food is amazing! Ive had the Smashed Avacado Toast - yum! I havent had a Crustless Quiche of the day that i didn't like, always delicious.  The Veg Omlet with that roasted garlic cream sauce - amazing. Oh and dont even get me started on the pastry items...to die for!
