UOFV1MeUITiCw-P4oTJpNQ.text: Ate here the other day for weekend brunch.  The waiter was phenomenal and he had great suggestions.  Food was tasty and portions were generous.  Had the soup, vegetable toast and the red velvet pancakes.  Little pricey but average for the area. Would like to come and try more dishes.

2odJW8gA5qpg1CwfzIEY3Q.text: So far I've only had one meal here.  It was pretty good too.  Beef sliders with garlic fries. I'm most impressed with the fact that they have GF bread and desserts, hard to find in this area. I'll definitely go back

xLxudC1p63mtVVtf5jAqWA.text: Food is DELICIOUS but I'm not a fan of the service. I like their oatmeal brulee, their Monkey Bread on the weekends is AMAZING. And I'm a big fan of the potatoes. But I'd rather order to go. With 2 baby's long waits can be killer.

GOfU3hCRX_9pcQlf3HSEeA.text: Been here a few times and the food was good. Tried the avocado toast,  chicken and What?, Korean tacos and salmon benny.  All were good and the presentation was nice. It's definitely a trendy little spot .  The service is okay which is why I gave it a 4.  The waitress at our last visit kept forgetting our requests and we had to bother a different server. But overall it's a cool place to go for brunch.

hmANUJiIvP0wQ60C71zVrg.text: Delicious food and great service! We had the croissant sammy, truffle fries, and turkey benny.  Brazilian coffee was good too! The bacon was crispy, the croissant was buttery and flaky. The truffle fries were skinny and crispy too, like Houston's fries. The portion sizes were perfect, enough food to be satisfied, but not stuffed.   I can't wait to come back to try the chorizo Shepard pie, shorts ribs, and ck market. I might even give and get the glutton free pastries.  They look like they are worth the calories and carbs.  The decor is cute and modern. It seems very well run considering they just opened a few days ago.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Shiort rib hash-get in my belly!

4ZtV0V_R53NPvehClukesA.text: I was a little worried when my grits came out with greenery in them but boy, was I pleasantly surprised! I got the CK Special with a side of Cheesy Grits. Everything was DELICIOUS. I went alone so I sat at a little table near the center of the restaurant - Awesome atmosphere and amazing wait staff. My only complaint would be the comfort of the chairs. I'm a little hippy and the chair rails dug into my hips. Next time, I'll request a booth. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. CK Special. Everything on this plate was amazing.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Don&#39;t let these fancy sprigs and petals fool you. These Cheesy Grits are delicious!

YZGrfl3gtnd2pBY7BjjSCA.text: Went for brunch on Presidents' Day. Was fairly busy and we chose to sit outside and eat. It was a tad chilly but nice. I ordered the turkey benny and it was very good. Citrus hollandaise was surprisingly crisp and tasty. Turkey was a little odd being with eggs. And a couple stems in the micro greens that were very noticeable. Overall very good presentation great flavors and felt kinda light in the stomach for a benny. Service was okay although outside people seemed "left out". Five stars for good food good price and for support of new eats in the neighborhood. You could use some fresh juices or blends.  Good markup and healthy delicious add ons.

lECWfHwfwouRfTzJRp7Y5Q.text: After hearing a lot of good things about this place, I finally had a chance to try it out.   As soon as I entered, I loved the setting already. Very spacious for the most part and very clean. The hostess was super attentive which was nice. Got seated right away.   One word to describe the food of this place? YUMMY!  I definitely had a hard time choosing what to eat here since everything looked so interesting and good! I ended up choosing the pulled turkey benny with a poached egg on top and a side of truffle fries because the cravings were real. My friend ended up getting the turkey burger with no jalapenos.   The pulled turkey benny was really tasty especially with the side of hollandaise sauce to dip it in. The sauce was very lemony which to me balanced all the flavors with the benny. The turkey burger, when it first came out, looked very plain until we saw the avocado spread, cheese, and sauce. Super juicy patty and very well balanced with the flavor as well.   Overall, I really loved this spot and would definitely try it again. Maybe for their happy hours on Fridays starting at 4pm will be next on my list. Can't wait to come back to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Turkey burger with no jalapeños.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Pulled turkey benny with a poached egg
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. The setting

KCRw21hsNzGarzqBRMGemA.text: The meat is outstanding. The service is great.   Sides are a bit too heavy for me but flavors were great.   Classic and elegant dining room with large booths that set a great ambiance.

knu4RqAlhKA7qslkGuqA7w.text: YASSS!! My favorite brunch spot! Craft has lots of spacious seating inside & outside. The lush greenery inside makes this cafe picture perfect! The menu is has very unique items that are just exquisite & they have a vegan selection too. The coffee is really good too!! I would highly suggest trying this chic cafe out!!

VvM6i0EIaAwp8x0CDaQE2Q.text: Had brunch here while visiting Vegas.  Great ambiance here..hipster feel with great food and pastries.  Man, those pastries looked so damn good that I wanted all of them.  I did get their cookies and they were good.  Anyways, back to the dining there.....we got seated immediately luckily.  We got there about 11:30am and it was crowded but by time it was noon, there was a wait.  I got their protein breakfast which was filling even though it was small in proportion, but because it was protein, it filled me up. Definitely a place to hit up but arrive early or there may be a wait.

zomD0jHlc-jWwpKWaVXVGg.text: Not a great breakfast! The crab Benedict was deep fried crab patties that were clearly fried in old oil.  As they were dark brown!!  Up the street will serve the same dish with fresh crab no deep fried patties.

Zlq-E1_SsqUxEJIADobCng.text: I dont know about everyone else but part of the reason I eat out is to be served..First time here, I loved the food especially the truffle fries. The server, a guy really was a lop. I had to get up and get coffee, very inattentive and frustrating. Even when getting a cup to go, it took 15 minutes... Service is huge and they didnt measure up...

mzGKekqmYPr1pWeLOGu0Ww.text: Great place and if you are vegan, be sure to ask for the vegan menu. I discovered Craftkitchen because my friend wanted organic, locally sourced food. I can speak very highly of the Mediterranean veggie sandwich and sweet potato fries.  Fabulous!  Nice environment. Good service too.

WZx8qB3Kj4JrdIRglkKd5w.text: I'm pretty much obsessed. The coffee + treat section is ALWAYS on point, the second you walk in the door. There's always a friendly hostess who organizes the crowd (if there is one) and finds you a place to sit. I have 3 kids under 4 and tend to wind up in the private dining room a lot (HA) which is fine by me! It's so cute in there, and as long as you call ahead to reserve it, it's yours! I hate to give away that secret but yeah..... Don't steal my table, people!!!! Lol.   I've had 3 different servers now. Katie, a gentleman with dark hair in a ponytail, and one other girl with dark hair. Boy, aren't I awesome with names? Anyway, all of them were so sweet and patient with my kids and I. They feed the masses with ease! Also, I came in here once with a friend of mine, Bobbi, and the manager who helped rectify a previous experience of hers was also AMAZING to us. Pretty much just the best service ever.   I've had quite a few different meals here, today happened to be the salmon Benedict, which is so full of flavor. Fried capers, I mean, come on. And the hollandaise sauce is made with angel tears, or something like that. The veg omelet is also amazing..... whatever that garlic sauce is, ASK FOR EXTRA OF THAT. Trust me, you will want more.   All of my kids are obsessed with the red velvet pancakes, which speak for themselves. My fiance ordered the breakfast burrito and loved it. They make their hot sauce in house and he says it's the best hot sauce in the world!!!! It's like a spread? Kinda? Almost? I dunno, it's definitely thicker than a sauce...... but I don't even like hot sauce and the stuff looks good to me!   Long story short, if you're looking for amazingly delicious, healthier-than-usual food, served by awesome people.... Come here!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito

RjqMCeTs59XCzpUnLdPuiw.text: Excellent healthy choice. I chose the Power Protein Omelette and was blown away. The proportions were perfect. Also had the Power Greens Juice which was excellent as well, I will definitely be back for more!

WuKe1EwQIe4lO3itS-Yt6Q.text: Went here for Sunday brunch after church. Didn't even know about it until I saw it on Yelp. I must say, the restaurant itself is aesthetically pleasing. There's an area to eat at outside in case you want to enjoy the weather or if you just want to bring your doggies. It's really simple & very modern looking. Very LA to me, I loved it. The staff is also friendly & helpful. Katie served us today and she gave good suggestions.   I ended up ordering the C.K. special which included 2 eggs of your choice, bacon or turkey sausage (I got the turkey sausage & it was really flavorful), & smashed potatoes (omg so crispy & perfect!). My boyfriend ordered the French Dip which came with a salad on the side. He said he enjoyed his sandwich. We also ordered sweet potato fries that came with this sauce. I don't know what that sauce was, but it was pretty delicious. Oh & cant forget the chocolate chip banana bread. Soooo good! Must try.   This is a perfect place for having brunches. I would've ordered myself a mimosa, but that didn't go so well for me at another restaurant two days ago LOL. All in all, enjoyed my visit here. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries, French dip (sandwich), &amp; C.K. Special

zAqt9q1Su3T27stZe8MizA.text: Went here with a large group...14 people for Sunday Brunch. We booked ahead and got the private room. There was a $50 refundable deposit for the room, but it's worth it for a big group, as there can be a bit of a wait. The food and service were beyond excellent. Every dish was delicious and our server was fantastic. We had a wonderful time and the value for money beats nearly any brunch in Vegas. Our group is pretty savvy about Vegas brunch and we all rated it tops! Well done CRAFTkitchen!

DJEYOIs6wHXy08EkwPPy5g.text: Found this place on yelp. Great brunch spot.  Go early!! The wait can get pretty long.  Food is excellent and service was great, but not so much that I'd wait over half an hour.  We got the chicken and waffles (small portion but still good), Korean tacos (a little too saucy), truffle fries (a-ok), and three desserts (didn't finish them but they were pretty!)

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

ZRps-Xv6UMjzMEwuXtZLag.text: Best breakfast place in Henderson. There is always a wait on the weekends so be prepared, but it's worth it.

AXnHy3J2aOKTZN3QywwI4g.text: SO GOOD!! The Chorizo Skillet was absolutely amazing. I would really recommend coming here. The restaurant was really well put together too. The seating along the wall is really nice for two people, feels very secluded and private

slLf1hN4nHkadV17y-BzVA.text: Cool breakfast and brunch place. Took my wife and sister and they loved it.   Sometimes there is a wait time so call ahead.   The place it's hip and has a farm to table look and feel.   The food is pretty good and not as slow as I imagine it would be. Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Table
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Grits

w_SYF653fWp5By0zO6cFqg.text: Been dragged here a few times now. I say dragged because not once have I had a very tasty meal. My food has always been average at best.  When you add the fact that the staff is typically not all that pleasant, well, it's just not a place I want to go back to.

5CXUlxpfXzTBWyiDo-Tmwg.text: A must go. The food is fresh and delicious. I had the salmon Benny which was awesome. The wife had a quiche that she said was the best ever! Highly recommend if you are in Henderson or Vegas. Pasties are a delight!

d2ysjMQ5bHa8jCjpm48JaA.text: This place is so good. The food, the coffee and the pastries. I hate that it's only open til 3pm. But it's one of my fave places!

FftxC6a1JZsHWAnES4eMKg.text: This is a nice place to dine and has a hipster feel to it.  This is a nice addition to Henderson, which reminds me of O.C. and the CAMP.  The food presentation is beautiful and a nice balance of the bad and the good (nutrition wise).  House crafted croissants, I couldn't resist but to order the buttery croissant sammy.  The sandwich is between a fried egg, 2 pieces of perfectly cooked crisp bacon, cheese and I added aioli sauce.  It was lacking a little bit of greens, so I snuck a few pieces of my mixed greens from my salad.  Flaky croissant from the outside, pillowy (not even a word) goodness on the inside and that makes it just buttery goodness.  My mother opted for the quiche of the day and that one bite I took had a good balance of eggs, cheese and lovely bits of bacon.  This was all baked on a moderate sized for one person quiche dish.    We both ordered from the early-hour menu versus the afternoon menu. The other set of dishes were shown on the flip side.  Either way, this is smaller portions, which is expected at these modern, quaint, well crafted food places.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Quiche of the day, asparagus, cheese and bacon w/ salad $11.95.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Croissant Sammy, 2PCs. bacon, fried egg, added pesto aioli $10.75. Salad had fingerlet chips.

JLD3aE6vZKjxbQ5F_m2__g.text: Has a clean hipster vibe, but sadly stuck in a strip mall. Lots of tasty sounding items on the menu. Workers are all lovely and professional. Bummer that I clearly ordered the wrong thing. Had the buttermilk pancakes, which tasted nothing like buttermilk pancakes. The pancakes itself were perfectly cooked, but sugar (and a lot of it) was added to the batter which was a shame. My husband had the eggs, potatoes and turkey sausage, which was flavorless. Avocado toast with poached egg was good. I clearly mucked up my order and will definitely avoid the pancakes if we head back.

gKTCJS-n855btrXxklNdKQ.text: I'm sure it would have been good but the 2 hour wait was not going to happen.  I don't think they followed the check in on line and took walk ins before us...very disappointing.

L0KFRZDxHfESZbx7fGZlUA.text: Why the 3 stars you ask? When most of the other reviews are 4 & 5 stars, why is this one 3? It's not for the service. Our service beyond awesome. In all honesty? It's based solely on the food. The food was okay. My mimosa was passable. Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but it's like they're trying to recreate the wheel. And somehow they just miss the mark.   One more thing, and not that this is the restaurant's fault, but the pretentious energy flowing through this place was palpable. Again, the service was OUTSTANDING & the coffee is pretty damn good. However, that being said, we won't be back.

Wtl4TPyDxNGZ-W5TmFzoEg.text: So Craft Kitchen we finally meet. I 'be heard so much about you. Literally I have had a few friends mention this place and rave about the food.   As soon as I walked in I was hit with a yummy smell of pastry. I don't know what it was but it smelled good almost like a bakery.  As I stepped more in, the aroma changed to food, and it still smelled yummy. Score!  The event I was attending was in there room that could accommodate 15-20 people, the walls were glass so u can see in and out.  I definitely think this room is good for private events, meetings and parties. The pastries that we had taste good, I look forward to trying there cupcakes and cookies- but out of the pastries I enjoyed the scone the most , it wasn't too sweet and had a balanced flavor with a bit of tart. I definitely will head back here to order from their menu. All the food I saw people eating looked tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Got a few to go, Lemon Poppy Seed, white Chocolate raspberry scone, and pumpkin bread.

X2Yay2jmttkiLO_ehnkcnw.text: My boyfriend and I finally got to CRAFTKitchen before the crowd showed up on Sunday morning. We attempted to have brunch here a few times before, but the wait time was crazy by 10 a.m.   We were seated quickly and the waitress was super nice. I suggest starting off with the monkey bread. It's amazing. I got the breakfast burrito and he got the pork carnitas omelet. Both were gigantic. I'm not sure how anyone can finish these. More bang for your buck!  Pros: The food is delicious. The decor is cute. They have a legit coffee bar with bakery counter, so you're not drinking watered down sludge. The service is quick.  Cons: The wait time gets insane on the weekends. If you're hungry and impatient, I suggest getting there before 9 a.m.   I'll definitely be back!

9WgU-jpPs95DdzsfjtBGXg.text: I'm a huge fan of CRAFTkitchen and would definitely consider myself a regular by now.  We were here celebrating a friend's birthday.  Had a group of 6.  We started with an assortment of pastries and cronuts.  The Nutella cronut was so freaking BOMB!!!!  The layers on that cronut were legit and light and flaky AF.  I was in heaven.  If you know me, you know I'm a fanatic for cronuts.  So this one was right up there with the original Dominique Ansel Bakery cronuts!!!  The cinnamon roll was huge and too sweet for me.  We also had the matcha green tea cronut which was tasty too.  The pumpkin muffin wasn't too sweet and pretty on point.  For lunch, I opted for something different and ordered the Pear, Pomegranate & Burrata Salad.  At the time, everything on that salad sounded delish.  When the meal came out, it was a beautiful presentation and looked yum.  When I took my first bite, it was just eh.  It didn't blow my mind and it wasn't as good as I thought it would be.  At a staggering $13.75 for a salad with just fruit and cheese, it's pricey!  I should have gotten the Citrus & Crab Salad which I've had in the past and so good.  Sorry pear salad but you were a disappointment.  My brother ordered the Chicken & What? which is always amazing here!  I'm in love with the pickled jalapeno maple syrup.  So good!!!  Our friends ordered the Short Rib Hash which is an OMG dish, had it and loved it.  So much flavor.  I was eyeing the Korean Shrimp Tacos and our friend ordered it.  I wish I got this instead of my pear salad.   Now I need to check out the CRAFTkitchen Friday Happy Hour events.  Soon I hope.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Pear, Pomegrante, Burrata salad. It was eh. I wish I loved it more. Need more flavor. To me this was bland!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. The pastries lineup: Nutella cronut, cinnamon roll, matcha green tea cronut, pumpkin muffin.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. This Nutella cronut is EVERYTHING!!!

2ccXj1YLTpnsH9OnPC074g.text: I haven't had the pleasure of being at the physical establishment to dine in, but I did order brunch through UberEats for this spot. the breakfast burrito with chile relleno, melted pepperjack cheese, eggs, spiced chorizo, & potatoes turned out to be quite meaty. the burrito was a little dry however, because the chorizo was overly cooked and a little overly salty for my tastes. the burrito was ok at best because of the dry salty flavor, but the tomatillo avocado sauce it was accompanied by gave it the subtle acidity it needed to make it enjoyable.   my little brother ordered the french dip sandwich with au jus and it was alright at best too. the au jus lacked flavor & the sandwich had more cheese than meat overall. the french bread it came on was overly hard and the dish honestly lacked the "wow" factor when it came to presentation and taste balance (maybe because it was take out?)   parmesan garlic fries were good & plain fries were good too. delivery was prompt and overall the food was ok. i didn't think the price point was that reasonable for the food presented in quality and quantity however. i honestly think i will try this spot and dine in with friends someday to try it out because of other raving reviews. in terms of our take out experience, it was not notable and i wouldn't order ubereats from this spot ever again though.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

Wi0PulPYtsEQUG0Q37K9dw.text: High quality brunch place in the Anthem area.  A tad overpriced, but everything I had here is delicious, filling, and beautifully presented.  Finally, tried the Sunday mimosa "deal." Unlimited for $16 with orange, blood orange, and pomegranate. Blood orange was the clear winner.  The servings all small. Disappointed that the refill service was lacking.    There is something here for every palate. Can't decide whether to do a healthier/light meal, heavy, or sweet?  Make sure you go with friends that share. Friends that sample each other's plates are the best.  Last brunch, we had the avocado toast (huge debacle over who go more of the poached egg..j/k), chorizo skillet, chicken and waffles, salmon benedict, and quiche of the day with a side salad.  Our previous brunch, we had the red velvet pancakes, smoked salmon, and short rib hash.    Would order again: both salmon dishes, and short rib hash.  *Side note: bomb potatoes from the skillet  Let's not forget their enticing dessert case.  Ordered a few things here and there over the years.  Unfortunately, some forgettable.  They do offer pre-orders for some of their baked goods/breads for the holidays.  Interior is spacious, gorgeous natural light (for optimal food photo taking), and cute succulents adorned on tables.    *Extras: Private room for events/meetings *Changing table in the restroom for the bebes!

kHJAVWLexfO4unjNdtXqww.text: Went into craft to pick up a few goodies.  Ended up with a massive cinnamon roll, strawberry macaroon and some cronut holes.  And none of them disappointed.  The cinnamon roll was the size of my face.  Seriously this thing was massive.  But my goodness it was so light and airy.  So damn delicious.  But not a fan of the frosting.  Sorry craft.   Macaroons were delicious with real sliced strawberry in the middle.  Definitely cut down on the sweetness.  But my minis fave is the Cronut holes.  Have to admit there cronut holes beat out anyone else in henderson.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

vU0wAdWSaadFaJd2aMdtJQ.text: I was looking for a new breakfast place 2 try and this one came up in my area I was in. I opted to give it a try and this is what I discovered. Once I arrived inside, the hostess said, "its gonna be a 5-10 minute wait". I looked around the quaint restaurant and saw 15-20 open seats. She saw me look around and she felt compelled to say, "well, I have to give the wait staff time 2 catch up". She did not seat me for approximately 5 minutes after that. I thought to myself, I'm patient but she could have seated me @ a vacant table and gave me water/coffee. That was a little disturbing to me as I've never witnessed this as I've out around the country. I must say that after that awkward beginning I was questioning my decision to eat here. Needless to say, the food was served quickly and it was very good. Good ending to a weird episode at a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chorizo scramble

OzcUR350BhteTM3KaDZ6xA.text: AVOID!  We waited 10 minutes at a non-rush time and then sat for 10 minutes without a touch.  We were HUNGRY and decided we needed to run for our lives.  Unfortunately, that was our first time there so we have an initial bad impression.  I could tell breakfast was going to cost about $30 with tip for what we wanted (average breakfast entree about $12)....so decided for that price we should get better service.  :-(

dvc8uibqRX4mH_YdKoagTA.text: 2.5 stars  CRAFTkitchen, you aight. Here's the lowdown ~  THE GOOD + nice atmosphere + selection of vegan/vegetarian options   THE BAD  - decent, but slow service - small portions - simple and plain tasting food - pricy   For savory breakfast options, I've tried the Butternut Squash Hash and CK Breakfast Burrito vegetarian style. And while filling and made with quality ingredients, the flavors for both dishes were very simple, and just too plain for my taste. Each time, I've had to load up with hot sauce and ketchup to enjoy it. Granted, I like food that packs a punch and the food here? It's like a lil' love tap.  As for something I did like, I have enjoyed their avocado toast. And while it's hard to go wrong with avocado on toast, it's not very filling for the price.   Overall, CRAFT just isn't my thing. The food is decent, but for the price, I expect better than decent.

cFEns8vEQ8NvluH3pRMNRg.text: Fabulous breakfast. I have a food allergy and they were able to accommodate that.  My server Jitra was the BEST!  I mean how can you turn down bottomless mimosas on ST PATTY'S DAY?    I am new to the area and can't wait to come back and try other menu items.  Food was great. I had the short rib hash which was so good.   What a beautiful gem in the Vegas Valley!

CeiMexN5mYbx57znimFKiA.text: Love this spot. Not from the area, but my kinda food. Fresh, simple and tasty.   They had a bakery there with goodies in the case but we didn't get any. Although I wish I did. Next time.   The service was great - friendly and answered any questions we had.   Fresh food was bright to us and we all consumed it with anticipation n hunger- good food. We would be back for other dishes to try.    Ample parking and even patio seating if you wanted.  So glad to have found this place.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Pork belly bowl (not fried pork belly)
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Avocado toast
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Kids fruit bowl.

9TWiHmEBiMWSWnEV0LPObQ.text: I am so torn with CraftKitchen.  We stopped by for a late lunch (possibly because it was an hour until closing) and was utterly disappointed.  1. Ham and Cheddar Kouign Aman  - nice flakey pastry to start. 2. Shrimp Po Boy - We had to use fork and knife to eat this poboy.  The batter was falling off of the shrimp (there were 3 shrimps total on a bed of cabbage), and the hoagie was dry.   3. Loco Moco - no taste!  Well, there was some, but this was not executed well.  The Loco Moco at my previous company's employee dining room taste better than the beautiful presented Loco Moco at CraftKitchen.  Very disappointed to the point that I don't know if I will be able to visit again and order anything else other than the monkey bread to enjoy with their delicious coffee.

kKPY9nPOZibGPO282oLUyg.text: Little mom & pop type of place in a strip mall in Henderson. It wasn't great but not bad either. Just too pricey for what we got. I got the fried chicken sandwich & the other person got a Cuban sandwich both came w/side small mixed green plain salad w/champagne dressing and burnt ish mini potato chips..pulled the chips off wasn't a big hit. Too far from where I live to go back plus it was @$33 for two sandwiches and side of plain fries. Our waiter was chatty but unfortunately wasn't that memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu. One mimosa was $8, unlimited-$16.. pretty steep for &#34;one&#34; tho. Usually they&#39;re @$4 each at other places.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

aqvk2PAE9m8zhJxRilA3bg.text: Omg! This place was mouth watering delicciousssss!  I finally got to check out this place, bookmark complete!  Apple cobbler pancakes! Need I say more? I was a bit worries they were going to be sweet but they weren't. They were perfect! Red velvet pancakes topped with white chocolate shavings and sweet cream cheese frosting! Turkey Benedict was surprisingly really delicious..turkey wasn't dry and the avocado smash was a great added touch!  I'll go back!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancake &amp; apple cobbler pancakes
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Butternut squash hash, turkey Benedict and CK special

K8bLlxp15W572YvnJ3TOsg.text: The food was good, but the service was pretty terrible. I went for breakfast. I ordered an omelette and asked the server if strawberry pancakes were available to order, she said yes. She brings my food. The omellete was fine, but she brings me a pancake drizzled with blueberry sauce and blue berries with a side plate of cut strawberries. I explained to her that I didn't understand why my pancake arrived like this and she said they technically didn't have any strawberry sauce to make a strawberry pancake (why wasn't I told this in the first place???). I was confused and disapointed. I sent the blueberry pancake back and asked for a plain pancake instead. I also had to ask for a glass of orange juice twice. I don't think I'll go back. I may order from Uber Eats because the food was still good, but never again with that service!

1JwHWYJi5-O-2tV-IekNEg.text: As a vegan, I am a big fan of Craft Kitchen. Although it is an omnivorous restaurant, it offers substantial vegan options - all of which taste great. In fact, what used to be a few vegan offerings on the "regular menu" turned into a full-blown vegan menu a few months ago. Awesome!  I recommend the avocado tacos, the vegan butternut squash hash (add avocado!), and the farmers' market stack.  Service is consistently fast and friendly. The decor is simple, but tasteful. Yes, it can get loud when the restaurant is packed (and it is a popular brunch spot, so it usually is packed!), but I appreciate that this isn't a restaurant that blasts music at high volumes.  The two-person booths by the windows are cute and offer substantial privacy.

eTdj7Xtjy6JCk1dVM7iuqw.text: I am SO glad I gave craft kitchen another chance after initially eating here in 2015.   My first experience here the restaurant had everything going for it...except flavor in the food. It was bland.  Then come 2017.  They got their game together and the flavors are out of this world!  I'm still drooling and daydreaming about their apple cobbler pancakes.   Craft kitchen offers brunch on the weekends in addition to bottomless mimosas for $16. you read that right. Bottomless. Mimosas. With. Brunch. Need I say more.   if you are looking for a private room for a special event they have one available to reserve.  Must try brunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

SahTpMH9CdHwWZskI_o1uQ.text: Great food. Outside seating for my dogs. Waitress was very good and brought us water for the dogs. Food was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib hash with a scrambled egg added

GpQ4d2FNldiBi05BDzBUVQ.text: Took a group of friends here and had a blast.  Best service ever and we were sitting outside of cafe.  The staff was all amazing and funny.  The food was delicious.  I had the red velvet shortstacks and the Pork Carnitas omelette with a side of apple wood bacon. The boys had a ball with the $16 bottomless mimosas. That was well worth it. Most memorable thing about the experience at Craft Kitchen was definitely the staff.  Thanks guys!  Totally made a great impression on us.

3aSn6fjADwZJhvkHxKd39g.text: Kinda upset This was my second time here and brought my friend after bragging about the service and food... I did take into consideration that it was Sunday morning and it would be busy... After waiting outside for 30-35 minutes then being seated on one of the many empty patio tables... we sit down and look over the menu, 20 minutes later we still haven't seen a server for drinks or anything for the matter. After another 10 minutes we tried to get a servers attention just to get some ice water (it's 95 degrees and sitting outside) no one paid any attention to us at all. So... we ended up leaving. I did notice when we walked out to leave a few servers standing talking to each other, yet no one said one word to us... the entire place is giant windows.... I work in the food service industry myself and understand a rush but to be completely ignored after being there an hour? I don't think that's cool..... I don't think we will be going back anytime soon and that sucks because the food the first time was great. Maybe it was a bad day but you can't ignore people like that. We were there for an hour total and got nothing but to look at the pretty pastry case. #SadMoments

bHYPXPUj2F5xRq0Y-0bdDg.text: We celebrated my husband's birthday here and the food was fantastic! The sweet corn ravioli with its beautiful presentation was very flavorful. I was skeptical about the burger at first but after one bite I was happy I ordered it. The meat was fresh and the tomato jam was to my surprise a nice addition to the rest of the flavors. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal but Devin the manager was THE ABSOLUTE BEST! I really appreciate the way he went out of his way for my family. His recommendations were perfect. His service was top notch! I think we had "waiter envy" lol... We had already tried the brunch and enjoyed it so we thought we would give the dinner a try. The food was definitely worth it but the manager made the place worthy of a review. Devin you were AWESOME! We will definitely be back!

5K6Ez1_NmCGAfhXOJoQOIQ.text: Had a great experience her. I've seen a lot of people checking in here, and have been dying to go. The last few times we tried to go here, there was a line at the door, and unfortunately we had no time to wait.   Pros: Healthy breakfast options Beautiful pastry's Service Food Quality Atmosphere Strong/flavorful organic coffee  Cons: The only ones I can think of is sometimes you may have to wait. Also, although my food was perfect, one person in our party was a little picky, and their eggs were under cooked.  Overall:  If you are looking for an interesting, healthy, quick breakfast or lunch, then stop in here to enjoy it in a homey, but modern atmosphere!

4XfA-1uJHU9In6EpCZGySw.text: After enjoying pastries from CraftKitchen on our last trip, we decided to have a sit down breakfast this morning with each of us choosing avocado toast.   A massive amount of avocado on a grilled toast, sunflower pesto and a single poached egg proved to be delicious, but hardly worth the sticker price.

uijiAIfv9Ey-yYqW3v3BCA.text: We enjoyed our breakfast at Craft Kitchen!  I was just complaining the other day that Vegas isn't a breakfast town and we came upon this restaurant and were delighted with the food and atmosphere.  The menu is very gluten free friendly, which I like.  They also have a really great kids menu which has small, kid versions of the regular menu items.  I had the crustless quiche, and it was really great, I only missed the crust a little :) My husband had the salmon on pretzel roll and he loved it, it had a generous amount of salmon.  My daughter had the red velvet pancakes and I don't know if she will ever go back to regular pancakes again!  My only complaint is with the music.  They were blaring a country music station.  I would recommend that you pick more neutral music and play it at a lower volume.  Loud country music would definitely keep me from returning!  I also don't think it goes with the overall vibe of the restaurant or the clientele.

g-1YrvfpRYHIRRCU0eTWiQ.text: Stepping into CRAFTkitchen I almost forgot I was still in Henderson. The outdoor seating is cute and if you slouch low enough in your seat you can convince yourself you're in a cute neighborhood and not eating in a parking lot. The restaurant is bright and decorated nicely- a perfect spot for brunch or catching up with friends. Ask for a seat by the window- the bench is cuter and the two person table is cozy and bright.  Monkey bread: Yes, yes, yes. It's like a cinnamon roll, but better. For only a little over $5 the appetizer was perfect start to our brunch.  Strawberry lemonade: My first glass was too sour, not enough sweet. Second glass (yes, free refills!) was watered down. It wasn't worth it. Go with the alcoholic drinks instead.  Croissant Sammy: perfectly buttered croissant with PERFECT strips of bacon. The "salad" on the side was just leaves, light dressing and little chips on top. It was a nice touch, but it was too small to consider it a side.  Short rib hash: The short ribs were flavored nicely and the dish was filling. However, I liked the croissant sammy better.   There is a glass case with tons of cakes/cookies/macaroons for those who want to just stop in and take out. Closed off room in the back for big parties.  They serve breakfast all day. However, they close early so don't forget to check the time before you go!

J-a8FOVgKJASJcYhAMC8aA.text: Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in Henderson.  Coffee is outstanding and the food is extremely well put together.  If I could I would give this place 10 out of 10 stars

DSYYkJHDScibaNZfTAaNqA.text: They say everything happens for a reason--boy was I glad that Kitchen Table had an hour wait, because we opted to go to CRAFTKitchen instead for brunch. It's enjoying it's well deserved new restaurant popularity and it's definitely worth it--and the 25 minute wait to be seated. It's first come first serve and every table was occupied.   I hadn't ordered yet, but was thoroughly impressed by the vibe and decor--you would never imagine a place like this in a Strip Mall in Henderson, but it's just what the area needs because Lord knows I am not a fan of driving 30 mins to Summerlin or the like for these kinds of culinary experiences. The interior space was modern, industrial Americana  and offered a private dining space embellished with vertical gardens. There are also adorable pod like booths made of wood that offer an outside view. Tables are constructed of wood with succulent plants as centerpieces--very West Elm.   I was tempted to knock my 5-star rating down to 4.5 due to the service--but they just couldn't help it--they were slammed with a revolving door of non-stop guests for Sunday brunch. It did take a while for our server to take our order, but once placed, our food was out in a reasonable amount of time.   My guest and I decided to share a couple of items including the Chicken and What? (chicken and waffles), Red Velvet Pancakes and Truffle Fries--I know, what a mix right? As a Soul Food snob, from the South, the Chicken and Waffles were delicious and full of flavor. I only wish the portion was bigger as the waffles and pieces of chicken were small. Though we shared, we should have ordered two. Up next were the Red Velvet Pancakes--phenomenal as were the Truffle fries.   Just when we thought we were full, we had a little food envy of the table next to us as they had two orders of Monkey Bread--one for the table and one to go. No shame in our game we ordered a batch of the bread too--unreal! Warm, buttery and flavored with plenty of cinnamon and sugar. Tip: the best part is at the bottom of the pan. And another one: CRAFTKitchen just might one of the best new eateries on this side of town. Take that Summerlin.

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. CRAFTKitchen Chicken &amp; Waffles.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. CRAFTKitchen Red Velvet Pancakes, Chicken &amp; What and Truffle Fries.

Wizr_nEeouOwupJCNXNR5w.text: It's too bad that we will never be returning to Craft Kitchen again. My husband and I have always been a fan of their food but the service has declined with each visit over and over. We have probably visited the restaurant more than 10 times; the food is good, coffee is excellent and it is close to home. We decided to give it another shot since we called and they said there was no wait for 2 people on a Sunday at 130 pm. My assumption is the restaurant was half empty on a Sunday (which most brunch places should have a 30 min wait min) because other patrons, similar to us, are just tired of their noticeably slow service. Since it was so empty inside we were hoping the service wouldn't be as timely as our previous experiences here. Sadly, no. After ordering our coffee, our drinks were delivered and our waiter dashed away without taking our food order. 15 minutes later, after I flagged him down that we were ready, he took our order. We waited.... waited and waited some more. 45 minutes later we were upset to see that food was being delivered to 3 other tables surrounding us that were seated almost 20 minutes after us. Since our waiter did not care to check up on us or inform us that our food was ready, I asked a food busser if she could check on our order.  She returned to tell us that new batter had to be made to make our pancakes. An update from our server would have been nice if there was a long delay from the kitchen.  The food was delivered after another 15 minutes of waiting and low and behold, my husband's order was incomplete.   To our server's defense, he constantly on the move, and overwhelmed with so many tables beyond his control. Maybe this explains his inability to check up on us. The restaurant needs serious modifications in their management structure. I wish this was our only poor experience at Craft Kitchen, but it was not. We love to support local businesses but unfortunately we will never return to this establishment nor recommend it to any of our friends and colleagues again.

__AbSy-rF5d6_rRvwTw7Bw.text: Delicious! Short rib hash 2 poached eggs! Yes our server was right you need 2! Yummmmm perfect start to my birthday! Awesome service! We will be back!

znWHkGFHivA8RIrEcbA47w.text: Food is delicious and the variety is amazing. Their coffee is consistently good and their baked goods are very tasty.   Great little spot with relaxing surroundings. The decor is beautiful!   I wish the prices weren't as high, but you are definitely paying for quality food, so I don't mind too much.

_kf0cbCuTxnicfVC5tdTTg.text: Excellent place for breakfast and brunch! Delicious food! The smashed avocado toast is excellent!!

l3yRZVfJJIXzV_46SFs1eg.text: I really only like to take time out to leave a review if I've had an exceptionally good experience. However, my time at CRAFTKitchen was so expressly crappy, I feel the need to warn any conscientious diners: This place *might* have good intentions with their locally sourced, organic food. Nevertheless, this place is not for those who have a discerning palate or have a desire to dine in a pleasant environment.  The food is clean, I'll give them that. The portions are wimpy. While I can live with that, it just wasn't delicious... And it's really not that hard to make eggs taste good.    MOST IMPORTANTLY - bad service, bad attitude from the waitress, the space has a really weird energy.  All in all, terrible.  Certainly the worst restaurant experience I have ever had. Same for the two people who were with me.

GVOoh_NDCMCkXhHGA_mt8g.text: CRAFTkitchen is like most things in the Vegas Valley, good facade, but not substance.  The decor, menu options and staff were appealing from the outside looking in, but then you order your food...  First and foremost, the food.  My wife got the Chorizo Scramble.  The potatoes in the dish were not just over seasoned, they were literally brined in salt.  The eggs themselves were over seasoned, but not inedible like the rest of the plate.  I ordered the Quiche of the day.  The flavor and ingredient profile was fine, except for over-seasoning again.  One dish could be excused as an anomaly, but 2 independent dishes, scream quality control issues from the kitchen.   Conversely my mother's side potatoes had no seasoning...  Other notable gripes: 1) We waited 15 minutes while there were several open tables.  More tables were bused and/or open than there were parties waiting.  2) Refills on drinks were upon customer request with drinks sitting empty for 5-10 minutes.  3) Waitress was excellent at being nice, but not providing good service.  Empty drinks most of the meal, only asked how the meal was 1 minute after arrival and was in robot mode asking if we wanted desert a 2nd time after being told no 1 minute before.  She was good at going through the motions and nice enough I guess.

Qx3tdAV5TCagWU5aBwLUVw.text: I ordered the Breakfast burrito. Needs a little work on the plate presentation to make it look more appetizing.  It looked plain and tasted plain.  Was expecting more flavor to it considering it has roasted chile, chorizo and a tomatillo avocado salsa.

Jy7GydbWQFtNEaYnVRdFqg.text: This place is wonderful.  My brother lives in the area and could not stop talking about CRAFT.  While we were visiting, we went... TWICE.    Friendly service, great food.  Not too much loaded down on your plate.  The pastries are amazing.  When we go back, we will definatly come back.

2SE5M5Cf5SXd4iPuAX3DZw.text: The food was good. But not great. Especially for the price you are paying. The flavors on all of the dishes at our table except 1 completely missed the mark. The churro waffles were the best thing out there. The Craft Benedict had a slice of ham that would have been enough for 2 orders. It was way too thick. The hollandaise sauce was on point though. The rest was just kinda there. My husband got the protein fix and said there was so much sea salt, the rest of the flavors were hidden. Almost on purpose as he couldn't get anything good from the rest of it. My dad had the chilaquiles. Said it was pretty bland and about half way through was over it. The salsa was amazing though. My mom had the strawberry shortcake pancakes and cheesy grits. Said they were both pretty good. I would go back just for the Carmel latte though. Man o man was that good!! This is a local place that I wanted so badly to love in order to support a local business. But it just wasn't there. Will give it another shot sometime in the future and hope it was a one off. The table next to us left without eating much of anything or paying. Something had to be off this day.

-fyLMjw0yf8XsPNdazOJXA.text: Delicious food and great ambiance, but the last few times I've gone in, the service has been incredibly slow. We had a baby shower in the private room and had to ask multiple times for a server to come in to take our drink order. A few weeks later I went in for lunch with coworkers and it took about 20 minutes for someone to take our order then another 30 minutes to get our food. I ran into some friends at another table during that lunch, and they had the same problem. It's become frequent enough at this point that I probably won't go back for a while. Hopefully they get it figured out because it used to be one of my favorite brunch/lunch places!

Y542qb1vEdg4ASqg__3f3A.text: Good creative food, great atmosphere, and depending on your waiter/waitress great service.  Erica is the best.  We love her.

4TthyZsWCeGwpgU2RVKxZw.text: Our second time here was for lunch. A nicely layered Cubano sandwich was very tasty as the Fried chicken Sammy was. Great service too!

ipVymGk1nU2nkxBeu0ydOw.text: I love this place but they recently got rid of the Pork Belly rice bowl which was my absolute favorite menu item, so that was a massive letdown, hopefully they bring it back soon, I would come in much more often

InFIWLD8l06tw27YzT1M5g.text: This is hands down, my favorite breakfast place anywhere.  Ive been here many times and everything that Ive ordered are excellent.  If you are looking for huge quantities, this is not the place for you.  I prefer quality over quantity any day of the week.  Their food presentation actually rivals any dinner spot on the strip.  You won't find a better cup of coffee from a Breakfast/Lunch spot anywhere.  These are the items that I have tried:  Avocado smash toast-  Excellent, egg poached to perfection Turkey Benny-  made with real turkey and homemade hollandaise sauce, very good Chicken and Waffles -   Chicken tender and fried to perfection Carnitas Omelette - I ordered with egg whites, pork was very good and had a nice kick Monkey bread -  comes out warm.  it was  good and addicting  Will continue to go back whenever i am in town......

Bl0rju1ANP5lWZa7DQNecw.text: Well, that is how breakfast is done.   There isn't much that will get me to drive across town but after hearing all the rave reviews of CRAFTKitchen and seeing all the pictures of gorgeous food I had to give them a try for myself.  They were packed on the Saturday morning after Thanksgiving and my mom and I patiently waited for a seat while ogling the delicious looking pastries in the display case.  Finally seated it took me a minute to decide what I wanted to order. Everything sounded amazing and as I unabashedly stared at the food from neighboring tables the decision process became that much harder. I finally settled on the short rib hash, while my mom ordered the smoked salmon on a pretzel roll. I also ordered a pecan roll to share.   The pastry came out first and it was perfection. I recommend having it heated to maximize the ooey gooey factor. We devoured this in about eight seconds flat. Next, our entrees arrived and they we're everything my heart was hoping for and more. The short rib hash was evenly flavored and the crispiness of the potatoes complemented the subtly sweet flavors of the meat. I loved every bite of this dish. The smoked salmon was excellent as well. The pretzel bread was soft and pillowy and enhanced the flavors of the salmon and cream cheese well.   I can't rave about this place enough and I look forward to returning soon and often.

yxZpGE5U3xkzHOe1mEaZ0g.text: This was my third time eating at CRAFTkirchen but my first time having lunch there. I had the Crab & Citrus salad - delicious!  Perfect portion size, plenty of crab and citrus segments, the right amount of dressing.  I highly recommend this fish for a light yet filling meal.

ShdkY44fVWbq1_SytzbuVw.text: Beautiful restaurant, delicious food, and excellent service makes CRAFTkitchen a triple threat and THE Henderson hot spot for breakfast, brunch or lunch!  --Restaurant-- Farmhouse Chic! A cross between contemporary rustic, with a touch of industrial.   First the place is 2x the size of the former breakfast place that occupied this space. They knocked out a wall and voila!! Three dining room areas!! The main dining area has booths, tables and counter seating. There's a private dining room also (call ahead to reserve). When it's not windy and the temps are right, take advantage of sitting outdoors!  Love the wall dividers with potted plants made from wooden pallets on their outdoor patio. The dark wood dining tables are custom made with CRAFTkitchen etched on the corner are just gorgeous! They make the perfect backdrop for food pix too :D  --Food-- Health conscious, meat & potatoes kinda person, sweet tooth? CRAFTkitchen has got it covered. Fresh, organic, baked goods made from scratch, cooked to order.  Foodies be prepared!  Your culinary senses will go crazy for Chef Jaret's creative dishes. The quinoa cake on pureed potato, (Farmhouse Stack) is brilliant. Smoked Salmon on pretzel bun made in house is really good. Turkey Benny with the PERFECTLY poached egg, is a winner as well.  Love the garnish of garden fresh greens they use too. Everything is meticulously crafted by chef and his awesome crew.   -Baked breads A++ I didn't have to tell Mr. B. I brought home bread the other day. He smelled the fresh baked cranberry bread as soon as I walked in the door. The flavors, taste and textures of all their breads are all perfect like that.   -Breakfast/Brunch\Lunch Everything on the menu is available all hours. Get the Quiche of the Day!! (QOTD). Creamy smooth, light texture. crustless too,(big plus for those who want Gluten Free). The quiches vary so check the chalkboard when you enter the restaurant or check their instagram ahead of time. Whatever they mix in, Gruyere cheese, spinach, bacon, potatoes, mushrooms, CRAFTkitchen crew nails this savory dish!   -Soups Dont miss ordering this either!!! Hearty and rich, perfect start for warming up in the morning. Hard to resist not ordering their soups either.  Butternut Squash, Asparagus, Pumpkin, I'll never get tired of.  The kids menu is kid tested and approved. The foodie-in-training toddler that comes along with me cleans her plate.   Lastly the PASTRIES & DESSERTS! Ohhh...my...make room for them too! The pecan sticky bun, brioche cinnamon roll, lemon tart, and that croissant bread pudding. So far everything in the dessert case is wicked good! Yeah and wicked for my waist. Good thing they open early (7am), gives you the rest of the day to work off the calories.   Been showing up here couple times a week for a month now and repeat orders have been consistent in execution and SO good!!  --The Scene-- Classy, casual, chill vibe. Family friendly, soccer moms, fitness freaks, instafoodiegramers, hipsters, grandmas and even the meat and potatoes crowd (ie Mr. B) would feel at home here. There's something for everyone.    Price ...For me, I have no problem paying average of under 15 or up to $25 for my meal, plus pastry..or pastries, tart etc. Know that quality ingredients are used.  I appreciate that.   Service...Excellent!. Dining in, there's table service. Their really sweet staff working the counter will seat you or are there to ring you up if you just want to buy baked goods from the dessert case.  The servers have always been great, whether it's early am or on a crazy busy day. Teresa and Rusty are pretty attentive, my orders come out in a timely manner.  Owner Chef/Tami (Chef Jaret's wife) is hands on the floor overseeing everything and greeting customers too.    It's nice that they dont rush everyone in and/or out. My guest pointed out there is no clock on the walls. Be prepared for a 20 minute wait in the foyer on crazy busy Sundays, no joke. But that is a given for popular spots anywhere.  Location....this spot was formerly occupied by Bread & Butter (miss you Chef Chris!) corner of Sunridge and Eastern. If you take Green Valley Pkwy up pass the Target, the street turns to Sunridge, turn RIGHT into the strip mall before you hit the light on Eastern. BAM you are there.  --SUMMARY-- CRAFTkitchen rocks! That is all!

ttPQbjG_aGiu55XH5NRO2g.text: Finally got to enjoy brunch with bottomless mimosas at Craft Kitchen and this has become a new favorite of mine. Delicious food with creme brulee stuffed French toast and pomegranate mimosas!!! Excited to come back and try more delicious options on their menu. Leslie our server was friendly and attentive.

zwnyYqzxNw8e2ZLG329l_A.text: The second time is even better.   While living in Southern California I took for granted all the great things that were within walking distance; grocery stores, parks, watering holes, and amazing brunch spots. Craft Kitchen looks and feels like it was plucked right out a San Diego or Santa Monica Beach community; very clean, modern look, and I can walk there!  I've come here twice now (brunch & lunch) and both meals were amazingly tasty and the service was on point. The first time here I ordered the Smashed Avocado Toast and enjoyed it on the "craftily made" outdoor patio. This light and filling lunch is comprised of Ciabatta, sunflower seed pesto, micro greens, and a poached egg. The perfect option for the eater looking to watch calories and is an avid avocado fan. Eggs, avocados, and crispy bread, what's not to love?    Visit number two: Short Rib Hash. My first thought is, this place is basically a coffee shop with a slightly refined menu, do they really have the balls to put out a Short Rib option? Yes, and they can back it up.   The Short Rib melted in my mouth, it was tender, flavorful with just the right amount of salt, I was very impressed that Craft Kitchen could pull this dish off. The poached egg broke perfectly when cut into and the smashed finger length potatoes had a perfectly crispy skin with a soft buttery inside.  I know Henderson is far from the walking communities of SoCal, but Craft Kitchen is a start to something worth traveling for.  P.S. - Get the Pecan topped sticky bun. Trust me.

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Braised Short Rib hash.

JHaeaZVqoqpQXGQjJTw6GA.text: What a Find!   It started with the warm welcome by the hostess and with the follow through on how long it would take to get seated, we were quoted 20, but had a table in 10.   Our experience continued with Erika (Sp?) our waitress, who was excellent. Then breakfast started coming, fresh squeezed OJ, check, excellent coffee (brewed & espresso) check.   As our meal we had the Bananas Foster pancakes, the Chili Rellenos Burrito, the vegetarian omelette and the Pork Carnitas Omelette.   The Bananas Foster pancakes were some of the best pancakes we've ever had, fluffy and light and the fosters sauce was perfectly sweat and not too rich. We treated it as a "starter" for breakfast. Would definitely get these again.  The Chili Relleno Burrito was very good. The Chili was still slightly crunchy (not over cooked) the seasoning was fantastic as were the smashed fingerling potatoes and the Avocado sauce.   The Veggie Omelette was perfectly cooked, the mushrooms and the associated sauce would have been suitable as a side in a fine steakhouse.   The Pork Carnitas Omelette was a terrific blend of spice and tart with the green sauce and Cotija cheese and the pork itself was incredibly tender and perfectly seasoned. The only bad thing about the omelette was that I wish it were bigger because I wanted MORE.   This place was recommended to us by a famous Vegas lawyer by the name of Trent Richards, thank you!   Chef Jaret, thank you, we'll be back.

qzjSfnKCRfvuSno4uODkHA.text: Great brunch spot. Wonderful food and mimosas! They have something for everyone. Local family owns it, happy to support them!

d57ht_-Tx3UcmP5gnXHf9Q.text: Their brunch menu is always changing and it always delicious. They are pretty popular so their waits can be pretty lengthy. But food is awesome and their service is great

bD033bu3GdyYRKwZvI_y8Q.text: Waited 36 min and didn't even get my food. We had to get up and leave. Ordered a scramble and fries! No apology from the manager and she knew that we had been waiting.

ayMi2kFRxUKhD67JntXQXQ.text: Great little breakfast joint with homemade pastries and great service!  Bottomless mimosas in fun flavors like tropical and pomegranate.  We ordered a breakfast burrito, an apple pop tart, a pecan sticky bun and a chai latte.  Everything was delicious but my favorites were definitely the pastries. The sticky bun was lots of layers of buttery pastry dough with cinnamon and caramel. Easily cut with your fork, it melts in your mouth and was a perfect addition to our meal.   The apple pop tart was fun to order and to eat. The apple filling was tart but sweet and the crust was topped with a simple icing sugar.   We had not only our own server checking on us but others would stop by to refill a water or clear a plate.  I'll be back!

Lj3mbe06RlyyjHx1CSeYTQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Henderson.  The food is really high end and on point.  The prices are good too.

0NtasUeSqAqQ2Gz69Sx2Lw.text: I have been coming to this my favorite brunch place since they opened, the food, the people and the ambiance was amazing. Great customer service and healthy options. The manager a young kid with a tie and suit was great and the Asian waiter with long hair was an top of things. Over the past 3-4 weeks or more the staff has changed and the young girl manager that is there now have a very negative and aggressive behavior towards people . If I or anyone that I bring complain about anything with a a fake smile she says she is working on it but doesn't have to social skills to address customers or has any experience what so ever how to treat a customer. We have met the owners wife a very nice sweet lady but I have to say being in the customer service business my self it's been a horrible experience since the management changed and the waiter left. It's very slow service and any complaints they don't want to deal with as to going so far am telling u if u don't like leave. I support all local businesses but I have to say if the owners don't change the management soon old local customers like me they will loose and that will affect them greatly. Additionally, the chicken and waffles, short rib hash, desserts (homemade pop tarts especially), and the farmers stack lunch entree were very well loved each time I went.

I had a short rib hash with a poached egg on top, avocado toast, and the port carnitas omelette! All the dishes were so savory and yummy! I'm hoping to be able to try this place for brunch soon... I'm dying to try the churro waffles!

MZPGSF162Ws71034xoFn9A.text: Craft Kitchen in one word - Stellar! I knew I was giving this restaurant 5 stars the second the monkey bread hit our table. We were looking for a family brunch on this day and every place we went had over an hour wait. Somehow we ended up at Craft Kitchen who was no different. We saw a few familiar faces and decided to wait it out. There was a great vibe outside the restaurant so the 45 min wait didn't seem like much.   Our server was so nice and accommodating. She went out of her way to secure the last monkey bread for us and she was very patient with my mother in law's gluten free questions. I wish I remembered her name to give her a shoutout.   The food was amazing. A bit under seasoned, but still amazing. We ordered the chicken and waffles, the protein plate, the short rib hash and of course the monkey bread. Everyone on our table enjoyed their choices and there were absolutely no complaints. Even my kids ate everything they ordered.   The great food, the wonderful staff and fresh ambience won this restaurant 5 stars. Can't wait to visit again.

FPPMUMpGJnS6AwZyekjtUQ.text: Very cute restaurant/ coffeehouse. We did love the atmosphere.  Service was okay, the server didn't bring water refill or ask if I cared for sugar when the latte was brought out.  Our breakfast was overpriced for what we got. I appreciate the 'local' sourcing and the organic GMO free food, but this doesn't have to be in such small portions. Felt kinda silly after leaving with a $27 check when we could have made a breakfast for about $3 with organic ingredients(which we did after).  Mimi's Cafe has a delicious breakfast and good service. I don't go there any other times than breakfast though.  CraftKitchen would've been better if the service was higher grade.

AjdxhP-urVA_gbElTtL2UQ.text: CRAFTkitchen is always a great place to go breakfast or lunch. I love the croissant sandwich and the salads. Healthy choices are tasty choices at this restaurant. I always bring friends here, and I am happy that they all enjoy it and go back.

iB11LFVwCGSEgoaew7Kx4A.text: To get 5 stars from me is hard. For 5 stars you need to meet: great atmosphere, great staff, great music, great food, cleanliness, and the place must "flow."   I'm in between a 3.5-4 stars.   When we first walked in, there was no one at what looked like a hostess table. It was unclear what to do, so I took it upon myself to write my name on the wait list.   There is no technical waiting area. There is a bar of sorts facing outside, which is where everyone waiting sat. But this took up seats where anyone who came in and wanted to sit here, wouldn't be able to.   It is a super cute place, very homey, and very inviting, but there wasn't any music and the tables were pretty close to each other, so any conversations you have will not be private.   The food portions are smaller than most places, so if you're a big eater, eat before coming or order two plates. The prices are higher, but matches the quality of the food.   One dislike, however, was that the special of the day was shrimp and grits. Being that I'm a huge lover of grits, I asked if I could order a side of the grits. I was quickly told "no" by our waitress. This was a turnoff. I would have preferred being told, "I'm not sure, let me ask," instead of an immediate "no." I'm actually surprised she didn't bring me a small sample.  I ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken was moist and crispy. The waffle was good, but on the smaller size. The shaved jalapenos were a nice twist. I also ordered a side bacon and the bacon was bomb! Side note: if you like your bacon crispy, be sure to ask for it that way - it comes out soft.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

cdagbOiOzbJJuD2Qi-U7YA.text: A couple of friends had recommended this place due to the good food and amazing, house made pastries. However, the recommendation quickly went out the window due to the poor service given from the beginning.  There were plenty of open tables and many waiting to be seated in the entrance. With most of the parties consisting of two people, it was apparent the staff would not seat two at a table meant for four.  When a two person table opened up, the hostess was so hurried to seat us, she nearly forgot to clear the table from the couple before.  The food was decent enough, nothing spectacular, and unfortunately, we did not try any pastries as our initial excitement was lost.

BuHnqUcn__wHa9DGTf2ilQ.text: Great food not to impress with service, waited to long for food. Waiter need to be more patience with new clients.

4bmXkaHKaP9Y9iEN3i74lA.text: CRAFTkitchen is so cute and the food is so bomb. I'm always a sucker for cute brunchy vibe places. Their server Jeffery is always super welcoming when I come in. He recommended my now favorite breakfast order which is the chorizo scramble skillet. I tried the croissant sammy today too which was "flaky buttery deliciousness" also we had a fruit plate today and all the melons and berries were perfectly ripe. I've been here and had their bottomless mimosas too which are pretty good. If you're in a drinking mood definitely try the blood orange mimosas!! I didn't care too much for the pomegranate mimosas. Also if you're going on a breakfast or lunch date the booth window seating is super cute. I'm also a fan of all the desert flower art in this place. Check it out! It's a great spot.

SqYQoANOmjlzmjA9oNkt2A.text: Talk about another great little gem in Henderson. CRAFTkitchen visited twice and both times had been spot on awesome. My first visit came with others yelpers first week they opened so got to see few things on the menu. I was torn between the turkey slider and the loaded roast beef. Once I saw pretzel bun was sold!! Talk about sandwich that delivered!!!! I have always preached that any sandwich for me always starts with the bread first and foremost. The fact they were serving it on pretzel bread that hardly see on any menu. Nice. The bread really was amazing. I could devour the bread by itself with some mustard. You add the nice portion of thin sliced roasted beef, horseradish cream (best part never overpowered the dish), and some tomato. It truly was the best roast beef sandwich ever had in life. Every component was the perfect fit, balance, and sandwich lovers dream. The salad that came with it was again perfect compliment nice refreshing with nice light vinaigrette and the crispy (no idea) added nice crunch texture round out the salad. I also ordered chocolate croissant. All the pastries made fresh daily in house. Not only do they look amazing, LOVE love the display case they have all fresh made pastries, and mix it up daily. It dam tasty. Other yelpers kind enough got try the truffle fries. It was ok. Truffle fries more like fad. I would not hesitate order them put it that way. Really all the dishes between four of us all looked good.   Second visit meet friend for recovery meal. I decided go for the Crustless Quiche of the day. I believe it was turkey and ham, What I do know is not big on Quiche but CRAFTkicthen got me hooked line and sinker. Times that Quiche all taste is scrambled eggs. Quiche here breaks all your stigmas, It has a nice creamy egg flavor and not just beaten eggs, The filling you get nice amount. Each bite perfect balance not just all eggs eating. The whole crustless makes for beautiful presentation and feels more filling. It comes with house salad that can never get enough of in life.  The decor HUGE fan. I like fact lot of wood from the tables, the front of the restaurant with patio area and potted fresh herbs on different levels.The open space feeling, they even have a sweet private dining room that have writing on the walls, and the display for the pastries are awesome. It very inviting feeling when you walk in.   The service was spot on five stars both times. Second visit I loved seeing the owner walking about checking up on customers and big smile positive vibes. The only bummer is wished they were open for dinner. I do like the fact that they serve both breakfast and lunch menu all day. So no matter time of the day can get your fix in. No doubt if am in the area plan on coming back and trying more more of the menu.

CJMIsh3Sjm0uhuctQY0Zrg.text: Drove past this spot and decided to try for lunch. Showed up at 12:35, was sat and not greeted or acknowledged until 12:45, which I realize is a busy time so didn't bother me too much. The menu looked great hence the two stars. I ordered a water and a garden panini ( no meat, no cooking involved) and did not receive it for 30 minutes. Had to ask for it TO GO, eat it in my car before I went back to work. Wanted to enjoy this place, it's honestly right next to our home. Perhaps I wasn't their type of clientele since I was alone and in my work clothes. Horrible service. The panini was soggy. The decor was lovely however. Might give this place another try but not likely.

VC61HD-Sf5VIQwLfk-Wn6w.text: We had heard about Craft Kitchen through a food blogger on Instagram. Her photos and descriptions of the food led us to venture off strip for some late breakfast.   We were seated quickly and brought water. We had heard a lot about the "churro" waffles so we started off with that as an appetizer. Gary got the French toast and I ordered the Croque Madame. We also both got lattes from their espresso bar. They arrived quickly and were delicious.   The churro waffles started us off. For a person who loves cinnamon and caramel, these were IT!! They were so delicious and I was in love. They are VERY sweet, I can't stress that enough. If you don't have a big sweet tooth, skip these. Gary got his French toast and while he loved it, the sweetness from the waffles had put him off. I was very happy I went savory with the Croque Madame. The bechamel sauce was spot on. Not too thin and not too thjck. It softened the bread just right. It was a wonderful item. It comes with a side salad with some sort of dressing on it, but I could of done without it. It was just lettuce with whatever the dressing was. Not a lot of flavor.  We saw they had mini cronuts when we were paying, but we were too full to indulge on those.   My only True complaint was the service. While it all started off great, one we ordered our server never came back. Not once. Someone else filled our water (once, it sat empty for awhile. We were never checked on for how the food was, if we wanted anything else or boxes. We weren't even brought our bill. We were ready to leave and finally went to the front to pay. We saw others paying at their table. Our waiter was sitting in the back doing his side work. I get that it's on us that we went at 1:45 p.m. but the restaurant had a lot of people in it still. We were customers and should of still had regular service. If he was off, letting us know we were being passed off to someone else would of been courteous. The one man helping was great (he ran food, filled waters and cashed us out at the register). We loved the food so that's why I'm leaving it at four stars.   Atmosphere: 8/10 Food: 8/10 Service: 5/10
