y1NsU5WoykBeGtRTApvBRw.text: CRAFTkitchen definitely served up a brunch to remember when I visited on a Sunday with a friend.   Most of the popular brunch places in Vegas and Henderson have quite the wait, so I wasn't surprised when the hostess let me know that I would be waiting for 30-45 minutes for a table. And because I had chosen to come around lunch time, there were some big parties that had occupied the tables. But no matter since I was waiting on my friend to arrive anyway. There are some seats inside, but when the wait gets super busy, you'll have to brave the heat and wait outside the restaurant.   The wait turned out to be quicker than I had expected, which was nice. Walking inside, I found the modern and simplistic style to be very appealing. Very light and modern colors and furnishing with open spaces and deep green plants on the wall that ended up giving me the vibe of a very fancy dining room area - just with a bunch of customers and tables and chairs. Behind the hostess stand is also a display case full of pastries, desserts (and the coffee area) that one can order to-go or eat in-store.   For the menu - they offer breakfast and lunch options, as well as special brunch options if you want to order something different. So much to choose from, but ultimately I went with a savory option and topped it with their popular CK monkey bread.   CK Monkey bread: This is a MUST order if you love cinnamon, bread, sweets, etc. Seriously - it's worth the $5.95. I would eat this every day if possible. I had actually wanted to order the sticky bun, which I saw was a popular treat. After I asked the worker about the bun, she said that she wasn't sure what the bun was, but recommended the monkey bread as something that was similar. I decided to trust her and I'm so glad I did because it was amazing. The entire concoction came out in a pretty big pan with brown sugar and cinnamon draped over the pullable pieces of bread. Eating it worm and having it melt in my mouth while tasting that sweet ooey-gooey cinnamon taste ... that was the best thing ever and pretty much made my stay at Vegas. It was so decadent that my friend and I had a hard time finishing, but we did because nobody likes a food waster!   Craft Benedict: $12.95 for two poached eggs with ham, tomatoes, and citrus hollandaise sauce on top of an English muffin. I liked that the hollandaise sauce came on the side, allowing me to pour as much as I desired. The sauce was creamy and not too acidic-y, just adding the right amount of flavor to the benedicts. And the eggs were cooked perfectly - cutting into them, the yolk oozed out and covered the rest of the benedict with that yolky goodness, creating that perfect bite/texture each time. The ham was not too salty and the tomato added a little kick to the dish that I really enjoyed.   Oatmeal Brulee: $7.00 - honestly not sure why my friend ended up ordering this dish, but he said he wanted something healthy and not too costly. This vegetarian dish came with oats caramelized with sugar along with some dried fruits and nuts on the side. The presentation looked amazing, but I don't think many people order this dish in general. I was able to try a little and I do think it was better than any oatmeal I've ever tasted (probably due to that brulee), but it wasn't too special of a dish.   Even though it was super busy in the restaurant, the workers were bustling around trying to help each guest - and were super courteous whilst doing so. The restaurant is only open for breakfast and lunch, but they seem to be doing very well in the Henderson area. Parking is hassle free as the plaza has a huge lot.   tl;dr - A very tasty spot for brunch if you don't mind the wait. Highly recommend the Monkey Bread and the benedict!

ohqaJd6vggdOUBTb9VrehQ.text: One of the best breakfast places in Las Vegas ! Quality food  Reasonable prices Very clean  Hospitable reception Excellent service  I bring quests here for breakfast  Never a disappointment

3ASt-Fnf-PiSIHtYoMX8qQ.text: Expect a long wait if you're coming to brunch on a Sunday like the rest of Las Vegas lol but the food is worth the wait!!

R5VwHCM-vzPNyF1ybbk7FA.text: I'm a huge fan of this place. The food is always on point, as well as the service. Great place all around. I also want to give you kudos for your online wait list program. I've used it many times and can say it's always worked great. The pork carnitas omelette is insanely good! As much as I want to try something new I can't break away from this one (so I always steal bites from friends food). What can I say, I'm a girl that knows what she likes!?

YIEzXJ2TGCAgaPwh5Df7dw.text: First time here and we will definitely be back. This place is awesome. The staff is first class. They all have a favorite menu item and are willing to share their picks. The food is delicious. Understatement. I had the chilaquiles and added chorizo and avocado. So freaking good. Too much to finish! Hubby had the Biscuits and gravy. The Biscuits were insanely good. The gravy was the best I've EVER tasted. The sausage equally delicious. Usually a great breakfast place falls short on coffee. BEST. CUP. EVER. Hubby had the bottomless mimosa. Had a sip to taste. Will definitely try that next time. Shout out to Marlene our server! She was sweet, attentive, knew the menu and offered us a delicious crescent just because we raved about the food. We recently relocated to to Vegas for work. This place will be in our weekend rotation. *** Word of advice, check in on Yelp or you'll wait over an hour. We had to wait because we didnt know, but so worth the wait!!! Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chilaquiles with Chorizo and avocado, Biscuits and gravy with a side of bacon.

-eHIPQOFvPm_GqBnoROv7A.text: Our food was delicious. Creme brulee French toast, churro waffle, kids eggs and bacon with pretzel roll and potato, enchilada style breakfast burrito with Portuguese sausage instead of chorizo. Everything was so tasty. Customer service was great. Would definitely eat here again.

5bRXeOGlh6PUf05squUR5w.text: My friends and I came around 9a on a Saturday and had no wait for a table! But shortly thereafter this place filled up. We each ordered our own savory dish and one sweet to share. Here's what I got to try and how I'd rate it.   Short-Rib Hash 2/5 - It looks amazing, but totally lacked in flavor.   Carnitas Omelette 2/5 - Looked small for the price and was also lacking flavor.   Churro Waffles 5/5 - These were one of the specials of the day and probably the best waffles I've ever had. I'm guessing they used churro batter because they were the lightest, fluffiest waffles ever to exist. They were absolutely covered in a thick coating of cinnamon sugar and came with a caramel sauce. There are no words for how amazing this was. I can't believe I had to share. I would definitely go back specifically for these.   Chocolate Bread Pudding 3.5/5 - Its hard to find good Bread Pudding. And I certainly had better luck in the Midwest. I felt this one either needed more chocolate chips or it needed a sauce. It had great moisture and I loved the cold ice cream melting on top, but I would try something different next time.   Service 3/5 - It was just fine. The waitress didn't seem to care very much, she simply got the job done.   I will note that one friend ordered the fried chicken sandwich and another ordered the chorizo scramble - both looked great!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chocolate Chip Bread Pudding - good, but not the best
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

pAK2qnBuEbhYUfCsPMEuhQ.text: We had the Cobb salad, the Pesto, Chicken & Arugula salad, as well as the CK grass fed burger, a side of sweet potato fries, an iced latte and some cronuts. All of the food was great!! I would return for that in a heartbeat. The iced latte however wasn't, so I'm posting this only for constructive criticism. There was not enough espresso for this to be a latte. It was almost white in color because it had only a tiny splash of espresso. I will still return to enjoy the food on our next visit to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

TVhdN_ocADMxD6OR8mQJKw.text: Came in here for a tea before I had to be an appointment in this area. I thought maybe 5 minutes to get a tea and head to my appointment and still be early. They ran around and just couldn't get around to finding all the ingredients for the tea. When I asked the lady running around if she was the manager she said no she was the owner and didn't realized I was the one she was getting the card for to reimburse my credit card so she got rude and that she was busy helping this other lady and pointed at the person that was behind me and after me in line by 10 minutes for service. I was so mad as she turned her back and wouldn't hear me out. It was unacceptable that it took almost 15 minutes for a tea that I never got because I was now going to be late. And the owner was foul and rude and thought she was helping the wrong person so she was nasty to me when I was getting bad service. I had to ask about my tea because I was standing there so long. Very disappointed. No reason to be nasty to your customer when I was just trying to ensure my transaction was going back on my card and a refund was being processed.

9sUBJt69kXvErugL5illXQ.text: Well let's start with the positive the food is 5 stars.  The red salsa is amazing so much flavor.  Just loved the food.  The problem was the hostess.  She kept trying to rush me out to take the table and merge it with another.  This is rude in insulting. I was still eating and spending money.  I don't appreciate being treated so poorly . I will not go back after her treatment

hqbZXEndjD6_0yQwUZN3gA.text: I really wanted to love this place... But Yelp reviews are great on here. Maybe it was an off-day, maybe it was because it's Saturday, or maybe it's because it's so close to Christmas...   The wait time was between 30 and 45 minutes, which isn't too bad when you see that the line never ends for this place. But as soon as we were seated we were given our glasses of water and our drink orders were taken.  Needed to have a mocha on a chilly day! . Our mochas came to us room temperature I should have known something was wrong when when my cup felt cold... I asked our waiter if he could please replace these drinks he brought it to I'm thinking the hostess or the manager's attention and instead of getting a new drink that was hot they basically just warmed up our drinks and return them to us.  The food was good, but when three out of four say not good enough to return to I can't say that it was great... I did order desert, and that desert Save the Day! They would return for the desert!!  The interior decoration are very well done. It sort of reminds me of Joanna Gaines and Magnolia.  LOL my HGTV people know...  I'd like to give this place another try but the other three said they'd only do a dessert here

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Son would&#39;ve liked a little more heat when it comes with jelepano
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. It was good...
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Hubby said it&#39;s not worth coming back for

jDMivCmVWvvDoE3vW6hSpw.text: Went to have Father's Day breakfast and try out for the first time. So glad we did!! We've lived here for 5 years and i can't believe I had never come across this place! We came right after it opened so there was only one other party there. We came early because i read it could get very busy. It was perfect. Server was very nice and attentive. We ordered pelligrino for tres people but she only brought us two bottles anticipating that we might not drink it all and she was right and she took it off the bill at the end. Very thoughtful. She told us the specials everything sounded delicious it was really hard to choose. Husband ended up getting the veggie omelette as well as the churro waffles. At first glance the waffles look crazy sweet, but they were not! Even the 3 leches glaze was not overly sweet it was amazing! The omelette was really good too. I ordered the French toast which was good and my 5 year old ordered the kids waffles which he absolutely loved. They came with fresh berries and powdered sugar and a really good maple syrup on the side. Service was great, food was great, and the atmosphere was very clean and inviting. We will definitely be back for breakfast and will have to try it out for lunch as well.

1hedZp-YwUbT_If86nOVww.text: Love the food, love the ambiance, overall this place is great. Craft is easily one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to, sadly I just had to take off a few stars for the wait on being seated and for the wait on food.  We went on a Sunday during peak time which was our bad. The place is small and unfortunately, you can't make reservations for this location. We were quoted around 45 minutes and were seated 15 minutes past then, not a big deal, we knew the food would make up for it. They have a huge menu and everything looks delicious.We tried ordering starters, but all 4 options were 86d. We decided on the creme brulee french toast to share. It was the best! The filling and the bruleed topping exceeded all expectations,I highly reccomend it! The entrees took a looooong time to get to us.The table that sat after us even got their food before us. Looking around, you can tell they are understaffed. The servers are also acting as baristas, hosts, and bussers. But even so, our server was super friendly and helpful. When our  entrees finally arrived, the soup was cold and needed to be sent back, and my dish was seriously lacking salt. But those small things aside, the short rib hash and the crab benedict were amazing!  I'll be sure to try this place again when it isnt so crazy busy.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib hash
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Creme brulee pancakes, my personal favorite!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Crab cake benedict with lemon caper sauce

sbkMBG_guNaKKLYHBwaMbQ.text: A great place to have dinner. Both the food and services were excellent. I had a beef carpaccio which was a smaller plate and it had so much flavor! I basically inhaled it all! My husband had garlic cerano wings and a combo plate with short ribs and sausage served with rice topped with an egg, it was delicious! I had a mojito served in a freshly opened coconut and it was very strong for its size! They also give your the coconut water on the side. The staff was attentive and informative. Would definitely recommend this place!

ng-b6qjpjfhefDlt0WIZ7Q.text: It was good but all 3 of our orders where either missing items or wrong. Kitchen probably had an off day, but when we told the waitress we were not offered any comps or credits.... not even a free dessert... surprising as they seem to be very popular.

ywtg6sncP4AjmGui1dCkuA.text: Went to CRAFTkitchen for a business lunch with a couple colleagues and a vendor. After hearing praises of the food, we just had to check it out!! First off, this place is only open breakfast and lunch hours, so don't try to go later in the day.   We sat outside because it was so nice out. They have a few tables outside, but it is in a strip mall so it's not like a private outdoor area or anything special... it's right by the parting lot. Anyway, so we ordered food and I got the chicken & waffles. Holy Moly!! SO TASTY. Everyone was really happy with their food, but the one thing I'd caution is the portions are a little small for the price range. It's quality food and it's great food, but be aware that portions aren't huge. I don't mind, cause ya know... portion control is good. But I know some people are bothered by such things.   Our server was really friendly and attentive and when we went inside to pick out desserts from the bakery case, the staff behind the counter was also really friendly. Overall great experience! Would recommend if you're in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

LuGDwqQpGliOtjK-9akFSg.text: AWE. SUUUUMMMM. The Chile relleno stuffed breakfast burrito is one of the best burritos I've ever had. Even their basic pancakes are incredible, fluffy and buttery sweet. Excellent service, beautiful presentation. Great casual atmosphere. A real gem in Henderson!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

TMi9VD689uJd5S9MYF2U-g.text: Food was amazing staff was friendly and patient, even though our was crazy busy and the atmosphere was perfect for a girls weekend brunch. The only downside was that the banana foster pancakes seemed like pancakes with bananas on top. Nothing special. But when the waiter saw that I only took one bite, she didn't charge me for it!  That's service!

grymPjIX6VvszrWK54eBIQ.text: We came for breakfast the other morning and It was very disappointing. Our server was less than friendly and we did not enjoy our food.   We ordered the breakfast sammy and the protein fix. The sammy was okay, but nothing I couldn't get at a fast food place for way less than the $10.95 Craft charges. It also came with a  side salad which completely baffles me. Who wants a salad at 9 in the morning??   The turkey sausage on the protein fix was dry as a bone, pretty much inedible. When we asked the server for salsa to moisten it up she said "Sure but it will be 75 cents". Hmmm, you want me to pay 75 cents more to fix your super dry sausage?   Not sure what happened to this place but it was not the least bit enjoyable. Not sure I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. The protein fix. Turkey sausage was extremely dry
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Croissant Sammy. Salad for breakfast?? Don&#39;t get it

Z4C5ulKa35vRr9D3LnHk8Q.text: We went out of our way to try this place. It was pretty good. I got the Cuban sandwich with sweet potato fries with bacon alveoli. The kid meals are over priced. One slider with two sides were $6.95.

gpfazyGLHbIKj11UCLj8Ow.text: I go here every Sunday bottomless Mamosa's veggie toast grits capresomelette, the entire menu has a twist that you will not expect that is super good. HOWEVER IM UPDATING MY POST BECAUSE   I'm so disappointed in craft kitchen they took all the good things off the menu like the acai bowl, no more cheesy grits, no more veggie toast! Such a bummer it'll be a while before I revisit with my friends. Total bummer!!

6XNnIJfb95E_YYtUVizzRg.text: I am in the breakfast industry and I understand when it is busy it is busy. I was standing at the front door with my fiance not one person greeted us or said we will be with you. We stand their for about 5 minutes waiting patiently a lady came in and jumped in front of my fiance and I. The host than came after being their for 8 minutes now we told her we were here before the lady she ignored us and sat the lady. My fiance and I left because we are not going to support a business that treat us like that from the front door. The worst thing you can do is mess up on people in the Industry let alone same restaurant concept.

gu6YrOO4F07RpIJ4gWaK8w.text: Was not impressed with their food.  I have read only great things on yelp so me and my gf ordered breakfast from here.  It is extremely over priced for the amount of food you get.  My gf didn't even get Potatos or a small salad on the side of her plate.  It was literally 13$ for something I could have made at home.  She got the turkey Benedict which was absolutely disgusting.  The citrus sauce was a horrible choice.  She only ate 2 bites and through it away.  I got the short rib and like I said early it's small portions so you spend $15 on a meal and your still hungry after.  Waste of money. Will not give this place another chance because I felt I ordered the two best things on the menu and it wasn't even worth it.

wZlG9rw_30uNGkhpIf0Q1w.text: Every time we come here, we can't help but over order because everything looks amazing, and they never disappoint.  But that's ok, because it means less cooking for us!  And the small sizes on the desserts give us the excuse to get a bunch of little things.

fyCxQv074ISjDOogGT-OiA.text: I love this place. Great food and great service. Teresa is a great waitress ! Make sure you check out their pastries!

Q1EC5phXTwgEiLKqe54BEA.text: I came in for brunch at about 1130 AM on a Sunday and ordered bottomless mimosas and the carnitas omelette. I liked the atmosphere and the service was okay. BUT honestly, the food was not worth the price I paid. I was also very uncomfortable in the tiny metal chairs they have. I probably won't be going back- nothing special.

ygwsiksW7L36sskQ2PDxCg.text: I love Craft and they have such great service! I'm a regular morning coffee-to-go customer. One day, it took longer than usual to get my coffee, and they gave me a coupon for a free coupon to make up for it! Totally surprised me with it and I realized then that they really care about their quality of service. Every time I've eaten there, the servers are super friendly and the food is great. Definitely a must-experience if you're in town!

77TnhWTkddyYYdqGrQS1MQ.text: Their presentation is great. The food itself was okay. For the price we paid I def felt like it have been better. I got one of the breakfast sandwich and it was pretty basic. Nothing spectacular about it at all. I got one of their bloody Mary's and they used sake instead of regular liquor? It gave it an odd taste and again it was just over priced and didn't enjoy it. Everything is pretty over done or has some "cool" twist on it. My bf and I even joked about their red velvet pancake, about asking for a regular one, and being told they don't do "basic" pancakes....we asked, they didn't have regular pancakes, just the red velvet.

I_sv6oddbx4Pbvc7AZzDyQ.text: Great service! Healthy options for breakfast. Nice change from usual, heavy Vegas fare.

rtpNMSm5fVAidWc9pztHKA.text: First time to try this place after finding it on yelp and we were not disappointed.   Food - both my sister and I thought our choices were delicious. I had the chicken and what (waffles, spiced with jalapeno) and she had the chorizo scramble. We also had bread pudding for dessert with vanilla ice cream and it was perfect to finish off our meal.   Decor - it is a very cute place with farm house/rustic style tables. I love the succulents.   I can't wait to go back and also try the different types of dessert that they had on display.

n2Kiirk5vm828l930HXwOA.text: Great food but service needs to improve. They are all over you when you first get in but you never see them after you get your food. Friend purchased bottomless mimosas but never got more than two and I'm out of a bloody Mary for 20 mins without anyone asking if I want another. Poor poor

i9ygsxfqbhb7Slq5rXBuHA.text: The staff is so friendly. I love the atmosphere and decor here. It's like stepping out of Vegas and into a different city like Portland. The food is excellent. Well prepared and delicious.  I like that they have a good variety of dishes and pastries. I'm definitely coming back

ZgvAdqezxnpGgmZomWewng.text: Fried chicken of the waffles is ok. But the waffles.!?! Awesooooome. I wish I had more of these. They a little discs of some of of corn batter that remained fluffy. It was not like corn bread, it was a Chewey happy waffle texture. Great waffles. The chicken itself was white meat and the breaking just fell apart. It was ok. But the waffles! I wish I had more of them. So good. It was like cake.

KxSyZfxuWKlavblJKdSlOQ.text: Went to Craft Kitchen today 11/6 just me and 4 lady friends Josh the waiter took good care of us. Five Bloody Marys and five omelets later we were relaxed and having a marvellous time. So I say, CK for good food, great omelets and a good time with  ladies friends. Thanks, Craft Kitchen

fgmzCFfwuT7k5rp3o_rCYA.text: Went in today exited to try a new brunch place with my boyfriend. Impressed with the good reviews, we decided to come here. We were told that it would be about a 30 to 45 minute wait which was fine. We waited patiently and noticed that a few parties came in after us to get put on the list & were told 15 to 20 minutes. After about 20 minutes, 4 parties that came in after us were then called & seated. The staff did not notice until a couple that came in noticed, and said that we were before them when they were called up. Staff did not acknowledge the situation. At this point I was already upset & decided to leave. I really would have liked to try this place. I'm not sure if I would come back after this incident.

-1sOjjQI5L9asmg7QSGHfg.text: We love trying new places, looked at the reviews and they looked promising so we thought we'd give this place a shot. We made a mistake. From the fake herbs outside to the uncomfortable ikea furniture gallery seating inside, we weren't impressed. First the food. Everything is ala carte and everything we tried lacked any seasoning whatsoever. We ordered 4 different plates. Carnitas omelette. Protein breakfast. Grits and eggs and red velvet pancakes.  The carnitas were the most blan carnitas we've ever tried. The grits were not seasoned, they were lumpy and undercooked, the egg whites were cooked decent but still no salt and the turkey sausage patty was tasteless. We also ordered a side of bacon. Must be a low sodium bacon and it was super thin. Nothing and I mean nothing had salt in it. One bright side? Perfectly ripe cherry tomatoes.   Service. I ordered a side of bacon with my breakfast. Even after reminding the waiter on 3 separate occasions it didn't come out until I was nearly finished eating my breakfast. I asked for hot sauce, they brought out a teaspoon sized dollop of this tasteless green mud. I told the girl I asked for hot sauce(tapatio, cholula, etc). The girl said that's what they have. I ordered a side of toast. They have two types of bread and yes the other one is gluten free(yeah, it's that kinda place lol). They brought out two dried out pieces of bread that were harder than a week old crouton, no exaggeration. No butter. No jellies. I asked for butter. They brought out a small dollop that was frozen. Not refrigerated..frozen! I asked for it to be warmed. I didn't see it again for at least 15 minutes after I asked two additional people for it. It came back cold. Not once did they offer a refill on our coffees or water. They were even stingy on the "bottomless minosas" that come in a 4 oz glass. Yeah, service was poor. When all was said and done it was $115 for 4 people. They actually charged us for the condiments!  Poor service, tasteless food, fake everything and outrageous prices. That's what you'll get here.   Well at least we can say we tried it. Lol. Ya win some you lose some.

C3ScOT7HrBkPNTGkF2rnCg.text: Well that was the smallest omelet I ever had, I believe I paid over $12 for a 2?egg omelet. Which lacked flavor. Still hungry. Service was slow seating uncomfortable. Also be prepared for a wait.  This side of town needs more brunch options.

hZG0b7SsPdeWZmxzAsiAmQ.text: This is an awesome breakfast place in the Anthem/Henderson area! Great good, great service, great location... If you're on this side of town, there is no excuse for you not to eat here.  My wife loves the crustless quiche, which is constantly changes ingredients, so you never get the same thing twice. My personal favorite is the breakfast burrito which is a man sized portion of eggs, chorizo, green chiles, and cheese... Amazing! The prices are reasonable, and the atmosphere is great.  We will also bring our dog and sit out on patio. Can't go wrong!

mvgjTOv-l1MaNzuaMS14kA.text: Awesome find! All thanks to Yelp. Working night shift its hard to find someplace open at 7am and that doesn't just serve typical breakfast food. So my husband and I happened to get off at the same time and didn't feel like cooking, so I whipped out Yelp and searched the area. Located two seconds from work, Craft Kitchen. First impression loved the look of the place and drooled at the pastry case. The two woman that were working were very knowledgable and professional. The pastries are made fresh daily and you can taste it. We both went right for the Short Rib Hash. I had a Mocha Coffee that was perfectly done, usually I have to add sugar but it was perfect. The Hash came out and was delicious! Afterwards I had already eyes the Berry Crostata and my husband the Pecan Sticky Bun. Mine was the perfect end to a great breakfast. His Pecan bun was yummy, but it's so sickly sweet I think it's better to drink with coffee then just straight on its own. My only complaint is the chairs! So uncomfortable!  Next time we go we will request one of the bench seats. Otherwise this was a complete gem! We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Cute cupcakes! I love the bunny butt digging for carrots!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Pecan Sticky Bun-ask them to heat it up and grab a cup of coffee
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Berry Crostata-Yummy for my Tummy

W_cBOMEXN6iYL2nvZnjG4Q.text: Amazing food ,service can be better , but we keep coming back !!!!!! Try it all !! Dangerously delicious

VpnjAkPzZqAcm74_OItxtw.text: I'll give it 1 star because the menu looked decent. We walked in and was told the wait would be 25-30 minutes. We were okay with that until we realized there were 4 parties ahead of us with 5 tables open the whole time we were waiting. Everyone who came in after us were being told the same thing. I think this place like to make people hungry by making them wait longer than they have to so they'll rate the food better. BTW, we left after about 15 minutes and no one got seated.

R-p-TajocGcGd4uHzsvxQQ.text: My first visit to CRAFT kitchen was very memorable & I will definitely be coming back! My girlfriends and I hosted a babyshower in their private dining room. It comfortably sat 14 of us with enough space for all of our games and presents opening! The service was delightful...we were helped left and right by both our server, Theresa, and the manager, Sammy. They were so accommodating and friendly. The food was wonderful! We individually ordered and got to see a variety of food. I had the "Chicken and What" (chicken and waffles) and enjoyed the jalapeno syrup. My boyfriend had the "Short Rib Hash" and added an egg on top that made it so delicious! We'll be back again for a regular brunch next time!

YT9Y3cAzTLyh6bdag1PLrQ.text: Second time here. Service is not so good. Two different people I have asked for things and they both forgot.

mW1nMfpnnQMUypzi5CMsYQ.text: I was certainly not disappointed in this yummy place. I started out with the soup (creamy pumpkin) and had the roast beef sandwich on a pretzel bun as my entree. Both SO delicious. My hubby had the chicken and waffles. He shared and it was also amazing. My older son had the sliders and the younger had pumpkin waffles (this was a "special ") and they also were very tasty. We also tried the truffle fries and sweet potato fries and enjoyed them both. The coffee was delicious. My only complaint was the service left a little to be desired. It took a while for the server to even come over to take our drink order. We asked for water with our coffees and didn't receive them until the food runner brought our entrees. The server just seemed like he was a little slammed and didn't check back on us, fill our waters or ask if we wanted more coffee. The food runner and busser really picked up the slack for the server. Without them I wouldn't have been as happy with our experience. I'm just going to chalk the service up to the place being new and him still learning the ropes. I will most definitely be back to try some of the amazing looking baked goodies in the case.

aOCgqqPU8yx_Uwon44tGxQ.text: I absolutely love this place. Great customer service, great food, & the absolute best pastries. Probably my new favorite place to come for breakfast.

TGppngaIkyMpiOLTVST4Hg.text: First time coming here and definitely won't be my last! Everything was amazing, all the way from the location, the environment and decor inside, the nice lady greeting us at the door, and our amazing server, Shawna! Highly recommend this place if you're a breakfast lover like myself!

gp9dIgriaSMh22mSY7m7Dw.text: Ideal spot for brunch! Carnitas omelette and short rib had were ideal. Put a fried egg on top of the hash and get a kouing Amani to go. Worth the schlep from Summerlin.

TX9mvjhaa2X5XeIFGXBS6A.text: It was ok but not worth the price.  We went for Sunday brunch, it was packed and there was a 30 minute wait.  We decided to get coffee and that ate up 20 minutes of the wait.  I had the breakfast croissant, which was ok but tiny and it came with a salad.  My friend had the waffles and they were ok but again, tiny.   For $45.00 it was not worth the price.  Great ambiance and the bakery items looked tasty.

7HVSWGSaZ7mEwDW6zbZmlg.text: Not good value for the money. I ordered the lump crab citrus salad. The crab was mixed in I'd venture to disguise just how little of it there was. The avocado dice was so small as to fall off a fork. The dressing was nice, light. But for $14.50 I was disappointed.

-PMKvTVuz9qaMOXKBq7e0g.text: Service was slow no communication between the staff and the customer,  food took forever to come out. Anticipated the food to take time to come out , so we ordered for the kids as we sat down. The tables that sat after us recieved their food before us. A previous time we came there was a hair in my food.

3sz5nd7wDCmDgLWYLhCw2w.text: What a pleasant surprise. Varied menu. Outdoor seating available. Nicely done ambience except the chairs ain't too comfy so you can't stay too long. Great quiche. Best smoked salmon(LOX) in town, served on a toasted pretzel roll, with all the trimmings. Also had great Tomato soup. Will definitely return.

6jka2paSIna3nsUMIfd83A.text: Went back for another try after mixed experience earlier in the week.  The seating is still awful, but all my food today was excellent.  Had the hash with an egg on top (extra) and a side of bacon.  I know, adding a side of bacon to a beef dish is a little odd, but just had to get some more bacon.  It was just as delicious.  It is cooked so that it stays flat.  Very crispy.  Yum!  Portions are amble.  I brought home at least half of meal.

KbePUCwt0r1nH4d7GeLaCg.text: We are SO happy this place opened ! The food, atmosphere, coffee is great. The owners are also wonderful. We are thrilled to have an alternative to Sbucks in the morning, too !!!!!

2ZUvkSmzUw0qgiVOcF-R4A.text: It was decent.  Breakfast portion was small. They were out of the pastry I wanted.  I probably won't go back though since there are other great choices around Henderson.  Their staff seemed pretty good though.

-2IoX8Xv0MqExhYEDovYHA.text: The grass fed sliders and sweet potato fries were absolutely delicious!! The atmosphere, service, and delicious food make this the perfect place for lunch-brunch-breakfast or even fresh, ground coffee!

RBLXxvuIVVYqLx8TuBgsOA.text: Just stopped by for a coffee the other day.  DELICIOUS!  The place is gorgeous inside.  Will be going back for the food!

v4MUM95FI-BVDxwkPIVqzA.text: This was a wonderful new place...Got quiche to go....was soooo good.Other items looked very good...will return.....Only wish is they need to get some cushions for the HARD chairs......

Bh7nSe3BS7H_cNu3S8H30g.text: We really wanted to love this place. Our favorite place (Layers) recently closed and we hoped this would become the go to spot now. Came twice on a weekend since they opened. While I understand it takes time to work out all the details in a new place, something needs to be done about the service. When you walk in there's a sign stating to go to the right counter to be seated. It's hard to see it right away and most people just wait at the door further blocking the sign. The staff doesn't really do anything about it and you need to catch someone to get a table. No fun when you waiting with kids. When finally seated both times took a while for someone to come by. On a second visit once we finally ordered, few minutes later another waiter came by to say he will be our server and what would we like. We said we just ordered. Again took time for drinks and only water came. Server forgot our coffee until we flagged her down. It was nicely comped later as apology for the wait. The waitress just seemed not to care at all. She made some weird comments when I was ordering my son's breakfast along the line "you sure that's what you want for him", not even half way through our meal asked if we are ready for our check, and asked two more times, until we finally said yes. Another server brought our food including small bowl of fruit. I asked if that's part of the kids meal and he said "yeah". During the first visit, we did get fruit with the kids chicken meal, so I thought that was the case again. Turned out I was charged for it and the waitress just said "which guy told you that". It doesn't matter, she took my order and I did not ask for it in a first place. Also, she never gave us itemized bill until my husband paid and it just seemed too much. Once I asked, she printed a copy which showed the charge for the fruit. While the food is good with quality ingredients and nice presentation (hence the 2 stars), the overall experience was not pleasant either time, and we won't be back.

QvwwLV6vB10EYiI3aEG8yw.text: slow slow service okay food always croweded thou  the danishes taste old

xEOz0vINjdYCwSUVO2sSyw.text: Not just great food, but fantastic food!!! They should win 2018 breakfast and brunch restaurant!!! Oh and of course, the service was exceptional!!! Definitely a must- visit if you are visiting Las Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

Qd40GTKmWSp9bVlzGcu2cQ.text: This would have been a 5 star review but unfortunately they open at 7am, we came in at 9:40am and they did not have the CK Monkey Bread ready and we were told it would not be ready for another 45 minutes????  Overall we really like this place, the food is good, the staff are all amazing and they do what they can to serve organic and fresh foods, all here in Henderson....  Finally a great place on this side of town.  The ambiance is really cool, the deserts and sweets, OMG.  They keep them right in front so when you walk in the front door to be seated you see the 3 counter spaces filled with them.....  This is a place I highly recommend as they are amazing and really needs our support, although like I said there is nothing else like this on this side of town so they should not have any issues.

wWxSxDaoAQAkt-eKPn7Trw.text: Great vegan menu! Cute interior friendly staff, little pricey but you get your money's worth as a whole package when dinning here.

pkfvoIuHnWYiJP3g10REvw.text: I find places to eat from Yelp reviews.This place did not disappoint. We came in from California on a turn a round. Service was good. Food was great. We had oatmeal brulee, smoked salmon, and churro waffles. At first I didn't think the portion size was appropriate. But we shared all the items and it was just enough. The food is very well made. There is something about eating from a place that bakes their own bread, especially the pretzel buns. It really completed the meal. I am not a fan of pretzels but I actually ordered two buns to take home.  We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked salmon on pretzle bun,eating this with the churro waffle was a nice compliment especially if you like salty and sweet together.

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Churro waffles. Very tasty.

nbnrMnOXKIVSLtj4-KZ8HQ.text: This place is nowhere near my side of town, so if not for a friend dragging me here for brunch this would've passed me up. This place overall a positive addition to my brunch list.   In my visits here I've gotten to try the Benedicts, chicken and waffles and just random samplings of things that my friends ordered. Overall I have to say the food is good, but not great. Although the Salmon was pretty mouth watering. The atmosphere is pretty good and it has a good visual aesthetic that works well for brunch and instagram.   Overall I have no problem coming here for brunch. The service is a little bit slow, but that's the downside of brunch sometimes. It's passable, but not too high on my list. If you're in the area it'll work in a pinch

wc7DO9BnpgWNFgjuqjZsRw.text: Absolutely delicious I use them through a delivery service and food still look like it did had I ate at the restaurant everything was packed perfectly and delicious would definitely order from them again

a9dBs56FkIIjCHprW4GiKg.text: Great food and coffee here. Try the sammy croissant. It's a huge portion and the egg just melts in your mouth.

l-F2EN_G_zvwE5IEwkzvNA.text: I have gone to the place several times because they have wonderful food and gluten free options.  Today o went with a friend for Mother's Day and the food did not disappoint however the menu was a set price with the option of additional charge for a bottomless mimosa or Bloody Mary.  The quality of the champagne was honestly probably the worst I have had!  Usually they use Wycliff and this had a horrible after taste and a screw top!  I hope this is not going to be a regular choice because it was very disappointing.  The service was great after they were not going to seat us because it was a reservations only day.  Clearly there were several tables available and happy they were able to accommodate us!

1mwMfCeoyXnEaXRTnPACMQ.text: The churro waffles are so freaking delicious, the best churros I've ever had! Chilaquiles were good too, I should have asked for it to be spicier. The cafe is very hip and stylish. I wish they had more locations all around Vegas so I can get the churros whenever I want LOL

BCAQ3Hql5JsBgn69Nn-cyg.text: Great service, great food. I was treated here for a birthday brunch and my best friend and I chose Craft Kitchen because neither of us have been here before.   I ordered the smoked salmon and my best friend ordered the short rib hash, and bottomless mimosas (classic and pomegranate). Everything was great! The smoked salmon was on top their house made pretzel buns (2 in total); portion and flavor was great. It wasn't a hearty meal (which is what I was going for). The short rib hash, on the other hand, WAS hearty, but oh so delicious. I actually wished I ordered that instead lol. All in all, great place. Definitely coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon (atop house made pretzel buns) and Short Rib Hash (with a poached egg on top), alongside 2 pomegranate mimosas.

94aZf-PJdsJnDRfxRhxQmA.text: You can add my review to the ever growing list of write-ups praising this spot. After a couple visits it's safe to say this is one of the best (if not THE best) breakfast/brunch/lunch spots in town. The short rib hash ($15.95 + $1.75 for a poached egg) was as amazing as it looks with plenty of savory, tender beef. The potatoes are what really elevate this dish. They're smashed on the griddle then fried, giving them their crispy texture.  The apple tart ($5.25) is a thing of beauty. The thin slices of apple have the perfect balance of sweet and tart and the ginger crust is the perfect compliment. Their chocolate chip cookie ($2.25) and chocolate brownie ($2.75) are textbook perfect. The only flaw was a dry, dense almond croissant ($3.25).  It's hard to believe this is the same space that was occupied by Bread and Butter a few years back, but Craft Kitchen has proven to be a worthy successor.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Apple tart ($5.25)
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib hash ($15.95 + $1.75 for a poached egg) - braised short ribs, smashed potatoes, roasted sweet onions and peppers

mSZe3PTmABWZsMQJ6VZdcQ.text: The food was exceptional! I had the carnitas omelet and was an instant fan. Very complex flavor combinations and keto-friendly.   I could have done without the Shirley Temple wannabee wandering around in her tap shoes, but I can't really blame the restaurant for that. Her nanna could have been more attentive, though.

7Yle3cptceqvrHE_GZ-okA.text: Cute little place ! I had thier pork carnitas egg Benedict soooo bomb definitely recommend! I will be back to try other things on thier menu everything looked so good

wwzIr9Fa2oVmvG2Zp_FhZg.text: I came here for breakfast a few weeks ago and yelp didn't let me down! The service was fantastic, the almond milk latte was on point and the omelet was delicious. We bought some cookies to take with us as well from their pastry counter and they were so good!!  This will definitely be a regular brunch spot for me!

fdJnrd8bGtXG6b3SehRkKw.text: This is my favorite breakfast place, in all of Vegas and Henderson, by miles! I am never disappointed in the quality of the food, or the efficiency of the staff. There is always a small wait, but for good reason.

HFfsUi-CTMznR_PyNy46Pg.text: So delicious! I was there for a bridal shower and it was phenomenal! Food was scrumptious and service was fantastic!!!

nXpUC6C8A3Jv5VWyzuBltQ.text: One of my most go to brunch spot. Craft kitchen not only have an amazing staff, they have a scrumptious menu! I love being able to sit outside in the spring with my little yorkie. They're pet friendly and are always welcoming. There is a private room for special occasions and work meetings as well. I had a going a brunch for a friend of mine and the server was able to tend to the group efficiently. We love you Craft Kitchen

iZGv84L7In_ArFUcXN5vhA.text: Visited for lunch on a Monday.  There was no wait and we were immediately seated.  The restaurant was a little on the noisy side, which was surprising because it was only 1/2 full.  Would hate to see the noise level on a busy day.  The restaurant was freezing cold.  The iced tea was amazing.  That alone would bring me back again!  I had the chopped Caesar Salad. The presentation was beautiful  There was a toasted Parmesan crisp garnish that was amazing.  The salad was good, but when they were preparing it, they were a little heavy handed on the anchovies so the dressing was a little too fishy for my tastes.  My friend has he house burger and it was HUGE.  She said it was delicious.  We each ordered a side of fries.  I had the Garlic Parmesan and I loved them, her sweet potato fries were delicious too.  Normally I would have given this restaurant three stars, however, since the menu had so many choices and that delicious iced tea, I would be wiling to give them another chance.

9dgFNCMCEaOpaWeQg7BFqQ.text: I came in here before I had my nail appointment since I was starving    I sat outside on there patio very nice breeze that morning   My server was very nice and friendly.... I ordered a mimosa    I got a side of eggs with cheese very yum I mean can you mess up eggs lol   And I got the red velvet pancakes I smelled them soon as they were brought outside supper YUMMY !!!!   This place isn't expensive I saw a lot of family's coming in so it's nice it's family friendly I will sure visit again before my next eye lash appointment to try something else :)

wim3kP2kmr11TSn0OWEZ5g.text: I came here hoping I could score a solid Paleo meal. I left because my server made no effort to accommodate my requests. Nearly every meal has bread, eggs, or white potatoes. I asked for the salmon without the two eggs and I could substitute sweet potato fries. Seems fair. No, he was going to charge me for the side even though I was getting half a meal.  I tried to explain my diet but he said he doesn't know about Paleo and wanted to know if I was ordering or not. That was enough to make our party leave that minute.  This restaurant comes up with every search for "Paleo restaurant". Paleo eating for health is a fluid concept that allows for variation because many of us are trying to recover from illness caused by the standard American diet. I cannot have wheat, nightshades ( white potatoes, eggplant) or eggs. I didn't expect the server to know about my individual needs. I did expect him to be educated and trained enough to help me to choose from the fresh food they so proudly promote, so that I CAN maintain my health. This was embarrassing and time wasting and I will not return.

7tdLhnGl4TrEK9o26Sr0rQ.text: My wife and I didn't enjoy the food here, unfortunately. It's a cute little place and has nice service but my wife's short rib hash didn't have much flavor, tasted mostly like bland gravy. I got 2 eggs, bacon and potatoes. That's a pretty simple dish and it was done well but I'm extremely confused why a breakfast place wouldn't have toast. I've had the chorizo burrito before as well and it was barely ok. I've never had chorizo that was so dry and flavorless.

xTZehjYZPncSTw2fZfKjpw.text: A bit of a disappointment.   Heard many great things and have been excited to try it out. Beautiful interior. Very warm and welcoming.  Not very busy on a Thursday morning but still waited a good 5 mins before someone took my drink order.   Coffee was terrible. Very bitter taste. I asked for Splenda and don't have. I get the whole "healthy eating" angle, but let me enjoy my Splenda.   Ordered the pork carnitas omelet. Very bland. Pork tasted watered down. Green sauce just had no flavor. I felt like I needed to pour some hot sauce on it, but after being denied Splenda, I was afraid to ask.   I may try again, but my first go here was underwhelming.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Pork carnitas omelet

X3FiBm1lqn5F8-riYMvPTA.text: Wowza! I loved everything about this place! Owned by a former bakery chef in Red Rock Resort. Even if you have food allergy, you can still eat delicious things here. The owner's wife and kids have nut allergy, so he cares so much about people with food allergy. How nice!! I couldn't tell from outside but this place was very spacious and bright inside.    I was welcomed by this young guy that was very nice. He took me to the little cute booth to sit. Cozy!! Loved their succulent arts on the wall. Each table had a little succulent pots. Cute!! The waitress, Teresa was also very nice and accommodating. I told her I'm trying to eat as healthy as possible. She recommended me a bunch of items on the menu. (Loved they have a bunch of healthy items to choose from.) I decided to go with "Farmers Market Stack".  It was absolutely delicious. The quinoa cake was crisp outside and soft inside. The tomato sauce was flavorful and the veggies were fresh. The portion size was small compared to other breakfast places. I appreciate the small portion size because I usually overeat otherwise.  The manager, Devin was making sure everybody in the restaurant was happy and satisfied. He was very nice and cheerful. I like to see people like that early in the morning to perk me up.  My overall experience here was absolutely amazing. One of the best healthy breakfast places in Henderson!!

n84sSQ_08pGeXvq9-ZJwCw.text: We were planning our next trip to Green Valley resort and were looking for new places for breakfast...we read that the owner and chef was the former pastry chef at Red Rock resort which we also frequent. We arrived on a Saturday am and ordered the smoked salmon with cream cheese on a pretzel bun...outstanding! The micro greens, paper thin red onion and fried capers made it unique. We also had the "protein fix" egg white & spinach omelette with house made turkey sausage very good and healthy which was what I needed after indulging the night before. On our next visit the avocado toast and short rib hash are next and I'm sure they will not disappoint! The staff was friendly and professional...out server Jeffrey was a delightful start to our day!

You do need to eat all the elements together to get the full flavor (ie the small greens, peppers, meet and potatoes.) Over all tasty.  Chicken and waffles weren't as great.  The chicken was a bit over salted , but the jalapeno syrup was interesting.  I enjoyed the pop tarts. My first home made one and it was worth it. Bread pudding is a must. I just wish this place served monkey bread everyday so I could try it.

F_SzvgXRD1GZXEn-qptsIA.text: Great breakfast place! Good ambience and food was delicious. Very flavorful but light. We had chicken and waffles and turkey benny. Chicken was very moist and waffle was soft and airy inside with a crispy crust outside. Hollandaise sauce was light and citrusy. I loved smashed potatoes!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

yr1Eyi9Mflk7C_kCQ7J_ng.text: Great atmosphere and delicious food. It's a little overpriced in my opinion though! It's perfect if you want a trendy place to have yummy food and good Instagram pictures, but be prepared to spend at least $15-$20 a person. They do have lots of gluten free and vegetarian options!

0Sv6mvX3-eeM_NE3U25c5g.text: Friendly and tasty. The breakfast burrito is amazing... Usually they are bland, this one is not.

N0q6n3Bxm6zWQHQbz_cQGg.text: Delicious food! The service is excellent as is the ambience. Bottomless mimosas are delicious and truly bottomless.

vqccZv_oYKxD_AMwmS2fEQ.text: Meh. Interesting food, small portions, mediocre service, overpriced  Tried Craft Kitchen today for the first time.  We ordered the chicken and what and also the turkey Benedict. The chicken was tasty,  and the jalapeno on the waffles was a nice touch, but the portions were rather small. Additionally, it was nothing novel or unique compared to the other Chicken and Waffles that I've had in Las Vegas (except being a smaller portion).  Add in the fact that they do not provide you with any of the typical side dishes that you expect with breakfast fare, the price point is undesirable.  The turkey Benedict was interesting. Clearly, the turkey is dry and insipid. While everything is cooked appropriately, and the hollandaise had an interesting Touch of Orange, I wouldn't go back for it again.   The sausage patty tasted like stuffing you would have at Thanksgiving. While I liked it, it wasn't worth $4.  Finally, the service is pretty terrible. The waitress was inattentive and did not come back to check on the table. She did not come back to do refills on our drinks. I ordered it hot tea, and there was barely enough hot water for half a cup. I consistently had to ask for more hot water.  I am glad I had a chance to try this restaurant, but I will simply just go to Egg Works across the street from now on.

usYJyfQ2LkSbRJtjl3rpkw.text: One of our favorites places to grab lunch with the dog.  Great food and staff, I mean it.  If they only deliver!  Then I would be enormous, but happy.

yWxspjZ-6ZRNxrYetubI8g.text: This review is based solely on the wait.  I never actually ate today.  I walked in and asked the hostess for a table for one.  I saw that there were 3 open tables inside (2-4 tops and a 6 top). I totally understand not wanting to sit me at a bigger table, however, after 10 minutes, another 4 top opened outside.  The girl then came over and told me it would be 'another 5-10 minutes".  I believe, if there's nobody else there, after a few minutes, sit the single in the 4 top.  Don't upset the guy waiting by making him wait an additional 10 minutes in the hopes that more people would come in and take the bigger tables.  I grabbed a coffee to go (coffee is outstanding).   This is my opinion, but I appreciate the feedback.

DSi7-Xo82CVsMog57nmAMA.text: Their menu is fantastic!! I've been here twice and have been impressed both times!  Delicious food and great customer service, this restaurant features natural and organic food choices for gluttonous and healthy diners.

I had the smoked salmon with pretzel dish, & my significant other had the chicken and waffles. Everything was so good! Great location & I will definitely be coming back!

BTukmTDN6wgFun2Lr_4VXQ.text: Chose this place because of the review.  Came for a Saturday brunch around 11ish.   The place was not that huge.  We had to wait for a minimal time for a table.  Ordered a carnitas omelet and my friend ordered chorizo skillet.   My plate was awesome.   The carnitas was not dry, and the portion was just right for brunch.  I highly recommended it.  The chorizo skillet, according to my friend, was good also.   I tried a bit and I could not agree more.  I would definitely come back to try other plates on the menu.

QUavm4MNceRqzLH9s1fKSQ.text: Nice presentation of meals here, but the waitress seemed to be doing double duty behind the coffee area and left my table without much service.   No refills on drinks, and no offer of dessert for us.  We went down the street to Mad OWL for dessert and coffee instead.  Prices at Daily Kitchen are more reasonable if you are craving yummy Organic food!

ZIkZcClctawlwDjAYw1Z9w.text: Nice place but don't go. Their hours are completely wack. They close at 4 or something. Are you joking!? I went here with my family and when we saw he menu I could not believe how overpriced this was. Over $12 for a sandwich! You're kidding! I told the waitress we will be taking our business elsewhere and refuse to play such inflated prices for simple foods. Sorry but I will not dine at a place run by greedy money loving animals.

8Z1Btwrz_Hu-u6WVvoyRUA.text: Under staffed.  Arrived 12:30pm on a saturday and walked out at 1:30pm without being served.  Restaurant was under staffed and attention to guests was overlooked at each table.  It's all about service which was lacking.  I may come back but not if I see the place under staffed again.

VXCbq1EcCJtwSUM3Fkmn3w.text: A friend of mine recommended this place as she knows the owners. I haven't had time to check it out yet, but I wanted to grab my parents a gift card. While here this morning, I decided to get a few baked treats. Oh my goodness... The kouign amann is amazing. I had never heard of this delectable treat before! The lightness of a croissant inside with a crisp outside. So good! Perfect amount of sweetness. I got a few other sweets as well, but haven't tried them yet. Service was friendly and quick for my small bakery order. Will be coming back soon with my friend for an actual sit-down meal! But I'm still getting the kouign amann!

2q0atIlauhE_xRo6nqgcCQ.text: The food is amazing - the atmosphere reminds me of a cafe in the city. Amazing coffee! My kids also love the food / grab a sandwich on homemade bread, salad with burrata or breakfast ... The truffle fries are a must!

r8FtZI1JRGSBRr5TxQYkaQ.text: The food was very tasty. I like all the healthy options. The atmosphere is light , airy and relaxing. Our server was a total sweetheart and made us feel very welcome.

L4dkbCmJZeV_eV2uv_8cTw.text: 1st time here and the service was great! I had the chorizo shepherds pie and it didn't look big at first but let me tell you it defiantly was filling and the flavor was amazing and I added a over med egg  and that just topped it off overall a 5 star experience!!!

bpVjEybLqpQ1mjdnuXbOMg.text: Carnitas omelette and croissant Sammy were delicious. Great food and a short wait on a Saturday morning.

-7iGrnaH0rnF0Dsheh_vPw.text: I was so excited for Craft to open!  Atmosphere is amazing, relaxing and inviting.  My Citrus lobster was delicious! My friend had Turkey sliders and we shared garlic fries which were perfectly seasoned and crispy.  We also split a hot cinnamon roll that was perfection.  Our server was great and sweetly kept re-filling my ice tea as I obnoxiously couldn't get enough. Will definitely be back.

atxJ3MsNye4aKcqweIYZIw.text: My friend and I decided to check out this new neighborhood restaurant & we're glad we did. The food was great! I stalked the joint on Yelp before I went so I had an idea of what I wanted. I had the short rib hash but added 2 poached eggs. So good! My friend had the bacon & egg croissant sandwich with side salad, which had tiny potato chips in it & was also delicious. THEN we split the creme brulee oatmeal! So bad but so good! I will definitely be visiting this place often.

yTQthiUeHzRig8ip44PRpw.text: Really good coffee, they said it's brewed in Boulder City. I don't know exactly what that means..it was just delcious. Everything's really tasty..The staff is so customer service oriented. Super nice..portions are kinda small. Good for me..

0OywLiLjmPCfvJBMAt3ddQ.text: Best breakfast spot in Henderson. Menu reminiscent of some of fine breakfast/brunch options you'll see in San Francisco. Food presentation was wonderful and everything tasted fresh and delicious. Our waiter Kevin was very attentive and friendly despite being busy. Definitely will revisit.

bM9B24NPn34A3GqbTwbU9g.text: Great new place up towards Anthem.  Weekends get busy but it's a great atmosphere and the staff is always friendly.  Too many delicious things to tempt you behind the bakery glass so beware.   The breakfast croissant is super good as well as the avocado bread.

xhI3PUOkkIAlh4i9kdEOXA.text: Very creative menu. They take breakfast or brunch and come up with new spin on traditional items and prepare everything at the highest level.  Service is absolutely terrific. Wait staff knows their menu and they are very attentive.tried their smoke salmon on a pretzel bagel and was absolutely phenomenal. Also something as simple as scrambled eggs had to be the most perfectly prepared eggs I can remember.  Their monkey bread served  during weekend brunch is just decadent.

IOvFiMFfynOH6hrGuT_2Kw.text: As the Yelp reviews suggest, this is a wonderful place to eat. Teresa was awesome and made our experience here the best!  We had the pecan sticky bun, chorizo scramble, and a side of bacon and coffee. It was all fantastic!!  We will be back again before we leave the area.

fvMOyJ-oQkkLGXT_kZHXzw.text: So very cute, with great outdoor seating for those warm spring days. Unless outdoor area is managed by Katie. We initially chose inside but moved outside a bit later ( seating under the vent was a bit chilly) and from then on got absolutely zero service. Katie took orders from other people seating outside but absolutely ignored us for 30 some minutes we spent eating. At one point my husband had to go inside to get us some drinks. Katie showed up with two drinks, inquired who helped us inside and quickly had the check brought out. In spite of the fact we were not ready to leave we did, feeling totally unwelcome to stay. In spite of delicious food the rudeness of the server who ignored us even after another team member directly told her that we needed service spoiled our experience. Sad:(

ZEGVVmg4eS-Wq84zKSBpPg.text: Very good food and fresh. Had the the BBQ spare ribs. They were tender, flavorful and delicious. The gravy is homemade and really great with the rice.

xlquiKRXv2Gws13ztk-FqQ.text: The protein fix was delicious! Cute, quaint, and everyone was very friendly. Great new trendy breakfast spot to check out.

ELqnddvppMPSGfEV4DV2hg.text: Amazing food, great homemade pastries and good service. Go early though or plan to wait. The place is a little gem and fills up quickly on weekends. Try the homemade pop tarts or the pull-apart bread. Yummy.

T-BsRV9_TsLOs1Bi4pj9yg.text: As we live in the area, a a few of us ladies got together for lunch to try out the new place. I ordered the Shrimp & Grits, it was just OK & came lukewarm. Shrimp were very small & dry. Really could have been served with decent sized juicy shrimps for the price. Others ordered the Crab Salad - nothing really special.  We all found the chairs very uncomfortable especially since we got together to gab a bit. It's definitely not a place to go if you want a leisurely lunch and enjoy your friends company. Service wasn't that great either. Not sure I would go back.   Disappointed in Anthem

HftX8w11T_BFZ5JQAFU8Cw.text: I've been waiting for this place to open and finally had a chance to try it for the first time yesterday. I like the idea of how you have an option of sitting inside or out. I love the layout of the restaurant. It's simple but yet cozy with a super friendly staff. We were instantly greeted and seated as soon as we walked in and felt welcomed.  The server was very nice and knowledgable of their menu. I wanted something simple so I had ordered the CK special. It was just the perfect amount of food because I normally don't like to stuff myself. The turkey sausage was amazing hence I normally don't eat sausage.  I must say the Carmel Latte was amazing as well.  I wanted to order a second cup of java but yet I get heart burn so I had to limit myself. The Sammy croissant was yet another hit! It was so delicious and yummy.  We had also ordered the garlic fries and cake pops for dessert and yet no disappointment. I totally recommend this place and will be back to try the other selections on the menu. Happy eating.

SosyBOpJ01lO90G4tF_SGg.text: Expensive. Food is not tasty . Pastries are dry and they dont have a lot of options.poor service .

LqBQp8dMeX_Takt0CxXsSg.text: Bad staffing! Wanted to have breakfast today, 12 people waiting, said it was a 20 minute wait for 2 and there were 5 cleaned tables for 4 and one booth area for 4 and one for 2 open. I asked if he was sure it is 20 min as there were SO many tables clean and ready to go not to mention a fully open outdoor seating area.  It's Sunday am!! If you don't want to be fully open, you will eventually go out of business like everyone else who starts slacking.

_qpqV968kZ93Tbi96T_tyw.text: First let me say I know Jaret and Tami and they are the nicest people around! Very talented and hard working and I wish them all the success.  Now on to the food...it's the BOMB! I can't tell you how long I have waited for this town to finally have some local places to eat that aren't a chain and actually offer delicious, healthier leaning, "foodie" type food. The combinations that Jaret comes up with for each dish makes your taste buds explode and leaves you with a smile on your face.   I've taken my mom, my family, my friends and have dined alone and every time everyone has left with nothing but great things to say about CRAFTkitchen. They also cater to people with dietary restrictions which is a bonus.   I look forward to many more dining experiences here and can't wait to see how the menu changes with the seasons. I highly recommend to anyone looking for a new take on breakfast and lunch.

Dn5PzoLwTWinYJ5vvcUtRg.text: OOF! Updated review here, but this time my review is based on customer service. Came in here yesterday with two others, and after we were seated my one friend and I ordered one single mimosa. They do offer bottomless mimosas, but we just ordered one. After we drank about 3/4s, our waitress came by and refilled our drinks. Our initial reaction was oh, cool more mimosa! But then we realized maybe she thought we ordered unlimited, which we didn't. So we decided not to drink them. Totally fine. Here comes the problem... I approached the waitress about our incorrect bill, and her response was, "well you didn't say anything when I filled them up." Umm excuse you! The waitress' mistake now became our mistake. No thanks. My response was, "what was I supposed to do flag you down while you're running around?" Queen of sass, I know. But this interaction was rude and completely inappropriate. This waitress clearly needs to work on her customer service skills. If we come back, I'd be sure not to dine with her!

ObsR8CWo4SZUSu2-OFQp_A.text: This restaurant was amazing! The food was delicious and came out quickly (we got the chorizo scramble, the hash, and the salmon benedict). The portions are pretty big, we all had to-go boxes. The staff was extremely friendly and eager to please. I will definitely be coming back to this place!

ABdVoj24t29KSP1y8yZtUQ.text: Wow...Just had a quick lunch with my daughter there today. Loved it,food was excellent wait staff was friendly and nice. I will most definitely be back!

WA3PZynTJXu3cXQBC7b3mg.text: They have delicious food, including monkey bread, which I love. Their staff works hard and are proud of their service.

faHGSU9CKBxU7HWR_YvejQ.text: Great menu and great food! Had 3 different items on menu, avocado toast, vegetable omelet, and protein fix. All were wonderful! Can't wait to eat here again and try something else!

P0hOunS8tjtXZeO0tdVi1g.text: Excellent food and service. Fresh organic coffee, tasty and spicy shrimp street tacos and to top it off...a gluten free delicious pumpkin tart. We will be back.

MXsm6xal-flfurIFiLHgFw.text: Very modern decor and eye appealing, but food doesn't deliver. Smashed potatoes are a great idea, but they needed salt. The turkey sausage was god awful. The grits were in the same boat as the turkey sausage, just horrible and made by someone who has no idea how to make grits. Overall the food lacked flavor and technique. If you want a great breakfast go to Mesa Grill at Caesars Palace and let Bobby show you how grits are made. This is a great example of how easy people are fooled with fancy decor and cool plate presentations. Open your eyes people and let the food be the deciding factor. I don't see this place around for long.

NUwf_RzVkLDmUOjJhPK2cw.text: Great local restaurant!!! I have had several items on the menu... Love the smashed avocado toast, the smashed potatoes are great but so far my favorite is the turkey sliders (which are packed with flavor) and the sweet potato fries with that amazing aioli! And a secret is they have homemade siracha type hot sauce and it's fantastic! Yummy place and I love the decor!

xu6Hyru7PDz9grVPJqcRvA.text: I am not gluten-free but I was curious try to it out, see if it lives up to the hype. So yummy!

HGmFVsymiivz3wIzhsMrBQ.text: The food was good but the service was SO SLOW. My friend and I waited over 35 minutes for our food and the place didn't have that many people in it. The people next to us told us that they had to wait well over an hour to get their first dish of food. But one good thing, I did get a good nap while I was there.

O6VV89SGzzFbvXVuJFg0YQ.text: Outstanding service and very friendly staff. The food was exceptional and came out in a reasonable amount of time. I had the acai bowl and it was very good and very well presented. The manager, Devon, was very nice and interactive. He works hard and is very relatable with the customers. He even gave us a free pastry because it was taking long to come out. I highly recommend this place for breakfast or lunch.

6G4Lj_-yCDIrIxjv13HQbA.text: Fantastic bakery items. Classical masterpieces and some interesting combinations. Finally a real bakery in Henderson. We are looking forward to trying their breakfast and lunch menu. Staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful.

K8Bwo94MJvdtYhzcLJ49GQ.text: So I had driven by this place a couple times since they recently opened and decided it was time to try it out! First impression when I walked in was a positive one! Clean, warm, receptive and very busy! We were seated by a friendly staff member and ordered a couple lunch items. I got the Beef Sliders, my bud ordered the Smoked Salmon Bagel and a side of Garlic Fries. Food came out in good time and was awesome. From the presentation, to the freshness, and most importantly to the taste, they knocked it out!!! They gear toward the healthy side, which can sometimes leave the taste in the kitchen...not this place!!  Everything was fresh and healthy but also flavorful and filling! Menu is very diverse and imaginative! Will definitely be back for more. Bringin the wife next time! She was wanting to go and a little bummed we went without her!!!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Caritas omelette...yummy!!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smashed avocado toast!!

U33OwiqDgZi4JP-4Ad8vRQ.text: CRAFTkitchen was great for a late Saturday brunch!  My party and Iarrived around 1:45 and the restaurant was busy but not too busy... we were seated right away.  The service was great, our waiter was very prompt and polite. He also seemed to have great timing. As I had friends visiting from out of town so we were very busy conversing most of the time. He always came around at the perfect time for ordering as well as refills and extras.  I ordered the carnitas omelette and it was DELICIOUS! The pork was tender and flavorful and mixed with the green salsa and cheese it was perfect. The portion was great as well... it wasn't to much food, I was able to eat most of it and share with my friends. I left feeling full, but not stuffed and that made me very happy. I also tried a bit of my friends meals: the apple cobbler pancakes and the breakfast burrito. First off all of the dishes were perfect portions and were presented beautifully. They cut the breakfast burrito in half making it easy to take the other half home. It was still delicious reheated later that day. I really liked the idea of putting a chili relleno in the burrito. It was different then your typical "breakfast burrito". The  salsa verde (served w burrito) was the same that was served on my omelette and it was really delicious and simple.  Now the apple cobbler pancakes were FANTASTIC! I will be back to try those again! The pancakes held up great to the warm flavorful syrupy apple cobbler and had a bit of texture with the crunchy topping.  For drinks we ordered michaladas and pomegranate mimosas. Both were delicious and served in beautiful glassware. (Making for great social media pics)  I can't wait to go back to CRAFTkitchen and try more of what they offer on the menu. The pastries in the pastry case looked delicious ( wanted to try them but was pleasantly full after our meal) I would love to try the coffee as well. They have so much to offer, and makes me eager to be back for more.

NqU-FClEdy2H9dWUaImToQ.text: The best service I've ever had. They were so friendly. And I even lost my phone in the restaurant and Devin helped me find it. Thanks again for everything!

3nbpLfUmQlsyRbiWU8Ii1g.text: Loved everything about this place.  Atmosphere, ambiance, staff and food! We went with a large group for a celebration and everyone raved about their food! Will absolutely return!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and WHAT!!

jR5uiFSiD7ke6ERjIug9MA.text: Our first time here and it was great! Good food, bottomless mimosas and service! Erica was an awesome server and we will definitely be back!

aXBU4-ianGnthcgaBnnM2Q.text: Best fresh and healthy food. Love going with girlfriends for lunch and mimosa. Highly recommend to people service is good and people friendly

sQMKlfmpqzhdCkBGYeM1IQ.text: Love this place, great food and good special. The chicken and waffles is amazing. Today I'm trying the special for the 2 year anniversary. It's birthday pancakes. They close early so get in for breakfast or lunch.

jpdghRI4Al27n-mh-Z7HuQ.text: Came here for brunch on a Sunday & luckily our wait was less than a minute! I guess it was good timing, as soon as we sat there was a line forming. Food is amazing, pretty dam good actually. Service was also good & very attentive. Will definitely be back to try other dishes!

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Monkeybread!!!! Must try! So warm &amp; gooey
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Cafè Mocha

RmqU4AV3FLEbrkqukQUTyw.text: Get their cappuccino!  I stopped here for brunch a little after 10am on a Friday and got in right away. They have a lot of outdoor seating as well. They have a walled off room with windows for events and the staff was so nice and helpful! They're cappuccino was soooo good! It may be the best one I've ever had! It was so foamy, creamy, and smooth. We got their acai bowl with fresh banana, blueberries and strawberries, toasted coconut, and house-made granola. I definitely recommend! We also got the CK special with turkey sausage. The only downside was that they are a little bit on the expensive side for the portions you receive. Still the food was very good! I will definitely be back!

cNrjYYpDk7IcOvT1u3wfMQ.text: Visting from La found this place great food. Love the chorizo scrambler (the Best ) !!! Will be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chorizo scrambler

FZKJzL8hcNkg2vVdiYZJzQ.text: fire alert fire alert!!!!  if your not sure what fire means  i'll explain it means amazing food was terrific by far one of my favorite breakfast meal i ordered the  "chicken what?" and my boyfriend ordered the "churro waffle and  "cheesy grits."   we recieved great,  fast service for a cheap price thanks again katie for the good service and chef jarid  for the scrumptious food

mGfzkd_5c1Y8JI8yEeyx_w.text: BEST salmon on pretzel roll !!! I love it there. Staff is always friendly. I wish they had bottomless mimosas lol Everything is always clean and fresh :)

28zTrgt6ED-hCeuJXFzCsg.text: WOW! WOW!! WOW!!!     This is the best thing to happen in Henderson since we've moved here!!! Atleast until the new Costco get built~     Located on a strip mall near the corner of Eastern & Sunridge Heights behind Osaka this is the place for breakkie & lunch. Open daily 7am -3pm all menu items available anytime!!!    We had breakfast, my selection toasted ciabatta slices with smashed avocado seasoned with salt/pepper and a little olive oil, a scrambled egg and finally topped with toasted pumpkin seeds, Atleast I think they were pumpkin seeds.....just FAB!!!! They do offer more traditional items with a little twist.     Coffee is not served from a pot or carafe either.....each cup individually brewed so an excellent cup of Joe  from a roaster in Boulder. Gr8 that the chef/owner Jerrod the former pastry & food service Mgr from Red Rock Casino is using local sources.      Jerrod told us they will be open a couple hours on Thanksgiving for pie & bread order pick ups. Also selling slider buns and the pastries are beautiful to look at and the glazed cinnamon roll I indulged in was infrekkin credable!    Head on into CRAFTkitchen ez parking, pleasant & welcoming staff and truly great food

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Housemade bagel, smoked salmon, capers, tomato,slice onion and alas cream cheese ~ YUMMMMO!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Toasted ciabatta / smashed avacado, scrambled egg topped w pumpkin seeds &#39;n micro greens  DEEEEELISH!

aLTuJso0EkABEOdHmpJoUA.text: Finally got to try this lil gem out ... The ambiance reminded me of a Cali vibe for sure which I'm totally into and then there was the food. I'm all for creating a spin on an old favorite and their pulled pork hash was just that! It was amazing... I added one scrambled and a mimosa  and did a lil work on the laptop while I was at it. I can't wait to go back and try the chicken and waffles

BHgIzzzH3NLBUxUP5lC3FQ.text: Loved it all!! Great place, came out with my kids for a Sunday brunch and the kids menu was really delicious, good size portions and healthy. Mimosas were great. Will have to come back soon.
