4MAv3xgZhd7MnXTSoZo0_w.text: The food was alright  !!! I like the atmosphere and the food presentation was nice,  but a little pricey for lunch and my surfer wasn't around when we need her but she came over when we were ready to check out.

4fKtEDdUFhR-2zqngMXFqA.text: Yummy yummy yummy! I don't know why it took me this long to review this restaurant, especially since I've been back a countless number of times. I try to order something new each time I go. So far, my favorites have been the short rib hash and avocado toasts. Their mochas and cappuccinos are delicious as well! The thing I love the most about the food is that it tastes super fresh and not overly seasoned or cooked in oil. I leave feeling satisfied and guilt free. They're all you can drink mimosas on the weekends is also worth trying! Just expect a fairly long wait during brunch. But busy means the food must be good right? :)

VvJbVGHC5NZnEqipd1_S6A.text: The food here is always good, but the service is always lacking. It seems like the servers and hostesses are distracted or too busy to be bothered. Today we got there and it took about 4 minutes to be greeted, all while watching about 4 people on the other side of the counter. We had our name taken and were told it would be about 20-25 minutes, while there were four or five open tables. I get it's a busy and popular place, but it just seemed a bit odd to keep people waiting. It seemed like the hostess was trying to have her own system of setting tables. Finally someone came over and started seating everyone who was waiting. I do think I will return, but hoping the service does get better.

FBJauc413j1_wqb3zSTllw.text: This place has let me down on three separate occasions now. Overall lack of enthusiasm from restaurant staff. No specials were read to me but I heard them being read to another table as I got my CK breakfast burrito. The first bite of my burrito was a giant piece of inedible, hard chorizo and I picked every single piece of chorizo out after that because I didn't want that awful bite again. The smashed potatoes were the best thing about the burrito but there was only a couple pieces in there spread out unevenly. Last time I tried to come here the pulled turkey Benedict came out completely cold and the time before that the homemade turkey sausage was hard and inedible as well. Not impressed at all by any of the meats at this place. Not sure what the hype is about Craft Kitchen because I really don't get it.

kgAL6W0PKBUjMXOM3sxF5A.text: Katie is the server queen. I'm the worst customer and yet she still took every punch like a professional. So polite, sweet and accommodating. Sad to see the cronuts go; this was one of the biggest draws for me, but I'll still be back for Chef's birthday pancakes next weekend with mimosas. Creme brulee

0Acb_YDbAJVMSzcQEXi3cg.text: This place was so awesome! The amazing breakfast and lunch options were so hard to choose from! Their desserts were also so delicious! Will definitely be going back on our next visit!

sjASuUNqaNlwj_QDCTJ-tg.text: Such a cute atmosphere and only a 30sec wait  Had the short rib hash with over easy egg and avocado toast with poached egg. Both were awesome. Service was great....specifically Katie was the best. Also had the cutest and super tasty macaroon....lemon and raspberry. Just filling enough

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Lemon raspberry macaroon.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib hash w/ poached egg. Avocado toast with sunflower seeds and poached egg and a side of bacon.

nR0a3YNtTAnEgWWL7GDWmw.text: This was our second visit to CRAFTkitchen for brunch. We returned because we couldn't stop thinking about the monkey bread, so good! However, both times we've been puzzled by the order in which tables are seated. Many tables sat vacated, un-bussed for several minutes. With a long wait list, I would assume the intention would be to seat as quickly as possible. We waited approximately 25 minutes for our table, which is reasonable for Sunday brunch. The concern I have, is the 2 top that was open when we arrived, remained open for 25 minutes until we were seated at it. The staff is all very friendly, but based on observation it does not appear they have defined rolls on who should bus, seat, stations etc. I would like to continue coming here because the food is great, but the unnecessary wait times are frustrating and take away from the experience.

iElYIPsIX2nvs6Kmniufgw.text: Hit and miss. Some of their food, I really enjoy and other menu items are "too creative" for my taste buds. Their bakery items are delicious though! The cafe offers a cool vibe but they are a little pricey. Overall cool place.

l6hEFHPVKkUizOmqF7eozQ.text: It was worth the 20 minute wait. The food is cooked wonderfully well and service was excellent. We sat outside as the line was long and they have no seats to sit and wait. I ordered the roast beef sandwich and it came out the way I asked, cut in 3 so I can share. The sandwich is shaped like a slider and I was expecting a hoagie. The meat was tender and flavorful. The rest of the parties shrimp and grits and portabello mushroom sliders were tasty as well. Food items are made differently here but everything is cooked well. No complaints. Service was snappy even though we sat outside. I joked that he can bring me a knife if the kitchen forgot to slice my sandwich and he didn't forget. The mimosas were tasty with fresh squeezed pomegranate juice.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu

fZpdjarKp_zLOENjGHVX-g.text: Really good food!  Everything is delicious.  Churro waffles, sweet potato fries, arugula salad, turkey burger and French dip.  Very fresh and tasty.   Wait can be long but worth it.  Parking is easy.

FszMhJCG3WeGwUYDjMnPYQ.text: Straight fire ! Great service, clean hip looking restaurant. Food is awesome and the prices are exactly what they should be . Definitely going back , I'd love to try more things on the menu

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

V_mVzuycu2sP8jUHvnvivA.text: I truly wanted to absolutely love this place. I had heard so many good things + the basic instagram b*tch in me was dying for the aesthetic pictures!   okay let's get started: my boyfriend and I went in on Thursday afternoon at 12. It looked pretty busy but we got seated instantly so I didn't think service would be a problem. Our server brought us some water and took our order at around 12:05 (no problem). We ordered a simple sandwich and an omelet. At the same time we ordered our food a couple next to us had just ordered as well...   next -- did not see our server for about another TWENTY MINUTES. I thought ok their busy I understand. We still kept waiting for our food unable to order anything else from our server as she hadn't even looked at us since she took the order. 12:34 comes along ..... still no food. However the table in front of us who also had an omelet had received their food, and asked for the check all while we were waiting for our food. At this point I was pretty irate. But just as I was about to say something at 12:40 our food arrived. THIRTY FIVE MINUTES AFTER ORDERING.   Tried to stay optimistic and was thinking the food was going to be amazing. 1st problem- Even after I had asked for my omelet to be well done it was not. I thought whatever it took this long I'm not going to say anything. 2nd problem - the omelet was disgusting. I don't know ho you can ever mess up an omelet but I was so disgusted that I took 2 bites out of my $15 omelet (I added avocado) and left it there.  Now I've only seen my server twice during these 45 minutes and both times were within the first 5 minutes -- she comes back for the third time does not say anything about the food and instead gives us a look like "is it ok" but doesn't say anything!!!!!! No apology for the food or if she could get us anything else :-) .... at this point I'm livid.   I don't know what took longer, trying to even get her attention or our food.   Go here if you want to pay for overpriced bland food and wait 30+ minutes for it. Literally a waste.

gnQXPuZ08GzMWfTNai0NvQ.text: Great little breakfast/brunch spot. Very cute decor and always great service.   Firstly their coffee is amazing. They have a single brewing system that pours a smooth frothy looking cup.   We've been here 3 times and haven't been dissatisfied. My husband had the chicken and waffles and I the croissant Sammy. Both very good. We did the bottomless mimosas the next time and both had delicious breakfasts. The 3rd time I was talked into getting the special they had of a roast beef sandwich which he described as a moundful. I have to say I was a little disappointed this time. Wasn't that much meat at all actually and it was just ok. But we will still come back.

DaN_-nsoMFJRyEJ2k5jZXw.text: Visiting my sister for the weekend and we stumbled across this place. Quick wait time and were able to order coffee in the meantime. The food was great the servers were great and I loved the variety of flavors with the bottomless mimosas. Def plan to come back here next time I'm visiting. Lesie was out server and she was so sweet. Thanks for an awesome brunch!!

DgwM_obD0yt9ldknoaA0kg.text: Great place for lunch or brunch!  Food with Personality all the way.  Homemade soup is delicious,   Cuban Sandwich is amazing.  The Korean Shrimp Tacos were exceptional.  My personal favorite is the Short Rib Hash is was wonderful, just be careful everyone wanted to taste it so there wasn't much left. The have a great private dinning room that is perfect for a small shower or birthday luncheon.  Make a reservation they are busy and don't forget to take some bakery items home they are bAked right there

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

rEvnT8ca7XpTQBOoR-OVLQ.text: Came here for breakfast but their lunch menu is so good that I end up having shrimp tacos at 9:30am Totally will come back again and give breakfast a try their menu is healthy and enticing! Service was good and the whole decor is trendy and chic.

Vti4paI1EfXMKq9ISC-uyg.text: With a busy Sunday brunch crowd at 1pm the service was exceptional. Not only were we seated earlier than the 20 min wait the wait staff are on top of it. We tried the  -Avacado on toast - (grilled ciabatta, sunflower seed pesto, micro greens, poached eggs) *this was tasty and light  -roasted  peach salad (burrata cheese, tossed greens, sliced toasted almonds, balsamic reduction and stone fruit vinaigrette) *very fresh and flavorful  - choc chip, butterscotch pancakes with chocolate sauce ( to die for goodness) -short rib hash (he said it was great) -choc chip cookies (better than mom's)  -pull apart cinnamon roll (I'm obsessed and ate it all by myself) Many gluten free items for those needs. I can say it's hard to find amazing and natural places to eat for breakfast but we found it. All the food was so great we are going again next week!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. These are the choc chip butterscotch cakes !

WCBwOogvZS8aMNhx7zyZeQ.text: This place is AMAZING! When you walk in the decor is so cute. You can't help but notice how clean and nice everything is and the way it's all set up is so cute. I came in with my two girlfriends and my kids on a Sunday and waited 30 minutes to be sat, but it was so worth the wait. We all ordered something different and all loved what we got. I couldn't find their kids menu online or here so I'm going to post it on here when I'm done writing this. Anyway the food is DELICIOUS! Sooooo yummy! Taking my hubby in next week to check it out again . Love this new spot down the street from my house. Oh! And and Ashley is amazing! She is so sweet, helpful, friendly and kind. She definitely represents the company well! The hostess Mo was fantastic too! Super friendly and sweet as well. I'm big on customer service when I go out and they got a 10/10 on my list! Hahah! Can't wait to come back and eat here soon!

9DO5i-Gsv6AXkF5qa3Z3JQ.text: The interior is so pretty. Food comes in slightly lighter than standard American serving size, so you're not overly stuffed afterwards, but fulfilled cause they're delicious. I'd recommend the carnitas omelette!

wz8hpumFfnCtfRPC4XyiiA.text: I would recommend this place to anyone in the area...Donuts were incredible...Breakfast amazing...the only problem is you compare every other donut to these and they fade...I don't eat many donuts.  But these were the best ever!

wUdNrWFCknPU4WQuvQkANQ.text: This is hands-down the best local restaurant in this entire Henderson area. Their menu, perfect number of choices which are made to perfection. You can't physically, mentally, or emotionally go wrong with any choices; if you do come in with some hang-ups, they have a great Bottomless Mimosa with quite a kick.  Family friendly. They do have a changing station in the ladies room that I'm aware of.   Staff are incredibly professional and friendly, even around the the less than awesome patrons that find themselves here.   Their coffee is automated, inexpensive and made to order and with precision.   There was a waiting line when we got here, but it's gotta be good if they draw a crowd, they really did not disappoint.

i13DVTHhzKkLHHc_95bwNg.text: I've been going to craftkitchen for quite some time and always love what I get! This past weekend my bf and I tried a couple of their new menu items, the churro waffles and veggie toast. Both were freaking amazing! The veggie toast is a must. Even if you're not vegetarian/vegan but want a 'somewhat' healthy food option, I'd get the veggie toast! It's so delicious. Honestly you can never go wrong with this place. Their chai lattes are delicious as well. Next time I'm going to try the butternut hash! Anyways, this is my go-to brunch spot for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

hPfKnAQY-nm8Zr2_brz-Xg.text: Went here for the second time today and ohhh my goodness.. it did not disappoint. The carnitas omelet is delicious and if you like breakfast with salsa and a kick in it. Definitely get that. They also have this salsa who they say is spicy but it's really do able. Today I decided to get their special, pork belly breakfast tacos! It comes with 3 and surprisingly, there wasn't much fat at all on the pork belly! Definitely put some salsa on that. I love my breakfast with a kick in it so I tend to choose ones that go well with pico de Gallo or salsa. I couldn't leave without getting fries so I got the truffle fries! If you like skinny crunchy fries, you'll love the fries here. Since I can never make up my mind, I also went for the carnitas eggs Benedict. It wasn't my favorite dish I've had from here, BUT let's talk about that poached egg doe!! Perrrrrfectly ooey gooey yolk BURSTING out when you cut into it. When you lightly poke at it, it wiggles.... Now that's perfection. For first timers I definitely recommend the carnitas omelet and fries!

7lT1Y9F7NriECgSNOYa-bQ.text: Cool relaxed breakfast and lunch spot in Henderson. There was a little bit of a wait on a Sunday but was expected and the hostess kept us informed of our table and was accurate with the time she quoted. Greek parfait was a little small for the price but overall tasty. The craft benedict was good. The eggs were cooked perfectly but expected ham to be a little better but overall a great breakfast spot. Servers were busy but always stopped by to check in an bring whatever was needed. Will be back.

pX9g6oIWTYOUXI9AohoJuw.text: LOVE this place!! My boyfriend just had breakfast here! We split a chicken and waffle and short rib hash! EVERYTHING was phenomenal! Food was clean, not greasy at all, presentation was beautiful, service was amazing- from the hostess, to the wait staff! New favorite place!!

vmz-GVVKxDA9b2G9CuA59Q.text: Amazing place and a hidden gem.  Not one bad food item on the menu.   Even their water is amazing, super filtration and ionization.  The tempting desserts are pretty bad ass.  Love the monkey bread!

yk3U-va207LeNRFKHJQhEA.text: Awesome service and lovely atmosphere. Had the Strawberry Shortcake Waffles (seasonal) and the bf had the Short Rib Hash! Both were exceptionally yummy and made with organic ingredients. Best place for breakfast!!!!

pw1uNFqfkELhFn0k_NRjJA.text: Excellent experience from the moment we walked in.  Will have to come back soon as I had bread pudding envy.  Two tables near me had it.  I had the French Dip sandwich.  I don't usually like beef, but this was so juicy, tender and flavorful.  Melted Brie, horseradish creme.  OMG. Best sandwich ever.  Definitely going to be a regular here.

z7QQMAKij_5wE_xc_-L5Fg.text: Very good food, it's a little more than I wanted to spend on breakfast but it was worth it. Fresh food, menu changes often, as its seasonal. Really good pastries.

WG5f8EoVu8vvVrmGSE764Q.text: Everything was salty. We ordered sauteed scallops, braised short ribs hash and omelet with Italian meat. The spinach in the scallop dish was salty and totally threw off the dish. $9 bucks for 2 average size scallops and salty spinach = rip off. Regarding the  omelet - I had mine with egg white smothered in a salty tomato sauce. Eggs were bland and the sauce with some sort of dice ham. The hash was slightly above average for the flavors but ruined by the saltiness. I only gave 2 stars for the aesthetic of the place and the concept of organic, locally grown ingredients.

3KM8wh1xFQ7Mo9F8-8R_LQ.text: OMG! What an AMAZING place. Menu and service are great! Came to CRAFTkitchen during our visit from CA.  It's now a "Def must go to" every time we're in town! Thank you Jeffery for a delish brunch & great experience!

nrYd2TklV6m5JdASE06k5g.text: I have been here a few times and the food is very good, small portions and pricey but is delicious. Bottomless mimosas was why I wanted to come here for Easter brunch. I will say I was extremely disappointed when I was turned away today because they are reservation only on easter. Which is ridiculous because NORMALLY this place does not take reservations for any reason. I was there for Valentine's Day, no reservations taken. I didn't even think to make a reservation since I was told in the past they don't make reservations. So why would you have reservation only on a holiday when normally on any given Sunday you will expect a wait. Will not be back.

BxTvNORttuuIhfJdG7btaQ.text: We came here after our workout since we since a flyer at OTF. Very contemporary inside. Nice looking coffee bar and desert display. It took a little while to have our order taken an have the food come out but, the food was super good! All three of us were very surprised. Everything was healthy delicious and definitely fresh! We we will be coming back

zNJ7FEwiC6mVAc2Nu1V0Kg.text: Nice little spot,  the short rib hash was great.  Good pastries too. A little expensive,  so one for special occasions,  me thinks.

xEZC9QjgiAhTZ_1zPKRh_A.text: It was our first time here and I give the place an A for effort, the idea is great,  but the execution for the price is their downfall. I had an arugula pesto salad with free range chicken and the chicken wasn't moist. If you pay free range prices, then the meat should be cooked right , and if you are going to charge Cheesecake Factory salad prices, you should give the same portion size. My daughter had a kids cheeseburger, it was a bite sized burger and completely over cooked. The portion size is really small. I paid $2.75 for an iced tea, a bit over priced for a tea. The best part and the only part we will be back for are their deserts. They were pretty good and decent priced compared to local competitors.

vQsaUEBG9BALhbQFs2F3dA.text: Just tried it. My wife has food allergies and they were very knowledgeable and helpful. And the food was great!

WVboUwoU4iruyW1CJONZlg.text: Food is good (read on) and service is really s-l-o-w! Had the soup of the day and we never got the cobb salad and sandwich we ordered due to ??  Who knows?! The reason it's not getting 5 stars is because they don't clean the tables promptly after patrons leave (I hate to look at dirty dishes aside of me - outside tables) and the chairs are not very comfortable and it takes forever to get your food. Cute, but not coming back. Good news: Short wait to get a table...only about 10 minutes on a Sunday around 12:30.

wSZnYNV92Zr43wZH16fpGA.text: When was the last time your server remembered you from your last visit??  Great service, awesome food, nice atmosphere. New fave breakfast place!

R_hx1-CG3ZzvDbdBDua8sg.text: There are not enough stars I can give this restaurant. From the service to the food, I was thoroughly impressed! Living in LA with all the amazing places we have, I am a harsh critic when it comes to brunch locations, this restaurant would give them a run for their money! The avocado toast was beyond superb! And the chorizo scramble was the lightest and heartiest skillet I have ever had! The food came out fast and the presentation was everything! If you are in Henderson and want an amazing brunch spot, this place is a MUST!!!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Apple and Strawberry pop tarts made for individuals with soy, nut, dairy, and egg allergy! Ah-mazing!!!!!

BwkzrVSSlj1EdXmR9nn_-A.text: I love this joint. Delicious food and good service. We got some pastries to go to bring to our families house that night and everyone loved them. Cute atmosphere and good quality ingredients.

LzNg9Mt14pxbN8exeoFBBQ.text: Where do I start? The hosting staff didn't turn over tables quickly during Sunday brunch... With a growing line of hungry patrons and several clean, empty tables, they probably need to beef up their hosting staff. The food is okay, but not amazing, and kind of inconsistent. I couldn't help but notice I got less short rib hash than everyone else nearby who ordered it. The short rib was tender but low on seasoning. The bread pudding we ordered was too eggy, so it tasted like a mix of bread pudding and scrambled eggs. Husband agreed on how weird the texture came off. (Also, even though I ordered it by its specific name in the display case--chocolate croissant bread pudding--our server was confused, said they didn't have it, left, returned saying they were out of chocolate croissants, and then finally agreed it was available by repeating the name back again with an "ohhhh".) Our garlic parmesan fries were one-note, and that one note was rosemary. Don't toss that in, unless you're planning on accurately naming them "rosemary fries," in which case, knock yourself out. There were too many artistic decisions that were "form over function" and/or nonsensical: fries spilling (literally) out of small, round bowls; sandwich on a narrow tray with greens next to it, perhaps to occupy all the empty space? But then the greens were spilling over the sides, and they were not dressed! I hope that was an accident. We were confused by the experience, and probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Greens next to the roast beef sandwich (already eaten)... no dressing, though. What do we do with it?!

qYBRou3p0hcuGamh0Y-aKg.text: Went in on a Friday around 11-11:30, lots of empty tables & was sat immediately. Noticed the restaurant immediately filled up pretty quick once noon hit. The ambiance was very hipster and chic (i love cute cafes like that) We ordered the braised short rib hash, turkey avocado benny and mocha lattes. Presentation of the good was great, pretty enough to post a picture on instagram! The ingredients were very fresh. Although the coffee/ latte was on the colder side. Overall taste was good, I've had better benedicts before but I also had much worse. I would definitely recommend this to friends, I would for sure come back and check out something else on the menu.

Fzwat_U_ONS7N7eWgx7yuQ.text: This place was our favorite find in Vegas. They have a nice ambiance and the food was amazing! They use organic and non- gmo when they can. We just loved it here.

NH0SwBdW-iuzUSalDdnK8w.text: Great service super friendly staff! And the food is awesome everything on the menu is great! Even though it was extremely busy the staff was still very calm and courteous. I got the Lox on a pretzel roll and avocado toast, yum!

Fz6En_a86WUoPj5dd_KJvQ.text: I really want to like this place, but, we have been a few times and it was a lackluster experience to say the least. The servers are eaither stretched way too thin or they are really understaffed because service is pretty slow always. The menu is also not too diverse and options seem pretty limited. The menu items are a bit overpriced for their simplicity as well. The roast beef sandwich was really dry on a hard stale pretzel bun, and there was so much horseradish on it that my eyes watered and I almost couldn't stand it. The  turkey sausage was pretty bad also, it tasted like ground turkey with a ton of rosemary and overcooked and dry. The omelettes are dry and portions are tiny. People seem to really love this place however, and I really wish them success, but I just can't bring myself to go back after so many disappointments.

55jegtNioZHRyaBdtEcTvQ.text: I have been wanting to come here for a longest time since  many of my friends like this place. Unfortunately, I was not satisfied with the service nor the food.   The service was soooo slow. There were two tables behind us that were seated after us and were able to order before us. Not to mention they got their food at least 20 minutes before we did. I was not happy about that. Then, we waited about forty minutes to get our food.  They couldn't even give us our appetizer first. I mean forty minutes come on. Fries is the easier thing you can prepare in the kitchen. The waitress was nice enough to bring us one banana chocolate bread (there was four of us) but she didn't even follow up with us on our order till we complained to her about the wait. She barely even had time to come by to refill my water.   I ordered the chicken and waffles. The waffles were decent but the chicken was not crispy but rather soggy. Very disappointed. I tried my friends short rib hash which was pretty flavorful.   In short, a highly disappointing brunch experience. I will give their dinner another try since my friend strongly recommended it.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Fig and burrata salad (5/5)
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked wings (4/5)
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Pork belly bowl (2/5). The rice was not fully cooked. Taste like plastic.

0O_Mcsm2HLGmiaIbNMXO1Q.text: IG has been blowing up with great shots of CRAFTKitchen's new Friday-exclusive "happy hour" menu. The curated list of savory, sharable dishes warranted a group visit because everything sounded so good. Eight of us ordered and shared the majority of the menu, including all four dessert options plus a stop by the pastry case on our way out the door. Go big or go home, right?  HITS: You can't miss the cheese plate. Great price, great selection, the bleu with walnuts was my favorite cheese but they were all thoughtfully selected and played nicely against each other. The smoked wings have a great presentation and are full of flavor. Pretzels and beer cheese are amazing, and the order is so huge you'll have to share it even if you don't want to. I hogged the Manila Clams for myself, with pork and a great white wine broth I wanted to drink like soup! The Grilled Artichoke dish was small but tender and well-executed with a great roasted garlic aioli that it didn't need but was wonderful nonetheless.  IF YOU HAVE ROOM: Almost everything we had was stellar but if you can't order everything, prioritize what's above. Otherwise, order the Bone Marrow, because duh, it's bone marrow. Fun presentation. CK Meatballs were moist with a robust sauce and ample ricotta. The Chopped Crunchy Salad has an amazing green goddess dressing that made it stand out from the Beet Salad and Heirloom Tomato Salad of the "healthy" / vegetarian options. The tempura shrimp was nice and light, bed of shredded lettuce underneath makes this passable as a salad for solo-diners. The Fried Polenta Sticks had great texture but I thought I'd like them more than I actually did. Perhaps by that point I was already overwhelmed by everything else I'd tried.  DESSERTS: Yes, this warrants a separate category. There's an affogato and a nice creme brulee available, but you really want to go for the Mason Jar Magic Bar and/or the Sticky Toffee Cake (in that order). The jar is layered with tons of textures and flavors, as if you're straight-up raiding the chocolate aisle or your mom's baking cabinet. It works! The cake in the STC was nice but I was missing the robust sticky toffee elements that originally made me gravitate toward this option.  Chef Jaret and the staff at CK are doing some great things here in Henderson! Looking forward to more visits to try the couple of things I missed (hello, CK burger!) and maybe try one of their pairing meals for a date night.

3Sgl3FNAXhj3KrhRn__TGw.text: Loved this place.  It is a smaller menu, but everything is very well made.  I had the Cuban sandwich which sounds so simple, but it was delicious! The bakery items are also wonderful

1D2mm4SFvo2T2AEqw3LdfA.text: I enjoyed brunch here! They offer bottomless Mimosas which is always a plus in any brunch situation! $16 for bottomless, $9 for a single mimosa.. average price I suppose. I ordered CrabCake Benedict which was really good, with a nice twist on a traditional hollandaise sauce, however I asked for my eggs to be poached medium so I wouldn't have yolk all over the plate. When I broke into the egg you could still see the "gel" of the raw egg white, and egg yolk was everywhere (I prefer a "slow leak" not extremely runny yolks but to each his own). The egg wasn't enough to ruin the entire dish. My BFF ordered chicken and waffles and the server was kind enough to swap the regular waffle for the churro waffles, which was awesome! The chicken was juicy and flavorful and the churro waffles were sweet and decadent. We arrived around an hour before closing during the week so it wasn't busy and the service was good. Our food came out quickly. I would definitely give this place another shot and try some of their coffee, pastries, and other items on the menu.

uurs-KZI9TstyIhgX1i_og.text: Chilaquiles OFF THE CHAIN. Avocado tacos OFF THE CHAIN.  Was a bit of a wait initially without reservations so I now know to always plan ahead here. Staff was great,  place was clean and the energy was good.  I'll be bringing all my out of town guests here for brunch. Looking forward to trying the rest of the menu.

KqjSuc9ytnM71P2UPT9FDw.text: CRAFTkitchen is a solid breakfast and lunch Henderson spot, and they've recently debuted a new "happy hour" on Fridays from 4-9pm, featuring an array of new recipes and a nice selection of beers and wines.  I first stopped by solo, and I opted for the CK House Burger ($14) because it's the most loner-specific item on the new menu. A bit of a faux pas: burger #1 arrived well-done instead of my requested medium-rare. Burger #2 - reportedly prepared by Chef Jaret himself this time - was a little on the rare side, but I'm more than happy with that "fault." Patty #2 had so much more life, and the overall profile was satisfyingly meaty and umami such that it didn't have to rely on the sweetness that I thought would've been provided by the tomato-onion jam.  I also tried the Garlic Parmesan Fries ($3.50 per receipt) per my server's recommendation. The fries are average shoestring, but the garlic parmesan flavor was delicious. The truffle and sweet potato fries did sound tempting, and I'll probably revisit them in the future.  ----  I returned a few weeks later to join a group of Yelpers. As I'd anticipated, we ended up sharing a slew of dishes.  CK Cheese Plate ($14): a must-try array of cheeses, fruits / fruit products, and honey which were altogether rich and varied in flavors and textures.  CK Meatballs ($13): strangely alluring, non-dry ground meat with more of a subtle flavor, strongly bolstered by an excellent sauce and ricotta combination.  Chopped Crunchy Salad ($9): texture and flavor contrasts are here aplenty, but I'm not that impressed by an array of raw veggie slices with some dressing and cheese.  Grilled Fresh Artichokes ($13): easily the star of the veggie dishes, with tender artichokes, delicious truffled cheese, a nice balsamic, and an addictive roasted garlic aioli.  Bone Marrow ($13): I'm not that experienced with more upscale treatments of the soft, fatty treat of I've had most often from the remnants of preparation of soup stock, but it seemed tasty enough if not very filling.  Tempura Popcorn Shrimp ($13.50): I don't see how this really conferred too many benefits over simple shrimp tempura or larger-sized shrimp.  House Smoked Wings ($12): my favorite of the night, with a crisp and sweet glazed skin and a noticeable smoky flavor (not just the scent). I was tempted to order this for myself alone, and now I'm certain that I will.  Tricolor Spring Beets Salad ($12): another good veggie dish, with goat cheese and beets forming a nuanced, balanced bite.  Polenta Fries ($10): mostly enjoyable for the texture and the sauce, marginal value making this something I'd ideally order for sharing in larger groups.  Pretzels & Beer Cheese ($12): a surprising treat, with a rich prominently beer-y cheese sauce that covered for any dryness in the moderately dense pretzel bread.  Heirloom Tomato Salad ($12): the grapefruit and vanilla gastrique and the shaved ricotta made this just good enough that I was able to banish the thought of "why would anyone pay so much for a few slices of tomato?"  Manila Clams ($16): the mix of ground pork and tender clams in that intriguing shallot white wine broth made this a very good dish, although I might have gotten just a touch of grit in one of the clams.  Sticky Toffee Cake w/ Vanilla Bean Gelato ($8): the oddly-reminiscent-of-corn-bread cake  was fluffy but didn't quite have the depth of sticky toffee-ness of the rich sticky toffee puddings that I've enjoyed. Excellent texture and flavor in the gelato though.  Creme Brulee w/ "assorted" housemade cookies ($7): not sure how getting two identical shortbread cookies constitutes an assortment. The most memorable part of this dish was the fruit.  Mason Jar Magic Bar ($7): wanted to love this, and the variety of textures and toppings was great, but the chocolate chantilly reminded me slightly too much of plain chocolate puddings rather than the rich decadence that I've had in many other chocolate desserts.  I've yet to partake in their wines or beers (select wines advertised as 50% off and selected bottled beers available for $3, both during happy hour only). Instead, I've relied on caffeine. Coffee ($3 sit-down cost) and Iced Latte ($3.50 sit-down) are solid options, brewed from the reliable Colorado River Coffee Roasters. Both gave me a good kick at the end of a workday. I somehow received the iced latte rather than an iced otherwise-black coffee, but it was enjoyably creamy nonetheless  By the way, another happy hour deal is 50% off baked goods (excluding the cold case), and although I wouldn't reorder several of my recent purchases at full price, the discount makes them excellent.  These meals and prior experiences at CRAFTkitchen have also resulted in a mix of excellent and merely good menu items, so 4* is right. Chef Jaret and his team deserve applause and customers for their sourcing and creativity, but a significant number of their creations don't quite hit the high marks that their pricing demands.

I almost gave it a 4 but not for food, the service is a little slow so don't go if you're in a rush but other than that it's amazing.

fO9uW_21zgWZIRK3kVVUpg.text: Weekends are busy. Recommend checking in online for wait list. Only waited about 10 minutes for a table since I checked in online. Was up to an hour wait when we arrived for walk-ins. Food was amazing and great selection of options for a variety of dietary preferences/restrictions. Coffee was yummy and bottomless mimosas and options of flavors was nice. Will be returning for brunch in near future!

InlSAULPo3V2v4B6LWtLAA.text: Amazing food. I loved everything. Avocado toast. Acai bowl. Truffle fries, Mimosas. I loved it all!

I ordered a vegetarian omelette, it was a perfect combination of veggies and delicious eggs. My boyfriend ordered the Chorizo Scramble Skillets he loved it. 6z7YEo_5LqdBMkg6z1xjjQ.text: Amazing birthday brunch yesterday!! The bottomless mimosas at $16 per person sounds bad at first, you are thinking on top of entrees & sides being high priced,  this is going to be some bill. However,  all of it is DAMN WORTH IT!   Unfortunately,  I did not get any pictures this trip. The food was too amazing to think of anything else. Not to mention the coffee is perfection (make sure to get some to go).   I had the pomegranate mimosa, quite a bit, delicious.   Jason & I shared each others meals. Carnitas Benedict & Salmon Benedict (add avocado), with a side of bacon & smashed potatoes.  Holy moley! It was amazing, if I didn't live polar opposite,  I'd go back today.   My brother enjoyed the chilaquiles which looked amazing & as he puts it, "this may top one of my favorite places!" (We are picky about Mexican food and prefer authentic hole in the walls)  The monkey bread was ok, but not my cup of tea. Those truffle fries are amazing with the lime citrus style ranch. (Stole some from the bro)   Yes, there may be a wait but get added to the waiting list via Yelp and it will be fine & worth it, anything good is.

tI0bXMdHeo5JzxU-KYkXlA.text: Where should I start....  Being a good critic, I have traveled in numerous places and have searched for the best food in each city. Coming from Chicago, I try not to have high expectations but being in Vegas, I set the bar high since this city is another food mecca filled with talented cooks. For this restaurant, I definitely set the bar high with the long ass wait time and being one of the few healthy restaurants in the area. However, after today, I was definitely deeply disappointed like a kid who received coal on Christmas.  I'll try to keep it short and sweet since I only have 5 seconds of your attention.   1. Long wait times. How??? I'm guessing this place must be really short staff both waiters and cooks since there's plenty of open tables outside and food takes forever to come out.  We have tried coming here several times to just get slapped with a wait time, in which we didn't even bother. It gets worse after 10am. In addition, you get fooled with how the food really is, thinking it must be that good since people wait for such a long time in this super stretch line. Buzzkill for you- it's not worth the money or wait.   2. Great healthy options, why they can keep a star. One of the few places offering healthy breakfast options. We tried one of the expensive items on their menu- smoked salmon on pretzel bun. WHAT ARE THESE PEOPLE RAVING ABOUT?!!!!! I've tried every smoked salmon in most cities and several brunch places. THIS IS NOT WORTH ANY PENNY. First of all, you pay about $14 for a cold pretzel bun, not even lightly toasted and it's smothered in cream cheese. I can get the same thing in California or Chicago for a cheaper price on a toasted bread plus a poach egg. BOOM! Hopefully this blows peoples mind. Now ask yourself, is it worth the wait and money? Not for the smoked salmon on pretzel bun. I don't like to judge on first impression but obviously, if that wasn't up to par for the price, the the quality of the rest of the items are not either. Sorry, truth hurts.  Other things that you can read more about or move on to the next review, but it's just me and my opinions. I dare you to try it and not agree with me.   3.The ambiance is nice with a flake hipster vibe or just trying too hard. When I say this, I mean: plants are fake, they went cheap in which they can't even afford real glasses for drinks(plastic cups you drink from at a buffet) and they just totally gave up on the decor outside(missing plants in plant bins). Talk about carelessness for quality and service.   4.Staff was super nice but looked overworked. They couldn't even stop by and asked if we needed anything else or how we liked our meal. We didn't even bother staying too long. We ordered right when we sat down. We wanted to save time waiting for service, food, and the check since everyone around us waited a long time for any kind of service.   My advice: check out the other breakfast places around you or just cook yourself a good breakfast. It'll probably easier to just order for pickup from this place like the rest of the customers do.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. My cold pretzel bun with excess Cream Cheese and no egg. $14 with tax

1FUTh4pyET_3_tbinIth_g.text: I've ate here a few times because it's close to work. Today I had the pulled turkey benny, it comes with a citrus sauce which was okay. I think without the citrus flavor it would have been so much better. The staff are all pretty nice & friendly. Their coffee is good! I think they're kind of pricey here because their food isn't anything to die for. I don't ever crave anything from here and it's never a place I choose to eat at. I just end up coming here because my boss chooses it since it's convenient because of the location.

6QNQiKAQW1KcJlvRQJv09g.text: This place is a modern breakfast and brunch place that offers a great variety of foods. The menu is really nice the food is light weight and fulfilling. The staff is always welcoming and nice. The place is clean and inviting. I highly recommend it if you're looking for a great breakfast or lunch place this is the place to be.

dTChIGaYXbgIvqQbWVJM9Q.text: Ok finally went to this place after seeing posts and pictures of all these ube desserts and ube pancakes. Well....... NO ube desserts OR ube pancakes in site anywhere. ALL of us were NOT impressed at all with the food we ate Plus prices are a little overpriced for the portions AND service sucked. Our waitress finally came to take our order and when I asked her about the ube pancakes and she said they don't have it today she walked away and went to other tables to pick up their dirty dishes and talk to them and didn't come back for a while. Then when she FINALLY came back to take our order she wasn't very friendly. Then after our food came we ordered the creme brulee French toast and red velvet pancakes she didn't bring us maple syrup but she walked away so fast and didn't ask if we needed anything else.  So it took me a while to flag her down to get the syrup and also sugar for our cup of coffee which my brother needed from the beginning. She didn't check up on us till we were done eating. So service was bad and food wasn't up to par either. I can cook better tasting pancakes.

dV9LcBzMr_Oa7j3puj4t9Q.text: Oh wow. This is, by far, my family's favorite brunch spot in Las Vegas now. With an extensive vegan menu as well as quality food and presentation, CRAFTkitchen impressed us throughout our whole experience.  We came here on a Tuesday around 2 pm - just an hour before they close. Thankfully, they accommodated us, no problem, and gave us great service to boot.  We split the vegan avocado smash toast, the truffle fries, and I had the vegan soyrizo breakfast burrito. My husband had a gorgeous foam-art latte + biscotti and loco moco dish to himself. We LOVED our food. I cannot emphasize that enough. It was presented beautifully and tasted amazing.  I think the only constructive feedback I can give is that my burrito probably would have been even better if the potato was cut smaller inside, and/or if it had tofu scramble. No matter what though, it was a great meal and staff treated us exquisitely. We love the large vegan vs. regular menus available.   We're going to be having brunch here again soon - I'm looking forward to trying the vegan chilaquiles.

QrGUtzsyQXahVTcjeUlOCg.text: This place is WONDERFUL! Ashley the hostess went above and beyond to make our morning delightful! All the staff was great, but she really stood out.   I came here with my Aunt for breakfast. We sat at this cozy table in a cute corner of this French-inspired breakfast paradise!  The front counter has a ton of fresh baked daily pastries! We shared an orange cranberry scone and it was delicious!  I ordered the veggie omelet and added chicken sausage. My aunt ordered the avocado toast- also wonderful; but if I had to pick one again, I would absolutely get the omelet! It truly was one of the best I've ever had.   Overall the service was great, the food was excellent, and I wish this was closer to my house so I could be a frequent guest!

Gzx4oieL3pcaFt_YX_UN9w.text: I loooooove CRAFTkitchen.  Just from looking at the photos alone makes me so hungry lol.  The food online is EXACTLY what it looks like in person.  Fresh, hot and delicious.  I ordered the Creme Brulee French Toast for a whopping $12.95.  This is fairly pricey for it to not come with any side dish.  Luckily, it was filling after finishing half of it.  Was there actually Creme Brulee on the top you ask?? YES.  Was the filling flavorful??  YES without being overbearing.  It was PERFECT.  Even the syrup tasted great.  Unfortunately, ordering a side of breakfast meat for $4 was ridiculous in my opinion so I didn't get around to trying those.  From what I can tell, everything is made to order with quality ingreds. so I'm sure either of the meats would've been just as enjoyable.  My chai latte ($3.75) was yummy, too but it's almost impossible to mess that up.  And you can add vanilla syrup for free!  I say they should improve pricing or AT LEAST offer one side to go along with your entree.  Otherwise, awesome place.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Creme Brulee French Toast and 12 oz. chai latte

vXMnWsXpTLgilclZd8ZcJA.text: New Years Eve Brunch was so phenomenal! This is my third dining experience here and I just can't say enough good things about this restaurant except I wish there was one closer to me! Located at the top of Eastern Avenue in Green Valley but so easy to find.   Since they were featuring so many of the brunch favorites, we decided to come on in. We were warmly greeted and although we had to wait for a table, so worth it! I had only eaten outside before and we sat inside this time. Interior seating is basic and clean. I loved the mini succulent plants on each table and the old fashioned metal chairs. This place is all about the food!!   We all reviewed the menu and decided we would all get something different and share. We had a fantastic server who was so kind and she delivered on point. We ordered the pork carnitas omelette with lime crema and cheese, the CK Benedict, the CK croissant with apple bacon, egg and cheese and we topped it off with an order of the Churro Waffles! Mom and I both enjoyed mimosa's, mine was Blood Orange and hers was orange. Each dish was delicious in its own way but the True winners were the pork carnitas omelette and the churro waffles! The lime crema balanced the spicy and  the sweet of the carnitas the t and the churro waffles were simply out of this world.   This place is always bustling and busy but they are never to busy to help you or get you what you need! I have now had brunch here twice, the first time enjoying monkey bread and the avocado toast and now this time. I have also enjoyed lunch here as well.   CRAFTKitchen is a winner in all aspects. I will be back again! You will be so glad you stopped in to eat here, bravo to the chef! Living in a large metropolis that offers so many choices of places to eat, CRAFTKitchen is one place you don't want to skip!

BeWRIZ9lBrS7Nmb__qQCbA.text: I would love to give this place more than 5 stars!  For starters my BF and I shared a Carmel apple pastry called a Kouign Amann. So delicious and a really good size for $4.50. The breading is like a wonderfully dense egg-ie croissant.  My BF and I fought over the last bite - he let me win.   My BF got the croissant sandwich. The bacon was wonderful - cooked perfectly and was thick enough to be chewy (in a good way). The croissant was also nice and fluffy. The side salad was a nice touch.   I got the pork carnitas omelette. The tomatillo sauce is fabulous. The pork is wonderfully prepared - moist but not soggy. I would love to have this dish swimming in the sauce but it would probably get too spicy for me (it does have a kick to it).  Most of the omelette I had to eat the next day as between the pastry to start and the small Yule log we got for the dessert, I was full.

9RbBqeMDcqKVsKaEbJwh5A.text: I have been coming to CRAFTkitchen since they opened several years ago. This local favorite is a solid breakfast, brunch or lunch choice in Henderson.   The atmosphere of CraftKitchen has a clean and modern vibe with both indoor and outdoor seating. They also offer a private room that you can reserve if you have a large party seating. Also, there are delicious fresh baked pastries and goods in the glass case up front which are nice to take home if you get too full.  There are several favorite dishes that I recommend like starting off with the Monkey Bread to share with your table. It is so fun to share and a nice way to break bread with others. The menu is Modern American which includes tacos, egg dishes, omelets and sandwiches. All are a twist on classics that give it that Modern American flair.  The service at CraftKitchen is friendly and professional. I have never had a bad experience within these past years. Only delicious food and great service within a fun modern atmosphere.

URTR4y91MPxGuzR59k0F-w.text: Last Saturday I had the privilege to meet some Yelp Elite Babes (Lauren C., Stefany, Marissa, Bethany, Trixie and Nina) for a yummy brunch here at CRAFT! *Big thanks to-the-mom-to-be, Lauren C. for setting up this meet up! *wink  I was actually surprised when I was walking up( this place has a decent sized outdoor patio area where they do allow dogs, yay! Once I walked in, again I was surprised at the size and the cute decor- definitely my style with the rustic, modern decor! We had the private room in the back which is separated by a clear glass, which made our brunch more intimate. This private room could fit about 10-12 comfortably so if your in need for a spot of that size, consider CK for the private space!   Okay, so let's discuss food. You can tell that they put a lot of thought in the food presentation here because everything that came out from the kitchen was pretty! I ordered the short rib hash and this is a meal within itself. The meat was very tender, so soft it practically melted like butter! The smothered sauce on top was very flavorful. Peep my pic to get a tease. Order this if you visit!   Besides the optimal options for brunch and lunch menu items- this place is also known for their pastries. If you're looking for a cute brunch spot, consider CRAFT!

MNjckPVNQqmgL9lv1oKY3g.text: I cannot sing the praises of this restaurant enough.  You just have to go there to really understand how seriously awesome this place is.  It looks like just another average sized, contemporary American restaurant but OMG, it could do no wrong.  My single issue: The hostess wasn't that friendly.  She was young and just sort of "Meh" about putting our name down and answering the few questions we had. At first I was a little bothered by her uncaring, curt attitude but then I thought, I waited two days to try this place and now I'm going to have to wait another 30 minutes in line, so I'm not going to let this spoil what is hopefully a happy meal experience with my family.  So I let it go.  We were seated sooner than expected.  Devin was our server and I think he enjoyed our back-and-forth banter as much as we enjoyed him.  He was on top of it all.  My Vanilla Latte was exactly the way I wanted it.  My husband's mimosa was the right amount of everything.  He said the alcohol level and taste were spot-on and that if we didn't have to leave, he would've just kept on drinking (LOL).  We got: -Cuban Sandwich -Chimichurri Steak Sandwich -Butternut Squash Hash -CRAFT Benedict -Salmon Benny -Black & White Cookie -Creme Brulee -Mango Panna Cotta -huge Macaron (they pulled a misnomer on that one and labeled it a "macaroon"- tsk tsk!)  Honestly, I could NOT believe how amazingly perfect the entire meal was from service to food.  Everything tasted way better than we expected and the prices, especially on the fantastic desserts, were more than fair. Not one item tasted just "okay." Everything was fabulous. My CRAFT Benedict had thick slices of ham that were so generously cut and the saltiness was at a minimum. The flavors were just beautiful, the absolute *BEST* Eggs Benedict I have ever had.  I cannot stop bragging about this place.  My husband is not a foodie at all but he said this place was great.  My two older kids with discerning tastebuds that they get from their mother were beyond impressed.  My daughter kept ooh-ing and aah-ing about her Salmon Benny while my son had everyone try a piece of his Chimichurri Steak Sandwich because of how absolutely flawless it was cooked and seasoned.  Neither my husband nor I are huge red meat fans but that steak was everything!  Every steak needs to taste like the it was cooked by the chef(s) of CRAFTkitchen.  I'm not big on macarons but this one was pleasantly delicious.  I was delighted to find a most sweet strawberry filling in the center, which was totally unexpected.  The kids gushed with happiness when they saw it.  The other thing that caught me off guard was the B&W Cookie.  First of all, that thing was gigantic.  I never liked B&W cookies because I always found them to be dry and crunchy, which I hate.  So I didn't bother trying it until hours later when we were stuck on awful traffic coming back home from Vegas.  I took a bite and it was so soft and moist that I was actually taken aback.  So I checked it out and it turned out to be more of a cake than a cookie and thought, OMG, they are brilliant!  Again it ran through my mind that this place could do nothing wrong.  It's been a long time since any eatery has wowed me to this level.  Very few places in general have ever left such an impression like this on me.  Thank you so much, CRAFTkitchen, for just knocking it way out of the park and exceeding any standards we had.  Each one of us walked away feeling so satisfied with the entire experience.  I cannot wait to visit you again all the way from Los Angeles!

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. The Black &amp; White Cookie was bigger than my latte.

MpN_57M23Z6wDLh5NSrdsw.text: It has been said that the "best" Restaurants are those guests want to visit repeatedly, and from the moment one sets foot inside CRAFTkitchen a desire to be anywhere else diminishes, everything from smiling servers to a smell of Yeast in the air appealing, as too is the modern yet pleasant decor.  Now a staple of the '702' since 2015, Jaret and Tami Blinn's investment of money, time and talent a winning combination thanks to passion plus a commitment to quality, it was arriving before the 11:00am rush that three guests were seated near paintings made by Blinns' daughter, just another element making the place feel anything but corporate.  Surrounded by couples and families of all-ages, many opting for alfresco seating while dining on items old or new, it was with individually made cups of Coffee in hand that six Pastries arrived first, a Blueberry Lemon Poppyseed Scone made without Animal products found to be a bit dry but soon forgotten in favor of classics like the Cinnamon Roll, Poptart with housemade Jam or an all-new Viennesoire layered with ground Pistachios and boozy Cherries.  Not forgetting Kouign Amann and its layers of Pastry plus Butter, the savory version with Ham and Cheese good but Strawberries plus Rhubarb with a bit of bite even better, it was while indulging in Sin City's best Monkey Bread that two sweet plates arrived, weekend-special Pancakes soaked by Blueberries standing tall while Texas Toast with a crystallized Sugar top is not only delicious, but texturally splendid.    Bridging sweet to savory with individually portioned Chia Pudding, the consistency just right thanks to Coconut Milk, Fruit and Nuts, suffice it to say that for fans of smoked Fish the #everchangingbrunch Benedict was a winner from top to bottom while those seeking a bit of heat may instead want to check out Chilaquiles that hold up well thanks to thick Tortillas, or a Short Rib Grilled Cheese that has migrated from weekends-only to main menu thanks to housemade Bread plus slow-cooked Beef blanked by Cheese, Peppers and Onions.   Switching back to sweet, two new Cookies continuing just as predecessors have in terms of quality, it was after devouring a Brownie featuring both soft Fudge and firm Chips amidst swirls of Nutella that the "grand finale" arrived, Chef Blinn taking time out of his otherwise busy schedule to surprise a fan with his Carrot Cake, in this case presented "Naked" style but still moist and delicious thanks to bold spice notes and particularly tangy Icing.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. CRAFTkitchen 04/20/19:  “Creme Brûlée” Stuffed French Toast – Vanilla Bean Custard Filling, Caramelized Toast, Whipped Cream, Maple Syrup
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. CRAFTkitchen 04/20/19:  “Creme Brûlée” Stuffed French Toast – Vanilla Bean Custard Filling, Caramelized Toast, Whipped Cream, Maple Syrup

F1jECiF6xjkndWRTfUqGzQ.text: A Solid, satisfying, gourmet burrito - the CK Breakfast Burrito consists of a chile relleno stuffed breakfast burrito with 3 cage free eggs, chorizo, pepper jack cheese, spiced smashed potatoes, tomatillo-avocado sauce. The burrito itself is not humongous, but so dense that you will not leave hungry. I would prefer a spicer mix in the burrito and a spicer, larger side of sauce - instead of the tastefully looking thimble container of sauce accompanying the meal.  The Short Rib Hash is not to be missed, it is demi braised short ribs, smashed potatoes, roasted sweet onions and peppers. The meat is sumptuous, fall off the bone tender, and the potatoes are expertly seasoned. The glutton in me would prefer a lager portion of meat, but again the meal is so rich-you won't leave hungry.  Service is top notch, friendly, and accommodating. The atmosphere is casual and stylish.

h4RLAhomxSOhNEjADaNcmw.text: Craftkitchen has been in the neighborhood for a few years and I can say that it's one of my favorite go to spots.   The restaurant reminds me of a place you'd find in San Diego. It's bright with simple modern decorating. They offer indoor and outdoor seating. In the back there is a private room that can hold up to 20 people with an 8 person minimum.    I've enjoyed everything I've tried from their breakfast and lunch menu. The brunch specials are always unique and well executed. The pastry case has never disappointed either, the staples or the weekend specials. One of their signature items and for good reason is the monkey bread which is great for sharing. Recently, I tried the Creme Brulee Stuffed French Toast that was also amazing.   On my most recent visit I reserved the private room for a small group. The staff that I emailed and talked to in the reservation process were friendly and helpful. Troi was our server for brunch and he was great. Thank you for taking care of our group, Troi! We were definitely not his own table, but you would have thought so by how attentive he was with our table.   Craftkitchen would get a bonus star if they ever bring back Happy Hour. My friend and I came here when it was offered and loved it. I'd love to return with a group for Happy Hour if it is every offered again!

INSPqqtjrHBsMI_rw4jLig.text: Great space and vibe, and the food is delicious. They offer a robust vegan menu! I tried the french toast with a side of bacon and it was super tasty. The coffee is great, too!

YJCCrrIxV4xaMukWGjLJSA.text: Absolutely delightful and diverse menu! Excellent coffee and dessert! I only wish I lived here and that I could enjoy eating here more often!

86wi3doMfpgjmIHXCMKQ5Q.text: Great local place that has amazing food and service. There is a standard menu and seasonal offerings. All the food is so delicious that I have something different every time, except for the strawberry pop tart. I love the chicken and waffles, breakfast burrito and sandwiches. The coffee is also spectacular. It's great to support local businesses and have a wonderful meal/experience.

g3YhcjgVNfOw3vk_nf1sig.text: This is probably going to be the most difficult review to write because our experience here was so "off." Some of the food was excellent, some of it was horrible, the manger's customer service was excellent, the server's was horrible.   First, we went on a Sunday for brunch, and they were moderately busy. We had to wait a short 5 minutes to be seated. The decor of this restaurant is very modern/clean appearing, and we sat at a cool little wooden table near the window which was great for people watching.  We were first greeted by someone who said they weren't our waiter but that they wanted to get us drinks started, we both ordered lattes. Ten minutes went by and our server comes up and asks if we had our drink order taken yet and then asked if we were ready to order food. We said yes we ordered lattes, ordered food, and then another 20 minutes went by. Our server came up to our table to check in on us and said "let me check on those drinks." He came back a minute later with two lattes that were room temperature (clearly had been sitting on the counter for a while).  -Strike 1 (cold coffee) -Strike 2 (very long wait for coffee)  Our entrees came about 15 minutes later and apologized for the wait and said the chef would like to offer us a free dessert for the wait time. We didn't think the food wait was that big of a deal but given the rest of our experience we said thank you and took him up on the offer. The gesture was kind and we appreciated it.   About a third of the way into my breakfast (which consisted of the most under seasoned eggs and potatoes I think I have ever consumed in my life), I found a long dark colored hair in my food (which didn't belong to either of us as our hair is short). I grabbed the manager who was walking by, she was very polite, apologized profusely, and offered to have something else made for me. I declined and helped my husband finish his very delicious red velvet pancakes with cream cheese frosting (I'd recommend them without hesitation) -Strike 3 (hair in food) -Strike 4 (very bland)  We finished our food and our table was cleared and the manger again asked if we would like anything else on the house to make up for our experience. We declined, simply taking the dessert previously offered to us. From the point that we finished dessert, until the point we were able to leave then took another 35 minutes. The server insisted on running to every table around us and didn't bring our check. I finally had to get up and ask the hostess if we could get our check and it was brought ten minutes later.  -Strike 5 (ridiculously long wait just to get our check)  All in all a very weird experience. The server was definitely not busy enough (he had a total of three tables with a total of 7 guests including the two of us) to have left us hanging at the end like he did. He honestly just seemed like a total space cadet. Despite the multiple errors, I will try to be back because I want to believe this place is capable of better (and maybe the server was just having an off day), much better, but we did not leave very satisfied overall.  Yelp 100 Review Challenge 2016: #10

wS4PmvSmlSKlZbI7_2n0UA.text: Good food and reminds me a little of Skinny Fats but not so much the fat option. The service was great and the decor is fresh. This place seems to be popular for lunch and the food was good and priced according. I had the crispy avocado tacos which were pretty good over all. My only request would be more sauce.

tzO0nofyB7dJe2zIvtuq9g.text: We stopped by CRAFTkitchen by [semi]-accident. I actually had my Yelp directions set for Kitchen Table but my cousin who is a local in Las Vegas directed us to CRAFTkitchen. The restaurant looked super cute and trendy so we decided to give it a try. We were first-timers here and definitely weren't disappointed.   UPON ARRIVAL & ATMOSPHERE: CRAFTkitchen is located within a shopping center. Tons of parking. We arrived around 2:30pm. We were hesitant because we didn't want to be "those" people who arrive right before closing, but there were quite a bit of people still seated so we didn't feel too bad. The restaurant was very trendy, modern, and "hipster." Nicely furnished, simple decor, and fresh herbs in their [meeting] room.  FOOD: I ordered the SMOKED SALMON on a pretzel bun. SO GOOD! Did your mouth water from the pictures you scrolled through? Well good news, it looks just like the pictures on Yelp and it was love at first bite. However, by the last bites it started tasting really salty. I still demolished it though. My cousin ordered the CHICKEN & WHAT? I didn't get to try it--let's just say his meal was gone within 5 minutes. He's either super greedy and finished it before I can ask to try it..or it was just that good. His argument is that it was just that good! I believe him. He originally ordered the Loaded Roast Beef but they didn't have enough pretzel buns for both of us (a small let down.) He asked to substitute the bun with focaccia bread but they were also out!  SERVICE: Although we came within the last hour of operation, we did not feel rushed at all. Our server was phenomenal. She was very apologetic about what they were sold out on and she was quick to refill our drinks. Huge plus!   Would I recommend this place? Absolutely.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon on a pretzel bun

8JHIFY79ldcxc_DMQ1qp5Q.text: Really great place for breakfast. There were three of us and we ordered just about everything on the menu. Very fresh and "clean" food. The turkey Benedict was excellent, as was the avocado toast. Good coffee. Great assortment of pastries, and pleasant atmosphere and service. Don't be in a rush when you go there.

pW0nuAZK8tMbk_nYwSfQiA.text: After being expected to be blown away by this place, it was just mediocre. I was super excited to try the salmon because everyone has it on their yelp, but the salmon was just too salty for me. Don't get me wrong, there was a LOT of salmon on that pretzel bun, but still too salty, I didn't finish it. The smashed potatoes were pretty cool, but I wouldn't try them again. Our service was really slow and it took forever for a server to even take our order. She just kept walking back and forth around us, but never asked if we were ready. Maybe next time in the area I'll try it out, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

ESl5EG6k3s59nVQJw1w3nQ.text: Finally brought my husband with me to try their short ribs hash. Only thing disappointing is our waitress was not very friendly. As we were ordering I couldn't make up my mind between waffles or pancakes and you can tell she wanted me to hurry up and make a decision quickly. Other than that good thing the food is good for me to drive more than 20 miles.   Friendly reminder please smile and I understand if you're having a bad day! Just make us feel welcomed!!

pqDypjccLj6JmM4R2Yuqvw.text: I've only been to craft kitchen twice but each time, the food has been outstanding. The first time I went was with a well known Vegas Foodie so we ended up ordering pretty much the whole menu. I love their homemade pop tarts and healthy options along with their not so healthy options. Also, extremely glad they decided to add a happy hour on Fridays too!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Craft coffee some of the best around!

MgiQVkzfkeNx3YiXDiey3g.text: I feel like a salmon going against the current with my 3 stars review of CRAFTkitchen. I've made 2 visits here around lunch time in the past 30 days. The food is a funky mix of items that you may not find at other more traditional breakfast places. The food was hot, fresh, colorful, flavorful, and filling. Why the middle of the road rating?? The service and the seating are not something I want to experience on a regular basis. Wait staff seemed overwhelmed and rushed. It was like they were trying to be patient and engage with the customers but they just didn't have the time.  The seating is very tightly packed together and when you get that place full it was so hard to hear that I had to raise my voice to be heard by my friend across the table. Then the front entrance was blocked by the people waiting to be seated- not sure how code enforcement would feel about that. It just gave me like an anxious/rushed feeling while I was eating. There are tables outside if you want to brave the elements but I would be afraid that service is even slower if you eat outside.  Sad to say the cramped style of eating is not my cup of tea so I will let all the 4 and 5 star reviewers eat there while I dine elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Avocado toast minus the egg
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Tomato soup

87IvCwuhf4UMzuYULhfIIg.text: The last thing this neighborhood needed was another greasy spoon breakfast place! *eye roll* No offense to those businesses, since there's a time, a place and obviously a market for that but my preference is now gravitating towards high quality, organic foods. I am a follower of the paleo diet, so CRAFTkitchen is one of the few options I have to find my type of food. To quote Jim Rohn, "Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live." I'm a firm believer in that.  Thank you Jaret Blinn for answering my prayers and putting this gem and welcome addition to the neighborhood near me. I now have a favorite brunch place that I can take all my friends to. I'm not just saying that because of the bottomless mimosas on weekends, although they certainly don't hurt matters either. *wink wink*   I love that they have gluten free options on their menu. I have a lot of gluten intolerant friends actually, so I take that into account when selecting restaurants. All of their ingredients are farm fresh and the presentation is just like you would expect from the fanciest of restaurants.   It's always super packed as of late and I worry it's just going to get worse as more and more people discover it because of all these great reviews they have. The modern contemporary meets industrial chic decor is definitely cool, it could stand to be a bit more comfy, but then that would also cause longer wait times, since people would be more prone to stay longer. I know how it works. I get it! That's just a lil gripe because I do like a bit of padding for my derriere when I sit down. Haha!   I do wish they'd make room for more tables (or make better use of the space). The long table across from the coffee bar is a nice place to wait to be seated but if they made that useable space, then maybe there wouldn't have to be as long of a wait, since people would be seated somewhere to get their orders going. Just a thought. That's my only suggestion. Other than that, they are on the right track. It's so cool to have been a customer since the beginning and watch their success grow. :)

eJdF-N7tzvCRIMhxEjvcMw.text: Four stars. Not because of the food; the staff was not interested in serving. CRAFT is a "hipster" place. As a person who's originally from Portland, I can say this restaurant would fit in with the Portlandia crowd. That being said, it's probably why the staff act the way they do. If you watch Portlandia, you'll know what I mean.  I ordered the croissant breakfast sandwich. Husband ordered the smoked salmon on pretzel bread. Both were delectable. The croissant was a little greasy, making it incredibly rich. However, the little salad that comes with, refreshed the palate. The little potato chips served on top of the salad add a much needed crunch to the entire dish.  Order their coffee! Freshly brewed per cup. It makes an amazingly rich and strong cup. And it's local. We'll be going back until we've tried everything on their menu.

ieeRp8Ne0oljFwL-OkRVtQ.text: Had our 3rd and last visit there this past weekend. Got there about 9am, hostess said there was a 15-20 min wait. I noticed there were a ton of empty tables but I figured there were people waiting and they were probably just cleaning the tables. About 15 min later about 40% of the tables were empty and multiple parties were still waiting to be seated. They seemed to be understaffed and unable to seat all of their tables on a Saturday morning. After a 20 minute wait in a half empty restaurant we finally sat down. From that point on we continued to be unimpressed. The service was slow and terrible. We were in a sea of unhappy faces. The other tables, like us, struggled to get a waitress to provide things like silverware after the food was delivered. The presentation of the meal was underwhelming as was the food. My breakfast burrito was filled with mostly whole pieces of potato and the flavor was nothing special. I don't get the opportunity to go out to breakfast much on the weekend so this experience was highly disappointing. 2 out of our 3 visits here weren't great so definitely going with other breakfast places in the area next time.

LWAOfu2gBn23KHm_l1iwRg.text: Thank you Jeffrey for going above and beyond for our big family! Bottomless mimosas, family, and good food definitely defines a happy Sunday! We will be back for more happy Sunday's. :)

JDPL7_CVmSLSCb_rzgkwxg.text: The best brunch place with the best service from everyone especially Katie!! Everything is always delicious & on pint. Love the salmon benny & breakfast burrito! Bottomless mimosas are the best too. Definitely a weekly spot for the best food!!

MmhgVdX8Fz1BYBJEwHGoYw.text: Food was great, service was very slow. When the waiter finally got to our table, he was very friendly.

PENyYCu8H76mZhBDdc1Tkw.text: What a beautiful experience!  When you first walk in, it feels like a modern country chic kitchen. It's bright and white with natural colors and tones. It's quaint and pretty! The plates are even pretty!  But the food... Wow, the food!! We started with the homemade, flaky, buttery berry poptart. It had the perfect amount of filling and our server was excellent when she offered to warm it up for us! Took me right back to my childhood.  We then moved on to the protein plate and chorizo and eggs- both were fantastic! Everything was wonderful and I am excited to try it out again. Brunch anyone?
