MxYfecwzH5O_IC9j-UThBA.text: They have churro waffles. Get the churro waffles. 5 stars. Also, service was friendly, short rib hash was nice, and latte was nice and frothy.

XC3OmaLmiWIWUjOlD2Eurw.text: I have tried many of their lunch items and loved them. They have wine!! ( which is always a nice touch for lunch with girlfriends). Love the gluten free bakery options. Especially the gluten-free pumpkin donut.

gTYxgghT479LS1rEHXCRhg.text: Heard about this place from numerous people and it was more than what they had talked it up to be. Fantastic place! Short Rib Hash and Monkey Bread are a must! Everyone from the host, to the waitress, to the manager were extremely personal. Devin, the manager, is actually an old friend from high school and he is such a nice guy who cares about everyone's needs in the restaurant. Fantastic food and fantastic service!

79Bf4dyhFobneh9idoYNEg.text: Came here for lunch today while I waited for my car to get washed across the street. I had actually been wanting to come here for brunch for quite sometime,but for some reason I always end up at Kitchen Table. I was greeted immediately by a very courteous young man who seated me promptly at the table I requested. A few minutes later an Asian waiter came to take my order. I requested the croque Monsieur be made a croque Madame and I also ordered a side of truffle fries with a small orange juice . All the food was very tasty (with the exception of the bread on the croque I was not a fan) and the oj was very fresh of course. The only reason why I gave this spot three stars and not 4 was because after my waiter took my order, I never saw him again. I had to get up and ask for whatever I needed and at the end of my meal get up and ask for my check. In defense of the staff EVERYONE ELSE other than my waiter was fantastic and very attentive. Perhaps he went on break? Maybe he should've let someone know?

FO_ZykQZFPeVBaiBdG25iQ.text: Attended an event at SkinBar today and they had a whole spread of delicate pastries and an assortment of cheeses and meats! It was all so good! I can't wait to try out breakfast and/or lunch!

_jebDJK0YwXcyE6XpHikAw.text: Just left here and I have to say I'm so glad this place is opened. I had the beef sliders and they were delicious. The presentation was on point and even though at first glance they looked small, they were absolutely filling. Our server was Rusty and he was very polite. We also got to chat with Devon, the servers assistant, and he was also very kind and helpful. Overall the experience was great, the look is beautiful and the food is great. Look forward to going back.

eokpq5vfBQgbLtsiRjxYWA.text: EAT HERE, I loved it! If I lived in NV I would be a regular. We found this gem on Yelp and took a cab from our conference for a DELICIOUS lunch. Very fresh and healthy food! A great menu (and I am picky) and great service. It was worth the detour before taking a cab to the airport. The coffee and dessert (even had great GF options) must be had too.

LnHmYFNVlG_tDV1Vb_Eo0w.text: Just finished my second visit and had to recommend Craft Kitchen. Their coffee is awesome and can't wait until they roll out the baguettes and baguette sammy's. Get in there and support this great new Henderson spot.

fRtO25oL2yyVfOwi6HBKyA.text: Walked into a warm and inviting space. Really enjoyed the outside fence full of fresh herbs. Had a salad with burratta cheese, greens, and pomegranate, with a grilled fresh baked piece of bread. Have to say this was the best salad Ive had. Everything seemed very pricey, but I split salad with a friend. Split was done in kitchen, and portions were more than enough for both of us. Ate with several other ladies who are usually critical but there were no complaints from any of the 8 ladies. Everything was plated so beautifully. Can't wait to return for more. Just wish it was more affordable so I could return more often.

XIG6xeKPnhuKNX4b7PffgQ.text: Ordered and enjoyed the CK Special and Oatmeal Brulee- both were outstanding!! The service is friendly and the decorations are fun.

GunWWG8w4tIcAIb9m4856A.text: Tried this place for brunch a few months ago. They were busy and it took about 20 minutes to get seated. I had the chicken and waffles and was completely underwhelmed with the lack of seasoning, small portion sizes, and breading that fell off the fried chicken. It was some of the worst food an apparently 'more upscale place' that I've had in a long time. Service was friendly enough, but really young and fairly inexperienced. They treated it like a job and did not seem particularly sincere.  I can't remember what my husband had, but I remember him saying that it was just OK. This isn't a place that I'm excited to go back to.

Uic2eSlD3wL0eY_1gNYj-A.text: After reading so many great reviews I had to try this place. I had the chicken and waffles and a decaf coffee. The flavor of the chicken and waffles was good however I think both should have been more crispy. My biggest issue was the portion size, very small. I was actually hungry 2 hours later. Also, the decaf coffee was more like water. I may come back and try something else but I'm not in a hurry.

C8oAANW8nu-t1RG_arGbwA.text: This morning we decided to have our 1st breakfast at CRAFTkitchen...We had chicken and waffles and an almond croissant with fantastic bacon..The food was fresh and very tasty and we ate every bite! Our server, Teresa was great to talk with and very attentive with our delightful organic hot coffee...I normally never write a review but decided it was time ! Thank you  Debbie Lynn

pnSW6bL-n16ejzBUqJ5MRQ.text: Took mom for breakfast on her birthday. Food was great but service from Jeffery was horrible. Ask for a table that's not in his service area. After our order was taken, Jeffery offered us refills for our coffee but he never came back to check up on us. I had to waive him down at the end of our meal asking for more coffee. Instead of apologizing that he forgot, his short reply was "it's coming". I couldn't help but notice that the table next to us had been seated around the same time and their server checked up on them twice and refilled their coffee mugs.

kahDn5QmgRD_Hf7oJ6WCMQ.text: Awesome experience!   The placed was packed and they opens just a couple weeks ago!  Must try  truffle fries!   Friendly, good service and creative takes on traditional foods that we know and love!

ukQLpQJDbAiwMHKdM_oLlw.text: I stopped by during the week last week, secretly hoping that one thing might have remained in the building from Bread & Butter, the Cronut! Not happening, but that is ok. So I tried the pulled turkey benedict, side of thick bacon and coffee. I was the only one in the restaurant and you know when you have checked your phone email, facebook, maybe a couple other sites, and you realize hey, I don't have my food yet and I have to get to work? That would be the case! When it did arrive the muffin was warm on the bottom and the egg warm on top, but the turkey, tomato, avocado and the side of too thick hollandaise in a chipped china container were all cold. Which made too large of a percentage of cold in the stack for me, and not pleasant to eat. I have had good thick bacon before as advertised for $5 we make it at home so I know it's expensive, but I am going to guess that this was not cooked that morning and reheated. Coffee was good and glad to see they did not break the $3 for it.  So this all added up to a $22 breakfast, so that questions my breakfast price value perception, for that price I'm kinda expecting an ocean view! But the menu looked interesting so we could find ourselves back for another try.

ceWD6wWkK7uYJcroAZhMEw.text: They're improving! Brulee Oatmeal is outstanding and the sticky buns warmed are decadent but musts.

Wvl_VxKnZCUAUwprs0P6ZQ.text: We were so excited to try Craft Kitchen when it opened. We were not disappointed. The sliders were amazing and surprisingly filling! The fries were delicious and I'm pretty picky about my fries! The pastries I tried were all really good. Cupcakes at Halloween time were so cute. The lemon and apple pastries were to die for. We will be frequenting Craft again and again!

geIrrqp2VFLfFPbWTTrZPA.text: Entering the restaurant, the setting is so light and fresh. The owner, Tammy, greeted us and walked us to the table. She told us about the restaurant and their food - she had so much enthusiasm and the food sounded so amazing. Our server was Elle and she gave us fantastic and quick service. It's not a huge menu but I appreciate that. Everything I've tried has been delicious and their coffee is strait up amazing. You have to eat here if you're anywhere near Vegas.

_UD4k_6CWBkchtOJ7u8QwQ.text: i personally would not recommend this place, it has the worst service.. I was new to the place there was no hostess at the front I didn't know where I was going .it was cold in there, it took server 5-7 mins before we even got water or even greeted.  45 mins to get food. complicated not easy menu.....monkey bread was good that's why 1 star..otherwise never will return or wouldn't recommend

1C2tf6aqvCo86LSCX47sOw.text: This place opens to the public on 10.28.2015.  I was fortunate enough to sample many of their offerings before their grand opening.  The service staff was in training, but from what I encountered they should be up to the task with friendly smiles.  My favorite was the short rib hash.  Meat was so tender and flavorful I just wanted MORE of it.  Not your typical "hash"  Beef was laid over crispy small potatoes..highly recommend this dish.  Citrus & Crab salad was very refreshing and you can tell it was freshly made.  Need a fork and knife to eat.  Chorizo shepherd's pie..need I saw more?  Just the right amount of kick without overwhelming your taste buds.  Pulled Turkey Benny didn't sound that great to me, but someone else at my table ordered so I got to a chance to try it.  Wow what a pleasant surprise.  Fresh and actually did not feel like a heavy dish.  The sauce that came with it was excellent.  Chicken and What?  Have to admit I am not a white meat person and this was boneless white meat.  My 8 yr old son liked it, but I would have preferred a drumstick.  Just a warning so you are clear of what you will be getting.  Beef sliders where very good.  Grass fed beef done perfectly.  Would have liked some sauce options that woudl have made them perfect.  The pastries and desserts is where Craft Kitchen truly shines.  Had a sampling of both and every item was perfection.  Several where gluten free and I could not tell.  This place is committed to good food and healthy choices and includes a lot of gluten free options.  Can't wait to go back and try all their other offerings.  The owners, Tami and Jaret Blinn will be creating more items and I am very excited to return and experience more of their craftiness in the kitchen!

seLtYTAHoC6q3R5J2uIV-g.text: While their cafe latte is good, it has too much foam for my taste, the foam fills about 1/3 of the cup, when I asked them they told me it's normal, but I think it's just their poor excuse, if I want that many foam, I might as well get cappuchino, get it only if you like a cheaper cappuccino.  I like the avocado bread, so no complain on that one, and we got another pork hash that was quite a disappointment, I know they maybe are trying to be healthy, but there's literally no taste in it at all.....and way over priced for the amount of pork we got, we went to DW Bistro sunday brunch and we can get their pork hash for exact same price with super tasty sauce on it and portion is almost 3 times as much.  I just feel the restaurant is a bit pretentious....really good decoration inside though...

zrDJ8o-_syspkI7VX54pFg.text: I was invited for lunch here. I ordered the protein breakfast. The food was excellent! The service was excellent! I ordered a cup of coffee after the meal. The coffee tasted like instant. Which I consider crap ! If I go again, I'll bring my own or maybe a Starbucks!

RSnYJ90VOi3qGFNmOeQgoA.text: Tried this place for the first time last Sunday.  Omg! Well worth the drive across town! The creme brulee stuffed French toast, is to die for.    Ok so I finally got back to Craft Kitchen this past Sunday.  And it went from 5 stars to 2 stars, not because of the food but simply because of the way the place is managed.  It was a Sunday, so understood that there would be a long wait (we were told 45mins), but when there were consistently 2-6 open tables at any given time during our wait time, I just find it unacceptable.  The friend I was with told me this is just standard practice her.  Service is consistently slow, waits long and they leave dirty tables sitting instead of turning them over and getting customers seated . When we finally did bet seated, no "thank for being patient/waiting". Lots of great places to eat in this town.  Food is great.  I'll give them that.

jdZkJz8CB0gj663fcPizkQ.text: My wife suggested this place so we decided to go. Happy wife happy life.  The place has a nice feel to it and every employee that we talked to was helpful and kind. I like the way the restaurant was decorated. Little things like the centerpiece on the table just added to feel.  Everything everyone ordered was delicious. With great food and great service how can you go wrong? You can't! So sit back, relax and enjoy something from the bakery or order something from the menu and enjoy.

VIF_YbnQdMoJ-V7O3nIaxw.text: The food is great but the "Yelp waitlist" needs improvement .. it currently holds a table until the person arrives (even if they're late arriving) therefore denying a table to people who are already at the restaurant; what it should do is allow the Yelp waitlist person to jump to the top of the list when they arrive .. that way they won't have ten groups of diners standing around when they have ten empty tables to accommodate them.

dEU6rvrws4ofXOZnq1WUTQ.text: My friends and I are usually fans of this place. We like to come and drink some mimosas while eating good food (but really who doesn't love that) usually the service is on point the most recent time I came here the waitress made it seem like we were bothering her. Usually when people order, the waitress makes sure there's nothing else you want, but not this one. The second my boyfriend was done saying his entree she whisked away our menus, but I needed fries in my life. She apparently didn't care. You know the service is subpar when your house coffee cup isn't refilled once. WHO DOESN'T REFILL A CUSTOMER'S CUP OF WATER OR COFFEE. (end of service rant)  Chorizo scramble: This place perfects the scramble. The thing I love most about this is that it was nicely layered. Every bite had everything, which is hard for some places. Everything worked together so well. It was beautifully presented and it seemed like it was baked together in a way because everything stayed on my fork without struggling to eat it in one bite.  Carnitas Benedict: My boyfriend seemed deterred from having the sauce on the side. The poached egg was overdone. Poached eggs are supposed to ooze out but ours just stayed in place. How are we supposed to take our yolk porn video for the insta story if it doesn't ooze out? The carnitas was cooked well. Despite the egg troubles, the plate itself tasted like perfection.   I've been seeing a lot about their happy hour, can't wait to give it a go!

y8jfnE53dXu0DDKXJNnLIg.text: First post on this app. Firat I must say this place is busy which means the food is good. I had the wet breakfast chorizo burrito with a coffee. It was presented well and was very filling. I can typically eat a whole entree however this was hard to do. It was flavorful and fresh. Also my aervice was good. Emily waited on our table and she recommended us many food items that were a hit for my friends visiting from out of town. This will definitely be my go to place when with friends. I also recommend using the YELP app to check in because wait times can be 45 mins during busy times.

4ilFYXGmsZ04busWsIwA-Q.text: I love when I'm on this side of town so that I may swing into CRAFTkitchen. One of my favorite things about this spot is the succulents on the patio but during my most recent visit, they were nowhere to be seen. My other favorite things about this place are the food and the cronut. Yes, I know that cronuts are food but they are so delicious here that they belong in their own category.   For those folks who are unfamiliar with a cronut, it's a croissant donut. Also, where have you been!?! I mean, WHAT?! Flaky buttery layers of pastry heaven that you must devour before your friends ask for a bite. There is a host to greet you and seat you but make your way to the pastry case before you sit down. You have to survey the goods!  Service here has always been A-OK for me. They once forgot to bring me my Nutella cronut but still *almost* charged me for it. They were super apologetic when I brought it to their attention, took it off the bill, and still packaged one up for me to go. That's what I call exceptional guest service.   I've enjoyed the Avocado Toast but could do without the sunflower seeds. I've loved the Acai Bowl with a side of bacon. I was disappointed with the Ham Benedict. My ham was cold and cut too thick for my liking plus the sauce is served on the side without my asking. I'm all for the sauce life and wasn't into pouring it myself. My most recent visit I enjoyed the Crustless Quiche of the Day. It's served in a small baking dish with a side salad. Fluffy and light, filling but not heavy. Super into it. I enjoyed the patio with a pal and her pup so it's nice to know it's pet-friendly!  Yum.

HMezRFHYtTDAMidebmFhvQ.text: Okay to be honest, we came here because of the vibe more than the food. It's got that super hipster "you an take Instagram photos here" feel about it, which I'm down with (obviously, I write yelp reviews and am about to post an insta pic). However, the food is pretty dang good. My benny was perfect for lunch, the capers were fried or something and were oddly enough, the star of the meal. My friend's burrito was good to them, but I hate a lot of the ingredients (personal preferences). The plants were cute, the little tea pot was adorable. The portions were great, my yolk was perfectly runny, there was a glass meeting space that my friend is hoping to rent soon.  The only reason for it being one star down is the acoustics. It was loudddd. The floor is concrete and there are brick walls. While it looks slick, it doesn't allow for audio absorption. Maybe put up some planters with padding behind them, add come cushions to the booths, etc. It was a good place, but we need to be able to talk about our yummy food, not just eat it.

b-JfWJHdxI2Bl2wG847aiQ.text: Amazing food and ok service. Don't go here if you are in a rush. I would give the food a 10 if I could. I have been several times and never have not loved what I ordered. The service I would give a 1. I used to think it was because they were always so busy but the last 2 times I went it was at a less busy time and service still terrible. Waving down the waitress to order, to get another drink, to get the check,etc. I hope they step up the service as the food is awesome!  Update: went today and had brunch. Leslie is the star server!  Ask for her to avoid the slow server issue. Food as good as ever. Can't wait to go back and ask for Leslie

1_D1dmDbCAx4AEKaFLamtQ.text: Sometimes your visual perception of something is painfully deceptive when it comes to the quality of the item itself. I think that's where Instagram fails us as patrons. Sure that purple colored waffle covered in Fruity Pebbles under a mountain of whipped cream looks delicious, but is it? Or does it just taste like sugar infused Bisquick with 3 dollar cereal sprinkles? I too have fallen victim to the wonderfully talented Instagram foodie photographers. Why the long winded lead in? Well it's kind of where this review starts, an Instagram photo. Of course I didn't order what was in those photos but I was otherwise influenced by them. As a blogger / vlogger and foodie myself I seem to forget that beauty sometimes really is only skin deep. It's not to say that my experience at CRAFTkitchen was bad or that the food was bad, but it is to say that believing isn't always seeing. I really did enjoy our visit and the service was wonderful. The staff was very courteous and friendly and we really never waited for anything. That aside, the food wasn't worth the cost. We ordered the Monkey Bread as a starter and it was delicious. A little dry as I'm used to it being moist and sticky but very sweet and flavorful. Now's where my experience falters a bit. Alex and Brittney ordered the Short Rib Grilled Cheese sandwich. It was my first choice and I even pointed it out to them. For some reason though, I changed my mind. Instead I ordered the Chicken and What? Their beautiful pulled short rib sandwiches arrived covered in caramelized onions, peppadew peppers and all blanketed in melted Havarti cheese between toasted sourdough. They were amazing. I know this because I finished Brittney's. A truly wonderful sandwich. I'm almost sad to write about mine and I really wished I had looked for a picture of it before I ordered it. Chicken and What is their rendition of chicken and waffles. What I received however can only be described as two swollen Eggos and two chicken fingers. I'm not even trying to be funny about this. I was turned on by the pickled jalapeno maple syrup but immediately turned off by the fact that I was spending a fortune for a Happy Meal. A Happy Meal that had absolutely no taste of jalapeno, pickled or otherwise. All of this being said my rating of three stars is not because the Chicken and What is a fail, but because the CRAFTkitchen is just too expensive for the quality of food. After winning multiple readers polls I have to ask myself what happened to that quality that got them there? My reviews are based on my experience and though the experience was fun, the cost for quality and portion was just way too high. Watch the video! youtu.be/j_d5igqk-oo

I mean, there is understanding on our end since we didn't make a reservation. In any case, we were happily served right away and given our bottomless mimosas  Definitely am a fan of the mango mimosa and pomegranate mimosa! It seems like others were happy with their orders as well, like the salmon toast and omelets.   Single bathrooms, so you might have to wait.  Easy parking since it is located in a shopping plaza in Henderson!  Would return, and probs with a rezzy...

drblJlcfYmQIu7dqjK2MvA.text: Word to the wise, use Yelp waitlist if you go here! They even encourage it at the front with a cute sign that tells people to download the app and use it! Pretty awesome.  I say that because the wait could have been so much worse than it was for us. We "got in line" right when we left the house and only ended up waiting about 10 minutes when we got there, which could have easily been 30-45 minute wait if we would have just put our name in when we got there! AMAZING!  The only weird thing was that when we got there, we mentioned we were fine sitting outside, but they mentioned they sit by server so if we wanted to sit outside it wouldn't make a difference of us sitting sooner. But no worries on that because we didn't wait too long.  Now on to the drinks & food. WOW! Absolutely incredible. I decided to opt in for the bottomless mimosas because even if I had two, it would be totally worth it because of the price. They had a few different flavors to choose from, but I ended up having the pomegranate one, which was super delicious.  For brunch, I ordered the avocado toast which was topped with a poached egg and sunflower seeds, which I thought was such a great addition to the dish. My husband got the churro waffles, which seemed a little small when he first got them, but they were super sweet so it ended up being just the right amount for him anyway. I tried a bite and definitely had food envy. They seriously tasted just like a delicious churro! YUM! He also got a side of eggs and bacon, which he mentioned was prepared well, too.   We will definitely be back and I can't wait to take my sister when she comes to visit because it's definitely a spot I know she will enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Mimosa and beers

L43N1IFfTMt99TBV0MlsBA.text: This place is a great breakfast and lunch place up on Eastern and Sundridge Heights as you go toward Anthem.  Great food, coffee and service.  Everything seems so fresh and unique for the breakfasts options.  I would use the words farm fresh for some reason, but really, I am not sure.  Just everything was so creative.  A nice bakery set up greets you as you first come in. Man, if I was eating that stuff, it looked so good... I have been here several times now.  Just imagine the food with titles like Croissant Sammy, or Pork carnitas Omelet, or Goat Cheese Frittata.  I had the Protein Fix for breakfast, which was 3 eggs organize spinach, avocado and turkey sausage.  Excellent. OK, you can see I am watching my type of food...  Next time I came here, I tried the vegan menu in honor of my daughter and I wanted to check it out so I can bring her here too.  Had the greek salad with the gardein chicken.  The salad was wonderful, the gardein chicken a bit odd to me but I ate it... Of course I would.  They do have as I mentioned an entire Vegan menu and that would be very good for so many!  I am coming back to try that Korean Fried Chicken Burger. or the Short Rib Grilled Cheese.  Yeah, it will be on my "cheat" meal for those.  GK says, check it out, it will be busy but you will enjoy it.

qfR3JATJk0xL1Wa1xinz-Q.text: Cute place for a basic / bougie brunch. Indoor and outdoor seating. Lots of windows, so the place gets good light. There's a "private" dining room too...it's more semi-private in reality bc the walls are glass and people in the main restaurant can definitely see you  The service is super friendly and high energy, though I found that it took longer than expected to bring the food out  Most plates will set you back $15 ish Got the pork carnitas benedict. Eggs came perfectly poached and I loved how they put the sauce on the side even when I forgot to request that. I was sharing this plate and thought it was great that they split the plate for us so it was easier to share. Also got the salmon salad to go. It came with a decent amount of salmon. I liked how the salmon came out hot, so they put it in a separate container. Very thoughtful!  Food is good, not mind-blowing. Not eager to come back here but wouldn't be resistant to it. I thought the service was better than the food lol

18xDM0k9yaPMhVSsJz2n6Q.text: My only regret???  Not coming here since this place opened!  My mom and I brunch on Mondays.  We do this because Sundays are too busy and we hate waiting.  Most places we've gone in the last 3 months aren't busy enough to wait.  Well, let me tell you, on a Monday, this place was POPPIN'.  The wait wasn't too bad (and you can join the wait list on Yelp!!!)  Service wasn't perfect.  It was a tiny bit slow but like I said it was packed in here (even all of the seats outside were taken, in 105 degree summer weather).  The food made up for it.  We loved the bakeries so much we bought some to go.  Everything came to our table beautifully presented, hot, fresh, and packed with flavor.  I don't think the price was off for what you get either.  I mean I've been to places that were more expensive for WAY LESS quality food.  Attention to detail is where it's at.  I mean the coffee came with a biscotti.  How many places still do that?  A mean latte with a biscotti for under $4!!!  Amazing.      Turns out that on Mondays you can get some of the Sunday brunch specials as well.  YAAASSSSS!!!!!!!!!!!!  Looks like my mom and I might not need to try any other breakfast spots...

QSKJlWjq0Yft-Xe2VintUA.text: CRAFTkitchen is a local favorite and certainly one of mine.  The restaurant is very cute, has a small private dining room (for your special group outings or meetings), as well as patio seating.   The service is consistently good and everyone is friendly.   I love their everchanging brunch menu as well as some tried and True favorites from their regular menu (crispy avocado tacos, churro waffles, Cuban sandwich).  There is something for everyone as their menu is pretty diverse with breakfast and lunch items (vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free options too!) and they also have an impressive selection of housemade pastries and desserts.  Weekends can be a challenge because the restaurant gets packed so be sure that you are okay with waiting for a table (bring a book or some fun people with you); otherwise, show up early! They also offer a waitlist through Yelp - which I recommend trying.  CRAFTkitchen is definitely the type of place that you will want to go to frequently - and if you can't - try their catering services!

y8fD_1qbHfyx8Fhu_eYcBQ.text: This is not just a good brunch spot, it's a great brunch spot. We took out of town visitors here and they thought it was the weekend highlight! We got the salmon benny, several pastries, the French toast, and the frittata.  The frittata was amazing! It was vegetarian and still so flavorful! They definitely had several good vegetarian options that weren't just "here have a vegetable." The Benedict was the best for sure. It was a huge portion of salmon and tasted really fresh.   We also did the bottomless mimosas. It's too bad they don't put the juice and champagne on the table for you to pick your own proportions but on the upside they were strong as heck (only a downside if you had later in the day plans...).  We got on the waitlist and it was a 35 minute wait. Being able to do this on yelp was great. We will be back for sure!

8-COxaFWLnUfEBt8m-hb_A.text: After a nice long walk I was ready for some breakfast.  So the hubby and I decided to take my mom here.  It was a great choice!    We sat outside since it was still very comfortable.  I got the short rib hash ($15.95).  The sauce used was sweet and savory and I'm guessing that was from the onions and sweet peppers. It was served with smashed potatoes rather than "hash" style and an egg on top.  The short rib cooked to perfection, not chewy, but darn near close to melt in your mouth.    Coffee - a standard for me was made to order, probably americano style - it hit the spot and our server brought out fresh practically before we knew we needed it!    I'm sure we will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short Rib Hash

1okI13SUreajI4hxK-cSWA.text: My hubby and I came here on a Saturday with surprisingly any wait! The unlimited mimosa option was great (and strong!) I had the pomegranate and mango both good.  The fries were very tasty and I had the taco carnitas omelet which was great but we both felt the portions could be larger for the price. That said the Mango cream dessert was out of this world! I think we may be back, service was good but we shall see.

huEH_ERA3XgqB_U9ShGhRA.text: Excellent service Delicious food. I have found that I end up buying 2 meals or adding an egg because the creme brulee French toast can't be missed but I need an egg or something and it comes by itself.  Clean bathrooms Yummy pastries and drinks you can eat there or take to go.  I will definitely continue to eat here anytime I'm in Henderson Note: the chairs are horribly uncomfortable. They have those metal outdoor chairs with the little bar that digs into your side butt. Lol. Miserable. But I endure it for the noms. Wish they'd get different chairs. :)

ZX_lYG3UTtA1cpNBQdBQ_A.text: I can't believe it took me this long to try this place! The dishes look great and taste even better! I had ordered the largest Burrito I've seen since Chapel Hill NC. I wonder if that place in Chapel Hill still exists. Great coffee! My girlfriend's Egg's Benedict was delicious and the atmosphere was perfect. Sitting outside on a beautiful day definitelyhelps! Just like I've said in many of my other posts, we'll definitely go back!  An important note to remember if you decide to dine here; you can put your name in the waiting list through Yelp! My girlfriend submitted our names, so we didn't have to wait for a table when we arrived! Love it!

qwAYgshQkbqOopuPvh1dlQ.text: One of our favorite breakfast/brunch spots in Henderson! We live all the way up in Summerlin, but if we meet up with friends for brunch, this place is definitely the spot.   Being able to join the waitlist here on Yelp is super convenient because it's always busy! And it's nice that that they have a patio area and allow dogs.  Today we had: Starter: spinach and feta kouign-amann. Main dishes: crab cake benedict and strawberry cheesecake crispy french toast.   The kouign-amann was a nice and savory appetizer. The crab cake benedict had a lemon caper hollandaise sauce that complemented it really well. And the crispy french toast was a weekend special and was super filling.   They do have a vegan menu and weekend brunch specials that they post on their Instagram!   If you haven't been here yet, definitely give this place a try! You won't be disappointed!

RRAYVwMLZxsVqYBxNGDqcA.text: Phenomenal food + Trendy + Friendly = You have to go. Couldn't say no the the potato cake salmon Benedict which was a True culinary achievement. You know a place is good when people are picking up catering orders, and countless takeout orders at 8am.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

SBBQPdmR50JyYT1FjlrnvA.text: I read that the coffee place I was trying got their pastries from here, looked at the menu, and decided to branch out.   You can add your name to the waitlist via Yelp and then check in when you get there. We did that and walked outside to wait. About 2 minutes later, we got a text that our table was ready. We walked in behind a gal that just got there who was immediately seated at a four top table. He sat us at a two top surrounded but children... screaming children. We dont have kids, and it is fairly echoey so it put a bit of a damper on breakfast.   Our server (leslie I think) was prompt and friendly. We ordered the potato cake and salmon Benedict. It was good, but personally I prefer less salmon. I think it is a good amount for value, but I personally think salmon is overpowering and a little goes a long way. I probably would not order it again, but it was definitely edible.   Nothing that's making me die to go back.

Qv5svbLM7u50JifNBhNM6Q.text: This is a MUCH delayed review as I have eaten at this establishment multiple times.  I think I leave with my stomach so full and I'm just so happy that I forget all about writing a review. My deepest apologies. I have enjoyed amazing breakfast during the week and the phenomenal ever-changing brunch on the weekend, as well.  The meals are always prepared to order and with the freshest ingredients possible.  I'll go on record as saying that my favorite breakfast at CRAFTkitchen is the Smashed Avocado Toast. For someone who has a sweet tooth this just blows my mind with the fresh greens. My poached egg was cooked exactly the way I like it, as well.   When my friends and I returned (on another date -- to celebrate my birthday) we decided to try out the brunch and we were pleasantly surprised with the vast menu options. We all tried something different and shared the CK Monkey Bread. Soooo yummy! Pretty sure we were rolled out of there that day. ;) The coffee is always fresh and delicious (which I, personally LOVE!) and the servers are extremely attentive.  CRAFTkitchen is by far one of my fave local places to eat. I'll continue to recommend it to anyone and everyone. Keep up the GREAT work!!

K7HYbFLO9awF0suKunOqsg.text: Great food, iffy service. Service started out great and got progressively worse. I think the wait queue was getting too long and no one wanted to sit outside because it was too cold to sit outside, that made the staff want to rush us out. We wanted to get a few things to go, but the servers wouldn't even wait for us to finish speaking before rushing off. In the end, it left a bitter taste to an otherwise great brunch. I would have given then 3 stars, but I want to give them benefit of the doubt.

yHBVkGqsYd9cZyPL1mBgYQ.text: Pretty good, great vibe, some food came out cold and service was mediocre. The style is great, it reminds me of Newport Beach.. Green modern style. My latte was dropped off with no sweetener and had to wave down help.. Also had to ask someone else to bring us waters.  Oatmeal Brulee was amazing with the sweet shell and they leave a nut assortment on the side that is delicious tossed in the oatmeal . Short Rib hash came out cold and bland for my taste. Dessert (bread pudding) was yummy. I sent my Bloody Mary back, the way they make it taste weird.. Like a virus smokey taste.. She said it was from the bacon but it wasn't the bacon in my opinion. I would order a standard Bloody Mary not theirs.

Tnr_83O2ai9wt0VEd5_q0A.text: Great place. All of the food is amazing. Only bad thing is you can't go there hungry because there is always a long wait to get a table.  Need more tables

MVpUVI1S1yW7bLS5o-ZACg.text: A gem of a find!  So excited when I saw this place being built, it looked quite promising and yes, it is lovely.  It's bright and clean inside, with large, chunky wooden tables and metal chairs and benches. There's a coffee bar and a nice selection of pastries and baked goods such as tarts, cookies, muffins and cake pops. Cute succulents adorn each table and models the new healthy and modern style of eateries.  While not organic necessarily, it seems that loads of vegetables and more clean eating is the motto. They do say they try to use organic, local, GMO free, humanly sourced food when possible. Whole grains, micro greens and vegetable loaded dishes are commonplace on the menu.  Items ordered; turkey burgers sliders topped with a sauteed veggie and micro green mix served on whole wheat buns, with sweet potato fries and maple aioli. Absolutely delicious!! My hubby ordered an egg white omelet with spinach and homemade turkey-veggie patty, side of avocado (which I ate). He said it was fantastic. We got a side of the homemade spicy salsa, which was again super tasty! We gluttonously ordered a pumpkin muffin that was more of a cake, but decadently ambrosial. I had a cappuccino with nonfat milk, awesome!!  Service was friendly and attentive.  They are only open breakfast and lunch (until 3 pm) and I am hoping one day that they'll do dinner.  Will definitely be returning to Craft Kitchen soon!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib hash--- husband said it&#39;s  been the best thing on the menu for him so far.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken or what? Delicious jalapeño maple syrup!!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon on pretzel bunch and cream cheese.

xfr7PsRU0AM_pnLBK40SVA.text: Best brunch and breakfast in town HANDS DOWN!! The food is fresh and unique with great service. Desserts and pastries are off the chart! Everyone I take here out of town LOVES it!

8jGb2zHew1GV9KhUfOUjug.text: Some of the best food I've had in Las Vegas. So if u come to Vegas u have to come here. The Mimosas  and Mocha were the best we have had it a long time. Service and cleanliness were much appreciated. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

IoeVdpWyx6A2WScgHnV8wA.text: There are at least 6 tables with 4 seats inside and outside plus 3 tables with 2 seats and we were told wait time would be about 10 minutes. When asked the hostess reason why, she said she was told by management to stagger the seating so they can give us "the best service possible". When I asked if they were short staffed, she repeated the same answer again. Once we sat down, it became evident that their waitstaff was disorganized, which I consider to be poor guidance from management. They brought out half our order and told us to enjoy our meal and didn't realize our order wasn't complete.  I give this review 2 stars because their food was pretty good and the waiter was nice.  If management is reading this review, I recommend working on better leadership to create a more organized service. If you don't understand what I mean by this, then go to Cheesecake Factory (or any well established restaurant) and see how their service works.

q34quHoMZYyK_7h-4ER5Rg.text: This place is so cool! Decor is fresh and modern. It feels bright and homey. Service is personal and friendly. Food is healthy and yummy! Jefferey is an awesome server that took care of my needs right away. I had the smashed avocado toast on gluten free bread. It was delicious! Great size too. I can't wait to try the other things on the menu also. I love their gluten free options, especially on the pastries. Great place for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smashed Avocado Toast, yum! It&#39;s usually on ciabatta, but I requested gluten free toast, and it&#39;s just as good! Highly recommended!

Saturdays aren't as bad and they still offer brunch! They also have a full coffee bar which I love, plus they give you a biscotti! I'd recommend this place. It's my go-to brunch place on my side of town :)

Had the quiche of the day that was one of the best I've ever had!  The ideal amount of fresh ingredients and full of flavor. _FzSr7tH62MqM3YQV0O2Vw.text: Food was good but it took forever to get to my table. They also took a super long time to get us our check. But it's really good here. Definitely will be coming back.   Get the Short Rib Hash! It's super good!!

9xiS2nsSm7arey7xyIpLCQ.text: Fantastic food! Love the healthy menu with lots of choices! Plan on a short wait, but it will be well worth it.

Obs5M7AVa0_aWMq1Zi3p1A.text: The BEST breakfast lunch spot in town. One of the only places that reminds me of being home in Australia - i try and make it at least once a week! The market stack is my favorite item and the pastry case is not to be missed. They have a new Vegan menu which is appreciated for those on a health kick.

uC7sTERUX2xJLpASm4gp2Q.text: Been meaning to go here for years, but the line is always too long for too impatient me.  But then it was mid-week and I had been fasting all day cause I had to get some medical tests done. Tests are over, I'm famished, school's out -- we take the whole family to CraftKitchen. Everything was so good: really well-brewed coffee, exceptionally tasty Eggs Benedict (I did the version that comes with Carnitas -- an excellent taste combo of egg w/ tomatillo salsa and chewy porky textures), nice waitress, and the absolute best was the Churro Waffles. I'm going to completely fail to describe this well, but it has this amazing tres leches sauce that just makes you want to cry when you fork up the last of it. The next time we go back, in addition to my main breakfast dish, I'm going to order my own serving of Churro Waffles, so I can completely wallow in and overdo this amazing dish all to greedy self!

ighCsd3OxAZHO8elDUFEyw.text: Stopped by for a late breakfast/early lunch.  Delicious Salmon Benedict and fresh coffee.   Would have been perfect if the waitress had EVER checked in with me after depositing my food.   Had to ask someone else for a coffee refill and that still didn't spur her to come by.

nwFraePs2mb_t8Q1FUg0mg.text: Korean shrimp tacos, garlic parm fries, and farmer's market stack were fabulous. Will definitely return to try other items on menu. Our server Katie was prompt and personable.

6foCOBwyuNRq6dX0LXOeAQ.text: Came here because of the good reviews but had a terrible experience!!!  Very poor service and food quality.  Started off with a long time we waited to be greeted. When we were kind of greeted the server wasn't even near the table when she said said "want some waters?" and walked away. My other guest didn't even hear her and she turned away too quickly to even say we actually had other drinks and an appetizer we would like to order. Our server rarely checked on us after that, and only refilled low coffee once the entire meal, and our food didn't come out correct. We waited for an entree to be fixed and we're brought over cooked yet cold food in return nearly 20 minutes later. The food and especially service were some of the worst I've experienced and we will not be returning.

6v3UcpXPtCiKBPS4uCnCuw.text: Me and the husband decided to check it out.  We were hesitant since we had our 10 month old baby with us and the place looked sleek.   I loved the presentation outside with the plants in the pallets.  It sets the tone before you even walk inside.  There's plenty of space on the patio to eat on a beautiful day as well.  A waiter held the door open for us and we were immediately greeted by the owner who sat us at a table.  She was sweet and gave us a quick over of the place and what to expect as far as food goes.   Our waiter Jenna was very nice and attentive.  She explained the menu very thoroughly to us since it was our first time there. She assured us our messy baby was no problem .  I loved that every person working was doing something.  They were either helping other tables or restocking or cleaning.   We ordered the truffle fries to share, husband got the chicken and waffles, and I got the roast beef sandwich.  We also ordered coffee, a cookie, pineapple/coconut pull apart bread (the only one eaten there), pecan sticky bun, and the berry scone.  We were absolutely thrilled with everything we ordered.  The portions were a nice size for the price and quality.  Everything was fresh and full of flavor. We couldn't have been happier.   I also loved the ambiance of the place.  The succulents on every table, the park benches, the wood mixed with metal, and even the light bulbs added character.  It's obvious lots of thought and attention went into all the details.  Even the salt and pepper shakers started a conversation! The only thing I would change is the music.  Beyonce screeching in my ear reminded me I was still in Vegas.   We can't wait to go back!  We've already shared it with a few Facebook groups we're on!  But being military, were always excited to take family and friends to new places far away from the strip whenever they come to visit.

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles!!  The jalapeño syrup is to die for!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Yum!!  Coconut and pineapple pull apart bread!!  The perfect amount of sweetness without becoming a dessert.

9kimuHeQNxx9Xi4RuaFaIA.text: Decor was beautiful. Menu had variety. Server was nice and gave us a pastry when we mentioned it was our first visit.  My carnitas omelet was cold in the center- and the side of toast was dry and cold, not to mention tiny. Should have been included in cost of breakfast. The coffee was almost $3 for a cup, which felt unreasonable for portion size and quality.   All in all way over priced for what was offered, and the quality of the food didn't live up to the decor.

0V6H4XfR6-T_ssIjroq03g.text: This was the first time eating here, I ordered the Salmon Benny & it was delicious! Defiantly a place to try.

k2D60jqN9yrciRE1CQ2hTg.text: We come here every time we visit Vages. It's a ways off the strip but definitely worth the drive! Not only is the food and service is good BUT also the management!  Last few time we've visited Suzanne (I believe she's management if not she should be!) she is not only adorable but super kind and professional. She was informative about the menu item but actually cared if we were enjoying our food. Thanks a bunch! We'll be back!

jUnV8kfYf_bObMo5s3FKeg.text: Everything was good, but not great. At our table we had the Sticky Bun, Short Rib Hash, CK House Burger and the kids Turkey Slider meal.   Sticky Bun - plain, but sweet. Maybe I was expecting the wrong thing. But it was like eating sweetened bread.   Short Rib Hash - the potatoes were really good, the short rib tasted just like beef roast. Comfort food.   CK House Burger - It was cooked well, really juicy. It was missing something though. My pickle wasn't very tangy and I wish I had some fresh onions or something.   Kids Meal- turkey slider was just bread and meat. Nothing at all on it and the meat wasn't very moist.   Overall, the presentation is what grabs you and draws you in! But this isn't a restaurant that would make me say, hey let's go back and try more food!

SazXFr_r1LSSM6X3mpIggQ.text: I'm actually awake at this hour and not working, what is going on?! Well might as well take advantage & try a breakfast/brunch place I've been meaning to try. CRAFTkitchen for breakfast this morning. Sooooo good! Great little local place right before anthem on eastern. I had the red velvet cakes. The berries were so big and fresh!! I'm definitely coming back to try more... If I'm awake.

1IQwD6j9DKq7bA36k3ZSXQ.text: Good food and great service! Luis was great, he dealt with me asking a million questions about my food allergies and went back and forth to the kitchen several times to check with the chefs. They have a vegan menu and many things are gluten-free. I ended up getting the sweet potato hash with some modifications and it was yummy, although my critique of it was that it seemed more like potatoes with a topping of hash, so I would have preferred more of a balance of the ingredients. The other negative was that they served me my juice in a plastic cup even though we were dining in. I hate single-use plastic, why does a sit down restaurant feel the need to use it?!? Other than those two things, the experience was great.

lsqSBGQ4XhVPEc1Nrqokug.text: I really want to like this place but I ALWAYS leave hungry and out about $50.   The freshness, light flavor, close proximity to home is there but they always lack service and portion, I guess. The servers are nice but some thing is just missing.

GQbY9iPjlPE38Js_ZLHeWA.text: I would first like to thank The Chef and owner for inviting us to their gourmet establishment. The cafe/ restaurant looks very upscale, classy, and contemporary. I love everything they had on their menu from appetizers, to entrees, desserts, coffee and wine. I took many pictures to give you guys a visual of how mouth watering each item was to me. I included a picture of the menu they provided. I love the staff on the floor and in the kitchen! They excelled unmatched guest service and relations to their upscale etiquette towards food. Nothing beats welcoming staff members which they made our day much more enjoying as we feasted at our leisure. As a food critic, we held an event here to network and promote Crafts Kitchen's food. Even though we were all over the place, they were patient with us making sure we enjoyed every last bit of our stay. I recommend dining here when you get the chance to drop by Henderson. Hands down fantastic! My pictures say the answers to your questions.

HALH14Hn8STFu66lGh25jw.text: Great food and atmosphere, a lunchtime  favorite that's great for breakfast/brunch, as well!

THNEayqeTK-Dtu79z53LaA.text: Real world food.  Story time:  as a grinder, I spend 3 - 4 months a year in Vegas.  Friends from the City call me a local.  Lke a local, I quickly tire of the Strip, the facade, the fakery, the mistreatment of workers at the hands of inebriated "adults" on their first trip to "Disneyland".  Sometimes you gotta get away.  Enter CRAFTkitchen.  A casual SoCal eatery (you know, micro greens, avocados, side salads).  From the second you walk in, the air perfumed with wonderful aromas, fresh brewing coffee, friendly faces.  The food, vibrant and fresh.  From the Early Hours menu, the braised short rib hash.  Tender braised short rib atop thick cut country fried potato topped with a fried egg and micro greens and dripping in its braising jus.  Break the yolk, mix it up.  Yes.  For something lighter, the smoked salmon.  A fresh toasted bagel with a thin smear of cream cheese, deep fried, crispy capers, beefsteak tomato, shaved onions and a mountain of velvety cold smoked salmon topped by micro beet greens.  Meltingly delicious and the perfect balance of flavors and texture.  From the Mid Hours menu, it's all about the croque monsieur panini.  Thin sliced Niman ranch ham, melted gruyere, creamy bechamel in fresh focacia, crisped in a panini press with a side of mesculine.   Nothing fancy, just good eats.  Finally, do not pass on the pastries.  The basic croissant, near perfect.  Flaky layers of thin, layers around a still moist, "stretch when you pull it" core with a gentle salinity and sweet butter finish.  The sticky bun; just get one, or two, or three.  Large portions.  Reasonable prices.  Very friendly, off Strip service.  Thank you Norm K. for the excellent review that sent me here.  A gem and well worth the drive to Hendertucky.

kkIFXd1yoEaHL_c6bdHfRw.text: My favorite brunch place. The avocado toast is to die for and the food is pretty high quality.

7t-GTPyVv2ZFPwF-kGs17Q.text: Craft Kitchen is a neighborhood cafe and bakery. Committed to all things local and organic and featuring comfort dishes ranging from "Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Short Rib Hash and the Turkey Benny. The bakery also has luscious cakes and mini desserts to sink your teeth into.  I like the stuff they carry on the menu, the Short Rib Hash caught my eye. It's braised short ribs, potatoes, roasted sweet onions and peppers with an egg on top. Simply fabulous, the meat was tender and juicy. Potatoes had a good crisp on them and the egg just held everything together.   The Red Velvet Pancakes was tasteful and pretty, with generous amount of cream cheese spread around. I finished it rather quickly, the portion I think could've been bigger. They have great desserts one in particular is the brownie cookie bar, it's so chewy and chocolaty also it's exquisite with ice cream.    The layout of the place is nice had a delightful and spacious ambiance. I came in around noon it was crowded and I still didn't have to wait to sit down. The staff does a good job providing great service, in particular Vanessa is super friendly it was her suggestion to get the chocolate bar.   Overall, this is a great replacement from the Bread & Butter cafe that used to be there.

Sphja_yebp5wRXLWmJ_tbw.text: This place is much much better than I expected!   The look is very hipster and modern, like a coffee shop.   The food, I ordered the chorizo scramble skillet with a side of bacon. It was a perfect amount to fill me up enough. The chorizo scramble wasn't oily or heavy and it mixed perfectly with the layer of smashed potatoes below. The bacon, extra crispy and not oily as well.  I also shared a cinnamon roll with my partner. The cinnamon roll was light and fluffy. Not to sweet or heavy in the icing either.   Overall I recommend this place for a healthy and gluten free choice if you're ever looking for a place that has tasty and delicious food with out overindulging.

hLL-Qbwcr32dupdl6ggVFg.text: This is one of those hidden gems in Henderson . Located in a busy strip mall, this restaurant is one of my favorite go to places for weekend brunch, or to sneak away for a work lunch. The food is consistently yummy and the staff is consistently courteous, even though they are busier than most eating establishments. I have to admit, I'd love to try everything on the menu, but I am always pulled back to a few items I love, and haven't managed to work my way through the entire menu yet. Plus they feature special menu items I feel like I must try before they are gone! Almost everything I've tried is a "Must try" in my opinion. Give them a try, you won't be disappointed. And if you're down for a really long, relaxing brunch, try the blood orange mimosa.

xMAYYL749-L8fT4M-ymGJA.text: We've been a few times.  Solid brunch spot in Henderson near Anthem. Like the fresh pastries in the front.  Short rib hash is solid.  Nothing is a blow your mind kinda item.  But if your in Henderson looking for brunch you should add this to your list. Sorry no pics to post.

Ath-V5eb2Hdl8ltGgCyI9A.text: I was really excited about the opening of CRAFTkitchen! I am definitely a fan of the cute, modern decor/seating and the beautiful presentation of the food (very instagram-able!).  But unfortunately, I'm not a fan of the small portions and the high price of the dishes.  My friends and I ordered the Short Rib Hash, Beef Sliders, Truffle Fries, and Sweet Potato fries w/ Maple Bacon Aioli.   - Short Rib Hash: I actually wasn't totally in love with this dish as much as other yelpers were! There was a bit too much gravy for my liking. I really liked the tenderness of the braised short ribs though! The smashed potatoes that it came with were good as well but nothing that stands out. I also added a poached egg for $1.75.  - Grass Fed Beef Sliders: I actually preferred the Sliders over the Short Rib Hash!! The plate came with 3 sliders which had pecorino cheese, arugula pesto aioli, carmelized onion on a house-made potato roll. It was delicious!! The only complaint was that my friend ask for his sliders to be cooked medium rare but it seems like that request was ignored unfortunately since the server told us that they were "cooked medium/medium rare anyway". When the dishes came out, the waitress didn't know the cook of it and his sliders ended up being cooked medium instead, much to his disappointment ):   - Fries: The truffle fries were pretty good but I would say the Sweet Potato Fries definitely stands out more with the Maple Bacon Aioli sauce!! The fries + that aioli sauce were probably one of favorite things to eat.   Would I come back to CRAFTkitchen again? It's unlikely. The food was tasty but my friends weren't even full after eating their entrees and sides, despite paying a hefty bill for brunch (~$20-25 each).

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short Rib Hash and Truffle Fries
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Sweet Potato Fries with bacon aioli
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Grass Fed Beef Sliders

_PtIhp4dw_0yxt3bOW0fMw.text: Braised short rib hash plate was delicious. Our server Teresa exceeded my expectations when she split our plates. She didn't need to and she went out of her way to communicate that if we want it split let the server know so they can make it that way. Great vibe and aura. Decor is fabulous. Chai latte was consistent. Will be back for desert.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

DcuT0TNbAoIxZM7_OeFVig.text: Food is good. However not worth 45 min wait. So many empty tables and still have to wait. Service was ok. Last time we will be coming here.

GryTNsIySpc6JI4Os61Q-g.text: Honestly our son came in from out of town, and he's really into eating fit and healthy.  So, we found this place on Yelp and gave them a call about making reservation, and was told that it was not busy so we decided to make the trip and give it a try.  Sure enough it wasn't real busy and we got seated right away even though it was just a little past noon.  Our server greeted us right away and got our drinks (water), and we had a feeling that the price was higher than normal but hopefully the food would be well worth the price.  Well, when our server returned we went and placed our orders.  This place looked cleaned but we were surprised that our food was taking so long as it has been well over a half hour and our server never came back to see how we were doing.    Finally after about 45 minutes someone bought out a salad and hamburger.  Unfortunately no one at our table ordered a burger so the person took it back.  After waiting another 5 minutes surprisingly our food was finally starting to come out.  There were six of us and needless to say with one child I was proud that a 5 year old was able to sit there without screaming and causing a fuss that long.  Well finally everyone got their food except for the one person whom we thought would have gotten her food first, since she only ordered the Acai Bowl.    Someone (not our server) came out to says that they had ran out of coconut, but they could roast another nut and bring it out later.  Really? Btw, during this entire time our server never once came out with any of our food, nor did we see her until everyone was nearly finished.  Only then did she start to come over to see if we needed any boxes, and she did bring us the bill.  Despite the fact that our server was not the best, and we had to wait over 45 mins after placing our order until we finally got our food I felt that maybe she had an off day or she had no control over the kitchen.  Having family member who worked in the restaurnant business I know how tuff it can be so I felt good that I was still able to leave a good tip!   Will I go back?  Not real sure that I what to spend $100 for this type of service no matter how good the food was.  And to be honest it was good, but not great!  Lastly, it was bought to my attention that the women restroom has only one stall, and needless to say when you have to go and there's only one stall, then go into the one stall that's not being used even if it's in the mens restroom!  Ouch!

7GSE3gR9b8xkB2ETx1gyuQ.text: Try the monkey bread (only available on the weekends) but get there early... They sell out fast! Thevcroissant sammy, and then shrimp tacos are amazing too.  The pancakes are mediocre, they're a bit dry and lacking flavor.

7AUO5OkMVSgxkj0rucNcww.text: Food and service was amazing. Definitely recommend to everyone to try. The smashed avocado toast was so good.

WqGL-4EvKdIKIlnOhuEwhA.text: Trendy. A bit "hipster." And a little pricey, but it's not bad! I'd recommend.   Food = 4.5/5 Service = 4/5 Decorations = 5/5 (LOVE IT!)  Overall, this place is pretty cute and a nice addition to Henderson. It's super hipster and the place definitely gives off a trendy-vibe. We got seated quickly, but unfortunately, we had to wait awhile to get our food. This "long-wait" system has happened on two separate occasions. It took us awhile to get our orders in. If they fix it, I wouldn't mind changing this to a "five-star" place because the food is pretty darn good!   We got the Red Velvet pancakes and the Chicken & Waffles (they call it a different name) and these were beyond delicious as entrees. I wish the fried chicken had a bit more seasoning because it tasted a bit bland, but the syrup and waffle, as well as white meat made up for it. The Red Velvet pancakes are great, but I wouldn't just order that as a meal. We ordered a plate for our party to share, which turned out pretty well. I also ordered a side of Truffle fries, which was super delicious. The fries were crispy, thin and just downright amazing.   If you're going to be drinking, I'd also reccomend the bottomless mimosas deal for $16 bucks.

qABJqSfIJ3TE1K_jahAGqA.text: This is probably my favorite place to eat breakfast because they took their time and cooked the food perfectly. The cinnamon roil that I Had was cooked  to perfection it came out warm and delicious

MfycBnAmJocOakkmmDHAPg.text: I'm aware that I ate here for brunch at 11:30am when it's pretty busy and granted, it was father's day.  I expected there to be a wait  since it's understandable to be busy on such a day. Even so,  I am surprised at the horrendous service of our waitress.  We waited about  30min to be seated which I thought was pretty good given the family holiday. Our waitress asked us (a table of two) for our drink orders and then did the same for the table who had just been seated next to us. After we got our drinks, she came by once to refill water and after that, she did not come by our table even once.  She came by the table next to us and kept refilling their mimosas and asking if they needed more water or anything else. Still,  she didn't come and ask us if we needed anything. To make matters worse,  our food order was taken before the table next to us and they ended up getting all their food before us. Fast forward an HOUR later and we finally get our food. We were never given silverware in the hour we were sitting there so I asked the server for some silverware and hot sauce which she immediately got for us. After a while, I wanted a coffee refill but our waitress was still helping other tables except ours so my friend flagged down another waiter and asked for the refill. When my coffee refill came,  I immediately asked for the check,  drank my coffe,  paid,  and left. I still left a tip since I understand a waitress job is still hard work,  but for a waitress to help other tables and not ours for the majority of a meal is horrendous.   I had high hopes for craftkitchen but after this, I will not be dining here ever again.

OnCeaF3fPC8JbQjoAZnHGw.text: Ive been here a few times and I have mixed feelings about this place. So far the couple times ive came I noticed a few positives and negatives. I like to look at the glass as half full so ill start with positives.  1. Service has been good. 2. Outside seating 3.healthy & unhealthy options 4. Deserts are good  now for the not so positive.  1. Serving sizes are small. 2. Food is a bit to pricey especially for the amount of food. 3. Food doesn't really come with sides. Sides are another 5 bucks or so when normal breakfast/ brunch places gave sides.   This is place is more of a cafe in my eyes. Don't come here hungry. Come here for more of a hangout during down time, its a mice spot for that. So far the food i have tried is good. However I feel like I don't really get what I pay for and leave unsatisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggs benny

n6OMS7tZ3WJOcxQC9WNZoQ.text: Came in today around 1 PM to have lunch with my boyfriend. I loved the rustic decor and that their patio is dog friendly! Each table had a different center piece that my boyfriend pointed out which I thought was a nice touch.   I ordered the short rib hash with a poach egg on top, and he had a breakfast burrito.  My hash was super yummy, my boyfriend was alittle jealous of it ;) he said the burrito was good and was happy with the salsa that came on the side. Our servers were nice and fast, the food was hot and yummy, and we were seated in a cute booth. We will be back (boyfriend said he wants to get the hash)

CYo7GYi1wnETUYel7vjPQQ.text: My boyfriend and I stop in from time to time. The staff is always so friendly and accommodating. We have never had a bad meal here. This is the kind of place where your face will be remembered and it will you leave feeling satisfied. It's obvious that the owners pride themselves on good service and excellent cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. The Red Velvet pancakes are to die for.

xODQzeqi40fLTFkd1MCYEg.text: Love the little trendy restaurant. Let me start off with their pastries!!! Cinnamon roll will not disappoint, trust me you'll thank me later! Croissant sandwich is delicious and their sweet potato fries are on point but if you don't care for salty too much I would definitely as them to omit it or be easy with the salt. The chorizo burrito is huge and tasty but not something I'd crave. Their minestrone soup is delicious and their salads always look amazing even though I've never had them. Red velvet pancakes with their sauce are pretty bland so those are a no go for sure. They offer mimosas and beer which is awesome for your brunch needs! They also have a protein fix option which is super delicious with their homemade turkey sausage patties egg whites spinach micro greens and tomatoes BUT I'd say their price point for breakfast in a local strip mall is a little pushing the pricey side for sure. Good food AMAZING pastries. Worth the stop for a coffee and pastry fix!

zdtuLfXDF4ToJps-U92-Qw.text: My favorite breakfast spot ever. Avocado toast or quinoa cakes are the best. Plus all coffees come with a mini biscotti!

tFwQm1cAmB_x0sYv-MiSVA.text: My sister-in-law and I tried this place for brunch and it was pretty delicious. We wanted to try a bunch of things so we ended up sharing everything. The service from out waitress was on point, super friendly with a smile from ear to ear. We ordered smashed avocado toast, kimchee tacos, crab cake Benedict, coconut chia pudding & kids grilled cheese with truffle fries. The waitress did warn us about the avocado toast that it tends to be a lot of avocado and not enough toast so she offered to bring us more toast if we needed it (definitely recommend getting the extra toast). The kimchee tacos were delicious, not spicy or overpowering in taste. Crab cake Benedict was delicious, that was the first thing I started on so I ate the whole thing haha. The coconut chia pudding was light and perfect amount of sweetness. Although with everything we ordered we enjoyed the truffle fries the best! It came with my son's order with the grilled cheese and let me tell you they were on point!! If you're a fries lover (and I mean come on who isn't) then you'll want to for sure try their truffle fries!

jGlVRfxmPXkWLDsif5_acw.text: 3 stars for the sole reason they didn't have hot sauce.   WHAT KIND OF RESTAURANT DOESN'T HAVE HOT SAUCE?!!!???   All they have is home-made salsa for $0.75 and NO HOT SAUCE. No I am not paying for salsa tyvm.

bJyWAizfuuM1VynZt87h8Q.text: Good stuff I are the squash hash with turkey  added with a side of  grits. All gluten free  I enjoyed every flavorful bite. Very clear tasting and not overly seasoned. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

65WlBX87kWW33HtZAe2CoQ.text: My new favorite spot! I love the fact that they have different menus accommodating vegans & weekend specials!! They also have an amazing selection of pastries including a ridiculous vegan blueberry scone that was one of the best & one of the best black & white cookies I've ever had!  The breakfast selections range from veggie toast to skillets & my favorite the breakfast burrito! The mushrooms on the veggie toast were perfect, my niece who only likes mushrooms on certain things ate them all! The breakfast burrito has an entire chili relleno in it, & you can get the soy chorizo if you don't like the pork option! It was so good I've ordered it twice already! The crab cake benedict on the weekend brunch menu was AMAZING! So fresh & perfectly seasoned, also a huge portion! The monkey bread was the best I've had in town for sure! A friend got the chorizo skillet & another the Cuban sandwich in different visits, both of them loved their food! The Cuban sandwich got a little soggy in the middle if it sits, but even than was gone! The staff is also happy to be there & on top of almost everything! We waited a bit our 1st visit, but there was an event & a photoshoot happening so it was understandable. I will drive the 25-30 mins & Wait the longer wait time on weekends for this amazing place! Can't wait to try lunch!!

rpkiZNtD03VlVsE0Z7nHPQ.text: Had an amazing early dinner date with my love at his place. Great ambience and food!  Can't wait to get back. We went to their Friday early dinner happy hour.
