K_4RqyPj92RFkYTnaMv6iw.text: Love this place and the food! The last 2 times I've been here, they have no servers.  The wait was an hour or longer and I'm looking at 6 to 7 empty tables. I ask the hostess why the wait with all the tables and they said there's no servers to attend to the tables.  So we left! Won't be back for a while, hopefully they can get some staff.

iJm_yuLkvJ2EQMujrH0i3A.text: Love love this place! Fresh delicious food with a great atmosphere. The service is friendly and efficient. We will be back soon.

iE6_3ww9JZ5GuARbKy3ExA.text: NEVER DINE AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT. TERRIBLE SERVICE. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER COMMUNICATION SKILLS. What a waste of an establishment. The food might be okay here but you would never know due to the extreme lack of customer service skills. Their hosts and managers (Sunday AM) have such a lack of care for the customer. I would NEVER recommend anyone come to dine here unless they completely replace their front of house staff. We made a BIRTHDAY RESERVATION for 15 PEOPLE a week ahead of time, had confirmation over the phone, and then were simply told it didn't exist when we called to amend the reservation to 12 people. "Nicole" the Monday manager (when the reservation was made) acted as if she didn't know the reservation existed. The Sunday manager explained that they take no reservations for Sunday and if they did they would have had our credit card info. Seems like Nicole forgot everything. After the frustration of finding out our reservation was never made official by this joke of an establishment we were told "well you could show up and see" with 12 people. The cop out of the front of house on this situation was complete bs. They knew that a reservation was made, most likely booked extra people, and then did not honor it. Show up and see? Lol I'll never try this place again. Hopefully the back of house finds a manager that knows how to treat guests properly and hosts that use their brains enough to remember a BIRTHDAY RESERVATION. NEVER DINE AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT. TERRIBLE SERVICE. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER COMMUNICATION SKILLS.

bBLxlA-5mMpjh_UbMmsdIg.text: This place was excellent, I found out about this place through a friend and decided to experience it myself. I love anything red velvet and when I tried their velvet pancakes, it was heavenly!! Also to side it with the hot chocolate ( which was very rich ) , was even better.  for pricing I say isn't that bad but you get what you pay for. Overall , this is certainly not your average breakfast/ brunch place. It has a very unique and significant difference, especially the ambiance that's very earthy and subtle. I loved the succulent wall piece as well. Although one thing I could complain would be the chicken and waffles, I had it sit out a bit since my friends and I ordered quite a lot and I tasted spicy waffles instead of sweet. I noticed it was because they garnished the plate with jalapenos for the chicken. And the syrup was quite messily plated and caught on that spicy jalapeno flavor with it as well and it was really weird . But aside from that, good service, great food and will come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and what?, fries, red velvet pancakes with cream cheese, baked bread with chocolate inside and stuffed portobello sliders.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Eye catching succulent wall! Creates earthy and cool depth to the ambiance.

uBDVX9qphS6NbUmeCkrAcQ.text: Amazing! We ordered quite a bit and every single thing was 5/5. The French press coffee was delicious. Pancakes of the day were lemon blueberry mascarpone, Wow! The most fluffy and moist pancakes ever! The chilaquiles were great, very fresh! We also had the salmon on a pretzel bun, also amazing and truffle fries, yum! Service was great, owner came by to say hello. All around great experience!

UnGQQ53VliQem1fwscLuJA.text: Ok, one of my favorite things to see is a busy restaurant. That means that they are usually doing something right. Well, Sunday morning, CRAFTkitchen was very busy. We had a bit of a wait, but that was fine. The place was buzzing with energy and a great vibe. When we were seated, we figured out the reason why they were so busy. The food was amazing, but our server, Erica R. was absolutely incredible. She helped us with the menu and questions. We loved the Monkey Bread and the Smoked Salmon and the Crab Benedict. Everything was perfectly prepared and we noticed other tables really enjoying their food also. We were just amazed at how Erica was flawless in her service. She was busy and had several tables, but you wouldn't have known it. She was always there, at exactly the right times. She was so kind and bubbly, it made for a lovely brunch. We will be back to enjoy the fabulous food, for sure, but it's Erica that we will truly remember. She's the real MVP. :-)

fmAxTrz5jqaQJFVd3u4ePw.text: Brunch was delicious and the service was great! I loved the crab Benedict! Also tried a few of their desserts. The lemon curd dessert was really good. Did not really like the black and white cookie.

ZN51CPOnhTOiGUqJEhWe0w.text: Devon is the best hands down. He's your to go guy at this place. Excellent personality and knows how to take care of his customers. The food is great and we'll worth the price my favorite is the CK Breakfast Burrito with the green salsa. Sooo good. It is definitely worth a try!

8FZMMZkJH3ewZQolq73vrA.text: I've been here twice.  Service is efficient and friendly. Food is excellent. Fresh, with a nod to high quality ingredients.  Most restaurants don't pay attention to the quality of the ingredients, but that is what separates fair/good from excellent. You're only as good as what you start with.   This place is excellent. The pastries are excellent.   I had the butternut squash soup today and it was tasty, not too salty and flavorful. Loved the fresh sage garnish.    Need to come back here for a bottle of wine and a cheese tray!    My new neighborhood hang!  PS - service is a bit weak. The girl that's the hostess is not qualified. Come in three tables empty. Ten minutes to sit down.  It's happened on three occasions.  Management needs to train the employees better and oversee them better, too.   If you get a coffee, at a table, I bet they don't bring sugar or cream. It happens every time.   Food is great, but the more you come back, the more service warts you start to see and the more they get under your skin.

z33xsB7U7JQDV2dYGR7QMw.text: I have been wanting to check this place out for a while. Their dinner pics on Instagram are fantastic! However, on this visit I was enjoying their breakfast.  We were seated right away even though half our party was running a little behind which I appreciated since most places make you wait.   They have 3 flavors of mimosas. Blood Orange, Pomegranate, & ???. And, you can enjoy one for $8 or go bottomless for $16. I went with a single blood orange. It was a pretty color and I liked the glass, but I would have appreciated more orange flavor. I debated switching to the pomegranate and soldiering on, but I went the responsible route and ordered a coffee. I have to say, the coffee was a bit strong for my taste, but of you're a Starbucks fan you'll probably love it.  For entrees, I had the Breakfast Sammy which is basically a bacon, egg, & cheese croissant. My husband had the Short Rib Hash. Our friends had the Smoked Salmon Sandwich & the Carnitas Omelette.  My breakfast sandwich was a little bit small, but cooked to perfection. I prefer my bacon crispy rather than chewy which it was. The croissant was flaky and buttery. Egg was over hard. And, cheese was ooey & gooey. It came with a good sized salad topped with a few house made chips. I'd probably order it again on my next breakfast visit.  My husband loved the Short Rib Hash, but we felt like it wasn't actually a "hash". It was shredded meat over some smashed potatoes. Delicious, but not a hash in the traditional sense. He opted to add a poached egg on top, too.  Our friends enjoyed their selections as well!!  This place is a bright, clean, and really cute breakfast spot. However, the standout for me on this visit was our exceptional server, Jeffrey. He had at least 4 tables of 4 people and was charming and attentive to every single one of them. It was one of those flawless experiences where the server is there every time you need them, so you want for nothing and never feel neglected...and at the same time, they aren't hovering or being annoying. Every server everywhere should take a lesson!!   We split our check and the tip with our friends...and Jeffrey's service was so exceptional I asked my husband if he had any cash so we could leave him extra.  I, also, noticed the manager checking in with each table. I wish we hadn't been so into our conversation because I usually make a point of alerting management to good service experiences when they stand out, but I didn't.  This was one of the best dining experiences I have had this year! Now, more than ever, I am excited to try their dinner menu!!

k2nhwiKa3FNWGjS7hhVM6g.text: Vegas native but Bay Area student.  I haven't seen a lot of restaurants in Henderson with such fresh ingredients like CRAFTkitchen.  Had the protein plate for breakfast because I wanted to make a somewhat healthy choice  I loved the seasoning of the homemade turkey patty, which the juicy cherry tomatoes complemented well!  Baked goods are a must to-go grab. Personal fan of the chocolate chip cookie

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Great &#34;brunch&#34; ambiance, spacious but with cozy seating areas
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Protein plate

S9jRqmyOUOnaarJ7pOisjw.text: This place is wonderful , especially if you can eat outside if the weather permits. Everything is made with healthier ingredients . The Waitress Tracy ?! Was super on point and very nice.  The Cuban Sandwich is better than what you get in an actual Cuban restaurant around here. They make eggs in detailed and high end ways that make them "special". Some of the desserts are small but they are perfect! The taste is quality all the way. CraftKitchen is a fine restaurant to check out and meet with friends and family. I would give it five stars but some items are pricey. But again better ingredients so it makes sense.  Recommended!

EuBYWGWbAdvI8MAbWH7JdA.text: Decided to give this place another try. We sat outside since we had our two littles. I love the kids menu. I think they offer great value with the kids meals. My daughter had red velvet pancakes and it was SO good and a big serving. My husband got the chicken and waffles. He thought it was ok, just a bit overcooked so the chicken strips were pretty dry. I ordered the Cuban sandwich and didn't enjoy it at all. Nothing like a real Cuban, which was to be expected, but their version misses the mark. We may return again to try more items on the menu, but so far half of what we've tried has been fantastic and the other half has been less than satisfactory, so we'll see.

tYIMPutvzrS7ogH7y95_DQ.text: I have this love/hate relationship with yelp's "Hot and New." It's almost always a guaranteed fail at service, but for the most part the general feel of the restaurants offerings can be gaged. Most Hot and New restaurants are just OK. And sometimes, like today, the find is exciting and worth the prolonged wait for food & drinks!  We arrived shortly after noon for brunch. Mind you, we were all STARVING!  I was hesitant to try a new spot this morning based on how hAngry I was even before arriving!  Apple maps even took us past the address, made us make a u-turn, and landed us at NOTHING.  Something is wrong with the Apple maps idea of this address, so use Waze when venturing to this new local eatery.  If you're familiar with this side of town, it's located behind Osaka before you hit Sunridge Heights.   Upon entering, we were greeted with the comforting smell of coffee and pastries.  Yum!   They really need a hostess stand outside or closer to the door.  We weren't the only group that walked in kind of confused about whether we seat ourselves, or need to be seated. After about a minute of standing around, a nice young girl scurried over to us (I guess we really looked confused).  She offered to seat us and asked us where we would like to sit. We opted for a table outside.  The weather today is PERFECT!  She gave us menus and a kids menu for Chloe.  No crayons for the coloring kids menu tho. Maybe an oversight?   We were immediately greeted by our server, Kevin. He took our drink order, then recited the specials to us.  We asked for his personal favorites (our favorite question at a new place). He recommended the Short Ribs w/an added poached egg on top, and the smashed avocado toast. We ended up taking his recommendation on the Short Ribs w/a poached egg and got the Croissant Sammy to split.  The little one ordered the waffles & fruit off of the kids menu. To drink, waters all around, 2 coffees and a decaf mocha.   Our waters came out quick, but the coffee drinks all took a while. I think the server should have explained that their coffee is brewed per cup, therefore takes about 10 minutes to come out (probably based on other customers who probably ordered before us).  The coffee is bold, tastes like an Americano it's so strong. It also has a light foam at the top.  I definitely think they need to tell their coffee story somewhere.  If I didn't ask about the coffee after our 2nd cup came out (and took just as long as the 1st cup), we wouldn't have appreciated how good the coffee was.  A little briefing on the coffee story makes the wait worth it, and somehow even tastes better!    About 10 minutes after our server took our order, another server showed up and said "welcome to Craft Kitchen, are you guys ready to order?" We explained we had already ordered, and thanked him for checking on us.  A little disorganized, but that's ok. At least he was the 2nd waiter to try to take our order. Lol.   When our food finally arrived to the table, we were all so hungry, we didn't really talk much. We devoured each dish, leaving no crumbs behind.  The braised short ribs were cooked to perfection. Zero complaints.  I make a pretty good braised short rib dish and it's rare I find one that blows mine away.  However, Craft Kitchen's version kicked my little homemade version's ass.  Bravo!    The croissant Sammy was nothing to write home about, but the salad that came out with it was amazing.  It had these little potato chips on the salad that tasted homemade.  Yum!   Chloe's kids waffle meal was the perfect size. 3 small waffles served with berries & maple syrup.  Being in restaurants myself, I know how pricey maple can be, so I do recommend they pull back on the serving size of the syrup. She hardly used half of the syrup they gave her.  I cringed at the waste. Eek!   Our bill was just below $50 before tip.   A bit pricey for brunch, but honestly for the freshness of the ingredients and quality of the meal, this was expected.    As we were leaving I visited the pastry case to see what I could take home!  We got a small bag of assorted cookies ($4.95). Honestly I expected them to be better, but I'm not mad about the purchase.    After drooling over the other items in the pastry case, we decided to talk to the pastry chef Katie about ordering a pumpkin cheesecake for Thanksgiving.  She took our info down and will be contacting us later this week about our size options & pricing!  Yay!    Overall, this place WOWed me.  The service wasn't horrible, but it can definitely be improved.  None of the staff really offered info about their concept until we asked questions.  I think their pricing, wait times, and menu can be understood better with even a brief explanation of their ingredient sourcing.  It adds value to the experience.  I look forward to dining at Craft again!  I think this place can only get better if they stay True to their purpose!

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib hash with a poached egg

jCHZUGRcm9CWBLBZ5iy-xg.text: Went for brunch yesterday with my siblings. The server got my brother's order slightly wrong by bringing sausage instead of bacon . Shortly after my sister took a bite from her farmer's stack and found a long hair that was weaved through her food . As for me, I had the Turkey Benny. The meat was dry, the Hollandaise sauce was oddly sweet, and there was quite a bit of avocado sauce on there (making it overwhelming) .   Don't get me wrong, I get it ....hair happens but not when you have a restaurant.  The manager was kind  and took care of us after that but we were just over it at that point .

pMOA1xoV3sNQEK2h78Yo_w.text: I really love this place. The attention to detail is everywhere from the decor, to the menu, to the coffee beans. A very clean, modern, hipster joint with an ever changing menu packed with yummy goodness. The first time I was in here, I just came in for a coffee but it was hard not to try something from menu. It was heartbreaking when 346 Patisserie closed and my family feared that was the end of classic French style baking in Henderson. Thankfully, this gem opens up just in time and delivers beautiful, imaginative baked goods. The Owners make themselves known in the dining room and are well trained with impressive resumes and I feel dining here you can clearly see the vision they have.   The service is exceptional. Well trained, enthusiastic staff who work the best hours on the planet (7am-3pm). I would recommend this place for a girls lunch, a decadent breakfast or impressing your out of town guests. You can bring the four legged family members for patio dining. If you do anything, try the desserts but work out at the gym an extra day to make up for it ;)

MtnWZcTc2JBZXNV-SQ6R2A.text: We called in here yesterday for breakfast and we were not disappointed. I had the smashed avocado toast with a poached egg on top and it was the best avocado toast I have ever had. Full of flavour and the egg perfectly poached. I would highly recommend Craft Kitchen.

muUoyb0BcpmLMjy-EyA8PA.text: Had a holiday party here for lunch - I love that they have a big enclosed room with 1 large table - perfect for a little privacy (we were kinda loud!) and for groups.  Short Rib Hash - meat so tender, melt in your mouth. Smashed potatoes perfectly crisp on outside, but still fluffy inside. Massive portion for lunch.  Truffle Fries - Okay, these were the stars of the meal. I've had my share of truffle fries, always disappointed because the fries would be too oily (restaurant would drizzle with truffle oil), too salty or the restaurant would smother the truffle fries with Parmesan - which is fine, except sometimes I really want to taste the truffle....not parm. CRAFTkitchen's truffle fries are a must-try. Golden brown crisp without a hint of greasiness. Truffle flavor without being overpowering. Perfectly salted. The crispy bits at the bottom of the bowl were the best. Small portion though -- if someone asks you to share, tell 'em to get their own.   My friend had a caprese salad with more salad. She turned around to talk with another friend and I stole the rest of her salad. The greens were perfectly dressed with a homemade vinaigrette. I love when chefs dress salads lightly, so you can actually taste the baby lettuces.  Mimosas - I had 5 of them. Okay, maybe 7. But we stayed there for 3 hours.  Cookies - Even though the chef is a pastry chef, I don't recommend their cookies. I bought 6 cookies to take home - 2 gingerbread (the cookies were so hard that when you bit in, I thought the gingerbreadman was knocking my teeth out), 2 chocolate chip & 2 chocolate chocolate chip. These were rock hard as well. They tasted like last week's cookies and sounded like you were crunching on concrete. One bite of each and the rest went uneaten by my kids and husband. If those sugarholics didn't like the cookies, then they were pretty bad.   So, 5 stars to this restaurant for the food (and mimosas) and I'm going to forget the cookies ever happened.

6dK-k-5QVOub1OOgH68fWA.text: Short review: This place is fantastic! Great food! Great service! Beautiful interior! Bad acoustics.   I really really wish I had taken food photos while I was here because it was beautiful to look at and beautiful to eat. I ordered the Korean street tacos and they are out of this world amazingly good! They got gobbled up before I could even think of getting pictures...next time.   And I finally get very solid kimchi and it's not even from a Korean restaurant... thank my lucky stars I thought it would never happen here in Vegas.   The waitress who's name I forget at the moment was super nice, patient, and informative. The interior was pretty and had some awesome looking decorations. The only bad drawback of this place is the way it's laid out for sound design. It's hard to talk to people while you're in there, because you can hear every conversation in the room and it's very loud. A group of young men a few tables behind me were so loud volume-wise that I was getting a headache every time they all got excited about whatever and laughed and joked.   But beyond that I'm looking forward trying everything else on the menu since so far this place is great!

2JyfTzu4lgQAWE3ka94ofQ.text: Best Breakfast/Brunch/Lunch place in Vegas...hands down!  I highly recommend the Craft Kitchen.  Food never disappoints and service is amazing. If you are within 25 or 30 miles you must visit for a snack, a meal or even a coffee. Love love love this place! JP and the rest of the servers make you feel like you are part of the family

4RELagn1EKvhXaXSSBNX1A.text: With warm anticipation, a new breakfast/lunch venue has opened in South Henderson on Eastern near St Rose.  With a fair amount of neighboring competition, it seems as though the aim to differentiate is towards locally sourced, organic ingredients...important to some, if you're into that sort of thing ;)  Starting off with the Croissant Sammy: Thick Applewood Smoked Bacon, Sharp Cheddar & Over-Hard Egg. Excellent sandwich, perfectly crispy bacon on a golden buttery pastry!  This was very enjoyable, fair portioned and memorable.  Pulled Turkey Benny: Charred Tomatoes, Avocado, Poached Egg & Citrus Hollandaise. Nice presentation, could fare well with a bacon bit or added crunch for texture, piled high of turkey, with a creamy avocado.  The underlying citrus is welcomed.  Citrus & Crab: Lump Crab, Avocado Puree, Baby Lettuce, Fingerling Chips & Champagne Vinaigrette. Very good, lettuce-cup-like in presentation with a fair amount of shredded crab and citrus. A bit difficult to eat with a fork, I just ate them like lettuce cups with my hands...hope you guys don't mind, I'm not shy around the dinner table :P  And finishing off with the Sliders: Grilled Onion, Cheese, Greens on a Whole Wheat Bun. Juicy, served medium rare, yet in need of an aioli / mayo to soften the doughy/yeasty wheat breading.  I'm a bit of a burger/slider snob, but it's almost there!  I was told that a lot of the menu is going under final revisions, subject to ingredient tweaks and adjustments.  I think the direction is spot on, and would love to revisit to venture further into the diverse menu selections.  Recommended!

CRhL73AQ5yPAfwHhHkvm9g.text: Major props to craft kitchen. Great environment to meet up with friends for brunch.I ordered the short rib hash ! It was fantastic. Service was great. Presentation of the food was phenomenal. Our party ordered a variety of things and all of the menus items looked to beautiful to eat. Also his is a great place for people with dietary restrictions like gluten free or vegan folks out there. Our waiter listened to the parties concerns and was able to make suggestions to accommodate those special dietary needs. I highly recommend! I drove across town to try them out ! It was well worth it

IRQgoPSAlc8JIA1UCFDslA.text: About a 30 minute wait is typical for the CraftKitchen brunch. There's about 8 tables outside, perfect for the nice weather and/or dog friendly venue. Bottomless mimosas at $16 and meals under $15. Food is tasty but very neighborhood quality. For instance, they had no tobacco sauce or other hot sauce, only 'in house salsa' which they charge you for. The food otherwise was very filling but I noticed the poached egg on my Benedict was very overdone and the mimosas were very slow service-wise. We ordered a turkey Benedict and vegetarian omelet, with a side of fries. Besides my complaints, the food was fantastic and perfect for any weekend brunch or weekday breakfast/brunch. The pomegranate mimosa was actually fantastic and perfect for a leisure few hours to chill and talk in Henderson. In Yolanda our meal cost just under $70 for 2 entrees, 2 bottomless mimosas, and a side of large fries. Prices were reasonable and the fact that they had a dog friendly seating makes it worthwhile. There are better food locations in Summerlin or strip, but CraftKitchen is fantastic for a neighborhood boozy weekend brunch.

L53NmNRnq6sCjWTFXFqZeg.text: The wait list said 30 min, after an hour we left.  The bad part was that we counted 9 non-kitchen staff mostly milling about, drying coffee mugs, wrapping forks and knives with napkins or just talking.  There was at least one open table and several on the patio that we asked to sit at, but were told the seating was based on servers not tables, but the staff didn't look busy at all.  Once seated the food is pretty good, and they don''t rush you, which can make it nice and we would have been happy with slow service  They need to figure out how to manage the flow better because to all those waiting with us, it wasn''t a good experience looking at anyone's face.

uD4vy1Rj6yqqpo5TvAaDGg.text: Love the food and service here! Always a solid experience. Chicken n WHAT is my favorite!

8h-Uj18mz1bNTJxp6Ezfug.text: Didn't get to try the food since the hostess skipped us and turned our 10 minute wait into 45. We approached her and her response was "Oops"  Even from the beginning we walked up to the hostess table and after silence for 30 seconds she greets with an annoyed "what's up."   Highly unprofessional. I wonder now if the chefs are as unprofessional as the staff.   Very disappointed. I was looking forward to trying this place, food looked great online. Not sure if it tastes great tho.   Will try again and retract this comment if staff is professional.  This happened Sunday, 10/14/2018 at 11:30am.

QfmzBvBfZKgTVLtjn71tLg.text: Literally our favorite place in Henderson for brunch or lunch. There's usually a wait and that's okay-it's worth it. Love Craft and looking forward to being back this weekend. It's been two weeks and that's too long.

6rBTDcpSnlt_MI05w3yt5A.text: Overheard our waitress apologize to the table next to us for the delay in their food.  Offered a free pastry for their troubles.  That was a nice gesture, she definitely went the extra mile.  It shows that they know how to treat their customers right.  But enough with their customer service, let's talk about the food.  I've been here enough to say that I've tried most of their dishes.  My "go to" order is the burrito and churro waffles...need I say more??    The burrito has a spicyness to it so I wouldn't recommend if you can't handle a little heat.  But the churro waffles...omg...is to die for!!

Q2Xn5SBR8wbeNUhmQQt0KQ.text: If only I could give this place 10 stars!! I keep saying this, but I think I've found THE BEST brunch spot in Vegas! I can't believe it took me this long to give this place a try. Although I blame it on the location, a little far from me. But I would come here a million more times if I could! They have indoor and outdoor seating but the outdoor is just kind of right in front of parking spots, I personally wouldn't sit outside. I came with a party of 4 on Saturday brunch and got seated within 15 minutes.   I was debating between the salmon benny. Or the crab benny (seasonal). Unfortunately, they ran out of crab benny so I opted for salmon. I also got the blood orange mimosa which was super tasty! I'm a huge fan of eggs benedicts, it's a dish that sets my rating for any brunch place. I must say, their salmon benny was one of the best! It was the perfect portion and I devoured that plate in 10 minutes.   I cannot wait to come back to try more. Their food was good and customer service was excellent. I highly recommend this place! I'm tempted to go again, next week.

07QT_XdTUvl48aPtZWo2hA.text: Ambiance was great, and interiors were beautiful!  The food was not good, and very overpriced!  I ordered a mimosa, and it was not good. Do not get the bottomless one, I repeat, do not get the bottomless one!  I ordered Eggs Benedict, but my salmon was falling to pieces and fishy (which means it's been frozen and defrosted a couple of times), and one of the eggs in my Eggs Benedict was overcooked. It was kind of like a hard boiled yolk. Lol  The Strawberry and Mango Macaroon was not good either. It was chewy, and did not crumble like a macaroon shell would.

xn1pvVTjMxvpYAbcAjoOaQ.text: This is the third time I've visited Craft. All three times the wait time to be seated was over 40min. 10 tables open total inside and outside. The waiting list create a log jam because of so many cancellations and no shows. That it sacrifices the service of those waiting to be seated. The staff has no urgency with a lack of awareness of what's going in the front of the Resturant. Tables left uncleaned with customers waiting to be seated. Once we sat down the serve took 5 mins to bring us our menus. Customers waiting with staff standing around isn't the service customers want to see. All three visits the food didn't disappoint. But the service in the beginning doesn't do the Resturant justice. I'm not sure we will come back a forth time.

Dr6PM6N2BW2cM7xz8YL2hA.text: Healthy food made with flavor. This is a cool lunch spot in Henderson. I love the decor it is trendy and the wait staff is friendly. I had the pork benedict and it was light and flavorful.

StqRakTX-l_yPaLNXUXLtw.text: Delicious food if you want to wait 2 hours to eat!   The only reason I'm writing this review is because they are so unorganized!!!  There was three tables out side and about 4 inside that were empty and cleared and they were taking more names but not seating people.  They said 20 min wait we waited about an hour.   The other thing too was all the employees were dragging there feet and not really rushing around for being so busy.   Sucks because I really liked this place

A-v1aPcmVVikAdEIEsLVKw.text: What a lovely little lunchy brunchy spot. I had my mom in town and we wanted to grab a sweet little cafe lunch during a day full of errands. I whipped out my yelp app and based on reviews decided to choose CRAFTKitchen! I am so happy we did! We were warmly greeted, and seated promptly. The feeling of this joint is so warm and fun. Our waitress was fabulous from the moment she seated us. My mom got the French dip sandwich which came recommended to her by our server, while I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap off of the VEGAN MENU (that's right, they have a vegan menu!!!!.)  As a vegetarian/ naughty (because I don't always follow the vegan rules) vegan- I always get so excited when restaurants have options for us vegg heads! Ok ok- back to the food.   The french dip looked divine. My mom raved over and over how delicious it was. It came with a side salad that she said was equally as delicious. She mentioned that the sandwich was so fantastic by itself that she didn't even need to dip it in the gravy. I think the True game changer is that the bread used for the sandwiches is made in house.   We did order truffle fries for the table. They were okay- but I will probably sacrifice the fresh breath for garlic parm fries next time.   I got the buffalo "chicken" wrap off of the vegan menu. I was blown away at how great the texture was of the "chicken." The wrap was delicious. It came with a buffalo sauce in the wrap that was FIREY hot! Thankfully i enjoy spice- but if you are slightly sensitive to spicy foods I would ask for it on the side. There were a few times I had to take a couple of deep breaths and a sip of water! Anyways- it was super yummy, and I can't wait to go back so I can eat it again!   We finished our lovely little lunch with a blueberry lemon scone and 2 vanilla lattes!  The coffee was delicious and the scone was absolutely heavenly.  I would recommend this spot to anyone for family brunch, dates, or just a bite to eat with your girlfriends or buddies. Overall really pleased with my experience

UOFqpc6v7dHx9etMLZ1NMA.text: We went on a Sunday during brunch time and it was very crowded. 20-25 minutes wait. Rightfully so; as the food was very good and flavorful. The service was a bit slower but I chick that up to the day and time we were there. They have a lot of veg options as well. Pastries are out of this world! Would definitely go again.

tO7Eu62PKoY-VZi5Jp1i6A.text: It was our first time here and it will not be our last! The food was awesome!!!! We sat outside on the patio, which is dog friendly BTW!! Service was just ok. Very slow service, got bottomless mimosas, but the server was never there to give us another one. But was Mother's Day, they were very busy, so it's sort of understandable about the service. The monkey bread is a must!!! The management apologized for the service and gave us a discount, which was very nice!

They were kind and didn't charge me. I've been here often with friends and family and they had issues too. None were severe, just seems the kitchen may need to step up their game a bit.

MkJwDCdNYYQC5XQ-jyUlAw.text: Wonderful place with great service & good food. My Short Rib was so good. A customer sitting at the next table recommended it & it was the best.

SWubD1CmgKWqhfqSqJbmkA.text: First thing first: home made pop tart. I repeat. Home. Made. Pop tart. Ok, now lets move on to  the rest. There is something for everyone.  Vegan? Got ya. Like meat? Covered. Breakfast lover? Two words: churro waffles. Desserts? Oh hell yeah. Staff is excellent, service fast. Healthy choices, the avocado tacos were excellent. Tempura style avocado, black bean puree on corn tortillas, just tasty. Organic chicken over my ceasar salad was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. A great eatery in Henderson.

4jTYfZvLAVLVUd7TCVjtWA.text: If you are a foodie and looking for something off the strip CRAFTkitchen is your spot!  You cannot go wrong with any thing on the menu there.  They have great imagination and creativity with their menu items.  I recommend the there pancakes which are light and fluffy.  When i was there i had the funfetti B Day Cake Pancakes which was off the charts.  My second recommendation would be the Churro Style Waffles.  These tiny waffles pack a punch with cinnamon and sugar.  I just wished there was more because they were so good!  If you are looking for a solid out of the box breakfast check out CRAFTkitchen.  BrandonFitFoodie

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Funfetti B Day Batter Pancake

RYf2WFhehK6eNHW6nH8Jlg.text: Today was my first time at CRAFTkitchen.  First of all, next time I go I'm definitely making reservations. And you should too if you don't want to wait an hour for a seat.   I ordered a little bit of everything (off the Vegan menu of course).  They had a great variety of menu items for both Vegan and non-Vegan.   For Starters we ordered :  * Plain FF.  Well done.  And those were good.   Not too salty.  Good price.  & Skinny; how I like em!  * Vegan Chili Cheese FF.  It came w/a hefty serving of fries, & not enough chili on top + cilantro.  The ratio here was off, but also, the chili itself was a bit too dry and should've been warmer, enough to drip all the way to the bottom (in my opinion.)  Menu Items :  * Vegan Chilaquiles. These were great!  I loved that subtle hint of lime crema.  But the only down side here was that their Vegan Chicken. It had nearly no flavor at all.  I'd have preferred more char and seasoning on these for that extra $4.95.  * Vegan Farmers Market Stack. I loved this dish.  It was hard to argue with it's complexity.  It had a good texture and overall flavor.  If I had to add anything I'd recommend a sauce drizzle over the smashed potatoes.  Besides that I would definitely order again.   Dessert :  * Vegan Cinnamon Bun.  Good it was a bit naked.  It needed more cinnamon sugar between the rolls and  I would've liked icing too.   * Pineapple Pannacotta.  This was amazing!  I wouldn't change a thing.  Definitely get this one!  * Lemon Tart.  Not Vegan.  I wouldn't order this again.  It had a very strong egg flavor.  Kinda gross.  All in all I would come back. There's such a variety of menu items & I'd like to try them all!

crqnGrxLry6I4ZZPL-Kufw.text: I don't usually post but this place is simply amazing. We came mid morning for breakfast, the service was fantastic, the food was super fresh and tasted fantastic. We've definitely found a new favorite spot.

1lv-KEKAAnhzS4X-uySaCA.text: It is difficult to put into words how excited I am about having a restaurant like Craftkitchen in my neighborhood.  Our experience her was great except service was a little slow (Sunday morning breakfast craziness I'm sure).  Love that a restaurant cares about the source and quality of their food.  Each dish we ordered was clearly prepared with care.  It was all delicious.  And the coffee was amazing.  We'll definitely be back!

rvZqzveuy0KDgbhmORvnGA.text: This place is GREAT! I've been here several times on the weekend and have loved every item my wife or I have eaten. Cool ambiance and attentive service. No matter how hard I try I can't go home without some goodies from the case. They are awesome. I really appreciate  how they have different specials that change every weekend so you always have some new options. They use Melissa's Produce company so all of the vegetables are of high quality and super fresh. We have the same rep and she turned us on to this place. Thanks Jennifer! I'm actually bringing some friends and family there tomorrow so see you then Craft Kitchen! What a gem!

pwlXneF9EskS_Yq-ClKjMw.text: I love this place. It has a trendy vibe to it. There is a huge selection of different types of meals and they plate it very nicely making it appealing to the eye. I recommend the protein fix if your looking for a healthy meal that does not lack in flavor. They keep me coming back for more! Keep on crafting!

eMMbtD8MGZimEMbcZDcxFw.text: Ill re-review again but based on what we got I think the wait time didn't justify the experience this time around. Red velvet pancakes are amazing, but the homemade turkey patties were underwhelming. Long wait, and just a few knockout dishes. The coffee brought this review to 4 stars (brazil bean) I will definitely be back.

UgxKGoC1CnC0mowqofTzcQ.text: The food here was so awesome!  Portions were perfect and the service was great.  I found this place off Yelp and I definitely recommend coming.  I had the braised short rib hash.  It was so good.  Everything is awesome on their menu!

XRuGLqwXeADt16Z6wP6nXg.text: This place has it all; great service, food, and ambiance. I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to dining out, but this place checks all the boxes down to the coffee. A friend and I split the turkey benny, chicken and waffles, with a side of truffle fries. They split the plates for us and we didn't have to ask! We even sat a while after eating, chatting and the server filed our water, checking on us even after the bill was paid. That's top notch service if you ask me. The rustic decor with abundant green (yet fake) plants was visually appealing. I would certainly recommend this others and will be back to try the lunch/ dinner or "mid hour" menu, as they called it.

rJDtZeOtPv5rcbzrdEPWEw.text: Pastries were great. Entree dishes were ok. Service was horrible. We sat for about 10 minutes, had to call the server over to take our order. After that, we didn't see him again. Had we not had integrity, we could have walked out. When we went to the cashier to run our card, she ran other people asking for help because she didn't know how to work the cash register. We sat there as she held our credit card and check being denied assistance by everyone. This place desperately needs a manager.

Up7yyekiCqRRLX9MbwMGsA.text: This is hands down our favorite brunch spot! Everything on the menu is fantastic especially the chicken and waffles. The new manager is extremely personable and friendly. JP is our favorite server but Katie was awesome today! Mimosas are bomb dot comb and love the atmosphere.

KgLh-z5r7qMzutf0GE0HaA.text: Loved it! Clean, cute, nice outdoor seating. My friend is Gluten-Free and Lactose Intolerant and it was very easy to accommodate her! Always a plus! The food was unique and delicious. We all enjoyed our meals. The coffee is fresh pressed as well!

fTYNAN_gYPvNUMjDC6QEEg.text: Had the opportunity to try several items here... Buttermilk chicken and waffles are divine! The Korean shrimp tacos are delicious and looooove the kimchi and pickled jalapeno on the tacos. My husband has the short run hash... He said it felt very decadent in calories but worth every single one!!! It was that good. The pecan sticky bun was delicious as well. I live out of the country, but will be back whenever I come to visit family in Henderson.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Buttermilk chicken and waffles!

d4BvZyL2zcGwEa2kYY2pqg.text: Came by on a Saturday morning and there was a wait, so just decided to grab from their pastry menu and a coffee ... And I was NOT disappointed!  The cheddar choice croissant rendered me speechless .... Soooooooo good!  I got also purchased a brownie, but I didn't like it because it had coconut in it, but the texture was good. My own fault for not ready the label well otherwise I wouldn't have gotten it. Coffee was great. I can't wait to come back and dine in as their food looks amazing!

upRRhpYVrFyUe12z71J4hA.text: The red velvet pancakes are such an amazing sweet! Love the atmosphere definitely a great place to stop for brunch. Will be coming back to celebrate closing escrow with clients and family and friends.

LYJu_qx4NLJq27qd-CCYTA.text: We came in for Easter Sunday Brunch and it was amazing! The food was delicious (as usual!). We opted for the bottomless mimosa and got to try the pomegranate and blood orange mimosa... So yummy!!! The starters, salads, and entrees were very good; but the dessert was off the charts! So much creativity and you can tell love goes into each piece food
