cooZDG1_qFuzivcQnwVQvw.text: I thought the decor was nice and approachable. Sincere welcome by hostess/waitress and staff. Ordered the hummus to start which came AFTER the entrees....we returned it and the server was kind enough to extend a pastry as a gesture for dessert. The avocado bread had no flavor which was so disappointing but the Bloody Mary was great. It was beautiful outside but the inside was so cold it was uncomfortable to enjoy our meal. Might give it a second shot......

u6_6QX7VWYNqnTqS1dHmRQ.text: The breakfast burrito was absolutely amazing. Great flavor and definitely filling. Our server Josh was awesome, genuine and on top of it. Great food and great service, we are for sure coming back to try all their desserts.

cLs8Lcf4fFM4OQLMu5UUnw.text: They definitely need to work on the (lack-of) waiting area. Nice you can eat outside, and great little planter dividers so you don't feel like you are sitting in the parking lot. Good service. Good food, but I wasn't like moaning in ecstasy or anything. I'm not a fan of sides not being included with an entree: to me if you are paying a minimum of 10-12 bucks, some measly potatoes can be thrown in for good measure. The dipping sauce for the sweet potato fries was quite tasty.

7dzHjRXk5WLz8bPXx7g-rQ.text: Found the best hipster place we could and this place didn't disappoint. Anytime micro greens are added to a dish you know it's good. Avocado toast had alot of avocado so prepare for that but the poached egg brought it togethet. My friend had the quinoa farmers stack which was awesome. Make sure to add a poached egg on top of that for maximum flavor. Lattes were crazy good along with the smashed potatos. They switch out the oil daily (yes I asked) so the flavor was intense and super good. Service was equally awesome and we'll informed

qofBWvYXNdkgOsz3rKilTA.text: Ok... This is my 3rd time eating here and I wanted to do that before I rate this new joint considering it just opened 5 days ago. The Food quality here is superb! You can easily taste the quality of the ingredient, it's not drenched with seasoning like many other places to mask the quality of their ingredient. They also bake their own pastry. :) There are so many food  joint along the Eastern Corridor and let's be honest, this is where quality suffers. If you want to just pig out cheap and stuff yourself with volume of food, don't come here. If you are looking for Quality, satisfying meal in a Relaxing Ambiance... This Joint is for you! And oh, did I mention the parking was sooo Easy!!! Considering its on Eastern Avenue. :) You know what I mean.  We will be back for sure.

0jDbtA1muPS3P5RW-5y4rw.text: Mom and I have been here twice now. We love the coffee and the food has such a fun twist! Shrimp and cheesy grits is so good! Today I had pork omelet with celantro avacodo salsa and Mom had the mini beef sliders with truffle fries. And the service is great too.

pZmK5zV887n_xXAv7iavZg.text: Just came here for brunch and had an fantastic experience. Short rib hash; Chorizo skillet; Monkey bread were all delicious. Erica our waitress was great and front manager Derek was exceptional. Excellent food and service. Highly recommend this place!

65Sl3O3azgytRclsEChpXw.text: New bohemian chic breakfast spot CraftKitchen is a cute little restaurant in the GV/Anthem area. While the decor is nice ( muted color palate, herb garden) and food is thoughtfully presented, I was thoroughly disappointed with our experience. The $16 Short Rib Hash was literally 5 small red potatoes topped with about 4 oz of shredded beef accompanied by a few drops of braising liquid. After waiting 20 minutes for it to arrive (we were the ONLY table in the restaurant when we ordered) I was expecting it to at least be hot, but was instead merely lukewarm. It looked like an appetizer sized portion.  My 4oz pour of OJ for $3.50 seemed a bit pricey to me. My gf had the fried chicken and waffles, which again, after waiting 20 minutes you'd think would be piping hot and crispy right?  Think again. 2 soggy chicken fingers and 2 small rubbery waffles are what we got. For $43 (including tip) for breakfast for 2, I was expecting a bit more than bland, under seasoned small plates. We left hungry and disappointed.

LwwlNWq-ONrbXIKZeT07mg.text: Great food! Good people! Best choice for a healthy breakfast spot! Coffee is definitely in a class of its own.

vVOtvgdJp_AF4pC5tBCAeA.text: Nice to have a gourmet breakfast/lunch place close to our home. The Korean shrimp tacos are off the charts and the pulled pork omelette got a "this is the best omelette i ever had" from my wife. Then to finish the meal off we have the pecan sticky bun...omg...incredible.

GXYtMbTTcZKbyg-_VrxpkA.text: Once we landed in Vegas, we immediately began searching out gluten-free breakfast options.  CRAFTkitchen bubbled to the top and it was pretty close to hour hotel. After our first meal, we knew we would be returning for what was almost every morning during our stay.  Our selections ranged through the CK Special, the Fresh Fruit Plate and the Greek Yogurt.  The menu had a lot more to choose from as well.  All dishes well done.   The service was spot on as my water glass was never empty.  They did an impromptu "iced coffee"  and they were really cool about substituting in a non-gluten item for the standard on the Greek Yogart plate.  Overall, nice place which did fill up quickly during peak times.

1jfF1syK03pFoXBjnSUR2g.text: I simply had to take the time to express how impressed I was with my dining experience at CRAFTkitchen today.  It was my first visit to the restaurant, and the staff (the manager Devin, hostess Erica, and waitress Katie) went above and beyond to ensure that my experience was second to none.  And the food...life changing!!!!!!  I was struggling with what to order, as there were so many menu items that intrigued me, and Devin was flawless in his assistance of recommendations.  It was his description of the Short Rib Hash that led me to order it ("A lot of love goes in to the preparation of the short rib for that dish"), and I was blown away.  A lot of love indeed!!! =)   I also had the Oatmeal Brulee, and it was incredible.  The temperature was JUST RIGHT, and the nut and fruit mixture with the caramelized sugar topping was nothing short of phenomenal.  Even the coffee was amazing.  Fresh, delicious, and again, served at the perfect temperature.  I simply can't say enough good things.  I can't wait until next weekend to return and try another dish.  I will definitely be raving about this restaurant to all my friends and family.  Please don't ever leave Vegas!  Thank you for a truly incredible and unique dining experience! =)

cRiKeWTp1IXiOrzFRBxT2w.text: Eclectic menu with prices about 30% higher than comparable restaurants in the area. Lunch with dessert and tip for two people just short of $50.00 (no alcohol). Lunch entrees were tasty; pastries were attractive, but not very good.

4Vh9C8lGYcJDV_19dSjc4w.text: This is a wonderful breakfast and lunch destination. Coffee was uncommonly good. Menu is creative, and the food is delicious. Great service (Teresa)!  As the restaurant evolves, I dream of (1) vegan options/substitutions; and (2) dinner hours. Thanks for establishing a great restaurant in this neighborhood!!

K037gv7WQqktowJOuTKkLA.text: Nice little spot. Chicken and waffles was excellent. Just the right portion size and great mix of flavors.

Q6o3FrLttoA1fQbzeyjS9Q.text: First off, for people who don't worry/care about eating organic food I am sure you will be happy with the offerings here. I have been really looking forward to this place opening for quite some time now as I was under the impression that they would be serving the majority ORGANIC foods/ingredients.   I didn't really know how to grade this place based on a single visit but for people like myself that were hoping for something else, I thought this may help.  For the visit that I had today I will give a detailed review and overall impression.  First off, I used to come here when it was "Bread and Butter" and the entire look inside and out has been changed.  This place has a great "feel" and atmosphere now and I think they did a great job with that.  Service was spot on from the minute I walked in the front door where I was greeted with a friendly hello and smile.  The only negative I have to say about my encounter with several employees was that they couldn't answer questions re: organic options.  I understand that being the second day open, this isn't to be held against them as they are still learning their new jobs.  I did get different answers depending on who I spoke with but the comments to follow were based on an individual who went and spoke to the person who orders the food from the different distributors.  Upon looking at the menu and speaking with the employees, it was determined that the only thing that was ORGANIC as a whole was the coffee they serve.  This was a huge disappointment for me as we don't have a single restaurant up in the area any longer that caters to ORGANIC food now that Layers closed down a few months ago.  I ordered a salad that was tasty but very small with a few greens/apple strips/ and a small amount of quinoa.  This came with a couple of pieces of bread.  Overall, I felt the food was good but not very filling without any meat in the salad.  I walked out spending 17.00 (w/ 3.00 tip) for lunch and didn't even get anything to drink!  I feel that if you are going to charge prices like this, you should be serving organic food.  I will not be back unless it is for a cup of ORGANIC coffee or until I hear that they have decided to serve the quality of food that is in line with the prices that are being charged

RIrvDFHmuL9AUkMVQ_pL9Q.text: Had a breakfast there. Food was good but service slow. Hard to believe coffee refills are a charge.

6TV_n24Z3CNNz8ogSyoZ7w.text: The bacon was really good but otherwise nothing worth coming back for. Don't believe the hype. Henderson desperately needs a good brunch spot and this is not it. Everything was OK but just OK.

zDUNMhTiT5_ydkkIIUrZlA.text: I love the atmosphere here. It's a pretty restaurant. Very trendy. Great place for breakfast/brunch. I got the pork carnitas omelet. Yummy! This was one of the few times I finished my whole plate! Great portion size for me. My boyfriend got the C.K. special with bacon and turkey sausage. He also finished his entire plate. He said the turkey sausage was amazing!

fP_YNDLO0CwevK9rseaURA.text: We had an oatmeal cookie which is the best one I've ever had, and No it was not hard, so try the cookies! I had the croque monsieur sandwich, which has the sauce inside--then they grill it as a pressed sandwich. You really need a fairly soft bread for panini and the whole thing was perfect. I took half home. Yes, it's pricier than Eggworks directly across the street, but it's a totally different food experience, worth the bit of extra money.

JPj3vcyXYyyCs6eHdu-7iw.text: Came here for the first time yesterday - the decor, airy layout, and overall aesthetic of the entire restaurant was very impressive. Also the fact that they offer bottomless mimosas is a huge plus considering there's nowhere else in Henderson that offers this brunch experience. Food was excellent also. Only knocking down to 3 stars due to the fact the service was pretty much nonexistent. On a busy Sunday there were only seemingly 2 waiters, so we sat at our table for about fifteen minutes before anyone even approached us for drinks/food. All of this was made worse due to the fact there were like 6 people standing around at the counter doing absolutely nothing but standing with their hands in their pockets / behind their backs chatting with each other while the two waiters managed basically everything. Definitely going to come back here because I'm sure things will smooth out, but there's for sure some work that needs to be done on making the experience more enjoyable. Sitting at a table without even getting waters for 15 minutes is kind of a joke when you're looking at a $70 bill.

bu19Wfr1GSvgPoWo3MBbZg.text: CRAFTkitchen is similar to those hip restaurants in downtown, but is a hidden gem located near St. Rose and Eastern. The staff are friendly and make great recommendations, especially if it's your first time there. Very Eco friendly environment. I highly recommend the short rib hash. It looks and sounds like a heavy meal, but it was actually not too filling and I didn't feel guilty about consuming it. They offer numerous fresh pastries made in house. The almond croissant is a must. If I'm ever back on this side of town, I would definitely come back.

89WypOJN2QcL2ee-TBVTNw.text: Amazing food.  Loved everything and the service is always great. Went for Mother's Day brunch and not only was the food delicious and beautiful they treated us like royalty  we will come back again and again

KcXNFPyVtELDeq3NP1FZrA.text: This place was delicious. I had the quinoa farmer stack and my friend had the salmon with a pretzel bagel. They both tasted fresh and flavorful. Planning on coming here again for another brunch date.

gnqxP3pXDF0MaW931AO8IA.text: Awesome Place! Great food.  A little expensive to go all the time, but you get what you pay for! Me and my family and friends will all be back!

w3DBS4kU89zkM7vzkGgbMA.text: This place was EXTREMELY busy. It was just 2 of us and we had to wait 1/2 hr. When we finally got our food it was not very flavorful and we had to add salt. We only got 1 appetizer and 2 entrees, no drinks, only tap water and spent $50! Totally not worth it.

tCEaWaEip_8rtA5aiE5O-A.text: I ate lunch here today and am still overwhelmed by how unique and delicious the food is!  VERY friendly and efficient staff, and the food is MORE than worth the money!  It's sort of like healthy meets the Southern U.S. and France.  We tried a little of everything and it was all amazing!  The desserts are beautiful and divine....

t0QrLH5g_Cxbel9LlGfDeQ.text: I got the turkey sliders and a strawberry lemonade and it was so good. Its my first time here but I will definitely come back and try different things.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

IzvqpOkwEH1M0vPKqXhNBA.text: Cute restaurant. The food was just as attractive as it was tasty. One could certainly tell why there was a crowd.  Went here with the boyfriend and friends from Milwaukee to try. They were definitely impressed, and appreciated that the meal portions weren't overloaded. "Perfect size so we don't overeat for the rest of the day." Fresh ingredients too - herbs are displayed in front of the restaurant.  I had the Chicken and What? Those waffles were so fluffy, and the breading on the chicken was light. Perfect match with a small kick from julienned Jalapenos. Didn't need the whole cup of syrup either - always a good thing if you don't need to drench food in sauces. A brunch special of that day that the boyfriend took advantage of was bottomless mimosas. Sorry, but he had to because we were living vicariously through him. One friend was pregnant and her husband was supporting her by not drinking too, and I was the hostess driving everyone around.  The one thing we were slightly disappointed in was that we never got to try the cinnamon rolls. Our waitress Teresa forgot to bring it out as a dessert when she brought back the first draft/copy of the bill, and came back 10 minutes later telling us that the kitchen had ran out. Hmm... Maybe next time.

Ztx3CkjMZBTcTn508QYvug.text: Amazing food and everything is prepared to order using organic/gmo free ingredients. So far the carnitas omelet has been my favorite and their coffees are a sure Kickstarter for the day.

WX4Knof-tyPxw-hzHb2Cvg.text: First time visiting this lovely place, great service and Awesome fresh food.  Will definitely be back!!!, had the Cuban sandwich and it was delicious with sweet potatoes fries instead of the plantains that it comes with.  Will try breakfast next!

n0h4vudEKEkExFcJi1q7-Q.text: This place was delicious.  Had breakfast here with family and we all ordered something different and shared.  I thought everything tasted great.  The staff was very friendly and always made sure we were taken care of.  The restaurant is beautiful, bright , and open. I will definitely be returning when I get back to Nevada

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Kids menu Red Velvet Pancakes

Etg206hxi5qZ-wz6McoBVQ.text: Cute restaurant! I'm from so cal and this place looks like it's from oc/la and not Henderson. When we first got there we waited a few minutes and no one even acknowledged us until I went up to the counter and asked if we can get a table. we ordered 3 items: salmon on pretzel bread, chicken and waffle and the special of the day ox tail risotto. The risotto was the best dish of the three. The server recommended the chicken and waffles but The chicken was dry and pretty bland, can get better chicken tenders at raising canes down the street. The salmon was Ok nothing special in my opinion. The risotto had good flavor and texture, too bad it's a special. I would probably give it another try to try some other items and their baked goods.

G2nW3yRQ5x1hxaL1ZzmahA.text: Chicken and waffle!! I've tried this all over the country and I've never gotten the fascination. This was the first time I have ever been impressed by chicken and waffles!  The chicken was excellent, tender with nice breading.  The key was the waffle.  It was light and flakey.  Not your typical filling waffle. All together with their special kick, it was very good!  Truly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Cheesy grits.  Wasn&#39;t blown away, but I&#39;m no expert on grits.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Carnitas omelette.  That sauce was so good.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle.  Excellent!!

oV7OJFEz1NSM2JIHAJT0og.text: Tried this place on a Sunday so we had to try the bottomless mimosas of course. We had the traditional, blood orange, and pomegranate in which all were delicious but my fav was blood orange! We also had the scallop ceviche which was on the specials menu and was fresh light and fresh just enough citrus and maybe was a pickled taro perhaps and thin tortilla strips for crunch...mm mm! I had the smoked salmon on pretzel bun and my brother had the braised short rib on hash. Smoked salmon was a nice portion was good and very nice twist on traditional bagel and lox. My bros short rib was cooked nice but was a little timid on seasoning and lacked the boldness I'm used to with a braided short rib. All in all this place was great and will be back soon cuz all I thought about when I got home was why didn't I order the red velvet pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Scallop ceviche

m79fHWu6SBnA02DMH8En1w.text: I loved the vibe and the food was perfect.  I will be making that part of my weekends.

TdQM-EhcdG4z10GTVAHmNQ.text: Great breakfast! Awesome servers, very friendly, yummy food. Will be our fave breakfast place!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummyyyyy!

VpD_6-TY-bPMjLv-5zFyHQ.text: Always a hit!! They cater to any allergy needs, the food is impeccable and the atmosphere is chic! Craft is my go to for casual, well executed food. The staff is relaxed but attentive. They never make you feel rushed. Fav brunch spot!

R9UhjW0lLLrVnJOqWti_kg.text: Yum! Can't wait to go back to Henderson so I can eat here. The portions are incredible.

Wg1b5brhkHO9hjW4prScOA.text: We just tried the Cuban and the French dip with truffle fries and it was AMAZING! This place is legit! Awesome service, super clean, accommodating for our stroller and baby carrier, and quality ingredient! Can't wait to go back for the breakfast!!

TFBR7LhR09h-emyFyYrNDQ.text: Every time I've been here, it's been a good experience. I wish you were open on at night when I'm looking for a place close to home with great food.

IW3c5dyIm2ZcI8yJDtwh5Q.text: We stopped by here for brunch today before dropping 2 friends at the airport for their flight home. We were seated immediately and were pleased to learn that we could order from either the early or later menu. We enjoyed every bite of our meals: from the brulee oatmeal to the pulled turkey benedict to the beef sandwich to the amazing short-rib hash (I will be dreaming of those potatoes!), there just wasn't anything negative to say. It was all delicious, fresh, attractively presented, and "cheffy" but not in a pretentious way, if that makes any sense. And to think that I almost skipped having a cup of coffee: that would have been a major mistake on my part!  Our server and the counter staff were all personable and helpful. We had a delightful meal in every respect (and it was very reasonably priced for what we received).  (My single complaint has nothing to do with the food. Try as I might, I could not get comfortable on the metal chair I was seated on. Perhaps the seat itself is too deep for me; I found I could not reach the chair back without slouching, so I ended up slid forward to the edge of the seat with no back support.)  I can't believe we waited until now to try CRAFTkitchen! It's close to home and so good that we will be regulars. Highly recommended!

aJOS6oIemTut-QgXg2DM7g.text: Good quality. Clean. Fresh squeezed OJ, great coffee, and right up the street from me. Fav.

LnDwwsF5CUrMF5OvBPAARw.text: My better half found this place on Yelp and were decided to stop in for a late lunch. Their posted hours are 730a-3p and we snuck in around 240p. We were a little worried we might be rushed, or even turned away (yes, it's happened to us before at another small business which I reviewed on here). Our server (I didn't catch her name) promptly sat us and got us drinks without any rush at all. We ordered our food and with her quiche, there was a small side salad.  Now my better half is deathly allergic to vinegar, so she just put it to the side. When our server came to check on us, she asked if everything was okay with the salad, and we told her about the vinegar allergy, and apologized for not mentioning it prior. She asked if she wanted a different salad, but the quickly realized that all the dressings had vinegar in them. So she offered us not only a side of fries, but truffle fries That was very nice of her to offer. Not once throughout the meal, did we get an inkling of them wanting to rush us out. In fact, as we were finishing up, we asked for a "to-go" cup for her coffee and the gentleman behind the counter offered us fresh cup for the road. Wow! And he even made her a latte instead! So we paid the check and on the way out, the same gentleman behind the counter asked if he could have a minute of our time. After that, of course. I figured it was for a customer comment card or a survey. He asked if we had tried any of their fresh pastries and we nodded no (I think he noticed my better half drooling on the glass pastry display as we walked in and waited to be seated). He pulled out a brown "to-go" box and proceeded to explain what each pastry was as he placed them in the box. About half a dozen pastries later, he closed the box, pushed it across the counter and said, "I hope you enjoy them!" He introduced himself as Devin and wished us a great rest of our day. A great meal AND some great desserts?!? Double wow! There are lots of great places to eat in this fantastic city of ours. Some have great dishes that you may or may not remember, but I think you ALWAYS remember that great feeling of when a business makes you feel WANTED and APPRECIATED. And yesterday afternoon, CRAFTkitchen did both. Thank you again guys! We will absolutely be back.  -- Matt & Lex

bijvYbycfl5LhwP9Oc_x_Q.text: Great bakery items!! The chocolate chip cookies are simple and delicious..my new Vegas favorite. Pecan sticky buns and cinnamon rolls are excellent too. A variety of delicious gluten-free options..the apple tart is exceptional. Pastry items cost anywhere from $2-$5.  Shortrib hash is the menu's home run item. Breakfast/brunch for two will run about $30-$40. Servings are not huge but very filling and high quality. Nice atmosphere and decor. Especially liked the counter seating looking out a large glass window.  Super busy on the weekends. If possible, enjoy CRAFTkitchen on a weekday for the best in service/experience.

JmzSKasP5x1DwF2s7-k_qw.text: I've never been disappointed with a dish I've ordered! Great atmosphere and great food!! This is always my go-to spot for brunch and lunch! And it's also on Uber Eats! Love this place.

glWw7wpP4_TTdN8ZP-TrPg.text: You can't make a party of 2 wait 20 minutes when you have 7 tables open. If you're trying to pace the kitchen it's not working because our food came out a minute after the monkey bread. Food was great but the new hostess needs better guidance.

Cw8lla4-xynDL7WuMI9Eeg.text: Wifey and I ate here on a cold (outside and in the restaurant too) Friday morning in Jan. I had the CK-Breakfast Burrito ($13.75), she had the Protein Fix plate ($12.25), and we added the Sweet Potato Curry (cup) Soup ($4.95). Overpriced was my feeling about it all. We had water, not even coffee and the total was $33.50!   Bad ratio of food ingredients in my burrito-- potatoes vs the chile relleno was 9:1 (no exaggeration) which makes it hella carbs to be made full-from potatoes and not the taste and flavor of chile; not on the menu as it is advertised/ described. Menu says it's "stuffed" w. chile relleno.  You judge for yourself, but if your not in the mood to be disappointed.... go somewhere else with your appetite.  Cold in there too. Walked by the thermostat on the way to the restroom and saw it SET at 66 degrees in the restaurant ....in January? That's how they roll in there. My guess is-to get you to order hot coffee.  No manager type person visible in there either...you know, someone who looked like they were in charge (not while we were there), to ask if they "..noticed everybody eating in there was wearing their coats & hats because of the chill" and I thought I saw a lady wearing her gloves in there too! Don't think I'll be back too soon. Too much hype. I've seen a lot better ...for what this place was advertised as. This place is for people who are ok with paying for someone to cut their avocado, plate it next to a fried egg and charge you over $12.  Little to none in pastries and treats on display at the counter too.  On the good side...it's decorated modern and clean. Good space to eat in (elbow room). Parking was decent for a Friday brunch. And the host and server were nice.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

u0fNQIat0RKur32xgShZ_Q.text: They have good food but kind of a ditzy staff.  Always feel like there is confusion of some form happening on the other side of the counter. (Perhaps I'm the ditzy one and just didn't know it!)

4dGLr3o-QV7CMZuV0HPJYg.text: This place is a gem !! I can remember when my daughter and I first went we fell in love right away with the pretzel bun used for the salmon and baked capers super tasty ... every time we go we still get the lox on the pretzel we each get a half then we try something new along with it today that was the breakfast egg and bacon  croissant sandwich it came with a tasty salad as well.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

B1Ux_fXMekffiM31Wn0pEA.text: Yummmm!!  I'd do 4.5 stars but I support fellow businesses so 5. We went in on a Sunday around noon. I couldn't decide on entree but knew I wanted monkey bread, because carbs. Items ordered:  1) red velvet pancakes (sadly, my 5-year-old hoarded then so I didn't get to try...but they looked excellent  2) butternut squash hash: the kale was so good but hardly any in there. The squash was super good and good amount. The potatoes were tasty but way too many for me. I would've reversed order of how much per item but overall, it was super tasty and I'd go back just for this dish and ask them to hold the potatoes if possible (haha I'm weird cuz "hash" I assume is the potato part)  3) something about protein? I forget the name. This was hubby's dish and he tore it up. I was going to get it, but honestly portion size looked pretty small on it so I'm glad I didn't.   4) monkey bread. Hot damn. Super crisp too and caramel buttery soft goodness underneath. Perfect! And I'm a pastry chef so I'd know (don't you hate when people say that?! Like, who cares...just cuz you're an expert, doesn't mean my opinion doesn't matter)   Very good brunch, will return.

RXbmZBrQTam32jFRiYwgdg.text: I really REALLY do NOT understand the hype behind this place. Been here twice and both times the experience was just "meh" at best. First of all the owners must be very greedy because they obviously don't have enough staff(properly trained) to handle the volume. And also, the portions are very small for the price. It's a trendy spot and I see a bunch of teenagers/college students there all the time but aside from a social hangout, this place does not have any substance.  Ordered chicken and waffles and got two small chicken strips and a soggy waffle. Waitress got the order wrong the first time and brought me out something that looked like shredded turkey with white sauce all over it. Looked gross but was probably better than what I actually ordered.  Like I said, I don't get it. Place sucks overall.

phLVAnIFg465xUyYauOLvQ.text: I wasn't too impressed by CRAFTkitchen.   The food was definitely very unique and delicious. I ordered the smoked salmon on the pretzel roll and was surprised with how much salmon it came with. I thought my dish was worth the price, however, my friends ordered avocado on toast and chicken & waffles, and their portions were really small.   They had 3 desserts on the menu. The apple cobbler with vanilla ice cream seemed the most appetizing, but the service took too long so we didn't order it. They also have various baked goods and desserts near the front register, but again they are on the pricer side.   Overall, the food was great and the presentation was beautiful,  but they can work on their service. We waited almost 25 minutes for our check and our server didn't bother to ask us about dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked salmon on a pretzel roll

TxhpMaJdmpvLIDFpkqcgTw.text: Second time eating here and it was even better than the first!  I had the Chilaquiles....so good & a huge portion! My husband ordered the Pork Carnitas Benedict and was so satisfied he wanted to order more!  Our little one ordered a egg, bacon and fruit from the kids meal and for under $6 for that you can't beat it.  Food is fresh and made with expertise.  Three different choices of mimosas and fresh made coffee were our choice of beverages.  I had to stop at the bakery counter and get a cookie and vegan protein bar!  Servers are super nice and knowledgeable, I will definitely be back and by glancing at other tables orders I want to try something different each time!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Pork Carnitas Benedict

ry3fgonwRBNr42XHC6-L9A.text: We came here Feb 3, 2018.  I REALLY wanted to like this place.  The menu and pastries looked delicious.  First of all, we were sat but no one took our drink order (and I needed a cup of coffee!)  We waited about 10 minutes before we met our waiter.  I ordered the Salmon Benny and my husband ordered the Craft Benedict.  While we were waiting, I saw a delicious looking Blueberry/Orange Scone at another table.  I ordered one for our table but it never arrived.  Our benedicts arrived without Hollandaise Sauce???  Oversight, no biggie. These items are served alone with ANY side or garnish.  When the Hollandaise sauce came to our table, I put my finger in it to check the temperature and it was super cold!  Our waiter took it back. BWe ordered 2 more cups of coffee and only one came,  By the time the next 2 ramekins of hollandaise came out, our benedicts were cold - as was the hollandaise (again!!!)  By this time, we just wanted to leave.  A young girl, not our food server, brought our bill and apologized for the hollandaise issue.  She asked if we had everything we needed  I told her about the scone we never received and she gave me one for free.  My husband noticed a female's name under server.  Our server was male.  Instead of saying anything, we just paid the bill cause we wanted out of there ASAP!   Very disappointing experience.

-eYzC-o8VRo1v9SFjG2ZSA.text: Go here weekly. Menu is updated with decent frequency. Quality, healthy, tasty options. Not terribly pricey. Nice staff, good coffee. It's real close to home, so thankfully they make it easy and worthwhile to keep coming back.

YCEiBY3-dVKdzj_1NVhdVQ.text: I have dined 2 times at Craft Kitchen and have been blown away each time! For my most recent visit I arrived at about 9:45am and sat at the bar. I ordered black coffee and a water. The crustless GF quiche on 1/10/16 was mushrooms, shallots, and parm; so that was definitely being ordered! I also ordered the sweet potato fries with maple bacon aioli.   My coffee came quick and fresh. I am an ex-barista(not sbux) I appreciate a good crema, the picture doesn't give my coffee justice. When it was placed it front of me I thought they brought the wrong coffee. It looked as if it had milk, my tired eyes adjusted to see this beautiful crema. The coffee was hot, but sippable. Super smooth!  QOTD was served with its usual mixed green salad that had a great vinegar punch to pair well with the decadent, fluffy, pot of love. Typically the crust is 50% of the reason I'll eat a quiche. Craft Kitchen doesn't let me miss it. The egg is this beautiful light texture, the Parmesan adds just the perfect amount of richness and nuttiness.   The sweet potato fries were good. Perfectly seasoned and fried crisp. I think I might have been served a regular garlic aioli because I'm not sure I tasted any bacon or maple. Not sure I would order these again.   On my previous I had the Burrata salad and it was creamy, fresh, and bright! I was thinking it would be sweeter, however, the dressing was a great tangy vinaigrette. I've also tried their creamy asparagus soup and the croque monsieur   Now. The sweets!!! I've tried the pecan sticky bun, kouign amann, and raspberry lemonade panna cotta. All of which were AWESOME! The panna cotta had this great candied lemon wheel on top, the light lemon and vanilla bean cut through the sweet and acidic punch of the raspberry sauce on bottom perfectly!! Warm that sticky bun up!!!!! It is SINFUL! Yum!   I love Craft Kitchen. Their fresh ingredients and heart they put into the whole concept is obvious! Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Raspberry lemonade panna cotta- GF!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Crustless quiche- mushrooms, shallots, and parmesan. Super DUPER delish!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries

tW43_G-O8AkSPT0OVpmutA.text: A relaxing, beautiful place to enjoy breakfast. Favorites included CK special with bacon and smashed potatoes, chorizo scramble skillet, fresh squeezed juices, and sweet potato fries. The Greek salad wasn't what we hoped for - over dressed, mostly lettuce.

Q8J1VejbrfCqmGYjEzQXaw.text: 3 stars just because: 1. Food was a bit cold, food is suppose to be ALWAYS hot. 2. Waitress wasn't very helpful, 30/40 minutes wait time but yet there's a bunch of tables available and she didn't offer to sit us outside. OVERALL taste and presentation was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

zDSjds-IOGMmWG47wnnseQ.text: Great Brunch! Be prepared for long lines for a table at the weekend, this place is hugely popular but worth the wait!

Z8h4ZT5iENkLvuhI-q0X4g.text: Always great service, food is really good! Treats are really good, it's a awesome place to mix in when eating breakfast or brunch around Henderson

GsPznpqPsg2n8JVKPpIfvQ.text: Invited to try some new menu items by chef/owner Jaret Blinn, four of us came here for brunch at 1 PM on 26 December.  Seated in the private (semi-private) room, we started with appetizer pastries (that's what I'll call them).  They ranged from sticky buns, to cinnamon buns, scones, and croissants among others.  Each one was absolutely wonderful.  Chef Blinn shows his skill with these pastries.    Following this, we had our savory dishes which included shrimp and grits, Citrus and crab salad, Ciabatta Caprese, crustless quiche of the day, short rib fries, Croque monsieur panini, and chorizo Shepherd's pie.  I didn't get a chance to try the citrus and crab salad but everything else was outstanding.  I enjoyed the panini and the Ciabatta Caprese as well as the quiche.  Everything is thought out so well and they're very good dishes.  After the main dishes, it was time for more pastries that I'll refer to as dessert pastries.  These included mango sticky rice, S'mores waffles, a chocolate sticky bun, and a duo of bread pudding and sticky toffee pudding.  Service was excellent with new share plates and silverware for each course without needing to ask.  Refills of my iced tea were frequent and again with no need to ask.  Chef Blinn's desire to turn out quality pastries and savory dishes is evident in everything I tried.  He's a very dedicated man who makes his food with quality ingredients and has a menu that is very diverse such that anyone coming here can find many things to like.  You're not going away disappointed.  It's a shame it's a 20 minute drive from home to get here or I'd be buying pastries more than I do now.  Getting some of these pastries in the future will be worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Bread pudding and sticky toffee pudding.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chocolate sticky bun.
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Mango sticky rice.

Kk0F_qo_IUc0FCu-9c6Ang.text: I knew from the photos I would be pleased.  Walk in and immediately experience a fresh and clean feel.  Wholesome and minimal design.  The moss, the grass, foliage... What's real and what's fake?    The design reflects on the freshness of their menu.  It's healthy without being overly dietary.  There's a comfort in knowing they choose their ingredients, for example in their house made sausages.    Croissant Sammy. Read the ingredients and knew immediately it was just my taste.  Requested soft cooked bacon, which was done perfectly.  I ordered a side of their bacon aioli which paired well with my sandwich.  The side salad was beautifully garnished with small potato chips. By the flavor of it, I believe they fried it themselves.   Their potatoes are nicely cooked and different then I've had before.  Small in size and flattens skins on, creates cracks.  When fried has a nice crispy outside and soft center.  Cafe mocha; froth, coffee, chocolate was well proportioned. The perfect hint of sweet, no sugar needed. Really enjoyed my meal.   On top of all that, all the staff were friendly and their good mood contagious.  Came in contact with atleast five of them, everyone was great!   Thanks so much, will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Cafe mocha
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

MkD_werspFQh512arG1cww.text: This is place horrible ! Do not go here ! The staff especially the manager was beyond rude and snarky !!! They had open tables and when my friend was only asking why the 20 minute wait if tables are open and people are waiting ? They replied it is due to kitchen staffing being unable to serve that many tables ! What ?! Then get more kitchen workers duuuhh! They are in a busy area ! The manager decided to come over to me and my friend and tell her " bitchy  snarky nice " they are doing the best the can but the wait and open tables was due to kitchen issues and then went on to say how my friends husband was not welcome there ! He wasn't even with us?! My friend and her husband frequent this place on weekend brunch bc they live close by and the food was good and staffing but recently the staffing had gotten worse and good workers were leaving . When my friend asked why are bringing that up the manger states " just so you know for next time ! What ?????? I was absolutely appalled and flabbergasted by the rudeness of their manager ! That how you treat customers ! Forget NEVER GOING THERE and neither should you !!! They think their sh* t don't stink !!!! SO RUDE! I will Make sure to let everyone I know about this !

wkMcufW39oJHfbfBJkAXvQ.text: I love that Vegas is starting to get more and more local places to eat. It's a great option over going to a casino or to the strip.   I thought this place was so cute! I came here recently with my uncle for breakfast. I love that they use local ingredients and are a farm to table restaurant.   They have outside seating but since it was winter it was too cold to sit here. We arrived just in time before a large crowd came in so we were able to get a table relatively quickly. If you do not feel like waiting a long time for a table on the weekend I would suggest getting there at 11am or before. This place gets popular after that!  I decided to order the avocado toast. This comes with an egg on the top and pesto. I really enjoyed this and felt proud for eating healthy since the other things I tried weren't as healthy.   We also tried their pecan sticky bun. It was so good! I wish we would have had them warm it up, I bet that would have tasted amazing.   I also ordered their hot chocolate that came with a marshmallow that was dipped in chocolate and peppermint. It was so rich I had to add a little water to it but it was very good. Dipping in the marshmallow was my favorite part and was glad it was included with the drink.  Lastly, we took a cupcake home with us. Since it was Christmas time it was a red velvet cupcake with frosting that was made to look like a reindeer. It was so cute and part of the reason why I purchased it. I really enjoyed it and was a good take home treat.   The prices here are a little higher since they are dealing with local ingredients but I do not mind paying extra for quality food.    I would love to try their lunch here next time!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Spiced hot chocolate
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Avocado toast
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

Zp2u7I021PCgwCSXoTzrKQ.text: It was our first time here. The menu was great the food was great, although it didn't come out to us as we had ordered it. The lacking category here was service. Our server repeated back the order and it still came out wrong; they forgot to bring us our muffin, so it was suppose to be on the house. When we got the check they hadn't taken anything off for the inconvenience as promised. The sever took way too long to get back to our table in order to tell him about the mistake in price. We left exact change and left. So unfortunate about their customer service because their menu is awesome and I would love to try more things on it, maybe with a different server next time.

aaZOLixpzUkAMCftkR2gcw.text: My new favorite breakfast/brunch spot! Food was on point and service was great.   The charming decor impressed me from the get go. I love spots that are comfortable and pleasant to look at - for me it adds to the overall experience.  Highly recommend everything we ordered - truffle fries, short rib hash and smoked salmon. The short rib was tender, flavorful and not too fatty. I liked the added touch of roasted/baked (?) capers on the smoked salmon - paired with the cream cheese, tomato, onion and pretzel bun, it made for a perfect combination. None of the flavors were too overpowering, as this dish can sometimes be. We finished with a huge chocolate chip cookie (which they warmed up for us so it was gooey and delightful)...the cap to a wonderful meal.  Can't wait to go back. The only downside to this place is it's not closer to my house!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Avocado toast
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Truffle fries, smoked salmon and short rib hash

PsFiyL9oGjsorSxUAn7KhA.text: What a Henderson Gem! The friendly hostess and one of the most friendly waiters I've ever had. The Monkey Bread was to die for ! I absolutely loved the champagne glasses. A little pricey but well worth it. I will be back!

GhU7Ir8n9vQWiubN2SbkHA.text: The food and service are always fantastic.  It's a hidden gem that's a little hard to find tucked next to a Pts behind Osaka   The staff are always upbeat and friendly, and everything on the menu is amazing i am yet to have anything less than a perfect dining experience.

AvXQNTyjbV2-UZkPI81qJA.text: We decided to stop in for breakfast on a workday and received excellent service. Our food was just okay, nothing to write about. I believe most reviews with bigger ratings see the great ambiance and service. I cannot see the food getting more than an A-ok.

AbkhRCvVaKkVkB6yY38DRA.text: Finally got a chance to come by today with a bunch of friends.   Ambiance:  This place is very cozy and nicely decorated and offers both indoor and patio seating. Both dining spaces are inviting and I'm a fan of their use of decorations of succulents, grass, herbs, and wood top tables...it gives this place a farm to table vibe! Which is what they aspire to do.   Food:  I personally ordered the Pulled Turkey Benny which was delicious. Turkey was moist and seasoned nicely, perfectly poached eggs, and the hollandaise sauce served on the side was honestly the best I ever had, with heavenly notes of lemon but still very balanced...gonna have to try to imitate that recipe!  Also had the house made gravlax...the fried capers were such a nice touch! It was tasty. We also got to try the hummus and focaccia, which was really good too!   All my friends ordered various items on the menu and no one was disappointed. 3 of us got their coffee and one friend ordered their bottomless mimosa, which tasted great. We had one kid with us and she loved her waffles!!!  Very kid friendly place. All of us will be back.

gKsUFVQ_IJGj5c1AWOx-Ug.text: Best French dip ever! It literally melted in my mouth, it was so yummy!!! I love that all food is free range and organic, as it should always be. Highly recommend it. Just wish it was open for dinner too :-)

790CMqwnNhg8R1uEqwVggA.text: This is my new favorite local breakfast & lunch spot!  Everything I've tried so far off the menu was healthy, fresh AND DELICIOUS!!!!  Definitely going back soon & perfect time to enjoy their patio!!

WQH-vgrQZi50ZhwOTRZobQ.text: I give this place 4 stars. Just came here yesterday for brunch with a group of friends. Our server was very nice. The only reason I give this place 4 stars is because its a little on the pricier side for the amount of food you get. Food is great, just wish the prices were a little more reasonable. Also I had the White Mocha Latte SOOOOO GOOD!!

InJxtoIiHq6rGW4yHI_akQ.text: Amazing food, my compliments to the chef and the cooks who make it happen. Horrible service though.

hcQLukAr_TR0CfBjIQKT8g.text: This place will cost a pretty penny but every bite is worth it. Fresh ingredients, great service and always delicious food. Some favorites are the French dip, pulled turkey egg Benedict and the avocado toast. Great atmosphere and vibe.

J_nb97YkQmcnPBzN4hxgTQ.text: Great new spot in Henderson, near Seven Hills & Anthem.  Cool decor, bright/well lit, friendly service. Ideal brunch spot for us.  Pulled Turkey Benny was delicious. Wife had the "Protein Fix", white green omelet and turkey sausage, also excellent.  Will be back.

PffFE3nBG6tOVTOnu6GFPQ.text: Everything was underseasoned.  We had the egg sandwich on croissant... it was decent, but the roll was not outstanding.  We also had the shrimp and grits... 3 shrimp that were tasteless and "cheesy" grits with very little cheese... we left half of them.  Throw in 1 glass of wine... $46 including tax and tip... won't be back... and it's a shame as we live in the area.

6RkJr8zfodlzDiYKT9SIaw.text: Today was the first time I visited this amazing find! I have found my new favorite brunch place. The service was incredible, the food was divine, and the ambiance was trendy and relaxing.  My friend and I started with pomegranate mimosas in these cute modern cups. We shared the truffle profiterole with black truffles and risotto.  Wow it was light, creamy, and amazing truffle goodness. We then tried the smoked salmon on a pretzel roll with capers and tomatoes. It was plated so well. The cream cheese was a piece of heaven with the soft pretzel bread and the tender fresh lox.  We then tried the blueberry lemon crepes with a blueberry sauce. The crepes were light and the lemon zest with the warm blueberries and whipped cream was just right. Then we had the ciabatta caprese which was plated very playfully. It had rich burrata cheese, basil tomatoes, and sweet balsamic. You get to put the topping on the ciabatta yourself which was fun.   Then for dessert we had the smore tart and peach/apricot pop tart. The marshmallow topping was so smooth. They both were delicious! I couldn't believe the fresh peaches and apricots in the middle of the pop tart. What a wonderful brunch!

C9m151zpvxqlNtOmp_BJdQ.text: As a super foodie I was impressed by the food and even more impressed by the quality of service... They exceeded every expectation! Churros waffles, Cheddar Biscuits and gravy were beyond mouth watering... Coffee was amazing! I felt like I was in the best cafe in San Francisco.... Only one improvement needed. Craft just needs heaters outside for that amazing patio they created!!! Thank you for the best breakfast for my family!!!!!!!!

kiD0lZ4eSql-smzO5OZIyg.text: If this review was based on food quality alone, CRAFTkitchen would get 5 stars. The service would get 1 star. Our server, JP, took our food and drink orders and we didn't see him again until he brought out the check. He didn't check on us one time throughout the entire meal...no coffee refill (he did refill my water once right before handing us the check so I'll give him that) nor at any time did he ask how the food was or see if we needed anything additional. I even had to go to the hostess stand myself to get an additional set of silverware. I would go again, but I'd make sure I had a different server.  Now the food...pretty darn good! Presentation and flavor was definitely worth it. Wish the service had matched the quality of the food.

9NbrZy2az878H2zDi0T79A.text: Love, love, love this place!!!! The food is so creative and tastes amazing!!! Service is decent. They get busy during lunch hour and so can get a little hectic. Totally worth the trip to enjoy this place!!

US3XKnEz6ojv5t7dqOZ_gg.text: Today was my second time here don't know why I waited so long the first time I got a roast beef on a pretzel roll it was the best pretzel on any sandwich I have had and the actual roast beef was good it was just a little pricey but it was a very very good quality place  So I finally came back this morning and I decided to try breakfast and I went with the chorizo skillet and while every bite was nearly perfect the crunch on the potatoes the eggs the fresh herb garden outside where the picked the cilantro, pico de gallo it was almost a nearly perfect breakfast once again a little expensive but you pay for quality  I rarely give a five star but this is closer to 4 1/2 and if I go back one more time here and it's the same level I will give it five

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

ybgSz7Hvr2V26K5Q6x8gJQ.text: Very cute restaurant!  Good quality food, and craftsmanship.    Terrible service... The "bottomless mimosas" seemed like they weren't really pleased to get to me.  What do you expect when they're being served in 4oz glasses?    We had to wait 20-25 minutes before the server had to tell us just a bit longer on the "giant" biscuit after I flagged her down to question why the 4 tables who walked in after us were getting their food before us.  Chicken and waffles are 5/5 most of the time, but my last time here, my chicken and waffles were cold; I think it was because it was made but was sitting under the burner for the biscuit to be made.   The turkey meatball on the protein omelette was a little dry, and the omelette itself was warm instead of hot.   The coffee is good!  And the crab salad on their lunch menu is superb.

qFr_X5oZSjYBpjNTzEgLKg.text: Very nice staff. I got the turkey Benedict for Saturday brunch was quite disappointed. I love eggs bene of all sorts. This was supposed to have avocado, instead had that subway mashed up quac type spread. No actual avo. Also very bland and had no flavor. So I basically just ate the turkey and runny egg. Disappointing.

5TCKKgsjZuhXd4iRYaicYQ.text: Went in for brunch this morning with a lot of anticipation for something wonderful.  We loved Chris Herrin's Bread and Butter in this same spot.  The decor is very inviting and spacious.  The outside seating looked very nice but we opted to sit inside.  The menu is very eclectic and you can get breakfast or lunch items all day.  The thing is - everything is pretty pricey.  Red velvet pancakes were tasty but not worth the $10.75.  Chocolate milk for the kids was $2.75 for a glass - no refills.  They offer a carafe for $5, but it turns out that a carafe only has one and a quarter glasses of milk.  Not at all worth it - in fact it seems kinda like a ripoff.  The sliders were somewhat greasy and nothing very special.  The chicken and waffles were pretty good.  Service was okay.  We had to wait for a while for our food and the table next to us received their food first even though they sat down and ordered after us.  We had to keep flagging servers down for drink refills and for the check.  One server kept saying weird things.  When bringing some more syrup, she said "that's my workout for the day" and then "just kidding".  The bill for 4 of us including tip was over $80.  I hope they re-evaluate their pricing and work on the service professionalism.  We'd really like to have another nice locals place to eat.

KKdAwA9WOkc3jH8pVwG-bg.text: Its a good breakfast place. Its not crowded and food is good. They serve pretty decent amount of food in reasonable price. Locals are very lucky for having great restaurants  around aside from being in the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Red Velvet pancakes is not too sweet thats why i like it

D3Zzah4KhnhHaIQVXtMvaQ.text: I have eaten here several times and have never been disappointed. Amazing food and staff works very hard to give you an enjoyable experience!

ZmadsxKeznBj8imjaekgFQ.text: Looking for a place to Sunday Brunch!? CRAFTkitchen is where it's at, even though the wait is worth it. 10am is prime time before the rush of brunchers on Sundays. I've been here twice, once was with my family and they loved everything they ordered.   We ordered Salmon Benny, Veg omelette  Avocado toast & Berry pancakes. Every single item was amazing & indulgent, even though some of their serving sizes isn't as big, it makes you content by the end of your meal!   Second time I was here I went with a few friends. The wait was 45 mins, but we decided to stick it out since we were already there. We ended up only waiting about 20-30 since we think people decided to drop their spots. It was definitely brunch hour around 1245. My friend and I decided to order the seasonal crab cakes because we were stuck with avocado toast and the egg, but wanted more protein. It was the best thing I've tried at CRAFTkitchen and so amazed by the concoction of flavors, it was a party in my mouth. Haha   Definitely will be a returning customer bringing brunchers to table!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Seasonal crab cakes

vFcWfHcIWRLtQGwtslLGsg.text: Who doesn't love breakfast? Breakfast is my most favorite meal of the day so when I find a place that is original with a tasteful menu then you bet I have to try it!   The place is open and has more of an industrial look to it. The front bar serves a variety of coffees and has a Showcase for their oh-so-pretty pastries and jams. If that doesn't get you excited when you first walk into a breakfast house than I just don't know!!   The item for the morning was their crustless mushroom quiche. When our server (I forgot her name) described it, it sounded amazing. So naturally without reading through the rest of the menu I took the servers recommendation and gave it a try. Let me tell you, I was BEYOND far from disappointed. The buttery, rich, savory, earthy flavors and textures that came with that dish was delicious. It was served with a little salad on the side. I know what your thinking, salad for breakfast? Yes, the salad added that balance of texture and flavor. Almost like a palate cleanser that allowed every bite even more amazing! Seriously I'm in love with my breakfast this morning! And when we found out that they make their jams homemade every morning and have a different flavor every day. We of course had to have a side of toast and jam! The toast wasn't your typical toast, it was toasted baguette and served with their mixed wil berry jam! It was fresh, sweet and nothing short of amazing!!   I'm highly impressed with this place I wish I would have found it sooner!! This is definitely in my top recommendations!!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Fresh black coffee served with honey
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Toasted baguette with their daily housemade mixed wild berry jam
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Crustless mushroom quiche served with a side salad

kxZQqgZ9zwi8NFSjzSCpmg.text: Came because my daughter liked the place. Food was good, price was decent, and place was clean. But I didn't feel customer service was good. We forgotten more than once, so much that even after we got our food I had to ask for utensils again. It seemed they were on it with everyone else so I don't know why they dropped the ball with us. Our drinks came after two other couples that sat after us, our server asked only once if we needed anything and she was walking so quickly that with food in my mouth I couldn't answer. And yes I needed something, a napkin. I did enjoy the food, but I was irritated at their service that I didn't enjoy the meal as I would have in other places. Probably only will return if my daughter drags me again. Not worth the hype, you can get same food same price elsewhere. Close by too. Lots of places to go Eastern, good luck if you go though.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Little ones milk.

wOqOAY0qlr2S3r4udr6R6w.text: After reading reviews from Rod U. and Norm K. I instantly knew that I had to try here. Being that we were at the M's Spa and Casino, Craft Kitchen was just less than 10 minutes away. With indoor and outdoor seating the minute you set foot inside you can just smell the fresh brewed coffee. I'm in love with this place already.  I tried the Italian Melt sandwich on this visit, mixed meats between a soft bread. It's has to be up there with one of the Best sandwich melts I've eaten in a long time. The salad that comes with the dish had their special dressing, a peach vinaigrette, light wonderful flavor. Couldn't eat a sammie without an order of Truffle Fries, Yum!   Simply love the vibe of the eatery, very clean and it has a healthy feel to it. There are some Gluten free choices,but I love that they serve filtered water along with filtered ice, now that's how you do it right!  Jenna our waitress should get 5 Stars alone, she's energetic, friendly and "Absolutely" fantastic! Make sure you catch her here on Wednesday and Thursdays, the two days she works. You can just feed off her energy, who needs caffeine.. Lol   One of those hidden Gems in Henderson, I will be back to eat more delicious eats from here.

ACnMQUKOaHbJEV_Q35HFNw.text: zero stars  is appropriate. horrible customer service. unless u a robot and reserve online u have no chance to eat hear. not because its good because so disorganized and unwelcoming that simple old fashion way u can't walk in and have a table. i was asked by 2 young girls if i reserved yelp i said no. so they have to have a phone number i said i dont want to give out my phone number to sit down in a restaurant. so high tech they can't write down my name??? it worked for many centuries for other restaurants!!!!. so i asked for a tramisu and a cold pressed juice supposedly with kale ginger carrots cucumber and another vegetable. Eating standing up next to the order counter and eventually walking out realizing they would not going to seat me without asking my name!!!!!??????  My juice had no ginger no cucumber and 3/4 of a cup filled i was wondering since ditched the ingredients why at least fill up my cup. meanwhile the entire time i was there no one none of the millennials asked me if im doing ok? ! maybe instead of high tech the owner should teach the young staff compassion, caring, and how to go to extra mile for customers. perhaps teach how to write down a person's name and when its time read it out loud.

LEG8CyVNpMc_9dJ6onTGww.text: If you are searching for somewhere to dine for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dessert in Henderson, look no further than CRAFTkitchen.  Truly a great place to  eat, we've been there often and have always enjoyed the food and service.  The last visit was for a private dinner event when Chefs Tami and Jaret outdid themselves, blowing away all the guests with their innovative dishes made especially for the party.  They cater events like this at the restaurant for dinners, so keep them in mind if you are ever in need of a site for your own function.  My favorite menu item is the Short Rib Hash with smashed potatoes, sweet onions, and peppers, with the Shrimp and Cheesy Grits a close second.  For the bakery items, hands down the monkey bread if you want to go to carb heaven, but all the items in the cases are inviting. Weekend brunch from 9am to 3pm has an ever-changing menu so you never know what new items will appear.  If you haven't been, drop by when you're in the area and see for yourselves what's cooking in the kitchen of CRAFT.

OHbfgYD7ve82qcrpH5Mgug.text: Let me start off by saying this review is based solely on service, not food. I like to be completely fair in my judgement of a restaurant so I'll start off with the good  The bottomless mimosas are relatively fairly priced and they give you an assortment of juice options to choose from. The food is always hot and delicious. The menu does change, so you can't always order your favorite thing, but I have always liked everything I have tried. The burrito is one of my absolute favorites as it has an authentic taste. The pop tart is amazing, and the ham and cheddar kouigh amann (or however you spell it) is the best thing I've ever had in my whole life.   But there's a reason I won't be coming back, ever. Not even that cheesy croissant is amazing enough for me to ignore the laughable service again.   You're busy, and I get it! That's what happens when you have delicious food. I'm not a high maintenance diner. I actually like to be left alone most of the time.   But on my last visit, I was left alone basically the whole time.   We started off by ordering water. JUST water. Shouldn't take too long to get back to us, especially bc for some reason, craft wasn't busy. When she finally comes back, we order our food and I'm not confident that she will get my order correctly bc she's not writing anything down. And I know! Some servers are simply on it, and don't need to. But that isn't the experience I've had with craft.   And of course, I'm correct. She comes back later to ask me to repeat my order. And I do, no worries. We all have bad days right?   So our food comes out and of course, I'm missing the side of avocado that I ordered. And since my waitress doesn't come to check on us, I eat through half of my burrito before I get a chance to tell her. Kinda defeats the purpose of getting avocado in the first place.   My companion ordered an americano, and she needed a cup of ice. Just a cup of ice. We asked our server but of course, the ice never made an appearance. My friend got so tired of waiting, she poured her americano into her ice water. Literally ridiculous.   But oh wait! We haven't gotten to the worst part yet.   The bill comes and we ask to split it by items. We didn't order a lot and we tell her what goes with which card. Our cards are red and yellow so no chance you could mix those up. But somehow she does! If you weren't sure which card was for which order, why not ask? You're lucky I'm not poor craft, and you're luck the price difference didn't make or break me. But imagine if my bill had been higher? When you're messing with someone's money you have a big problem. And that day, you messed with my food AND my money.   I want to support you craft, but I can't. The people who work for you are visibly miserable and not attentive. Not to mention I overheard one of your servers trash talking her recent table because they apologized for not being able to tip.   Don't come here. The food is great, but there's a lot of other great places for brunch that have bomb service. Try echo and rig perhaps. But stay far away from here.

Q7NMWpwAPykiP-Db7LiTvA.text: This was my first time eating at CraftKitchen. Unfortunately it was disappointing to say the least. I had the seasonal lemon blueberry mascarpone pancakes and the short rib hash - the latter seems to be one of their most popular items. The waiter immediately exclaimed it as his favorite. Oddly enough the short rib hash, at $15.95, does not come topped with an egg as one would expect. The egg is a $1.50 upcharge.   I love short rib and was excited to try this dish, however the short rib was gamey and not very flavorful. It's also worth noting the portion of meat only seemed to be around 3 oz. The smashed potatoes - although abundant - were very underwhelming and under-seasoned, if at all. I will say that the egg, which I paid a premium for, was cage free and perfectly cooked to the over-medium doneness I requested.   As for the lemon blueberry mascarpone pancakes - they too were very disappointing - perhaps even more so than the short rib hash. These pancakes were neither lemony (at all) nor did they have any creamy texture or taste from the mascarpone. In fact they were dry and seemed to be regular subpar pancakes topped with blueberries and blueberry syrup.   None of the four people I dined with were impressed by their food, aside from a vegan blueberry and blood orange scone that was great. The service was friendly and relatively attentive, however there's nothing that would bring me back here.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. The very disappointing lemon blueberry mascarpone pancakes. Although they look delicious - they were not.

7imlP2dz4mx3-HT6kwY5eA.text: This was my first visit here and it won't be my last. The food quality was phenomenal and the dishes were beautifully presented. I ordered the avocado toast which consisted of a poached egg a top smashed avocado with artisan toast, dressed with greens and sunflower seeds. The egg was perfectly poached, which is almost a miracle because It's difficult to get a perfectly cooked egg outside of scrambled at even some of the better breakfast restaurants, much less a perfectly poached one. The flavor was hearty and on point, tasty without being over seasoned, allowing the natural flavors of the ingredients stand on their own. The restaurant is a bit on the small side and we came at a peak time, so we did have about a 20 minute wait to be seated but all things considered, that wasn't very long at all. I can't really think of any constructive criticisms to mention so, 5 stars!

Wm7wfI59cUR9_r9pxf8N6w.text: I would give this place five stars for the food and service, but they need to get a few things in order first. They don't have a call ahead system and the waiting area is micro sized, so you're stuck either waiting outside or in your car for a good 30-60 minutes sometimes for their weekend brunch. For the third time now, they were out of gluten-free waffle mix by 11AM, which is basically the only GF brunch option aside from eggs. Obviously it's a big seller so I don't understand why they don't stock up on it!   Aside from those snafus, their food is incredible and the bottomless mimosas are amazing. It's definitely my favorite brunch spot, but I wish they'd work out these kinks!

ioSUi8M_BxKmyBXoVPQxOw.text: I love living so close to CRAFT Kitchen!  This is an adorable little spot for lunch or brunch or breakfast or dinner! You don't quite know where they are until you see the adorable palettes with herbs lining the front of the restaurant!   Food: CRAFT uses fresh ingredients to offer small bites and full meals to fit anyone's palette. I love their smashed avocado toast the best and salads! Sometimes their menu changes, so it keeps things fresh! I've even come here for Mother's day and had a completely different menu offered with bottomless mimosas! There's fresh cookies and pastries in the front and options to grab and go if you're in a hurry!  Drinks: Whether you want fresh juice or a nice glass of wine, CRAFT has the best selection for you. If you're into the cafe feel and want coffee or tea, they make it fresh and on the spot!   Service: Everyone at CRAFT is welcoming and friendly! You don't even feel like you're hiding in a shopping plaza in the suburbs of Henderson!   It's a great place to meet up with a friend or have a date night/day! Check them out for sure!

0ioUGOVo-HeAagekB09kOg.text: 1. Ambiance: it's a place where you  walk in and automatically get the "good vibes only" feeling. Vivid green scenery all around and the plants on the wall gives the place a refreshing twist. The restaurant is clean and I liked the way the booths are adorned and intimate.   2. Food: Three words: Churro Style Waffles-- UH MAY ZING! The perfect combination of the crumbled sugar in conjunction with the taste of an delicate and precise waffle/churro phenomena. CRAFT kitchen is what Henderson really needed. Let's begin with the vast menu choices from sweet and savory eats to the perfect healthy plates that are simply palatable. I've been here three times already and I have to say the Short Rib Hash is one of my favorites on the menu. The beef is juicy and blends well with the seasoned potatoes. I definitely enjoyed sipping their a Chai Tea Latte as it starts the taste buds before the food arrives.   3. Service: Although it's always busy, the wait is not long and the staff is always friendly and complementing. They have always asked me the preference of my seating and are always attentive right away. I've never had an issue with their service.   4. Overall Experience: I say they get an A for encompassing 1,2 and 3 -- which is what makes a "good restaurant" be GREAT... with a GREAT experience every single time. Keep up the good work and hope to see you soon!
