7ouC7IlZUhSAl9zcvWCYUw.text: My new favorite place, although I have one small gripe..... read on It is very hard to find a breakfast joint in the area that doesn't looked old, dated, and dumpy. This place is gorgeous, cute, clean, and exactly what a brunch diner should look like. I ordered coffee, and after one sip, was immediately disappointed in my own kuereg, and the garbage I drink at home. Blew my socks off.  I ordered the Craft Benedict, which has a citrus hollandaise sauce. I was excited because I make my own with lemon juice. This one was clearly closer to orange and made it so flavorful. Also got the Portuguese sausage as a side.  Here is the most agonizing part of the visit. The Benedict came out with just that, no extra side. I was hoping for has browns or something, man! So since I was still Hu gry, this gave me the opportunity to order a pastry. So this is why they don't give you potatoes here!!! I got a home made peach pop tart, also yum yum yum!  I can't wait to come back and try more stuff.

MvrUuUJs0hw_ypWW8WPsJA.text: I ordered the stuffed french toast, & in the past it used to be much better. It appears the filling & technique in the kitchen has changed :( I was not so impressed with this latest recipe. The french toast is served with real whipped cream, fresh sliced strawberries & real maple syrup. The egg dishes are much better, accompanied by their tasty salads & amazing coffee(I don't know what they do to this coffee-just a reason to come here!). Anyway, I come here regularly with my teens & they enjoy it. Pastries & cookies are really good.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Stuffed french toast with &#34;real fruit &amp; maple syrup&#34;

Jye5q1XU642ZN8ei7Qboxw.text: Really good food, served quickly and without fuss. I felt the prices were a bit on the steeper side for locale, atmosphere, and level of service, but definitely not enough to be a deterrent from coming back!   The service is great, but it's casual dining, and I feel most of the menu items didn't reflect that in their pricing.   The monkey bread is incredible! A perfect balance of crispy, gooey, caramely, doughy indulgence you expect monkey bread to be! (Priced appropriately-don't skip it!)   For our entrees, we had an "all American" and the chilequiles with carnitas added (served vegetarian on the menu and any meat available can be added). I personally can't comment on the flavors/textures of the "All American" style breakfast, because I was so consumed with my wonderful chilequiles! The egg was cooked exactly as requested (a big deal for me) and the sauce was well spiced but not overwhelming.   They also have an impressive bakery case and coffee bar for bites on the go (or to take home).   All and all, the homemade pride shines bright and we would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Traditional breakfast with homemade turkey sausage
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Monkey bread worth kissing your mama for!
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chilequiles with carnitas and over medium egg!

VSjPeaOqp6wKb96An093FA.text: Way to pricy for what you're getting. Apparently it's a popular place to go. Food was OK I had the chicken and waffles. Seems like a clicky popular hangout more than a quality restaurant. 'm not planning a return visit.   For the same style and price I'm headed back to truffles and bacon.

VCsbChG2B_fV3Cy8eMnCDQ.text: Checked out this place for lunch on a Tuesday as per a recommendation. Immediately fell in love with the ambiance- from their succulent wall to their cute little 2-person booths!   The staff greeted us immediately and were friendly and prompt with seating us. The place was busy! Always a good sign that our meal is going to be good.   They're only open for breakfast and lunch but serve breakfast all day (until they close at 3PM)- dare I say..this may be my new brunch spot!?   They have vegan and gluten free items and healthy/guilty pleasure items- something for everyone! They also make their pastries in house daily and serve espresso and fresh juices.   I tried the fried avocado tacos (Vegan) and it came with 3 and was a perfect little lunch! I'm giving it 4 stars because the service was just okay- we had to ask for water after our meal as we never got any. My coffee was also so-so but they did fix it for me when I asked them to.

VAC_FcGY5hgTixLXuQvIaQ.text: We went as a group (6 people) for brunch on a Sunday. They had a great menu - I got a chai tea latte and a breakfast dish (eggs and bacon). Food was delicious and came out fast! The atmosphere was good - it was clear they were very busy. We really enjoyed it until we paid our bills. Once we paid, waitresses were clearing our table including our waters. We weren't planning to stay long because we noticed how crowded it was. But still, felt just a bit rushed.

zngvcF5CrMfO1gOLCqxyEg.text: Such a cute brunch spot! The wait time was about 20 minutes since it was a little busy on a Saturday Morning but they did get us in as fast as possible and all the employees were super friendly and smiling.  The menu was super healthy and they also have a separate vegan menu. I got the avocado tacos and they were amazing! By far the best avocado tacos I've had in a while. They were super light and filling. Everything on the menu was affordable, which was a plus. And the wait time for the food was quick. Would go again for a nice breakfast/brunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

HG9Jh6f5jcWb90N6WcAqPw.text: This place has been on my bucket list forever. I checked in online an hour in advanced on the app, only had to wait 15 minutes when we got there. We got seated it took about 20 minutes to get our food, felt like a while but I was super hungry. Wanted something salty and sweet so we settled for the chorizo skillet omelet and the creme brulee French toast. The chorizo skillet was really good. It had smashed potatoes on the bottom, cheese, pico, sour cream, and I got it with avacado. I give it a 7.5/10. Was impressed overall. But the creme brulee French toast blew it away for me. It wasn't soggy the cream filling was yummy, it had a good bread to cream ratio. And it had whip creme and strawberries on the top. And it was crusted on the bottom of the bread with sugar and cinnamon. My taste buds exploded. 10/10. I wanna come back to try other things. From what I hear their weekend menu changes every week. I like the environment overall and it's super chill. Hopefully we get our food a little faster next time though.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Creme brûlée French toast
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chorizo omelet skillet

adaeyVIdaPm0dtQsh7FyxA.text: The pros: chilaquiles were very good as well as the chocolate chip pancakes.  Cons: took an hr to get seated, we had a large party and got there pretty early but the host kept seating people at 4 tops and not saving them to get two next to each other. Not very well organized as the wait line kept getting backed up. The service was also a bit slow.

Dr0S-J9UqvpjioJWc459FQ.text: I left a 5 start review after we had brunch and the review stands. What this is about is the policies o of the manager who ended up creating a big problem. I had left my credit card there, probably because of the effects of their bottomless mimosas.  It took me a week to notice it was gone and went to see where I used it last.  Called on Monday closed to their closing time and said I would come by the next day.  Got there only to be informed that the manager had already torn up card.  Supposedly it was his policy after a week..  no attempt to contact me.  I needed to use that exact card to validate a purchase now I can't until the credit card company reissues me a card.  Not the biggest deal but I can't understand the policy and still see it as a reflection of their service.

1BN3aNtTvL49zcCFedKenw.text: This is our favorite breakfast place in Henderson! We have never ordered anything that we didn't LOVE! Definite recommends are the smash avocado toast and The skillet for breakfast. They make amazing cappuccinos with homemade biscotti. They now have an online waitlist which has changed everything about this place. It's a must !

Q4GZMY-O2ZUE8f1n8ZWMtA.text: Amazing place! Consistently great food and service.  Wait times on weekends can be long but so worth it. Wish they had other locations... maybe one in Southern Highland where we are desperate for more dining options.

xNGkCDGjaP7wsGPjjZm69w.text: Troy was an amazing waiter! We loved the food. Bottomless mimosas were definitely worth it, I recommend them for sure. Everyone enjoyed their meal!

CEQQJ6FKHpolgBmMfrpNXA.text: This is my favorite "go to" breakfast spot near my house and I have tried all of the competition around. Great food, awesome menu choice and great staff. As others pop up this one will stand the test of time.

Sh2LUi0n6f4JUrOKVunmqA.text: Great brunch menu! I've been here on multiple occasions and every time the food is on point

dq_-VjlsFO0nK5qJLw5BIg.text: The food here is great. Service is a little slow and the aluminum chairs are uncomfortable...be prepared to wait for a table on the weekends!!...other than that a great place to eat!.

4phVM5hvhXCuuJa17rIF6Q.text: Delicious food and bakery! Very friendly staff. One of our top breakfast/brunch spots!

GMfirPLYDh4S3M1YzqMtMg.text: Had the best brunch just now. What great food. What great bottomless mimosas.  No rush. Excellent food. Excellent and filling on both food and mimosas!!   Get there on a Sunday before noon as it starts to get crowded after noon. Got seated at 11;15am within 5 mins.  Our mimosas were NEVER empty. I recommend the pomegranate mimosa. Omg. The breakfast burrito vegetarian style omg!!    This is a must go to restaurant !!!

F2eZiTC23e6n1o7yLsdO1A.text: This is a great spot for lunch. My colleague and I stopped for a quick bite and although it was very busy the hostess seated us quickly. The service was very good and the food was excellent. We will definitely be returning.

mjvvFhjWVzRY26Y4wscqIg.text: Hashtag I heart this place!  My friend and I were on the hunt for a breakfast spot today and she mentioned this place in a group of options. I liked the name and it reminded me of a name of a restaurant that I would find in Seattle or Los Angeles, so I was like "Yes! Let's do it."  We arrived at about 9:15 a.m. today(Saturday) and were sat immediately(it got packed shortly after we arrived) in a cute two seater booth by the window. The decor is really cute and rustic. They have succulent wall gardens and a succulent plant on the tables. I find this type of decor simple yet charming.   We were brought waters and menus right away and given some time to look over the menu. I decided on the smoked salmon on pretzel roll with a latte and my friend ordered the mashed avocado toast with an espresso. We split an order of smashed potatoes with bacon aioli. Everything was really good. They gave me a lot of smoked salmon in a gorgeous presentation on a soft pretzel roll with cream cheese, tomatoes, onions, and fried capers. Amazing. The latte was definitely one of the best ones I have ever had and they gave me a small slice of biscotti with it, which I thought was a genius touch. Smashed potatoes were perfectly crisp on the outside and soft on the interior. The star was the bacon aioli, though. So good. Life changing. My friend said her mashed avocado toast with poached egg was good, though I didn't try it. Looked really tasty.   Service was phenomenal. We had Jeffrey as our waiter and I thought he was fantastic, attentive, friendly, and charismatic. Really love getting great service my first time somewhere. It sets the bar.   Will definitely be back for more yummy breakfast and lunch options. I saw a table splitting the monkey bread, so I must return for that.  5 star experience, friends.

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Smoked salmon on pretzel roll

cA4E96lERTBv9OoA_nUXCw.text: Unfortunately food quality suffers when it's busy. Do not go on weekends. Got the Craft Eggs Benedict. I ordered medium cooked egg and received 2 very well done fried eggs in it. I wouldn't even have cared that it wasn't pouched if it had been cooked to medium as I had asked for. This is the third time I've been here, first time was good and it wasn't a busy day, second time on a Sunday was horrible and they gave us the wrong sandwich and we didn't want to wait the 40 minutes for another. Thought I would try this third time on a Sunday again and I won't be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

8aOZcYqHEQVgTe5395UGOw.text: This is probably the most unorganized place of seating. The tables have been left open and there is a line of people on the wait list, but for some reason the little lady at the host stand can't figure out how to seat people. we are only a party of two in there letting other people go ahead of us and it's been 45 minutes.

_i53XHe9AsqSnGy-y4VlRQ.text: Came here for brunch on a nice quaint Sunday afternoon. CRAFTkitchen has been on my "to try", but because it is so far (deep in the heart of Henderson), I haven't had the chance to until I was on this side of town.  And WHOA was I blown away. I had the most satisfying, most delicious, most drool-worthy meal ever. And this was before I started feeling tipsy from the mimosas! Our server (sorry, I forgot his name) was also amazingly sweet and personable. I wish I could give you a Yelp shoutout, but I went over a month ago and his name escapes me now.  Anyway, onto the important part: FOOD!  I think they have a special brunch menu every Sat & Sun. Not sure, but I the korean-styled short ribs with eggs & rice (see picture). It's a little pricey compared to the rest of the menu but it was the most perfectly portioned, delicious piece of yum I've had in a while! I ate it all feeling perfectly satisfied (not too full, but no longer hungry).   Unfortunately by the time we tried to order the monkey bread, that was out as well. We were told by the server that the banana bread is always the first to go. He suggested for us to try the bread pudding with vanilla ice cream (or was it gelato? Can't remember TBH) and it was deliciousssss! I think the monkey bread might've hit the sweet spot a little harder, but the bread pudding w/ vanilla gelato/ice cream still put the icing on that Sunday brunch.   So basically...tl;dr, arrive very early or no monkey bread.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

Fo3UoYnoRuzMy2-Bmc9kmA.text: It's a solid little spot that is decorated modern rustic. When we arrived we were seated immediately, which was cool. At the front counter they have all the desserts latex out for your viewing pleasure. It's a giant tease, but it works. I thought about the lemon tart the entire time I was eating.   Our waiter was super friendly and helped us out. He explained things to us and offered suggestions. They have a unique system here! They change their brunch menu on the weekends and serve totally different items. So if you're looking on yelp at the food photos and it says BRUNCH , chances are it's only served on the weekend. Anywho! I got the cheesy grits and chicken situation. Every spoon full of grits felt like it was filled with succulent cheese and spices. It was pretty awesome. The wife ordered the chorizo scramble and of course I took a small taste.... another fantastic dish.   The portion sizes seemed a bit petit, however EVERY single bite is packed with flavor that literally sends your taste buds into convulsions. ( ok that was a little dramatic, BUT it really is tasty. Like super tasty) We eat got a mirmosa , one pomegranate and one blood orange. Both were good to go. Sadly I was fulfilled I failed to try the lemon tart. That just means that I'll have to return.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chorizo Scramble Skillet and such
Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and What with a side of cheesy grits... FANTASTIC

BxqHvVjqcA63D1RUc-1v0w.text: Amazing! Great service. Lots of gluten free options. Worth the wait. I had the gf churro waffle. I got the gf lemon blueberry muffin, gf hazelnut brownie, and gf oatmeal chocolate chip cookie to go.

JVjuy7G3qvHKXqsoAMPQRw.text: I really enjoy this place. Went here for a date and the food was so good. I appreciate the bottomless mimosas, my only complaint is the wait. Lol. I wish there was more seating so it would be easier to come eat here

sgLFiBuN3qbKvoaLz6Syow.text: AMAZING brunch. We had the pork carnitas omelette with avocado tomatillo salsa, fresh cojita, and lime crema, as well as the chorizo scramble skillet with smashed potatoes and fresh pico de gallo. Both were absolutely fantastic. We also tried a few of their macarons, which were creative and delicious.  We tried milk chocolate-grand mariner, almond joy-rum, and cookie butter. Our server, Josh, made great recommendations and was very attentive and friendly. We wish they had another location in So Cal -- we would definitely be here every weekend if possible!

IoXSoJAu7snHdydxa77U-w.text: This place is fresh innovative and serves a good variety of dishes. We are in love with their desserts and the breakfast burrito! Everything on the menu is delicious. Wish there were more locations.

ro7DyaLNuOxyJGPq-8wq4A.text: Rarely have I been to a place where the food looks as good in person as it does in pictures. I had the roasted salmon benedict. It was pretty good except the English muffin was mush three bites in and I hadn't even poured the hollandaise on. Also salmon could have been cooked a little less for a better texture. I absolutely will be back for some of the other things I wanted to try. That mocha though, now I can never go back to Starbucks.

iGzaTdo-hiuyeHbnJpy0ng.text: Excellent customer service!! I was actually surprised the service was so wonderful. This is the type of service you would expect at a high end restaurant. The staff makes you feel welcome and always remembers you. The dishes are all delicious and inventive. I have dined here at least 4 times in the last few months, truly enjoyable experience. This is a must try!

nAu6-CHOekpMMFDUdCtW0Q.text: The only bad thing I can say is that the menu looked so good it took forever for me to decide on what to order. I settled on the Croque Monsieur Panini and Truffle fries and it was delicious. On the way out I also got a key lime tart to go from their pastry counter and it was great also.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States

dOT2qnziuFvJ4Npq38rcKA.text: Ok, here's the deal. We've been here twice so far and I would actually give this place 4 1/2 stars if Yelp allowed that.   It's a casual, high end breakfast/lunch place.   Pros - owner and concept. A slightly limited but really good menu ( kids too) with great quality and great execution, as I said high end. The space and design are a plus, although the front window seatings are a bit uncomfortable.  The  pastries, coffee , food are excellent.  Cons- prices. This is the sole reason why I didn't give 5 stars. A bit of a mixed bag here. I expect to pay a bit more for great food done right, but the prices border on expensive. It makes coming here weekly or even a few times a month a bit of a stretch for a couple or family. A lot of reviewers have posted the menu, so you can see for yourself. Portions are adequate but definitely not large, you're paying for quality, not quantity. If you come here really hungry, it's going to cost you. Often you have to add to your already pricy entree choice, then a pastry/dessert so  it adds up quickly . All of this shouldn't be a big deterrent, but you should know what you're getting into  and I did say the food is excellent.  The staff is fine, very friendly. We've experienced a small learning curve too, but come on, they just opened and I'm sure they will develop a good flow sooner than later. Got to talk to the owner and his approach is what's going to make this work. He is obviously well trained, very knowledgable and experienced. He seems open/ committed to adapting his place to make this a success. I also hope a few of the prices are reviewed/ adjusted or some cheaper items are added.   I look forward to this place being around for a long time and would like to come here more often.

8vxUqs9RexvHJpYgIlhLhA.text: This place is a must try and then return and then return again and again! Went for brunch with my mom and we shared two plates, the smoked salmon and the chicken wat? They both were off the charts delicious!! I can't wait to go back and try a few more plates. Don't take my word for it, go in and try for yourself.

fJJLqgw4HM5RRop1McSLjA.text: CRAFTKitchen has an amazing concept. They have a unique take on all their dishes and most ingredients are locally grown. The menu changes every so often which gives regulars a change to experience something new. I know that concept has kept me coming back! I've tried both breakfast and lunch and have been completely satisfied every time. The only criticism I have is that I've had to wait about 15/20 minutes every time I've gone. Also, I once was completely forgotten about by my waiter, which was frustrating, however the owner noticed and came over and took care of everything. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to try something different for brunch!

1AEpDMCrDO48PzZc48XGpw.text: Been here a bunch of times for breakfast and never written a review.  Breakfast kills it so we decided to try it for lunch.  Hummus and pretzel chips and Cobb salad were good. Loved the blue cheese and bacon flavor.   Will definitely come again and again.

rxz2D-XtpN6ySh1yKJhV9Q.text: Let me just start by saying, the food we ordered was absolutely amazing. I came in for brunch on Valentine's Day and the wait for a table was 30min. This was expected, there were empty tables outside that has not yet been cleaned up.  Thirty five minutes later these tables stayed this way until I asked if we could just sit outside at one of these tables that were waiting to be bussed. Our server was last seen right after she took our order. A runner delivered our food hastily. We ordered the truffle fries and parm fries. They were great. I ordered the shredded turkey Benny and the citrus Hollandaise sauce had perfect texture and flavor. The eggs were poached perfectly. My boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles and the syrup had the right amount of spice. I would definitely go again but maybe not sit outside. I feel like we were forgotten.

I had the vegetarian breakfast chili relleno burrito omg, yum! And he had the salmon eggs Benedict also great! Garlic fries were yummy and the small raisin bread loaf was delicious. Oh and the coffee is totally on point! Nice and creamy and strong just how we like it! We can't wait to go back and try more! Very happy!

e7IzG697HRrXC9frQHrbFQ.text: one of the best in Vegas... if you haven't made the trip... you need too... SO MANY GOOD THINGS, YOU CANT GO WRONG!

9hloqtQVoSBCWXXoL5c24Q.text: My husband and I decided to share the short rib hash with an over-easy egg on top since it was the first time we were trying this place. Also had the truffle fries. Both were incredibly delicious!! Glad we decided to try it. Would definitely come back.

sfKPXHnXLFIxFbNs3qfHOg.text: Love that this quaint little restaurant has come to our  neighborhood! The chef has years of experience in the major Hotel's and I for one, am very HAPPY that he got tired of the Hotel business and opened his own fabulous place! The food is  always fresh, healthy, and there is always something exciting and different! I always look forward to our next trip into Craft Kitchen!!!

chU2GJWdUYC0z9MKlaV-uw.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here at CRAFT. I spent the morning with two of my friends here one Saturday, and I ordered the smashed avocado toast while my friends ordered the croque monsieur, the pumpkin brulee, and the ciabatta caprese.   We mostly enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant. It was unlike any other restaurant we had ever been to. I loved the rustic and fresh look of the wood and the succulant plants. It brought a well first impression of what else was to come.  The food was spectacular. I overall enjoyed the presentation of my avocado toast, and judging by my friends' expressions, they loved theirs as well. As for taste, it was as good as the presentation. The sunflower seed pesto really paired well with the creamy avocado spread, and the bread was perfectly toasted. It was also filling, so the price was worth it.  I would definitely come back here again to try something on the sweeter side. The pastries featured in the display looked amazing. It's nice to know that the owner appreciates fresh ingredients. I'm very impressed overall.

45OGHIpkt8kfZDDhk5GRWw.text: Love this place. Pinterest like vibe to it, very modern but earthy. The menu is very natural and I've had a few things here I definitely like. Their orange juice is fresh squeezed which is a plus for me. The only thing I didn't like was there portion sizes, they were all a bit small for my appetite but still yummy. I just wish I could get a bigger serving, probably wouldn't fill me up 100%.

nN0FoULj4pnfI-Rr6r97NQ.text: I was in town visiting family and wanted to try a local breakfast spot. The eggs Benedict caught my eye; I'm not a ham girl, so I asked to substitute for bacon, which was thick, not greasy, and incredibly tasty. The entire dish was amazing! Their homemade citrus hollandaise  was sooooo good!

LzORf6juaIIRTJ-hsA5qTw.text: On weekends for lunch/brunch, the wait can be long even when there are empty tables.  Then the wait for food can be long, especially for some reason when you are seated outside.    The breakfast dishes and baked goods are the best if a little pricey.

uKToXTjV_C3-nVN2QBD1jQ.text: The food is amazing I'm so glad my wife found this place excellent for lunch I had to pause during my meal to write this. The parking is very accessible the dining areas is amazingly clean , the walls are covered with painting that bring a lot of life to the restaurant. I love the aged wooden tables that are branded with the restaurant name "craft kitchen" even more the bathrooms the floor the walls the chairs everything is so so clean. Everything is made fresh , and they offer vegan plant based meals. Everything is organic they bake they're own pastries an breads here which is a huge plus. I ordered the scrambled eggs with chorizo over sliced potatoes with a side of avocado and let me tell you it is amazing so much flavor you have to try it  believe me you won't be disappointed.

pfRXmez62cZhc5u4haG24w.text: Took an Uber from the Bellagio on the recommendation of a Best Of list in a local magazine we picked up. It did not disappoint! XQVxuCx5RN8n5Ghdl8LXXQ.text: If you're looking for a fun brunch spot with solid food and BOTTOMLESS mimosas, Craftkitchen is the place for you. wDAVltWdN1TujEysNvC8pA.text: The service is terribly slow... the wait is forever long with tons of open seating... yes the food is good, but is it worth the wait? NO! Sorry I will not wait at a place that has empty seating, dozen of people outside waiting...

MdGGOlTBNzFSU9utVScmEA.text: I am always amazed when I find really good places that are way off The Strip. CRAFTkitchen is one of those places. I was bowling at the South Point last Saturday and we weren't really feeling the buffet or coffee shop there. Naturally, I looked at yelp and it led me to the light. Usually, my wife is the one finding places to eat so color me impressed with myself. lol  CRAFTkitchen is located in a strip mall in Henderson. In many ways, it is in a very unassuming location. Specifically, it is on the corner of Eastern and Sunridge Heights. Not far from South Point at all. It seems to me this is more of a local place, which is a good thing. We arrived about 9ish and were seated right away. The decor is very bright and industrial at the same time.   In looking at the menu, my wife and I had so many choices to make. I would have ordered one of everything on the menu, but that would have just been down right unreasonable. Besides, I am not Gordon Ramsey and this was no Kitchen Nightmare. lol First off, you got to have the coffee. It was so good. To me, it had kind of a smokey after taste to it that I liked. There are two menus. One is the regular dailey menu. The other is a brunch menu. We did not take a look at the brunch menu. After much salivating, my wife and I narrowed our decision down to two items.  I ordered the Chorizo Scramble Skillet. It was a beautiful symphony of cage free scrambled eggs with chorizo, onions and cheddar cheese, spiced smashed potatoes, and micro cilantro. I was offered the option of adding avocado so I did. When one is offered avocado, one must have it. I asked myself, self, what are smashed potatoes? They were the potatoe skins fried nice and crisp. The flavor profile of the whole dish was over the top in my eyes. My wife had Croissant Sammy. It was another beautifully put together dish consisting of house made croissant(I will get into that in a few.), thick apple wood smoked bacon, sharp cheddar, over hard egg, and tender greens. Now normally, a breakfast sandwich is a breakfast sandwich, but not in this case. According to my better half, the house made croissant made the dish. So much so, she bought 3 others to take to our family. I have to say that they were amazing. I have had some pretty good croissants in my day, but these were the incredible. The service was good, so I have no issues to report on that end. Parking is ample, since it is a strip mall. CRAFTkitchen is open from 7a.m to 3p.m. Saturday and Sunday, and from 7:30a.m. to 3p.m. Monday thru Friday. When we left about an hour or so later, the crowd got bigger and there were people waiting so you might want to get there early if you don't want to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. Chorizo Scramble Skillett

OlAhQHWRbPkgWDGlr1P6kA.text: Waited an hour, then they told us it would be another 10 min to be seated and the kitchen was so backed up that our food may not come out for another hour because of the to go orders. Plenty of empty tables and seemingly finished plates on the tables that had people in them??? Not sure what the deal was. I guess we should have taken the hour wait as a sign. Fortunately Egg Works is across the street, and is a well oiled  machine. We had no problem getting service there.

EpILPpc_GXlYinoxY1qIug.text: Doses and mimosas, yes that's what attracted my friend and I to try this new restaurant! It's located in the back of a strip mall on Eastern and Sunridge heights! The decor and design was very clean, and had a crisp fresh appeal with flowers located on tables and the walls had various earthy art pieces. The booths were separated by wooden walls that went to the ceiling so overall the ambience was perfect to try the bottomless mimosas and have a light brunch! I ordered crab cake Benedict that I was honestly disappointed in. The crab cake itself was watery and the hollandaise was chunky and it started to separate. So for me, the food was not where it should have been, but the mimosas were great! We tried all four flavors which were orange, mango, pomegranate, and blood orange. So I highly recommend this place for the reasonable priced bottomless mimosas. We also had the mango panna cotta which was fabulous! It had a good amount of mango, citrus flavor followed by the creamy goodness of the vanilla bean panna cotta! Make sure you check this place out for brunch as I am willing to try again, I just hope the food doesn't disappoint next time!

BjHUohJT2ToeX5zeBl_bcg.text: I adore this place! First of all when you step up you feel like you are in Portland instead of Vegas with the palates filled with plants and fun outside set up.  Inside it's quirky and modern all in one.  The food has high quality ingredients with a farm to table feel.  The short rib hash is so satisfying, and I recommend you get the poached egg on top.  They cooked mine perfectly.  Their small pies in a cup give me deep joy, not to sweet or artificial, just the rift balance of texture. As far as quantity goes main entrees are not a giant plate of just carbs and fat like many breakfast/ brunch restaurants, it's thoughtfully presented, and just enough where you have room for something sweet afterwards    Just today I was craving their pies like crazy and I got the time wrong, and they were closing.  They were so accomidating, and insisted I come in.  They had put all their stock away and found the two pies I wanted and rang me up.  Such wonderful service and those two pies came to under 5 dollars.  Check them out if you want a fun fresh take on breakfast/brunch, I'm so happy we finally have something like this on our side of town.

Photo of CRAFTkitchen - Henderson, NV, United States. View of pallet herb garden from seats inside

rRMIt-L-9c9TZ17c37yqgA.text: In a sea of shopping centers, an eatery like CRAFTkitchen is the pure definition of hidden gem. If you happen to be way out there in Henderson and craving a non-diner experience, this is your place!  Though the wait on a Saturday is longer than one might expect in the 'burbs, it's a nice place to enjoy brunch. Family friendly for sure, since old people and kids alike enjoy a midday meal. The queue is truly "first come, first serve" so larger parties could wait longer than most. I'd say stick with groups of four or less if you want to get a table in 30 minutes or less.  Those imbibing in an adult beverage can have a single mimosa, or for a better deal, go bottomless. It's $8 for one drink, $16 for endless refills.   Croque Monsieur panini with truffle fries was exactly what I wanted at noon on a Saturday. Other people in our group tasted the short rib hash (with an egg on top), avocado toast and smoked salmon. Portions were just enough, nothing too gut-busting, nor was I left hungry at the end of the meal.   Henderson keeps getting cooler and cooler, CRAFTkitchen is one reason why.

rqM4DIWOnDFKmXcyHuKs1g.text: Clean bathrooms excellent food great service the breakfast menu is really tasty I cannot say enough good things about this place

LBABsmgFA-uPKed3LeTSpQ.text: *Military Discount*   Went on Saturday 2-13-16 at 11am. This restaurant is located on Eastern between Sundridge Heights and W Horizon Ridge.  Ah, yes, way up in white people land....Anthem...home of range rovers and trendy haircuts for your dog.  $41.46 got us a croissant sammy, a waffle for my boy, a latte, some sliders, some sweet potato fries, and a carrot bar.  We only came here because there was an hour wait at Kitchen Table which is just down the road.   $10.75 Croissant Sammy has thick apple wood smoked bacon, sharp cheddar, over hard egg, and tender greens.  Lemme just say this...I do not like fried eggs and I don't particularly care for bacon but this sammy was delicious.  The bacon was thick and salty, the egg was rich and creamy, the croissant was flaky and hot, and the small salad that came with it was perfect for breaking up the richness of the sandwich.  I loved every bite.  My favorite part was probably the itsy bitsy teensy-weensie potato chips on top of the salad.  It's little surprises like that that take this place from 4 to 5 stars IMO.    $14.95 grass fed beef sliders have truffled peccorino cheese, caramelized onion, arugula pesto aoli, and microgreens on a house-made potato roll.  The flavor on these things is out-of-this-world tasty.  Slightly sweet, beefy, tender, and perfect with their soft little potato rolls.  Plus, I'll eat anything with microgreens on it cuz' they are fancy *pinkies up*.  The sweet potato fries were average but the maple bacon aoli is creamy and tangy and wonderful.    $3.95 carrot bar is....OMG.....so delicious!  Dense, spicy carrot cake is topped with the most creamy, decadent cream cheese frosting, a tasty brittle of some sort, and white chocolate "leaves".  Definitely one of the best desserts I've ever tried.  Their case full of pastries is absolutely stunning and they all look amazing.    The best part about this place is the incredibly attentive service.  The moment we were done with the carrot bar our entrees came out.  The moment we were done with the entrees the plates were cleared and the check brought.  I'll be coming back here, mark my words.

3-B8FOaCO1QytN5j343ZGQ.text: Thought we try something away from the strip, so we gave this place a shot. We were not disappointed. Wifey and I split the Chile Relleno chorizo burrito and churro waffles. Both items were bomb.  The Chile Relleno chorizo burrito was delicious. The Chile was not spicy at all, although I prefer spicy, it was still good. The tomatillo green salsa which came with it complimented the burrito well.  The churro waffles were also very tasty, but be warned, they were a bit sweet (at least for me they were, the wifey said they were fine). Covered in a rich creamy caramel sauce these churro waffles were amazing.  The little ones ordered pancakes. One ordered red velvet and the other chocolate chip. I tried them both and they were both pretty good.  We will be retiring here again before we leave Las Vegas.

IFkw1RCsunqJys9ERQRdmw.text: So I know I am in the minority here with this restaurant and although I like to visit someplace a few times before making a review I have to give my 2 cents on this one.   We came last Sunday around 1pm thinking the breakfast rush would be cleared out a bit but we waited 45 minutes to be seated. In their defense it was cold out and no one wanted to sit on the patio so it made an already small restaurant seem minuscule. The cute old lady waiting next to me said it best..."these guys didn't dream big enough" I would have to agree, the place is pretty small. Everyone was huddled together in front of the cashier/coffee bar/bakery area and unfortunately to the restaurants misfortune we all had nothing better to do than stare at every table to the left and to the right. Anxiously watching as tables were finishing their food and as the bussers tried doing there jobs in synchronicity with the hostess. Maybe I am being a little harsh here but although the hostess was the sweetest gal ever she seemed to not delegate as fast or firm as she should because we watched over and over how the staff made things longer for the people waiting.   The food...  Short Rib Hash Well lets just say when I first saw a picture of the Short Rib Hash on Yelp I got all giddy inside. On the drive over I was thinking about how I would have to contain myself so I don't just scarf this down in 2 minutes. I'm sorry to report that I was underwhelmed. When you tell me I am getting a Short Rib Hash I instinctually think that I will be getting chunks of short ribs that have been braised on their bone until they fall off then chopped down into some other ingredients to form a hash. What I received was almost like Pulled Beef in a sauce. Weird. It wasn't bad, just wasn't anything I was expecting. I think a more fitting name would be Pulled Beef Hash. Also the flavor profile surprised me, it was a cross between pot roast meets braised short ribs. I decided to add an egg because well duh its breakfast and that really helped the dish for me. It was a perfectly poached egg.   Red Velvet Pancakes Well that too was a small let down. The actual pancakes are perfectly round and expertly cooked and the flavor was de-lish but why such a little amount of sauce? I mean I was choking them down. Its not good thing to have to take a sip of water after each bite. I will order this again one day and just ask if they can please be a little more generous with the sauce. Also, somehow I missed the part where they say they shave white chocolate on it? And I mean ALOT of white chocolate. Usually non disclosed white chocolate is a bonus but since it lacked sauce it just created the most intense pancake eating session ever. Roof of the mouth sticking good I guess you could call it.   The Smashed Potatoes I love what they are doing with their potatoes. I am so darn tired of those nasty diced potatoes breakfast places serve and the same goes for hash browns. Thank you for making me like breakfast potatoes again!  CK Special My poor finance isn't too happy with me when I mess with breakfast, he's a simple man. Wants a simple breakfast. The CK Special did deliver him their version of a simple breakfast and he was pleased. We especially liked how thoughtful of a touch it is to have homemade Turkey Sausage. What a treat! Very tasty and something they should tout more because it was very good.   Lattes  I am a coffee queen and shoutout to the barista for my excellent latte!   Overall I was somewhat pleased with my experience but I didn't leave feeling blown away as some other reviewers have seemed to express.
